title: Overall - great experience!
review: We were there on business. Staff was friendly and competent. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Banquet staff and food was excellent. Would definitely stay there again. We didn't play golf, but among our group there were several who did and reported that it was an excellent course and experience.

title: Golf Channel Am Tour National Championship
review: Thank you Barbara for your post and for being our guest.  I wonder if you perhaps made a mistake on scoring, as it appears you scored a 1 out of 5?  We thank you for your visit and for being our guest.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Excellent resort
review: Overall....not worth the money.   The check-in process is long and tedious!!  None of the desk clerks spoke good English!!  Took forever to get checked-in to my room.       Was there for 17 nights.   The rooms are average.  Need some updating.   The lighting in the rooms are horrible.  The lighting in the bathrooms were very dim!!      The food choices there are ridiculous.   Food prices were very high and the food wasn’t good at all.  $7.00 for bacon (3strips).       The parking is a joke.  Valet parking was $39 a day.  The self parking was a mile or so away.       For a  17 night stay, I could’ve come out better with a Airbnb or a VRBO!!      The courses were okay.  I thought they were very overrated for the advertising!!!  The staff at the courses wasn’t very friendly of helpful.       My suggestion, if you have to stay there, then it’s okay.   Otherwise I would look at staying off property!!! …

title: " Great hotel and golf course"
review: Thank you for being our guest and sharing your review.  I sincerely apologize if the resort didn't meet your expectations.  I appreciate and value your opinions, thoughts and will review with the team.  If you wish to discuss further I would always be available for discussion.  561-227-2555   Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Conference experience
review: For work we had a couple days of meetings here, and stayed in the hotel. It is very nice. Rooms are a decent size and things worked well in them. Check in and check out were easy. There is a large beautiful pool outside, and surprisingly to me it was not very crowded, which made swimming in it and lounging in it very nice. There are nice areas to walk around by the golf courses and though there are signs for alligators, I did not see any (probably for the best!) I did see a lot of very pretty birds around the resort, as well as an iguana and a bunch of smaller lizards. We got good bar service at our company events. For meals the catered food was pretty good, nothing extraordinary. There are a bunch of restaurants and bars around the property.

title: Great Business Atmosphere
review: The PGA National Resort & Spa is a great place for business, and a great place to grab a quick bite to eat.  The Wagyu Burger and Sweet Potatoe Tots is the perfect snack or lunch during the day or after a round of golf!   The waitstaff is exceptional and attentive to your needs! Enjoy a relaxing afternoon and find the freedom to just be while everything is taken care of for you.

title: Produffers National Convention three
review: Thank you for your wonderful post and for being our guest.  And I agree the "Wagyu burger" is amazing!! :)  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Surprise
review: Three days of golf at the home of the Honda Classic. Expensive but worth it. Stayed at the resort. Over 200 golfers and 100 wife's or friends. Rooms were comfortable but not as stylist as some others for the same price. Food was very good. Golf courses were player friendly if you play from the tree's that soot your handicap.

title: Nightmare
review: Thank you GMoney and all the "Pro Duffers" group for visiting us this past week.  Weather was great and the group seemed to have a great time.  Thank you again for your support of PGA National and look forward to seeing you again next year.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Hurricane Evacuation
review: Exceptionally clean and attentive staff. Front desk personnel sets the stage for a great stay. Food was fine although limited due to construction in their flagship restaurant  BUT  Packed the golf bag. Who would not want to play one of their 90 holes, home of the famous Honda Classic. Would get in two days which surely would add to the enjoyment of the stay.  When we got there, the clubs stayed in the car. Why? They had a four day tournament (Golf Channel amateur) which closed all the courses. First time we heard about it was when we walked in...nothing on the web site; no emails. Nada.  Surprise, surprise  Like visiting the zoo and the animals went on vacation. Like going to Disneyland and the rides were shut down.  C'mon PGA management....you guys do things right and play at…

title: Nice looks, some work needed behind the scenes
review: Lots of great renovations and good looking areas but its clear they have neglected some areas like around the tennis courts and the courts themselves... courts need to be resurfaced, water fountains looked like they are from 1970, and had maintenance guys looking like they are just driving back and forth continuously and pointlessly for hours at a time every time I am there, some just sitting watching us play, highly distracting, it isnt Disney

title: Resort Prices But Poor Service
review: Thank you for your post and for being our guest.  6 of the 19 courts were leveled off new this year.  We hope to complete the remaining courts in the next year.  Tennis is a huge amenity for our guests and members so it is necessary to maintain the surfaces.  Thank you for your comments.  I will review with the team the water stations.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Not worth its Luxury ratings.  Poor experience in too many departments.
review: I saw on the PGA’s website that they had a summer special offering a night or two at the resort after spending a certain amount of money in the spa. I thought it would be a perfect place to celebrate my sister’s birthday. I specifically chose a Monday because my sister’s husband had the day off from work and we could all be together. I called the spa and explained in great detail what I wanted to do. I booked almost a thousand dollars in treatments at the spa alone (not to mention what we intended to spend at the restaurant and other activities – all in one day). The woman at the spa transferred me to the main desk to book the rooms. “Why couldn’t she take care of all the booking,” I thought. Regardless I went ahead and spoke to the person working the main desk, explained my…

title: Beautiful Resort
review: I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience occurring during your stay.  Please contact me directly to discuss further and I can offer my assistance.  561-227-2555  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: 1 Night Get Away
review: Joint Bday celebration.  9 treatments and rooms booked. They messed rooms reservation, slow Monday (off-season), instead of just booking the room, they blamed it on us.  Exchange was horrible and stressful.  We did not relax and enjoy the treatments. No manager ever came out.  Husbands/baby had to wait in the lobby instead of rooms. The main pool advertised was closed. Construction noise in the morning. Did not get requested king bed. Pool attendant asked if we were on Groupon (we were not). It felt like "you wouldn't be here otherwise". Their advertised breakfast buffet was closed due to lack of people staying at the hotel. Even budget hotels don’t do this.  You have a projected guest count and cook based on those numbers. The notion of consistent service of what you advertise…

title: Hotel staff excellent! DJ  and his male coworker at the front desk were outstanding  in representing the hotel  !
review: These two young men at the front desk left an impression 💯made a slightly early check in first week of August  and really enjoyed the afternoon . Great room service next morning also  Thanks again DJ !

title: Cottages
review: Thank you for your wonderful post and for being our guest.  I will make sure both team members are recognized by your comments.  Thank you again for being our guest.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Beer Bash and stay at PGA
review: I have to admit I did stay at the cottages and even and I never made it over to the main hotel except to check in   The cottages was ok to stay in for a 3 star hotel they gave a kitchenette and 2 bedrooms with 2 ver small bathrooms  It’s a good stay if your not wanting to use the main building and don’t need the hotel experience

title: Nice place
review: We checked in to PGA Resort for the annual Beer Bash. They have a package rate for the Bash and overnite stay. Got our room early as requested headed to the I-Bar for lunch. The food was very good and perfectly cooked. Excellent burger and an  amazing chicken sandwich. Definite shout out to Matthew at the I-Bar for making our stay great from the start! Pool was always crowded but nice! Beer Bash was a little crazy like it always is, but a good time. Overall great stay, nice room, good food, and the whole staff did an amazing job to make feel us feel welcome.!

title: Amazing relaxing stay with brilliant hotel staff
review: Butch, Thank you for attending the Fifth Annual Craft Beer Bash and taking advantage of the room package. We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. We will be sure to give Matthew some recognition for making your visit to iBar so great! We hope to see you again for a return visit! Thanks for taking time for such a thoughtful review.

title: NOT SO MUCH COTTAGES, MORE LIKE RETIREMENT HOMES
review: I booked the trip on Hotels.com. My wife, two daughters, myself and our dog. We needed two rooms to be comfortable, and when looking at their options the price for two bedrooms was the same as for the two bedroom cottage, where we all could be together; so I booked the cottage. We checked in and discovered the cottages are like 8 minutes away (driving). Not next to the hotel and its amenities. The cottages are homes, part of a community next to the hotel; old, with worn out carpets, more like a 2 star airbnb. I go back to the front desk to express my disappointment and ask to be booked at the hotel. The young, dismissive, arrogant, front desk representative tells me cottages are part of the hotel (despite of being separate), and because I booked through a third party there's…

title: A Pleasant Surprise
review: Please accept my sincere apologies for any inconveniences.  We appreciate and respect your business and for visiting us.  Please give me a call directly to further discuss so I can offer my assistance.  561-227-2555   Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Fun time great courses and comfortable rooms
review: I stayed for a couple of nights as I was in town for a reunion.  I was able to get a good price through a travel site.  The ratings were not the best but the location was convenient.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The grounds and pool are gorgeous.  The room was clean, it was quiet and the bed was comfy.  I also appreciated that they had really good coffee!

title: Palm Beach Visit
review: Went to celebrate our dads birthday.  It was a great place good food, good drinks and great rooms and golf courses.  I really only had two drawbacks.  First they add a 18% service charge to EVERYTHING and I mean everything even a small package of ibuprofen.  Sometimes it would say it on the bill other times it wouldn’t, had it not been for one of the bartenders I wouldn’t have known that.  To me that is a little deceptive.  The other was the champions course had the tee boxes all torn up.  They were redoing them and you had to tee off from a grassy area.  That in itself wasn’t that bad but we didn’t know it until we went to tee off.

title: Full size bedding nightmare.. and extremely loud resort!
review: Thank you Joel for being our guest and for celebrating your fathers B Day.  I apologize if the summer golf course maintenance wasn't communicated to you prior.  I will discuss with the team with the team that importance.  Thank you again for staying with us and look forward to seeing you again.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: HAPPY FOURTH OF JULY!
review: Stayed here on July 4th for my daughter’s birthday. Friendly staff, very nice property with a great pool and rooms were clean. July 4th fireworks were amazing. Thank you to Norrene in reservations for the great customer service! The room was just what we needed, we’ll be back very soon!

title: Girls getaway
review: Thank you for being our guest over the 4th of July and your daughters celebration.  It was a lot of fun.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Be prepared to spend a lot of time at the front desk!
review: There was five of us including myself who stayed here overnight and had a spa service. Four of us got massages and one got a facial. My massage therapist was Macy and she was amazing. My body felt so much better after her massage. The other girls said their massages were just as good. Apparently the facial wasnt the best though. She said the extractions were extremely painful as she used a tool and then recommended to use neutrogena on her face. A couple of us are also estheticians and would never recommend neutrogena to use. I took off a star because we never got to use the mineral pools or our cabana because of the rain. Even when it stopped raining, we still couldnt go in. That was pretty crappy. The food at the spa cafe wasnt the best either- nothing special.

title: Mediocre Spa...
review: Thank you Jessica for being our guest at the Spa.  I'm sorry about the inconvenience of the outside pools.  We monitor thunder storms and potential lighting strikes in the area to ensure our guest safety.  I apologize if this took away from your experience.   Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Fantastic Golf Resort
review: My husband bought me a spa package for my birthday. We were so excited to go to the spa and resort. Because he purchased 4 different spa treatments ( a package) we were offered a complimentary night in the hotel. I received via email my gift certificate and on a separate email my complimentary room and details of my spa package. I copied both and brought them with me. This was not enough, they wanted the hard copy, which I didn’t get. We spent half an hour at front desk then when it was time to check out another hour with same complications. They were rude, the accountant was rude and everything was the customer’s fault. I went to the spa and had them hand carry a hard copy to them. I will never stay there again. I will say the spa was lovely. I hear they were recently got…

title: Great [lace for golf
review: Went this spring for a golf channel tpurnament. Service was first class and the rooms we fantastic. Great pool great golf entaintment in the bar at night and great food. Will definitely be back next year!

title: Marriage Retreat
review: Thank you John for being our guest and for your post.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Attending a function
review: We hosted our 22 annual Marriage Retreat at the PGA National Resort & Spa on June 7 - June 10. We had a fantastic time and was given exceptional service. The excellent service started from the time we met our account manager Craig C. Craig was extremely helpful in making sure our group needs were met. We were undecided between PGA Resort and Spa and another nearby resort, but Craig was able to invite us to visit the resort and gave us a fantastic tour, which helps convince us that PGA Resort was our best choice. Thank you, Craig, and let's talk about our 2020 Marriage Retreat!!!!   The hotel is beautiful, and all of our couples had a fantastic time. We were still amazed by the beautiful pool and lake view. It was very relaxing, enjoying the scenery. All of the staff was quite…

title: Love "Dog Friendly" PGA Resort
review: Thank you very much for your post and for being our guest.  Yes PGA National is an amazing place to schedule a memorable moment weather for a wedding, birthday celebration, anniversary or any special event.  Looking forward to the opportunity to host you back in 2020 for the Marriage Retreat.  Thank you once again.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Beautiful resort!
review: We stayed the night and enjoyed the pool during the day. We tried to book for the following day but the resort was fully booked. We had a good stay, bed was comfortable. We will be back. We did not get a chance to use the spa, but we really loved the warm pool.

title: Anniversary - PGA National Resort & Spa
review: Overall it was a very nice time. It was our 10th anniversary and we wanted to have a special memory. We both enjoy golfing and that is why we booked. I would encourage the resort to make sure and provide everything on check-in and explain everything. It is easy to forget things for the staff because a lot of people are checking-in or out. We didn't know what was missing from our check-in until dinner and breakfast when we didn't have our vouchers. We did get stuck with two double beds for some reason, even though we booked a king bed room. They said, "oh we gave you something with a view". The view was a palm tree that was right at my balcony and the only thing I could see was the back of a building. Well, that is a view of something... I am not complaining. It was a nice time.…

title: A great and relaxing weekend!
review: Thank you for your post and for sharing your wonderful anniversary with us.  I apologize if the room assignment.  Please contact me directly next year for your anniversary as I would love to do something special for you both.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Average Visit
review: We had a great stay at the resort. It started when we pulled up to check in. We met one of the friendliest and helpful staff member upon our arrival. He gave us some great info on the resort and their valet service and parking options. The registration staff was, also, very amicable. The young man who brought our luggage to our room took the time to explain the air conditioning system, TV controls and showed us the other amenities in the room and gave us some tips on keeping the room cool.

title: Serious Upgrades Needed
review: Thank you for your wonderful post and for being our guest.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Business Trip
review: Understand the overall resorts focus is on golf.  The pool was above average with lots of familys.  Overall pool service is good.    The resort is large.  The grounds are wonderful, but the rooms are dated.

title: Spa Day - Swedish Massage
review: Decided to stop in and enjoy a 75-minute-long Swedish massage. John, my masseuse, was excellent! Experienced, professional, and used the right amount of pressure (I was happy to pay an additional fee in advance, $15, for firm pressure) to relieve my stress and relax my muscles. When you’re paying for a service such as that, you want a top-notch experience, and that’s what I received. I enjoyed that he began with a scalp and facial massage and worked his way to neck and shoulders, arms, front of legs, then back, then back of legs. A very thorough massage. 12 hours later, I feel refreshed. Thank you, John!

title: Enjoyable conference visit
review: Thank you for being our guest at the Spa and for highlighting your wonderful service by John.  John is truly an incredible massage therapist and has quite a large customer client request list.  Thank you again.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Conference Stay
review: Arrived late evening quick and friendly check in, scored an upgrade with huge living area, separate bedroom and giant bathroom.  Comfortable bed and quiet room.  Had dinner both nights at the IBar in the lobby, fun staff, great food, nice wine list and cocktails.  Conference rooms were just right.  Salt water lap pool and work out area opens at 5 am in the Tennis Center, very nice.  Only issue was breakfast downstairs, waited long time to be seated, lip stick on coffee cup, waited long time for omelette chef to show up, my omelette was given to someone else that was it I left and went upstairs to coffee shop for way over microwaved egg sandwich.

title: A Pleasure to Play
review: Thank you for your post and your visit.  I apologize for the inconvenience in the breakfast restaurant.  I will review with the team to improve.  Thank you for bringing to our attention.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: PGA maybe but more like daily fee
review: Came here for a work conference. The conference area and rooms were really nice, the gym was great, nice walk-in pool, and a bar with great food and indoor/outdoor seating area. The grounds were also manicured nicely.

title: PGA National Palmer Course Unremarkable
review: I was not staying at the resort, but just came for the day to play golf. Played the Palmer Course here after playing the Tournament course that has the Nicklaus "Bear Trap" 3 times.  The Palmer course was a bit of a muni look for the front nine - flat, straight holes and bunkering with little imagination.  Tee shots not requiring any thought, just load and swing away.  The back nine had 4 holes that required some shot making off the tee and some unseen challenges once the ball landed and eye-appealing bunkering.  Normally the staff is very good, but today the proshop personnel seemed a bit arrogant.  Not the proshop, starter or cart personnel told me the course did not return to the clubhouse after the first nine holes.  It was noon half way through the round and we had to rely…

title: Business trip
review: Thank you for spending the afternoon with us.  I apologize if the Palmer course didn't exceed your expectations, we normally receive very high praise for this course.  I will pass on your comments to the golf team.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Club cottage
review: The resort was nice. Dated, but nice. The spa was also good. We had a room on the bottom level and it was quite comfortable and nice. The staff was nice. We ate at the resort restaurant (Ironwood) twice and we thought that was better than the two off property restaurants we tried (J Alexander's and Jetty's). We came here for a meeting and I am not a golfer. Would likely not return (since I am not a golfer) but it is a very nice property.

title: Great conference venue
review: Thank you for your post and your visit.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Wonderful place
review: Pga rentals from pga are horrible NEVER responds to calls...repairs are done days late...toilet was done after 3 days.... lights not replaced...cooking in the dark... repairman never returned..... ants everywhere.....

title: Great place!
review: Have been coming here for over two decades.  Beautiful pool and service.  Great golfing and tennis, beautiful gym facilities.  Good food, although can be expensive here.  There are a lot of other restaurants to go to around the resort.  Great shopping close by (the Mall and Plan Beach Outlets).

title: Noisy, expensive, no Wifi!
review: Thank you for your wonderful post and for being our guest for all these years.   Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Great Resort
review: While the place could be a haven for relaxation, there is noise everywhere and all the time! Whether it's the gardeners vacuuming outside, the power generators (constant humming throughout the night), the golf carts, or the super loud music in the lobby, it's really exhausting!!! Also, there was no WiFi!!!  Not in my room, not in the lobby, not by the pool, not anywhere ... I was there 3 days and at first, they said it was a 15-min glitch, but no!! Frankly for $500 a night, I was definitely disappointed.

title: Beautiful Resort
review: Thank you for being our guest.  I apologize for any inconveniences you may have experienced during your stay.  Can you please contact me directly so I may discuss further and offer my assistance.  561-227-2555  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Nice spot, with friendly service
review: We had a great time.  The resort is beautiful especially the pool area.  It was very clean and everyone was super friendly.  We stayed two nights.  I would deffinately come back and stay for longer next time.

title: Vacation Rental PGA National Resorr and Spa
review: I would advise not renting in PGA National for a long term rental in a condo. We trusted the resort and rented 2 months Jan and Feb 2019. The condo was barely livable. There were bugs in the kitchen, it was filthy, the linens had food stains, the AC was broken, the dishes were in the cabinet with food in them as well as food stuck on outside of the fridge. We were promised a nice patio. It was a mess. There was broken glass on the patio when we ariived. And outdoor lights out. The first 3 weeks were repair people and cleaners constantly.  Upon leaving Feb 28th we realize an expensive bottle of cologne was left in the medicine cabinet. I contacted the cleaners who wrote me back yes it was there but they had no authorization to pick it up. I contacted the Rental office at PGA.…

title: So Average
review: Thank you for being our guest.  I apologize for any inconveniences you encountered.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: No Mulligan Here
review: Read my review of the JW Marriott in Houston so you know I KNOW a great hotel experience. The PGA is not that. We were here for a wedding which took place at a local country club. Check in is 4 PM.  At 3:30 they had no idea when our Junior Suite would be ready and dumped us in a standard double room.  There isn't one updated feature in this hotel.  Card key swipe?  Yes, but we went through 4 sets of cards because the mechanism wasn't working which I had to point out to the hotel.  The bathroom was woefully underlit as is the room.  I liked the set up of the bathroom as it lends itself to two people getting ready at the same time.  How about a fan in the bathroom?  It is Florida and the humidity is considerable.  How about getting rid of bathtubs in most of the rooms?  So 1970.…

title: Good
review: Thank you Karen for being our guest for a wonderful celebration.  I apologize for any inconvenience your experience may have had during your stay.  I value your opinion and would like to discuss further if you may have the time.  My number directly is 561-227-2555.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Excellent hotel and golf
review: There were so many things about my stay at the PGA National Resort & Spa that were wrong that it’s hard to know where to begin. So, let me begin at the beginning.  I arrived about 2:00 P.M. on Sunday at the tail end, unbeknownst to me, of The Honda Classic Golf Tournament. There were golfers, noise and commotion everywhere.  I just wanted to get a room, change into my bathing suit, and escape to a quiet corner of the pool to read and relax until I had to get ready for my dinner with colleagues. Not so; no rooms were available. I waited nearly two hours by the pool, since the lobby was unbearable, hiding in the shade as I was dressed in street clothes and was more than a tad bit warm.  No one came by to see if I needed or wanted for anything.    Finally, at 3:45 P.M., having had…

title: Conference
review: Stayed here 4 nights on business. Couple of quick observations first they were preparing for a PGA tournament the following weekend so very busy with construction and set up for that event. That said the staff at this resort was fantastic top to bottom. Rooms are spacious maybe a little dated but very comfortable. Bar and steakhouse were very nice as well. You will be a ways away from any other restaurant or shop so without uber or rental car not all that much to do onsite. Unfortunately didn’t play any golf which obviously is the main attraction. Overall a solid four star stay

title: One night stay
review: Thank you Kevin for your visit and your wonderful post.  Yes we are preparing for a major golf tournament this week The Honda Classic.  I hope it didn't inconvenience your experience.  Our staff are incredible so thank you for mentioning.  Hope to see you back soon.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Beautiful Resort with a lot to do
review: We had an ok stay at this hotel. The property is really beautiful, the staff is friendly, the rooms are spacious and well decorated but very noisy. The pool area is big, they were a lot of people there so it was a bit hard to fully enjoy and it was not very clean.The prices for food are extremely high but it is too be expected in a resort like this.  I had a facial at the spa and was not too impressed, the staff was great but I am not a big fan of the facility, one side seems renovated while the other one is really old. It was really expensive for what I got, not worth it and  the same can be said about the hotel, a bit too pricey for what you get.

title: Very pleasant
review: Thank you for being our guest during a busy Presidents weekend.  I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience experienced.  If you would like to discuss with me further, my direct telephone number is 561-227-2555.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Sweeter the second time!
review: LOVE, love, love this resort!  From the rooms to the food, staff, pool, golf and spa!  If you are in Palm Beach, the best time to visit is in April/May/June when the prices are a little less.  Off Season!  Top notch place to host an event!  You won't have to leave the property.

title: Great hotel
review: This hotel offers everything! Five golf courses, top restaurants, tennis, a full service spa with over five different pools. The hotel rooms are all you could ask for. Close to the best restaurants in palm beach gardens, the beach and shoppes. Close to I-95 and turnpike. Friendly staff. You can't go wrong.

title: Few days away from home, Great
review: Thank you for your visit and review of the PGA.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Costly but worth it!
review: We (2) escape home for 2 nights, we decide to choose this hotel, it was OK, a little bit pricey really, and fees hotel also pricey...... to far from the beach.......... but closed nice restaurants.  We had a nice suite with balcony but costed me $90 a night...... Nice Property........ Very clean room, Amazing BED very comfortable. Staff very friendly.

title: Review of Hotel Only
review: Thank you Leonel for your post and visit.  Yes the mattress's are the new Black Beauty Rests from Simmons and we placed them in all the rooms last summer.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Ironwood Birthday Celebration!
review: We are returning guests to PGA resort for a number of years.  The ambiance and friendliness of the staff is outstanding.  There’s plenty to do over Christmas and New Year with children and adults well catered for. We ate in Ironwood restaurant on New Years Eve and the live music in the bar was fabulous with a great party atmosphere.  The pool was at times very crowded but ADAM the manager always looked after us and managed to find us a bed when it appeared none were available.   The concierge, Antonella always found time to chat, offering advice about places to visit and dine. Need a table booking...no problem...Antonella had it in hand.  The bell captain Ziggy and his guys Dan and Michael always found time to greet us and offer advice. Angel and Jaime in the breakfast diner…

title: An amazing Christmas vacation and excellent service on first visit!
review: Our first visit to this renowned resort. First impression was the wonderful care Antonella the Concierge, she booked us things prior to arrival and upon, she is a great asset! All the staff excellent Bill at front desk, Jim and Blaze too.  Pool was a pleasure. Rooms upgrade to a view of pool or lake huge difference. Great food on premises also fab bagel place 5 minutes away by shuttle car. It is such a relaxing place, whether you play golf or not and tennis facilities great too!

title: Nice place
review: Edward  Thank you so much for your fantastic review on the property. We are so pleased to hear you found PGA National to be a relaxing place to spend your holiday vacation this year. We will be sure to recognize Antonella, Jim, Bill and Blaize too with our employee recognition program in house due to your mention of their names. We really appreciate you taking the time out of your busy schedule to let us know how we are doing and hope you will return for a future visit in the near future.

title: Girls weekend? this is the place
review: Stayed here for 5 days over the New Year.  Arrived around 11am, and checkin was well after the guaranteed 4pm time. We settled for a double room because we just wanted to get in a room at that point.  After that it was smooth sailing .  Stayed on a golf package and the courses are beautiful.  The pool was packed the first 2 days, but calmed down for the rest of our time.  Coffee shop in lobby is great as is the iBar.  Ironwood for NYE dinner was a bit slow, but it was fine.  Wave pool bar was good for lunch.  Nick by the pool had drinks coming to us all day every day we were out there and was friendly and very attentive.  Adrian at Wave and also iBar was a great bartender and  awesome as well. Vanessa at iBar was beyond friendly and kept the pre-dinner cocktails coming.  Top…

title: Need Adult Pool
review: Thank you for being our guest during the holidays and for your post.  I will definitely recognize our amazing team members.  Thank you again.   Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Beautiful but pricey
review: Girls weekend here... nothing more relaxing than a spa weekend with your girlfriends,eating healthy, sitting by the pool with a good book. The staff is friendly and attentive. Must try the Watsu dead sea salt water experience. Of course, golf is a given, if you play, the grounds are immaculate.

title: Mixed feelings
review: The golf facilities are great ..but: How can you ask for 100 usd deposit per night for a prepaid room and 100 usd deposit for an adapter?  The prices we paid for food and drinks😱 I looked down at a parking space, my friend into a concrete wall and my two other friends into a wall of trees. not what we expected...

title: What a dump!
review: Thank you Helene for you visit and post.  We secure upon arrival from guests staying at PGA National a $100 "authorization" per person, per day, from your credit card to secure and establish credit, so you have the ability and flexibility to charge anything to your room while being our guest.  I'm sorry if caused any inconvenience for you during your visit.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Beautiful facility...nice staff
review: We just attended a wedding at the PGA Hotel, Palm Beach Gardens, and this hotel is terrible.  The food is awful.  Breakfast, lunch, and dinner. We tried them all.  The staff disinterested. The facility rundown.  Do not stay or eat here.   There was no management to be found.   And I do not want to hear now from anyone at the hotel how upset they are that my stay did not meet my expectations....oh please.  Pass this hotel by.  And quickly.

title: A must for any golfer!
review: I am sorry for any inconveniences you experienced during your visit.  If you wish to discuss further, please contact me directly at 561-227-2555.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Italian open 2018
review: As one might expect, the the PGA is a beautiful property with plenty of amenities and extras.  We were there for three nights because of a family occasion and not golfers.  Nonetheless, the property is well maintained and the staff were anxious to please. Very nice.  Of course there were little things that needed attention, like the convertible bed had no sheets. But a call to the front desk (even though it was after midnight) was promptly addressed.  It is a huge property and must be a major undertaking to keep up. Nonetheless, these magnificent grounds are pristine and lovely.  One regret is that we did not play croquet...they have a classical croquet set up which was very old school.  Unfortunately, time didnt permit our indulging.  We had a small suite which accomodating my…

title: There are better places to go if you want golf
review: What PGA National is not and pretends to be is a golf destination for true golfer. What it is, is a hitelgeared towards families with little kids who's parents might want to enjoy a round of golf. Courses are not manicured let alone kept in good shape. They are difficult but pedestrian. Haven't seen one true interesting hole yet. Pro Shop staff unconcerned and treat you like cattle. Little help before or after setting up in the cart. This is a business, not a resort. We had solid tee times for all four courses made months in advance. For no reason, they switched them around and had us playing one course twice, one not at all. No apologies when we noticed it and had them fix it. In fact, we were told " no big deal, you're playing them all now". What? Our room itself is nice and…

title: Golf Weekend
review: Please accept my sincere apologies Judy for any inconveniences experienced during your stay.  I would certainly enjoy a conversation with you to review your experience.  My number directly is 561-227-2555.   Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: great quality golf in a beautiful surrounding
review: Great set up for no stress, high quality golf trip. Excellent staff and five courses out your back door. Beautiful pool and spa facilities too. Lobby bar and Ironwood restaurants do a nice job with good food and service.

title: Golf Tournament
review: Thank you Robert for your visit and post.  Hope to see you again in the future.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: PGA national
review: Played in the World Amateur Golf Open Championship and experienced the Squire and Palmer courses for the first time. What wonderful courses, each with it's own personality. Challenging in different ways, and beautiful surroundings. The staff was amazing and great practice facilities as well. Would have loved to had more time to experience all of the courses and maybe get some spa time as well. A destination for another day!

title: Good but could have been SO much better
review: Several things let the hotel down. Things to improve:- No complementary water in the room. Poor in a hotel this size and quality. Especially for the type of room we had (which we had to change and pay an upgrade for) No turn down service, again expected in a hotel of this size. Sports channel selection were much poorer than other hotels we stayed in during this trip.  The hotel looked like it needed a refurb. The towels were taken and replaced every day and this is bad environmentally. Plastics straws were used widely whereas other hotels on this trip used paper ones, and had notices on why it’s important to reuse plastic. We picked up many many straws and plastic tops on the golf course and given the amount of fantastic wildlife on the resort this is worrying. Please make…

title: Golfing Paradise
review: Thank you very much for your visit and sharing your experience.  Nothing is more valuable and important to us than guest feedback and the "guest experience".  I will review and share the items mentioned with our team.  We take all critiques and opinions seriously.  Thank you for also mentioning special team members by name so we can reward and recognize them for there wonderful service.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Amazing!
review: Stayed here with a group of golfers in September. The property is magnificent, beautifully cared for and stunning to look at. The golf courses are amazing, all very different but all in great condition, just a shame the Champions course was closed. The golf staff looked after us superbly, very helpful and efficient, nothing seemed too much trouble for them. It was unbelievably hot so one of the marshalls would come round the course with iced towels to help cool us down, nice touch.  Rooms were great, very spacious and extremely clean. Beds are possibly the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Swimming pool is fun and clean with lots of beds. Only downside was no poolside service for drinks.  Breakfast was good, lots of choice, pleasant staff. The bar by the golf shop was good.…

title: Modern and clean hotel with a truly brilliant golf course
review: Thank you Tom for your visit and for being our guest.  I will pass along your comments to our team for review.  Our guests "experience" is most important to us and I appreciate your feedback.  We hope to see you back soon with your group.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Lunch at 91
review: Our son just moved to West Palm Beach and recommended we stay at this hotel.  We were definitely not disappointed.  While we are not golfers, we so enjoyed the perfectly manicured landscaping of the property. The lobby bar was great for food and cocktail and they also had nightly entertainment the weekend we were there.  We so enjoyed our stay and this hotel will definitely be the one we will stay at in the future.

title: Very well managed Hotel with nice rooms
review: I had previously given a poor rating for this resort but after all it worked out well. In a previous review i was mainly frustrated with the golfshop guys as i went there to play the championship course which then was under maintenence again although i had called previously. the resort itself is nice and the my room (a suite) was really nice, modern and very large. the bed was very comfortable as well. the overall atmosphere in the resort is also very enjoyable. the best of all is really the management. Bill Horn the manager knows how to keep his clients happy and he is definitely going the extra mile to make sure everything is perfect. If i would be a Hotel owner, I would want someone like Bill look after my business. I will consider going back to the PGA national but this…

title: Fun in the Sun
review: Thank you Maier.  Your business and guest experience are always important to us.  You are always welcomed back to PGA National.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Great place for a wedding!
review: This resort had almost everything on the property that you could want or need.  The ability and willingness for the staff to drive you to nearby shop or restaurants located on the property was an unexpected bonus.  I would recommend this stay for adults, not sure for kids since it is a little pricey (unless you can afford it).

title: Beautiful resort style hotel.
review: Thank you for your post and visit Lee.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Our Day at PGA
review: We went to the resort for a destination wedding and it was the perfect place for this event. We loved the pool area and the food and drinks delivered to you poolside were excellent. The staff was extremely friendly and we did not meet one person who wasn’t smiling and friendly. The rooms/bathrooms are old and you can tell they have been redone over and over again. If you stepped out of our sliding glass door there were two tiny chairs and three big bushes in mud.......I don’t think we could have sat out. My friend played one of the golf courses and said it was a great experience. I chose a spa package and it was a 10/10. Perfect. Friendly, beautiful, very clean and my massage was excellent. We received a bottle of Prosecco, a mini sample of cosmetics, a delicious 2 course lunch…

title: Our day at the PGA Resort
review: This hotel is as beautiful as it looks online which is not always the case. Fast friendly service by everyone. Food was delicious, pool area is amazing, everything was immaculate just the way I like it. I honestly can't wait to get back there for a longer stay.

title: Wedding
review: Thank you Ann for visit and your wonderful post.  PGA is an amazing destination.   Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Spectacular, unique spa and fabulous luxury property with delicious on-site dining options
review: This was an awesome place to have a wedding along with golf. The staff was very professional and was always available when we needed anything. Nickole DAngleo was the best person we could’ve ever worked with for every aspect of the event.

title: Great place for conferences
review: We are thrilled to hear that your wedding along with golf was everything you hoped it would be. We so appreciate you taking the time to write such a positive review and are going to most certainly share your positive feedback with Nickole D'Angelo. Wishing you much happiness in your recent nuptials and we hope to see you again soon.

title: Picture Perfect!
review: I love the restaurants at this luxury resort - the Ironwood Steakhouse is to die for, especially the chocolate bomb dessert that literally melts before your eyes. I'm craving one now that I'm typing this out. Also, check out The Spa. The Waters of the World salt pools at The Spa are magical and super-unique! Like, one of the pools has salts from the Dead Sea. How cool is that? I loved swimming in them and they also have health benefits. I also enjoyed the newly-upgraded ladies lounge - it's so nice. The service is attentive, the food at the outdoor cafe is delicious - everything about it is sooo lovely! I highly recommend this spa!

title: Great Stay
review: My boyfriend and I stayed the weekend at PGA National and we loved it. He played golf while I went to the spa. I bought a massage which included private pools, steam room, whirlpool and a sauna which you could enjoy all day long. It was awesome. The entire staff was very pleasant and friendly. Everything was very nice and clean. The room was very spacious and had a nice view overlooking the pool. Parking was really close and complimentary. Our overall experience was great, we would definitely recommend. We will be back.

title: Treated like royalty!
review: The staff is friendly, courteous and well- trained.  Great customer service in every area from valet parking, to check-in, to bell hop, to concierge service, to pool, to restaurants, to the bars, and the spa. King pool room with veranda was comfortable and well appointed.  Bed was super comfortable luxury linen and plush towels.  Met the nicest people in the hot tub, who found out it was our anniversary and bought us a drink.  The concierge also found out it was our anniversary and surprised us with a bottle of prosecco and chocolate covered strawberries.  There was only one incident with party goers in an adjacent suite living it up being loud and roust.  From Midnight to 2 am there were louds knocks at their door and loud hoots and hollers and laughing.  It sometimes sounded…

title: Fabulous Spa Services
review: Located in the back end of the hotel is the newly renovated spa area.  It's nice and fresh.  Their Services include head to toe beauty services; Maria is a fabulous designer that gives a thorough and quick blow out.   There's also head to toe wellness services with fine facials and cleansing massages and wraps.  With any services you have access to the 3 Waters of the World Pools where you can lounge and cleanse your skin and muscles.  Stay for lunch where healthy salads, wraps and cucumber water add to the pampering.

title: Excellent place to play golf and have a good vacation
review: pga national resort & spa is located in palm beach is an incredible place is perfect for golf lovers because it has several fields to play this focused on golf, restaurants, pool and social area are very nice. I have a great experience in this beautiful and luxurious hotel, I recommend it since it is an incredible and different experience. also the golf courses have a great history because in these fields the most important golf champions in the United States are played. Very good hotel and excellent service

title: Beautiful resort, but way over priced...
review: My wife and I stayed at PGA National Resort and Spa this last weekend as a “stay-cation” since we live in Palm Beach Gardens. The hotel itself is very nice and recently renovated. Upon check-in they upgraded us to a king bed which was very nice, as it was the last king bed available. The pool area is very nice with comfortable lounge chairs and nice fountains. On Sunday “funday” they had a poolside DJ that was very entertaining with great music and trivia. The driving range is nice and the unlimited range balls included with the resort fee was great for practicing our golf swings. They provide a complementary golf cart as well. A downside is that it was off season, so the Ironwood Grill was closed on a Sunday and we didn’t know that beforehand and we planned to order some raw…

title: Perfect - even for non-golfers
review: Just back from a 7 night stay at this hotel. The rooms are spacious and well appointed, with balcony. They lack a kettle which was a disappointment - although there is an easy to use coffee machine. The bed is very comfy indeed and even the pillows (I HATE hotel pillows) were OK. All the public areas are very tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean. Check-in was swift and welcoming. The pool area is lovely - great sunbeds and helpful attendants. We loved it here. The only downside is that, in our opinion the drinks and food are over-priced. A poolside snack, with cocktail was around $30 a head. Both food and cocktails were excellent but could have been bought for half that price elsewhere. That said, I'd be glad to stay here again and would recommend it in all other respects.

title: Non-golfers there for a conference
review: The basic room rate is set really low - for the summer, I suppose, and it was still very hot in late September.  They make it up in everything else, I think.  The restaurants are all a little pricey, drinks too, there's a resort fee (common these days, so not particular to this hotel only).  Parking is free, though, a plus, as were classes at the separate gym club.  Hotels that don't offer free breakfast with your room rate are becoming the minority.  I suppose it's only perception that it's better if you put the breakfast costs in the room fee and call breakfast "free," rather than the way his hotel does it, but I balk at paying $21 for buffet breakfast when I don't eat much at that hour in the first place.  So we skipped their breakfast altogether.  There's a really good…

title: Should have known it was going to be bad from the start..
review: Wow!!! Just Wow! It started as a last minute reservation...looking for a staycation and a bday massage for my girlfriend. I got a great rate $129 FL discount and when I was booking I selected a 50min Massage for an extra $125. Since the reso was in 24 hrs, I printed the confirmation. It didn't let me select a time at booking.  Weird, right?   I decided to call the hotel a few hours later because I didn't want problems on the day of the reso...Guess what? When I called, they told me the spa was booked but its OK because they didn't charge me.  I was a little mad but I figured I would give them a chance to make this right. I SHOULD HAVE CANCELED AT THIS POINT but I didnt.   I told them that the only reason I made the hotel reso was because of the Spa treatment. Eventually they got…

title: Amazing service
review: I am sorry I am just seeing this now?  Please accept my sincere apologies and contact me directly and we can discuss 561-227-2555.   Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Not worth the money
review: Business trip and not a golfer but the resort is beautiful, food is amazing, rooms are  big and clean with great views, the pool is perfect and most of all the staff are top notch. First class service, well done guys

title: Great Stay - but!
review: Front of house staff - excellent. Check-in - excellent Room - very good Breakfast - very good service and good food Food/drinks at the bar - very good Golf courses - excellent - we all really enjoyed those selected. All the course staff were very attentive ...made everything so much more enjoyable Golf shop - a little expensive - only to be expected really. Pool area..very comfortable, plenty of fun beds...nice pool. Generally...this is a very well run establishment with great golfing experienced. One thing...BE CAREFUL in Bar91...I was charged twice for food and beverages I did not consume. I didn't notice at the time as I didn't have my glasses. Wouldn't take much for staff to run through with you quickly what you have ordered/consumed. Should be pretty obvious though they one…

title: Reserved room not available
review: Thank you Mickie for your post and visit.  I will share your comments with the team.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Really nice getaway
review: Shame that I am still waiting for the manager to make my disastrous attempt to stay @PGA right when the room I reserved was not available(pool view) - room provided had no view in a corner overlooking concrete paths, was given the run around for 45 minutes before I just gave and went home this was 4 weeks ago dissatisfied FL resident

title: Great property
review: Enjoyed a small overnight stay at PGA.  The special included a BBQ, concert, breakfast buffet and late check-out. The staff was wonderful, and the food was great.  I especially loved the comfortable bed.  Didn't want to leave.

title: Great getaway
review: Thank you very much Lois for being apart of our 1st annual Labor Day celebration.  More to come...  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Great anniversary golf weekend
review: Great music Friday and Saturday nights in the lobby bar area All personnel were helpful and friendly The golf courses were fun and in good shape we played Fazio and Palmer. Food in the ironwood restaurant was delicious and the service top knotch.  Service and food in Bar91 after golf really hit the spot also with great service

title: Great Pool, Nice People, Horrible Beds
review: Thank you We have really created a wonderful atmosphere in the IBar on the weekends with the entertainment that we have brought in.  Valerie on Friday and the amazing Larry Johnson on Saturdays.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Great stay!
review: My wife and I went to PGA National for a "stay-cation" to celebrate our anniversary.  The resort and spa are both very nice.  That said, neither of us got a wink of sleep at night due to the terrible king bed in our room (#2064).  I understand that when you go to a hotel, you never know whether the bed in your room will be hard or soft.  However, this bed was not only too soft, but, most importantly, completely uneven.  My side sloped downward at the bottom.  My wife's side sloped toward the edge.  If you are planning to go to PGA, let the front desk know when you check-in that if you find the bed in your assigned room a piece of garbage, you will need a new room.  Oh, and what's with the maid waking guests up at 9 am?

title: Great Staycation
review: Thank you Stuart and please accept my sincere apologizes for the bed and room attendant.  I will talk to my team and review.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Family loved it (but pricey)
review: Our stay at the PGA Resort exceeded our expectations.  Overall the staff was amazing, the Ironwood Restaurant was fabulous.  Room service quite good.  The  resort has a lovely atmosphere, relaxed and casual.

title: Wedding weekend at the resort
review: Spent the past weekend here for a wedding and cannot say enough good things. The spa was massive and they do such a great job up keeping it. My massage with vikki was amazing, it was just what I needed. David Kaplan went above and beyond making sure the bride and our group was taken care of. Robert from events also was a huge help to making this weekend so perfect for the bride and groom. These guys were seriously the best and we can’t thank them enough for going above and beyond.

title: Beautiful resort but they need to work on their Customer Service and Diversity Training
review: Thank you Sydney for your visit for a special occasion.  I will pass on your great comments tp David Kaplan and Robert and Vikki who are wonderful staff members.  Bill Horn, resort manager

title: Gourmet
review: My job involves a lot of traveling, through my business and personal travels I have stayed at hundreds of hotels and resorts. Very seldom do I give bad reviews because I tend to give people and businesses the benefit of the doubt. Perhaps they are having an off day, or personal problems, or maybe it was a new chef, etc. After I parked my car and walked to the main entrance I was immediately welcomed with a warm smile and a hello by the Bell Captain, Ziggy Wilson. After that warm and welcoming greeting I assumed that I would be treated the same way during the remainder of my stay. When I got to the registration desk I stood in front of the registration lady and was ignored. I stood there and finally she said wait, and I continued to wait as she continued looking at her computer.…

title: Okay
review: This place makes you feel like a celebrity!  Customer Service exceeds 100%.  I highly recommend this facility. The staff were very friendly, cordial, and attention to detail.  The valet drivers were awesome!  Anything you requested was done immediately and with a smile.

title: PGA National is Service!
review: The hotel hallways are a maze  The rooms are large. Needs okay. Landscaping beautiful. Clean thru out  Coffee make and fridge in room. Alcohol  everywhere . Pool is gorgeous. High end accommodations and attitudes

title: Wonderful resort, nice staff, but watch out for a few things!
review: Went for a birthday weekend for my daughter and kids,  Great time at the resort, pool, piano bar.  Rooms very nice and large.  WIFI strong - but takes two-part log in, so if you have a device to connect (we had a baby monitor), it won't connect.  Great Saturday night band that evidently is there every Saturday.  FUN!  BUT WATCH OUT:  They already put tip (+7%) on everything - food, drinks, then do the "add'l tip" line thing.  Hate that.  Get a little tipsy and don't notice that, you end up WAY over tipping.  Like us dummies.  At the bar, asked for a "house red wine".  Got the bill - charged $18 plus tip.  OUCH.  Taken advantage of - had house red wine at dinner for $12.  At the pool - don't like bloody mary mix, so asked for well-vodka, tomato with an olive.  Had two each.  Got…

title: Review from a non-golfer
review: Thank you for your visit and your post.  Will review the areas of concern you noted.   Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Impecible customer service bar none!
review: Room - my bed was quite comfortable. Appreciated the fridge, plenty of space and the balcony overlooking the pool.  General ambiance/environment - this place has a "party atmosphere" on Thursdays and the weekends - in the lobby - which surprised me, especially given the number of children golfers that were staying/competing at the time. My room was close enough to the lobby that I could hear the music. I did not mind because I tend to stay up late but I imagine, for some guests, that would be very unwanted. The hotel grounds are decent, but this place didn't scream "resort" to me. The pool - the pool was great, albeit a little warm (but who can control that with that hot Florida sun?) The servers were attentive and quick with drinks. We rented a cabana for an afternoon and it…

title: The Concierge (Antonella)
review: Thank you for your visit and your post Amy.  I will review your experience with our teams to improve in any areas that touch the guest experience.  Thank you   Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Nice stay, but conference center needs a little bit more attention
review: This resort has it all. So much to do or so little to do. All done in a 5 star resort way. Customer service from every single associate was beyond average standards. The lobby, the pool the restaurant's, the rooms all gorgeous! Do your self a favor and get here ASAP!!

title: Spa day
review: So my mom, friend &  I spent the morning getting facials. I’ve had them before but not here. First of all you walk in  to the front desk and we were immediately processed . A host takes you back to a gorgeous area to lock up your belongings. The facial you get the works. Steam,mask ,scrub etc. with your purchase you get access to the spa pools.My esthetician Leesa was gentle , took her time. 1 hour later you have baby skin. 3 Pool areas & scrumptious healthy food. Wonderful day .  Oh & The color palates of the spa simplicity with soothing colors..Treat yourself and go.

title: Great Food and Spa
review: Thank you very much for the wonderful post about our amazing spa.  Please come back soon.   Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: I attended a professional solid waste conference at this hotel.
review: Came here for my nieces weddding. Enjoyed the Spa and the wedding was beautiful. The wedding food and the restaurant food is great! The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are clean. They were a little late getting us into our room but offered us a $50 credit on food. I felt that was a very nice gesture due to the inconvenience. Great weekend!

title: Classy , yet simple !
review: Thank you very much. Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Entirely 5 star
review: This is a really nice hotel.  It is visually very impressive. When you check in, the staff are real nice to you.  I stayed in a handicap room as I have a physical disability . The staff were very nice to me in accommodating my needs. The food was delicious and the venue was perfect for our group.

title: Lovely spa day
review: I purchased a massage via groupon.  My massage by Holly was excellent. She was very pleasant and professional.  I utilized the sauna which was relaxing.  The therapeutic pools are my favorite and the prosecco complimented the entire day.

title: WOW !!and we don't play golf.
review: Thank you Andrea.  Yes Holly is an amazing massage therapist.  I will let her know of your compliments.  Hope to see you more this summer.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Still a great spa experience
review: 6-20 thru 6-26..Our original plan was to cruise out of palm beach then stay here for a few days. We decided not to cruise but instead stay here. Just the entry alone blew us away. While waiting for our room to be ready we ate downstairs, yes a little pricey but the food was outstanding. The hallways were a little dark but nothing a light coat of paint won't fix. The room was nice and big but the bed was one of the best beds I have stayed in, I had back surgery and always struggle "but not during my stay in that bed" we were there to celebrate our 34 wedding anniversary and to our surprise the hotel sent up champagne and chocolate covered strawberry, what a nice touch. Thursday night they had the violinist/DJ, outstanding, Friday they had a live band  Saturday they had a Motown…

title: Golf at “the squires” course
review: I returned after a few years to find the facilities and amenities to have been updated. This is a large spa with its own outdoor pool area and extensive indoor wet areas with steam and jet tub. The staff is friendly and the treatments and products used are very good . This spa provides a great way to enjoy an entire day of leisurely pampering.

title: PGA Staycation
review: Thank you Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: NOT EXPEDIA GOLD VIP HOTEL
review: Stayed here for one night on a buisness trip, location is prime, hotel is really great nice clean def very upscale but disappointing when i checked in i got a small bag with a pen and comb as a gift for being a expedia vip plus guest i asked about an update to my surprise there was no more of my room types and i was “upgraded” was very disappointed as i wasn’t upgraded i asked for a view my view was the back of A building room was very plain and simple i was tired so i didn’t even go back and ask from desk, really disappointing when expedia always does that claim hotel will upgrade high consuming as myself definitely misleading

title: Great service
review: Thank you for being our guest.  And yes we do provide upgrades for the Expedia VIP's that stay with us.  During your visit the resort was almost full, so unfortunately our options for upgrades were limited.  Please contact me directly next time you plan on staying at PGA and I will personally assist you with your room assignment.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Loved our stay
review: Service and food at the restaurants and throughout the resort is top notch. One example while having lunch there was no coffee on the menu. the server went inside and made sure I had a cup  The only thing holding us back from a 5.rating is the bathroom in the hotel is a little dated.

title: Three days of golf
review: Thank you very much for your feedback and post.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Horrible Customer Service, Needs Updating
review: A very nice hotel. Great amenities including a relaxing balcony/outdoor restaurant overlooking the pool with live music in the evenings. Golf is professional level (Honda Classic). Staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. A member of our group had a daughter who was signing a college scholarship. Hotel arranged for them to hold the ceremony in a boardroom. Great stay!

title: Conference visit
review: I stayed here this past week for a conference related to my job. I am not much of a golfer so I can't review this hotel from a golfing perspective. So I will review it from a hotel and conference perspective.   First, everything is very nice and everything is spectacularly maintained. The rooms were clean and housekeeping was most efficient. Everything worked in the room except for the TV. The TV was very spotty. At first I thought it was because of the bad weather the first few days but the when the weather cleared up the TV was still just as bad. Luckily the Wi-Fi was excellent and I could watch TV on my laptop.   The room had a refrigerator which was nice I wish a microwave was included as well though. So I brought all cold food of course. The food at the hotel was very…

title: Large event hosted at PGA
review: Thank you very much for your gracious post about the property.  Yes the Fitness Center SRC is second to none and we are very proud of it.  Thank you for your comment about the TV, we are actually halfway through with our rewiring of the entire property with Cat 6 cabling to correct our TV problem.  But apologize for any inconvenience it may have caused.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Service is slip sliding away!
review: My company hosted a 5k event at PGA for the 3rd year in a row.  Our on site manager Laura was amazing; extremely responsive, accommodating and professional.  All other staff members were on point and helpful.  Our event was set up promptly and executed smoothly.  We will definitely be hosting this same event for a 4th time next year at PGA!

title: Golf Outing
review: Thank you for you wonderful post and for being our guest for your special event.  Yes I agree Laura is an amazingly young and talented convention/sales manager that we are very proud of her exceptional skills to organize all the logistics and service for your event.  I will forward your comments to her and the rest of the team.  Thank you.    Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: PGA is AMAZING
review: Just got home from our annual 25th guys golf outing at the PGA National Resort. This was a 3 night stay for a party of eight and it was our 2nd stay at this resort.   First the good: The steakhouse on property was exceptional! We had an amazing (it's pricey) meal there. The pretzel bread is not to be missed! I ordered a filet mignon that was cooked perfectly and was delicious.   Now the not-so-good: 1. The buffet breakfast was included in our package. Normally it's $25. Had I of had to actually pay $25, I would of had big issues with it being insufficient. Being I didn't, it was "okay" and there were flies swarming around the omelette ingredients.  The service at the buffet was exceptional. Angel made up for the shortcomings of the actual buffet.  2. The rooms feel very…

title: Spa Experience Mediocre
review: First I will say there were a LOT of Women using the facilities who were there on a Groupon. Probably a good deal for that. The steam/sauna/ and pools are nice.   However, if you’re looking for or are used to a truly first class spa experience, this isn’t for you. The locker rooms are stocked and have very nice staff, but there’s nothing cozy about them. Waiting area is ok.   We had gift certificates— my boyfriend enjoyed his facial, and my Swedish massage was as expected— relaxing. The masseuse was very nice. However where I was VERY disappointed is the Reflexology I added on to the massage. At a spa that is supposed to be this caliber, the Reflexology should be real!!! My $40 pedicure at my nail salon includes a BETTER version of Reflexology than this!!  I gave my therapist…

title: larger rooms at good rate
review: Thank you for your review and being our guest.  Please give me a call directly at 561-227-2555 so I may be able to offer assistance.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Beautiful place to stay, will definitely recommend.
review: heaven for golfers, but also good value for non golfers with great pool area, be prepared for alot of kids. check for special rates, many good resturants in area rooms larger than most resorts fitness center large, clean with many free exercise classes

title: Not what we expected
review: Thank you

title: Oh the cost for the mess!
review: We stayed here in May for a wedding. Staff at check in was very friendly and willing to help - even took a picture of us dressed up for the wedding! Pool and bar area was beautiful!! Did not take advantage of Spa or Golf, but have heard nothing but good things. Will definitely return soon! Thanks.

title: Overpriced disappointing experience
review: This spa is in bad need of renovation along with a good cleaning and staff training. The staff at the front desk were not welcoming. They were proficient in having us sign paperwork and to have us pay $798 for a 75 minute couples massage & two facials. They told us the pool area and restaurant where we had planned to spend time together & have lunch was closed due to weather without offering us any alternative. One of the front desk staff walked me into the locker room giving me a very quick this is here that is there,  here is your locker. *A note for her.  You are the first person guests come in contact with so have a little enthusiasm for the place you work. If you aren’t excited to be there the guests won’t either. Another much nicer staff walked into the locker room a few…

title: Wedding Weekend !
review: Good afternoon Sue and thank you for the response.  Please give me a call directly so we can discuss together.  561-227-2555  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Spoken to in a RUDE and CONDESCENDING manner by security for no reason.
review: Stayed in Rm 3071, excellent large room, were here from Thurs- Sunday for daughters wedding on Sat.  Food and beverage above expectations for a crowd of 150 people both Friday night reception, and Sat night dinner and reception.  This resort does a excellent job with all the aspects of a large wedding crowd.  Very happy with results.

title: Expensive resort but worn and tired
review: Thank you Paul for your post and expressing your experience.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Expensive and a bit tired.
review: Completely and utterly disappointed in the lack of professionalism and customer service skills displayed by their "Wanna Be Secret Service Agent" Security Guard.  Mr. Mark Bender spoke to me like I was a 10-year old he was bossing around. I am a 45 year old grown adult. I do not appreciate be spoken to in such a condescending and disrespectful manner one hour after I checked into this resort as I was walking into the pool area with my son.  This was uncalled for, unprovoked, and completely unacceptable. Additionally when I went to talk to the manager about Mr. Mark Bender's unprofessionalism, rudeness, condescending tone and lack of respect towards me and other adults we were with...the manger would not give me his last name so I could write in a complaint.  He said "he forgot…

title: Loved it!!
review: Loved everything!! Location was awesome, staff was excellent!! The room was clean, the staff was courteous and extremely helpful. I totally enjoyed myself and will definitely return!! I loved the different amenities and the grounds was lush and green!

title: Outstanding golf and accommodations for average golfer!
review: Thank you for you wonderful post.

title: Bear Trap Open
review: Golf courses were in excellent condition.  Staff are friendly and attentive.  Food is very good-especially the cheeseburger at IBar.  Easy drive from airport.  Lots of activities for all ages. Will stay again.

title: Buddy Trip A Winner
review: Thank you for your polite post and experience at PGA National

title: Very decent room and amazing golf
review: Many years of friends meeting to play golf. This resort has everything. Golf, pool and spa. Food  is spectacular. All staff are curtious and attentive. Multiple golf courses to choose from and multiple restaurants.

title: Meeting Staff
review: We recently held an upper level corporate meeting at PGA and the staff was outstanding.  Lauren our conference service manager was very helpful.  Ada & Joseph in banquets went out of their way to take care of our group.  Floyd from A/V was pleasant and responsive.  Johanna in housing was a super star accommodating all of our ever moving reservations. And, I received great feedback from our guests who hit the SRC before coming to the meeting saying that "Joanne at the front desk was a breathe of fresh air."  My only comment would be that the piano located outside of the Oakmont Room was a bit cumbersome.

title: Couples massage
review: Thank you for your recognition of our amazing team leaders.  They all are wonderful at exceeding the guests expectations and their engagement with our guests is second to none.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Delta Sigma Theta Sorority
review: The wife and I spent the entire day at the resort we started with a Swedish couples massage and man was it relaxing. The entire staff was AAA they made sure everything was perfect. If you are looking for a upscale experience I highly recommend PGA spa. After our treatment we spent the rest of the day relaxing in thespas mineral pools and even enjoyed a few cocktails poolside. Even the staff at the pools made you feel like royalty. Must do again soon.

title: Over priced
review: Thank you for your business and for truly enjoying an amazing experience at the PGA Spa.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Calling all Golfers!
review: Joseph(manager), Fransesco(lobby bar), and Ian at front drive all EXCEPTIONAL! Tons of potential for non golfers. May I suggest that a bit more money invested in rooms, and better preparations for large groups!!!!

title: OUR NEW HAPPY PLACE
review: We returned to PGA several times throughout the 2018 Winter Season. Your resort is one of the most relaxing and beautiful destinations we have traveled to this year. The rooms are very clean, spacious and your beds/mattresses are over the top as if you were at a 5* resort. The pool is so relaxing and peaceful, as you do not feel you are sitting on top of each other. We enjoy relaxing in your very spacious hot tub after a day at the pool. Wider and Jorge were always there with amazing and friendly service. The front desk staff are always so welcoming and Ziggy is there to meet your every need. We were able to try several new restaurants with the help of you most pleasant concierge Antonella, who goes above and beyond to help you have the most enjoyable dining experience. Ironwood…

title: Wonderful place to stay !
review: Thank you Ruth for your wonderful post.  We appreciate your returning to our resort in so many ways and thank you for recognizing our great team members.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: PGA Resort and Spa
review: My husband and I stayed here and went to some spring training baseball games for the Washington Nationals.  The resort is very relaxing in a beautiful setting on a golf course & full of palm trees!  The rooms & beds are very comfortable & the pool is great with a poolside bar & restaurant .  The food we ate at the iBar restaurant was delicious and the staff is very friendly and accommodating.  This was our 2nd stay here and I hope we can return next spring.

title: For the Golfer and family
review: Thank you for being our guest and your wonderful post.  Spring training is such an wonderful period for all of us since the Nationals and Astros started their spring training here.  As well as having the Cardinals, Marlins and Mets here as well. Good luck to the Nationals this year.  Should be an amazing season.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Flying visit.
review: I returned to PGA National with my family. The purpose of our visit so soon again was to spend time with the family in a relaxed atmosphere. Also, to play golf, swim in a beautiful pool, utilize the spa and enjoy great food. We played the Palmer, Fazio and the Championship Courses. They are all great courses and all play very different. The multiple tee boxes allow play of all levels. Ironwood Steak and Seafood Restaurant is an excellent restaurant. Several in the group used the Spa and enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere. After golf, we enjoyed the pool and pool restaurant. Whereas our group included adult children, after dinner we danced at the iBar and enjoyed the live band. I am pleased to write this second review from the standpoint of a family vacation. We will be back again…

title: Eh.
review: Not great. Not bad, but not great. Something titled as grand as "The PGA Resort and Spa" would lead one to expect something...more than what it actually is. Everyone is polite, everything is clean, and the rooms are comfortable enough. Just lacks any POP or surprise. It's good enough.

title: Can you hear me now
review: Thank you Charles for your visit and post.  I would respectfully disagree with your post as I believe we have an amazing property including 5 Championship golf course, including the Jack Nicholas and home of the Honda Classic Championship Course, a full service and award winning Spa, 8 restaurant outlets, 40k square ft. of meeting space, a 5 million dollar completely renovated sports and racquet club that has been selected as the best fitness center in the area among just some of the many amenities offered for any guest enjoying a full service resort.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: They did an amazing job with the Honda Classic
review: In addition to the loud noise and screaming where you can’t carry on. Conversation I noted Prices for wine by the drink are no where near competitors.   About double. The appetizers are small and also over priced  One thing is the view is good

title: Best staycation ever!
review: Thank you for your comments Mr. Bowers.  The lobby does have a very energetic quality and feel in the evenings to provide our evening guests with a fun and active entertainment experience.  I apologize if any guest noises affected your experience.  Our wine by the glass pricing is between $7-$8 for your basic wines and up to $12+ for higher end wines, and is competitively priced within the market place of our PBG neighborhood set.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Honda Classic
review: I went with my aunt to this sprawling and incredible golf course/resort to watch the PGA Honda Clasdic tournament and I was really overwhelmed by the great facilities. It’s an organizational boondoggle to keep thousands of people happy while trying to feed them and satisfy them through multiple days in the hot Florida sun but somehow they really were able to pull it off. I would consider staying here the next time I’m in Florida. Great job PGA!

title: PGA Resort
review: Just returned from PGA National. It is my fifth time to the resort and I’m returning in March with my entire family. Not only does the resort offer tremendous golf courses, it has several other activities. The Spa is one of the best I have used.
