The fitness center has any type equipment the you need for a complete work out. The pool is beautiful. The rooms are very comfortable and relaxing. The food is first class and at the Ironwood Steakhouse and Seafood Restaurant I had one of the best steaks I ever had. This is the type of resort that young and old can enjoy. I highly recommend PGA National and I am looking forward to my next visit.

title: Poor customer service
review: Thank you very much Bruce for your wonderful post.  Look forward to seeing you back again soon.

title: Bad and good
review: Terrible customer service, especially at the golf courses. While the facilities are top notch, I honestly cannot imagine coming back here again. We are paying $700/night for the gold golf package, and we have been treated like second class citizens so far.  We were forced to take a golf cart without a top. It then proceeded to rain pretty hard for about an hour. The starter told us we could take another cart with a top, and then when we tried to do that, another older gentleman yelled at us like we were children. Instead of finding a solution, we were yelled at. We then tried to call and noone picked up.  Later in the day, when closing out our tab with the cart lady, we realized we were severely overcharged. Hopefully that can still be corrected.   Restaurants are closed in the…

title: Underwhelms Relative to Reputation and Expectations
review: Please except my sincere apologies Max.  Please contact me directly for assistance  561-227-2555

title: Low Service for this Category of Hotel
review: 1. The room was old, poorly cleaned, and in disrepair  2  . The fazio golf course was poorly maintained 3. The front desk personnel were sullen and dismissive. When we had a problem they basically said we were out of luck. Fortunately Ziggie an outside attendant came to our rescue. 4. The room, not worth the price EXCEPT it was as quiet as a tomb and the bed was like sleeping on mount Olympus, absolutely comfortable  5. Breakfast and lunch were first class, dinner at ironside was outstanding  5. The leadbetter golf scool was fabulous

title: Wonderful/ Maravilloso
review: Great room. Nice pools. Perfect if you like to play golf. Good service and good food. We will come back.  Habitación fantástica. Piscinas excelentes. Lugar perfecto si te gusta jugar al golf. Buen servicio y buena comida. Volveremos

title: Golf Trip.
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to write such a thoughtful review. We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit. We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your visit and that you found the food and service to your satisfaction.  Gracias. Hasta que te volvamos a ver.

title: Dated Hotel, Nice amentities
review: Wondeeful location. The staff is superb. Golf staff helpful and willing to assist. The bell staff was great, especially as I was rushing for a tee time. Rooms were large and well appointed. Steakhouse was good and nice wine list. Would definitely recommend for a guys golf trip.

title: What a dump! Nightmare trip
review: Thank you for staying with us and your post.  Its Honda Classic week so we have a big week ahead of us highlighting the Championship Course and Bear Trap.   and Tiger will be playing :)  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Great golfing resort
review: PGA is most definitely a resort dedicated to golfers. The hotel itself is dated and the rooms could use an update. Nice pool area and even on weekends, there are plenty of lounge chairs available. Pool service drinks. Had a nice lunch there with courteous service. The coffee kiosk in the lobby with bagels, yogurt, muffins etc. had a only one person working there with a long line of people. The coffee was awful. A woman also mentioned that to me in the elevator. There is a very good tennis facility there, many members have games in the morning and take up the courts. The fitness center was excellent with all the equipment and the classes offered and were included were small, personalized and very good. Instructors were helpful and really enjoyed. The golf range is included with…

title: Expansive grounds, great food
review: Here for two nights for a conference. Rooms were generous with a two sink bathroom to convenience couples (which I wasn't).   Fixtures and furniture seem to date the hotel somewhat. For example, no power I could find at the desk or bedside. I ended up charging my tablet in the bathroom and my phone from a power brick I carry with me. There was a commercial  six-outlet power strip plugged in alongside a dresser marked "maintenance" so I think they recognize the shortcoming.  Best part was the food. This venue had some of the best conference food I've had in a long time. Breakfast for example. The bagel bar had all the usual toppings as well as 3-4 different types of cream cheese. And chopped egg - separated into whites and yokes!   Also, it was not over-air conditioned like so…

title: Southern Seniors Golf Association Trip
review: Thank you for your response and for being our guest.  We currently are addressing the need for additional power outlets in the guest rooms and hope to have a solution soon.  I apologize for any inconvenience.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Great concierge serivice
review: This was a very good venue an the golf was outstanding.  The staff were most gracious and attentive and was very receptive to all of my needs.  I was with a fantastic organization and with that made the trip so much fun and more enjoyable.  I had several meals on property and was well pleased with taste, presentation, and the service was outstanding. Due to going to such nice venues like PGA National I will renew my membership to Southern Seniors Golf Association  I am glad I made the effort to attend  this event and play golf at PGA National.

title: Surprisingly Good
review: Thank you William and we completely cherish and enjoy hosting the Southern Seniors Golf Association.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Family Wedding
review: Antonella Mancino is the concierge I had the pleasure to interact with. She is always smiling and did a fantastic job for me. Recognizing that dealing with the traveling public isn't always a walk-in-the-park, she deserves a pat on the back.

title: Absolutely WORST stay anywhere I have ever been!
review: I am shocked and so surprised at the stay I recently had at this resort.  It was my first time staying there and I can honestly say that while we are planning a luxury trip to West Palm Beach in the near future I will NOT stay there.  Not ever again.  Perhaps had my issue been resolved I would rethink it but for almost two days (my whole stay), I had no working lights in my bathroom, outer vanity area or one light in my room.  They flickered, and then they died and never worked again until 10 minutes before I was scheduled to check out and all of  sudden, they all came back on.  The hair dryer did not work anywhere near a mirror and the coffee pot did not work.  It was clearly an electrical outlet issue which to me is a HUGE SAFETY concern but when I reported it, all three…

title: PGA Natiional
review: Thank you for being our guest.  I apologize for any inconvenience experienced during your stay. I was not made aware of this situation?  Please contact me directly at your convenience so we can discuss and I can offer my assistance.   My Sincere Apologies. Bill Horn,  Resort Manager  561-227-2555

title: Such Potential But Lacking
review: This was a wonderful experience. First, we upgraded to a Jr Suite for $60/night which was very well worth it. The hotel employees went out of your way to make our stay a wonderful experience. Hotel food is very good (no recommendations). You can use the fitness center and ALL exercise classes are free (great deal). The Fazio and Squire course in February were in fair shape. The Palmer course was in great shape. The hotel has done major renovations the last year and it shows. Now they need to spend some money on the golf courses.

title: Just the best of Florida
review: Thank you very much for being our guest Dennis.  And for enjoying the experience. Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Cottage stay
review: Stayed for a weekend with a group.  The reservation for golf and Spa was ridiculous with no Spa flexibility.  No choice of services or times regardless of agreeing to pay an upcharge.  Planning the reservation was difficult as the representative couldn't adequately explain how the rate was being calculated.  Skipped the spa altogether and booked room separately.  Much better deal.  The resort is very large with a simple stark design.  The check-in personnel were pleasant if not very professional.  The lobby bar staff were welcoming and friendly but it is very pricey.  $4 for an iced tea.  It is a very fun bar area with good service.  The rooms are an adequate size with necessary amenities although the bathroom items are average and nothing exceptional.  The insulation is poor as…

title: Stephen Jensen
review: Pga National is a very nice golf resort.the rooms were comfortable and the golf courses were in great shape considering all the rain they had since the summer. The steak house restaurant was good but very expensive,the other restaurants were acceptable, I would recommend this destination for a fun golf getaway.

title: Average hotel great golf
review: Thank you Mr. Jenson for being our guest and for your great post.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Amazing resort
review: The golf here is well organised and and very good.. The Champions course was a treat to play, the Fazio very good and the Squire OK. The hotel is a decent property but was spoilt by poor staff in cert win areas. The reception staff were good. Angel the lady in the Palm Terrace was outstanding but the bar staff and golf course restaurant staff were a little surly, poorly trained and overworked. The room we had was facing the rear of the property and whilst well appointed was very dark. So overall come for the golf avoid the restaurants and the bars which are overpriced and staffed with surly people. The golf is worth it though.

title: Pleasant Vacation Spot
review: Good afternoon Paul and thank you for your comments and please accept my apologies for any staff concerns.  We strive for quality service in all areas.   I will bring to the attention of the team.  Bill Horn, Resort Manager

title: Great place for meetings and conventions.
review: The hotel staff were exceptional and accommodating. The ammendties were incredible. Beautiful pool and pool side bar. The outside terrace over looking the pool was amazing with heater lamps and propane fireplaces.  There was a fitness center with over 50 classes to take as well as as state of the art gym equipment.  Very clean!

title: Ripped off From The Second We got there
review: Golf courses were fine, but the hotel and resort felt like a rip off from the second we got there to the time we left.  We tried to check in early, but were told our type of room was not available for early check in, but many more "upgraded" rooms were available. We ended up having to pay $20 a night extra for a room that was available with a "better view" - the room turned out to be identical to the other three rooms our group rented, at the previously agreed upon rate.  This felt like a total scam, and occurred within 5 minutes of our arrival.  The first night after getting our bill, there was a $30 charge that made no sense - labeled "Golf Package Allowance Exceeded."  I brought the bill to the front desk and was told "this happens all the time" and the charge was removed. …

title: Could be so much better!!!
review: Good afternoon SC Golf,  Please accept my sincere apologies for any inconveniences.  Please call me directly if you would like to discuss. Bill Horn, Resort manager 561-227-2555

title: Nice hotel for a Family
review: I’m at the hotel now. For two days in a row I’ve sat on the deck off the IBar (Central Bar) and have waited more than a 45 minutes for service. Yesterday, we sat down near some empty glasses, but nobody cleared them off. Now I’m here again and the service is sporadic, at best. Several of the people on the deck have been waited on, but a number of others, including me, have not. They have plenty of servers, but most are standing around talking with each other. I’ve been here at the hotel many times (the golf is good), and while the service is fine inside, it’s TERRIBLE and SPORADIC out on the deck. The wait staff is fine when you get service, but it’s rare. Also, when you call the hotel and ask for a department, you can wait seemingly forever.   On the plus side is a nice pool,…

title: Total Bummer
review: Thank you Mr. M for bringing this to ur attention.  Our goal and standard at PGA is to always go above and beyond and to exceed the guests expectations.  I apologize if we have missed on the I Deck staff servicing customers.  If you could please give me a call directly we can discuss in more detail so I may assist in this matter.  561-227-2555

title: Superstar Concierge....Antonella ! knows the area very well..first class service
review: Since their renovation a few years ago the hotel is really great aside from being very crowded during holidays and closed to outsiders during April break when it's taken over for the week. The gym and golf courses are really good and lobby are and rooms are nice too. Really good for families.

title: Great Event and Facility at PGA National
review: We enjoy having our event at PGA National each year.  The staff is amazing to work with and help to make our event better each year.  The hotel is clean and the food is delicious.  The staff is so pleasant and friendly.  They take care of everything you will need during your stay /event.

title: It was decent
review: Thank you for your wonderful post.

title: Great Event at PGA National!
review: I guess I expected a lot more from this place. I’m very familiar with the area so I took the opportunity to finally stay here. The pool area is very nice and so is the gym facility. We requested an early check in but that wasn’t available when we arrived. Items on the premises are super pricey. I’m not one to complain about money but for 2 fountain sodas at the bar it cost 12 bucks without tip.  Room I had was nothing special. Average and it had two full size beds which the sheets were like sand paper. Walls are very thin and you can hear your neighbors clearly. Room had a balcony which was nice to go on from time to time. Tv didn’t work have the time not sure if the cable connection was poor. The food at the breakfast buffet was good had nice variety little pricey. Drinks at…

title: Good facility, average service vastly overpriced
review: Good morning Trudy and thank you for your response.  We are always trying to improve our product and amenities.  I will review your comments with the team.

title: Overrated Overpriced
review: Hosted a group of 12 at PGA National for 3 days last week! Fantastic facilities and a great team of service professionals. My contact was David Lederkramer, who from our contract signing until our event was a true pro! We had to be rebooked to the dates last week due to Hurricane Irma and his reaction and flexibility was incredible. Tyler, our concierge for golf, was equally good at communicating and setting up all of our needs for golf. We ate on property the first night at Ironwood and had a great meal with our group. I highly recommend this resort and I am already looking at dates to have our event in 2018! Nice job to the team at PGA National Resort....everything was great!

title: Nice property for a conference
review: I attended a 2 day conference at the PGA National Resort and it was nice. My room was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. Unfortunately I didn't have time to enjoy the resort but the grounds looked nice. My room was quiet except one morning I was woken up but a loud noise that may have been a truck backing up outside but sounded like a shooting sound effect from a video game. There were lots of families and kids of all ages around which seemed weird during mid week while school is in session.

title: Spot on in everything they do. Top location.
review: Thank you for your visit.  This past week we held the world famous "Little Moes" tennis tournament where kids from 36 countries participated in a global tennis tournament on our 17 tennis courts and facilities.

title: Nice resort hotel with golf and great pool area.
review: Top notch resort in the beautiful palm beach. Big golfing destination, although I wasn't there for that. Hotel is really nicely done throughout. Rooms are spot on and to a good standard (I had a junior suite). Pool area is great. The entire hotel is well kept and maintained. The main bar and restaurant area have a great feel and I was very happy to while away an evening at the bar chatting to staff and folk while the entertainment played. Staff are really well trained and make the extra effort. Everything seems to be taken care of. Highly recommended destination.

title: Every aspect was fantastic
review: Thank you Jonathan for your wonderful post.  Hope to see you again soon.

title: IBar, IDeck, ILove PGA National!!!
review: The renovation on the pool makes this hotel. Of course most people are here for the golf. The rooms are nice and roomy. Lobby is a bit too busy since the bar in in the same area. Overall I was very satisfied and friendly staff too.

title: To many things missing to be a coincidence
review: Overall the resort and spa is a beautiful property.  As an avid golfer I was looking forward to our stay.  As a frequent business traveler I travel pretty much every week and have never had anything go missing.  During our stay over 4 days we had 5 things go missing, only one was recovered from security.  They included a bag of clothes, a pair of earrings, a bottle of a nutritional supplement and pair of golf shoes.  Out of those only the bag of clothes was returned to security.    The golf shoes went missing at the golf course after my round!  They were supposed to take my shoes and clubs to the valet.  I left the course without my shoes, returned 30 minutes later and they were no where to be found.  The staff looked for 30 minutes and we filed the issue with security.  There…

title: Did not honour multiple bookings on arrival!
review: Ravi, I apologize for any inconvenience.  Please call me directly so we can review.  561-227-2555

title: Great Staff
review: I’d be able to post a review if we had been able to stay in our prebooked and confirmed room BUT when we arrived we were told that they had overbooked by over 12 rooms and that we had to stay 3 miles away at a Doubletree Inn ! The booking director of operations was not available to talk even though he had a form letter drawn up that the people working at the front desk handed to us and we were told they could do nothing ; couldn’t reach Bill  Horn ( the director ) and when we asked them to call there was a message for all of us standing at the front desk and being shuttled off the property  Many of us had flown through the night and were running on 24 hours of no sleep and to add insult to unjury we were told there was no early check in the next day, no guarantee of a room or…

title: Italian Open 2017
review: We had a business meeting here and the meeting services was outstanding.  Great location, amazing food.  The entire staff was so professional and accommodating.  The PGA Resort and Spa is just a classy hotel.  Sincerely want to thank Craig Cochran and Laura Busch for all their assistance in making our meetings a huge success!

title: Golf and Dolphins Long Weekend
review: Thank you and happy holidays.  Craig and Laura are superstars!!  Thank you for the recognition of their hard work and efforts.

title: Sit back and relax
review: My room was so comfortable and "clean" but the view was marginal.  I'm not complaining, I didn't spend a lot of time there.  Anywhere at the resort, the staff was friendly and so helpful.  Made me feel very welcomed when the next day, the staff remembers you and welcomes you like family. Then the views, well, IT IS BEAUTIFUL.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone for any occasion.  I was there for several significant birthday celebrations, and the PGA Resort was the perfect background.

title: Rarely Write Review but Had to After Poor Experience
review: Happy Thanksgiving Anita and thank you for the wonderful review you posted.  We hope to see you back soon.

title: Very Nice
review: I stayed here a few weeks back for a golf event. I decided to bring my family so it was over the weekend. When I booked the room, I requested a king and also spoke with a back office manager that stated it wasn't an issue. Wrong, when I arrived I was told there were only double beds and a mistake was made but.... if I wanted a king bed that there were junior suites and oh by the way that's an $80 update. Since I had the family and a little one I decided it was worth it for the comfort of the family. The external property definitely shows it's age and looks like the inside had been recently updated. The room was nice, but had this musty and damp smell. The balcony as mentioned looked old and appeared unsafe so didn't want to take the chance of going out. Another observation is…

title: PGA Golf
review: Than you Ryan for you post and visit.  I sincerely apologize for any inconveniences during your visit.  I will discuss with the team your concerns as we always try to improve our service levels to our guests.  Please call me directly if you need further assistance 561-227-2555.

title: Great Golf!!
review: Accommodations: AWESOME!  Location:  AWESOME!  Food: TASTY!  If you are looking to kick back and relax, PGA Resort is a great place!  The rooms are very spacious with a balcony view. The location is literally a golf course (super nice), and food — yummy!!!

title: Stayed for business but will definitely return for pleasure!
review: We were only visiting for a short stop on our way for a long cruise out of Ft. Lauderdale but the facility was beautiful and the staff very accommodating!  The pool area over looked the golf course and had spectacular views.There was a lot of things for the kids to do (ages 8-13) in & around the pool area while the adults enjoyed the hot tub!

title: Staff excellent but Squire course was nearly unplayable.
review: Thank you Tina for being our guest and for your wonderful post.

title: Perfect Resort
review: We wanted to play the Championship course but it was occupied so we played the Squire. I had no idea we would play the entire course from the cart path only. I had several times I ended up hitting the wrong clubs because I always seemed to be so far from the cart path. I have a heart condition and I just couldn’t handle this course. It should be closed in this condition until it dries out. The course was so wet we all ended up with mud splashes on our legs and didn’t enjoy it at all. The ball would plug or splash in the fairway. The course was in average condition for the Palm Beach area, but drainage is a major problem there. Greens were good. Fairways had a lot of weed incursion. Fortunately the staff shined as usual and made it more pleasant. Sand traps were packed hard and…

title: Disappointing
review: Thank you Tom for your post.  Weather can cause many challenges during and after rain and course play.  Pending on the level of rain received we try our best to determine if the course is suitable for play.  If you allow golf carts off the cart paths and onto the course after a big rain, the damage from the weight of the carts is far worse on the fairways then if you allow cart path only to maintain the condition of the course.  Please return in the future and try us again.

title: Good location but property is tired
review: A group of thirty came to enjoy a sparkling weekend, and did. The staff merits the first mention. Everyone was pleasant, did whatever was appropriate and addressed us by name, if possible. Rooms are large with nice furnishings and very clean. Perfect breakfast buffet with made to order omelets, hot foods, excellent fruit assortment, and lox and bagels.  We ate lunch at the pool, good choice, and swam for a couple of hours.  Lots of chairs.  A spa and fitness center are available , too. If you golf, I guess this is the place. None of us tried it.  Our dinners were in the ball rooms, so we did not try the restaurants, but the banquets were quite good. Lots of well located self parking, or valet. Quite the night scene in the bar area. Large public areas.

title: Memorable buddy golf trip at PGA National.
review: This was one of our best buddy golf trips which we have been doing for 10 years. This is our first time here and we are coming back here. This will be in our rota. We played Squire, Fazio and the championship course and all of them are fun to play and the championship course definitely fit the bill. There was 2 inches of rain on Friday and yet the championship course was almost dry and the greens were firm and fast. The staff has been amazing, our experience starting with group reservations to stay to golf and check out has been nothing but wonderful.   The staff is always ready to  go extra length to take care of you.  Our Friday round washed out after 9 holes and they took care of us by giving resort credit that night which paid for our dinners. There was maintenance done on…

title: It’s Off Season, but Make the Best of It
review: Thank you Suresh for your wonderful post and for your golf group staying with us.  The Champions course is an amazing experience and we hope you retrun soon.

title: Great golf, well run resort
review: Here’s the Deal.  I liked the Hotel.  I was there for a Convention.  Upon arrival, the Valet said it was $24?? Per day for Valet service or park at the bottom of the hill for free.  Excellent that I was given the choice, because free parking is very close by.  I would have paid $5-$10 if they reduced the cost.  My room was very clean, but on floor 1.  The Lobby is floor 2. Strange.  It didnt effect me since the room was perfect.  No view though, you need to ask for a higher floor. I saw 2 other rooms and they were all clean and better than most hotels.  All had a refrigerator, no mini-bar.  Off Season, the main Steak Restaurant is closed Sundays and Mondays, and the only place you can get food is the Bar, or room service, which is the same menu.  I Ubered to a Capitol Grille…

title: we experienced excellent room service . Personnel were  very  helpful and professional
review: Thank you Patrick for being our guest and your post.  I will take your comments to our team to review any improvements needed for our guest experience.  Thank you for recognizing Robert as well as he does a wonderful job connecting with our guests to improve their experience.  Thank you once again

title: Birthday trip!
review: Visited PGA National for a three day group golf trip. Each day the golf carts were loaded up with your clubs and waiting for you when you walked out the back door....they make everything easy. Played the Fazio and the Squire courses first. Very soggy due to extensive rain but both enjoyable layouts. Can't give a perfectly accurate assessment without playing them in decent weather but would consider them both as typical Florida courses:-- very good condition, plenty of water, but nothing too out of the ordinary for Florida. The Championship course is what you come for! The course struck me as very fair (surprisingly wide fairways for a PGA tour course) with guarded greens, but not "tricked up" at all. Greens were predictable and rolled beautifully. Just knowing you're playing…

title: Exceeded expectations!
review: My husband and I went for a weekend getaway to celebrate both my birthday and our anniversary. From the second we pulled in until the minute we left, we were greeted with smiles and fantastic hospitality. From bellman, valet, front desk, concierge, housekeeping... everywhere, we were taken care of and treated like VIP's, which was LOVELY! We stayed in the Media Suite which was breathtaking. We can't wait to go back. Great experience!

title: Never going back
review: Thank you Stacy for your visit and your kind post.  The Media suite is a wonderful guest room amenity that has fun interactive fun things to do.  Thank you also for recognizing our service team professionals who always try to go above and beyond to make the best impression and experience.

title: Great room, too bad not what we reserved
review: Terrible checkin, room humid, ac sounds like a Jet engine, paint chipping in room, shower won't drain. I'm not going to go on... Old property, poorly trained staff. The food from ibar is horrible and I literally couldn't eat it.

title: Great hotel!
review: Good afternoon Timothy. I'm sorry you had a poor experience.  Please contact me at 561-227-2555 so I might discuss and offer assistance.

title: Birthday weekend
review: We had reserved a Golf junior suite, instead ended up by the spa, with no view, only greenery.  However turned out to be a blessing, as the room was very quiet and no one was walking down the halls a 2:30 AM singing or talking loudly.    Played two rounds of golf, courses were not in best condition but enjoyed playing.

title: Hurricane Irma
review: Stayed because we had no power ! Was told by several people no cancellation fees like everyone in the industry was doing !! We own a inn ourselves but we're out of power . I was just one night cancellation fee when our power came on . Spoke to Michael the manager but was told "corporate was all over them so they couldn't waive it "". Ridiculous!!! Went to Wyndham and cancellation fee was waived !! Will never recommend this place ! Horrible customer service!

title: Horrendous and Inexcusable Customer Relations!!!!
review: Good morning Betsy.  I am disappointed to see this review.  I believed after our polite and professional conversation we came to an understanding, even though you were checking out, not because your power was back on but because another hotel was closer to yours and you would have preferred to stay there.  We were just honoring our commitment to you that was disclosed when you made the reservation, as we turned others away.  I'm sorry you feel disappointed.  Please contact me anytime for further discussion and assistance.  561-227-2555

title: BEWARE HURRICANE IRMA REFUGEES!!!
review: As a result of Hurricane Irma, we were forced to evacuate from our home and stay in a hotel.  This morning (9/17/17) we received the good news that our power had been restored and we could return home.  Immediately upon learning this news early this morning, I called the front desk at the hotel to tell them of our situation and asked if we could possibly check out today instead of tomorrow. The response I got was that we could check out today, but we would still be charged for tonight because that is the hotel's cancellation policy. I repeatedly explained that we weren't on vacation and we weren't just leaving the hotel on a whim.  We were there because we were forced from our home and only wanted to check out a day early because we finally got our power back.  I know many…

title: Name Says it All
review: We honor our commitments…and in order to secure our inventory we apply minimum length of stay requirements that we FULLY DISCLOSE as part of our reservation confirmation process…..The safety and security of our guests/members and associates is our number one priority…We stayed fully operational during the storm and served our guests in an exemplary fashion…We turned hundreds of guests away also looking for shelter during the storm because of the guaranteed reservation we made.  We received several positive testimonials from a number of our guests… We try each and every day to conduct ourselves with the utmost in compassion and caring for our guests and associates and I am sorry you didn’t feel that way… I am very proud of our team of professionals.  May we also add that we offered very low rates during the storm to provide shelter to those in need. We did not raise our rates, in fact, to the contrary.

title: The Good the Bad and the Really Ugly!
review: After being displaced by Hurricane Irma, I unfortunately had to spend the last 2 nights at PGA National Resort & Spa. My town of Delray Beach got hit especially hard and we couldn't remain in our home any longer with temps upwards of 100 degrees. So when I got word my power was back on I couldn't wait to get home after not having power for almost a week after this horrible natural disaster. But when I went to check out, the front desk informed me they'd be charging me an early checkout fee of a FULL night's stay! So despite FL Governor Scott's pleas for hotels to be compassionate to Irma refugees and waive penalties like this due to the dire circumstances PGA National has made the decision NOT to and in their own words, "we are hitting everybody with early check out fees - NO…

title: Love this hotel
review: We've been coming to this hotel every Passover in march/April depends the year for 7 years now and I must say it's the best. The rooms are very spacious , clean, housekeeping is very good, live the pool and live the lobby, it's a great hotel with lots of space! Would recommend for anytime of year.

title: Great locals weekend getaway!
review: Thank you for the wonderful post.

title: Love It! Had a blast at the 2017 Craft Beer Festival Weekend
review: We chose the PGA for a one night stay so we could crash after the Jason Aldean concert and not have to drive an hour home after a long night, and maybe play a little golf the next day as a bonus.  We live at a sister golf community an hour's drive south, so we were looking forward to playing the Championship course through our Palmer Advantage membership, but those darn South Florida storms cancelled our Sunday golf plans. Although the hotel was not really our focus, we were so pleasantly surprised! The lobby, restaurants, pool - all very nice and modern.  We LOVED our Spa Suite - what a beautiful big room!  We had excellent room service breakfast - huge perfect omelet awaited me as I crawled out of that cloud of a bed!! We will definitely come back to try our luck at the…

title: A Great Resort!!
review: Thank you for your wonderful post and for being our guest.  Yes all of the rooms have brand new Black Beautyrest matresses and they are wonderful.

title: A family-friendly property with a beautiful spa and amazing dining options
review: Stayed the weekend for the Annual Craft Beer Festival.  Had a great time! Food is fantastic, staff is friendly and the place is beautiful. The bedding is so comfy you won't want to leave the room. And, The POOL!   It's simply magical.  We will be back again for vacation or another fesitval.

title: Failure with no recovery.
review: Very nice place overall. Room was okay, nothing special. Feed and drinks at the lobby bar were good, and the staff was as well. Fire alarm in the middle of the night - not great, and a mechanical error, from what I heard from other guests, but nothing from hotel. The middle of the night exercise was not handled by staff well at all; it was handle by staff at all! No communication, nothing. At checkout, no mention, no efforts of any type. Pretty poor, given the inconvenience, etc. Then I get a random, unexplained additional charge on my credit card. I got it fixed, but adding that on top of the night's experience, I won't be in a hurry to come back. The lack of response to the poor experience seems absurd for a place of this reputation.

title: Perfection!
review: Thank you for your post.  Please accept my sincere apology for any inconvenience. We did have a false fire alarm one evening.  We attempted to apologize and explain to as many guests as possible.  But if we didn't properly communicate to you at the desk upon check out I sincerely apologize.  Please contact me directly if you may to further discuss.  561-227-2555

title: Great Resort
review: The front desk team greeted me with such a friendly welcome! They accommodated all of my requests. I really loved everything that came with The PGA Suite! Poker table and pool table was awesome. Also appreciate the valet guys for helping bring up our stuff, and the concierge that sent up some fruits and water to my room! Everything was perfect and everyone were really nice! I had an amazing time for my birthday weekend getaway. This place is really worth it!

title: Nice But Some Disappointments
review: Thank you Nixss for your wonderful post and for being our guest.

title: Short but amazing vacation
review: Great time!  Great entertainment @ the I Bar.  A resort with every amenity possible and very attentive staff.  Started the day with a wonderful massage at the Spa!  I live locally so it was a great place to stay,  meet friends and enjoy a night away!

title: Awesome stay!
review: We loved it! The kids enjoyed the pool and junior golf. The staff was so hospitable. We've definitely found our to go to resort in Palm Beach whenever we fly over! I would highly recommend even the rates were pretty good!

title: Beautiful spot to relax by the pool
review: Thank you and please come visit again.

title: Perfect!
review: Room was nice with a view in the treetops.  Super tropical.  Room was really dark just needed more lighting. Closet had a hanging bar about 3 feet high. I'm sure the room was meant to be wheelchair friendly. Need a vent fan in the bathroom. Very damp after shower.  Don't try to split your check!  Took forever but the food was great even though cold. But very expensive.  Glass of wine $14 didn't like that. Loved free parking.

title: Wonderful Getaway
review: Thank you for your post and visit.  We will review your comments with our team to review the areas pointed out of concern.

title: PGA Cottage...Our Sanctuary!
review: Every facet of our stay was fantastic.  All the employees were friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and sincere.  Our room was perfect and comfortable.  The golf was excellent!  The evening entertainment was tons of fun!  Food was great.

title: Amazing Spa & Golf weekend getaway!!
review: What a great trip.!! We were two couples looking to get away for the weekend and chose PGA National Resort & Spa. The guys played golf and girls went to the spa. The Championship course is everything you could imagine and more. The women loved the spa and said it was very clean. We ate dinner in the Ironwood restaurant and everyone enjoyed their meal. My filet Mignon was terrific and the French Onion Soup was worth the calories. David the manager was very welcoming to us and went around the restaurant making sure people were enjoying their meal. The room was very clean and the Resort is very well maintained. On Saturday night they had a group singing in the lobby and they had everyone on their feet dancing. We cant wait to go back again soon.

title: Wonderful accommodations
review: Thanks golfballguy for your post and business.  And for allowing us the opportunity to have you and your friends back for a wonderful experience.  Stay in touch if your back in the area.  Have a great summer

title: An excellent overall stay
review: We came for a junior golf tournament held onsite and everything has been smooth and comfortable. From shipping clubs in advance of our arrival through our stay, everyone here works very hard to ensure you're comfortable.   We stayed in a cottage (500 rand numbers) overlooking the Squire course and it's a 4 minute walk to the pro shop and resort. There's a community pool also very close that's not crowded, very private and well kept. Our cottage had 2br, 2 bath, full kitchen, washer dryer, patio with outdoor seating, fast wifi, satellite tv. Our particular unit could certainly use some updating, but it was very comfortable.   The onsite food was delicious and the pro shop is well stocked with many, many brands. We especially liked the selection of little kids golf apparel.

title: Astounding service, nice rooms, and excellent amenities set this resort apart from others
review: Thank you Angie for your post and being our guest for the Optimist tournament.  The cottages area a nice and comfortable experience where if with a family allows a full kitchen facility.  Thank you for being our guest.

title: Amenities & entertainment
review: We stayed here for a golf holiday, and was very pleased with the hotel. The pool got very busy, with it being a holiday weekend members were able to use the pool as well as hotel guests, and really anyone could walk in and use the pool area. But that was only downside to our stay. The beds were by far the comfiest beds I have ever had the privilege of sleeping with. That in itself would be worth a return! The rooms were well equipped, clean, and luxurious. The hotel itself was lovely too. Plenty of places to eat nearby.

title: Lack of attention to detail was very disappointing
review: Stayed two nights for a girls' spa weekend at the beginning of July.  Spa reservations were messed up upon arrival and the attention to detail in the room was not what we would have expected, given the reputation of the resort.  In our bathroom, there was mildew on the shower curtain and layers of dust in the ceiling vent.  The batteries in the ceiling fan remote did not work, so the fan ran constantly and the light was perpetually off.  New batteries were never provided.  The second day, a bottle of cleaning solution was left behind by housekeeping.  Completed the online survey sent by the resort after my stay and included all of the above.  Expected some sort of follow-up, but got none, despite sending an additional email via their website.  Again, lax attention to detail,…

title: Relaxing Stay!
review: Good afternoon Catherine and thank you for your business and post.  I apologize for any inconveniences during your stay.  If you would like to talk directly my number is 561-227-2555.  I am out of the office until Monday but will pop into the office on Thur or Fri and would be happy to give you a call to discuss.

title: Ok but not great.  Make sure  you get a deal if you stay here, not worth full price
review: Spent one night for a little getaway on a pool view junior suite, the room was spacious, clean and the beds.... extremely comfortable! The view is very nice, relaxing, pretty, with music in the background, the drinks are a little overpriced but delicious! but the food is definitely 5 starts! Delish! The only reason why I gave this hotel 4 stars instead of 5 is because they need more servers at the pool... it was only one guy taking care of all the orders around the pool so the service was very slow! Other than that.... the front desk people were pleasant and profesional... would most likely come back one day again!

title: Awesome weekend with the grand kids at PGA National Resort & SPA
review: Thank you for your visit and for your post CaticaA.  Have a great summer and hope to see you again soon.

title: Brilliant second stay!
review: This resort is ok, a bit out of the way,  Looks nice outside but could use some updating.  Front desk staff left something to be desired, not helpful, didn't seem to care they weren't helpful.  A simple request of a late checkout on a Sunday and they refused to bother to  even check, just a snarky "NO we are completely full".   I promptly checked the availibility and this was untrue, there were plenty of rooms available?  No offer to store luggage, not help with where we could shower, as most good resorts we stay are helpful with, Sadly poor staff can make a stay unfavorable.  Though we will be coming to the area quite often in the future we will not stay here again.  Also beware of the $25/day "resort fee" to use the pool was also a bit obnoxious, especially since we used the…

title: Awesome Place!
review: We stayed at that location the first week of June for my boyfriend golf tournament, it was a wonderful experience there. The staff is very professional always greet you with a smile especially the valet parking and bellman staff. Cannot wait to come back!

title: Rude staff in spa.
review: Thank you very much for your post and business.  Cant wait to see you back!

title: Overrated and unfriendly!
review: We had mani pedi early.  Staff was disorganized and upset we already had gel on our nails despite paying up front for removing the gels.   She mentioned we could have had a warm neck cushion but they weren't warm yet.  Really?  Then why mention it.  Rude all around.  Then- out to the pool where Roosevelt greats us with a warm smile.  Always so kind and helpful.  Pool area had a garbage smell with each breeze.  Not a great visit.  If only I could take Roosevelt with me to wherever I decide to take my business.

title: Aromatherapy Massage
review: Good morning Renee and thank you for your post and apologize for any inconveniences.  I will address.

title: Just amazing
review: So disappointed in the flexibility of the staff. Do not cater to families, especially in the off-season, if you can't allow them to enjoy the facilities. We spent money at the resort all day only to be told we couldn't eat pizza we ordered from outside the resort as a group in the lobby or pool area. The food is disappointing for the and the attitude was of every staffer we encountered  was "couldn't care less". We have an annual tournament in the area and won't be staying here next year.

title: Great hotel, not so great check in
review: My husband and I checked in Friday night, June 16,2017. Our room was paid in full before check in for the weekend. Upon arrival, I proceeded to check in. I was asked for a credit card to put on the room which I provided. The gentleman that took my card, ran it and says it was declined. I told him that's not possible, and he said it was. As I gave him another credit card, I pulled my account up online and it showed I was charged $100. I then showed it to the gentleman who said "it shows as declined on my screen" again I showed it to him, showing the charge and he had already charged my other credit card. I let it go, as I knew upon check out, I would be refunded as we were not planning on using room service, etc. Since my husband and I was staying for our first wedding…

title: Spa Visit PRICE doesn't match Service
review: Good afternoon Sharon.  Thank you for being our guest.  I sincerely apologize about any confusions or inconveniences you and your husband experienced while on site.  I would love to assist you with the credit to ensure your billing was accurate.  If you wish you can call me direct at 561-227-2555.  Thank you once again for being our guest.

title: always relaxing to go there
review: Have been customer for over 15 years. Made advanced reservation with request for specific therapist & was confirmed with email. Upon arrival front desk had changed reservation. The time before they told me remodel was complete & it was NOT (women were expected to use men's locker room)   New women's locker room decor uncomfortable, masculine and with a lot of dark wood.  Decorators came through surprise both MALE.  PRICE increase higher than any other spa in area.  Inside jacuzzi not working.  Outside Pool staff WONDERFUL. Yet they didn't have pool towels using hotel towels I told my husband don't buy me anymore gift cards. $$$$ A Doesn't match Service

title: Event Planner Review: Great for Groups!
review: Good afternoon Kathleen.  Please accept my sincere apologies for the inconveniences you experienced.  Could I please ask you to contact me directly so we may discuss?  561-227-2555.

title: Great Family Get Away
review: 3 weeks ago me and my brother decided to stay a night at the Pga National in Palm Beach Gardens. it was my 4th time there and my brithers 2nd time. i love the place because it s not too far from me in broward, and the hotel has everything you can think of for a resort! amazing pool, spa, nice lobbybar, clean rooms, very good steakhouse, and also a poolbar and grill. we also decided to try the tenniscourts last time and it was so much fun. at the checkin we were greeted and helped by David Guerra (i hope it s the right name i remember). he was the most professional and friendly person ever! always polite, and professional. and he knew all the answers to our questions.. from the moment we arrived we knew we will have a great stay just because of David! we also had a little lunch…

title: Great stay, some room for improvement on advising travelers about tee time reservations and prior planning on our end
review: This is the 2nd time I go with my friends to the resort, first time back in 2004. The hotel became more popular this time, probably coinciding with Memorial Day weekend. We stayed at a cottage for 4, 2 rooms with 2 queen beds in each room, living and kitchen area, 2 bathroom. Great time, plenty of comfort, cheaper lunches as we ate at the cottage, things we bought at the Publix (nearby supermarket). We didn't book any tee times in advance, that was our mistake, but the guys at the pro-shop helped us to accommodate our games. The Palm course was closed, the Fazio recently sanded, Squires and Champions were fantastic. Lesson learned for next time, to book tee times well in advance. B-fast was quite good, with everything that you can imaging, staff quite nice. Only dissapointment…

title: Great time, sour taste about pro shop
review: Thank you Mr. Guillermo for you visit and being our guest and your comments.  Please let us know the next time you plan your visit and we could assist you with your tee times.  Thank you once again.

title: Good but not great
review: Our friends and family had a great time at the PGA Memorial Weekend.  The room was great (1st floor is great for pool access).  The restaurants were great.  The service at the hotel was great.  The pool was fun.  The service around the pool area was extremely slow.  The only negative event this weekend was the pro shop and miscommunication.  I was told the rate would not include a cart fee and it did, but it was the way the clerk said it to me.  It wasn't about the money, but he said they are hiring people who don't know what they are saying and basicly I had to pay for their lack of knowledge.  Not a professional way to handle this and it put a damper on me playing the Champions course.  Real shame.  I loved the rest of the weekend and will be back, but will have to think about…

title: Golf great, everything else NOT
review: Thank you for being our guest and staying with us.  I apologize if there was some confusion in the pro shop.  I will certainly direct to our Director of Golf Operations.   Please let me know when you return and I will try my best to make up for any short comings we had.  Have a great summer

title: Not Impressed
review: We came down with my in-laws for a short holiday. The resort is a massive complex but well maintained.  We were put on the first floor of the resort and I seemed as this was the pet wing. I'm very fond of pets but bringing large dogs should not be allowed. The dogs barked every time someone walked down the hallway. When I say large dogs one black lab and one golden retriever.  Besides that we used all the amenities. My wife enjoyed the Spa. I played golf three days. Very over priced for the course conditions. Three days of golf cost over $600.00. Very pricey for out of season. This is not a 5 star resort yet it cost for beverage and food is 5 star prices. Someone needs to reevaluate the resort so people will use there services and stay on premises.  Next trip down we will stay…

title: Perfect pampering for my daughters and myself!
review: We booked facials for my daughters and a massage for myself for the day before Mother's Day.  We arrived several hours early and enjoyed sitting out by the pools and taking a dip in the three different pools.  We enjoyed a lovely lunch sitting out by the pool.  It was a VERY busy day there, but it was still extremely relaxing with quiet music playing and everyone respecting the no cell phone rule!  My massage was the highlight of my day!  The rooms were extremely quiet and the therapist was exceptional.  I felt pampered from the time I walked into the door until I walked out after my massage.  My daughters both enjoyed their facials and also felt very pampered!

title: Just back from our 4th guys golf trip to PGA National
review: Thank you for spending a special afternoon with us :)

title: Wonderful renovation
review: Weve been coming for 4 years for a buddies golf trip, this was the first year we stayed in the hotel, we usually stay at a house on the property and use the hotel amenities. Great spot, nice sized rooms with comfortable beds, the food is excellent for lunch by the pool or at the restaurant or patio in the lobby.  The pool is a good size and well laid out.  Staff were great. breakfast buffet was perfect.  The golf is the real prize.  We will be back again next year, its a perfect set up.

title: Great Golf Experience
review: Thank you very much for being our guest and returning with your friends.  PGA is the perfect buddy/buddy golf getaway in all of south Florida.  Thank you once again.

title: I will never return. Low class hotel
review: The last time I visited the PGA Spa, I was very disappointed to which I expressed via trip advisor.  I heard that they had an extensive renovation and decided to give it one more try especially since I reside in the area.  I received a wonderful massage by Grace. She was extremely professional and very competent. The waiting room was very soothing and clean.  The renovated steam room and sauna were lovely.  Spent the rest of the day by the pools and had a lovely lunch.  I will definitely return.  So glad that I decided to give them another chance.

title: AMAZING!!!!
review: This was the second time that I have stayed at this resort and its get better each time. The staff was really great and went out of their way to help me with my requests.   My room was quiet and clean and the bed was very comfortable.   The pool was also great.   The only issue with a place like this is that it ruins most other places. Its hard to find places with customer service like this.   I cant wait to go back.

title: Came for a conference and fell in love with this hotel!
review: Thank you very much for being our guest and for your wonderful post.

title: It's a Spoiler
review: This hotel is amazing. It is located directly on a PGA tour golf course, but even if you aren't a golfer, it's still an amazing place to stay! The hotel is immaculate. The rooms are spacious. The staff is friendly. The pool is incredible and there is even a spa on premises. The hotel is only a few miles from the ocean and some great places to eat as well. I was here on business so I didn't have all the time I wanted to take advantage of just how great this place is, but I'll definitely come back when I get some R&R time soon!

title: Enjoyed a nice stay here!
review: Thank you Paris for your review and for your visit.  The PGA National has a lot of amenities for guests, even if they are not golfers, like our fabulous Spa, Sports and Racquet Club our amazing pool experience and our close proximity to the best beaches in Florida.  Thank you again and hope to see you back soon.

title: Great long weekend
review: My husband and I travelled to many outstanding places, both in and out of the country, but this resort ranks in the top 3 of our trips.  Beyond the phenomenal golf courses, the resort itself was exceptional.  From the time we walked in, we were spoiled by luxury and over and above service.  Life is short, as I learned a few months ago.  Spend the extra money and allow yourself to indulge in the good life.

title: Gorgeous resort - service not up to par
review: We stayed here in March - the hotel and grounds are absolutely beautiful but trying to get a drink at the bar or food was a daily challenge. The first day we arrived we went to the cafe to get a sandwich and there were two employees staring at a panini press talking to each other not even acknowledging the guests. A second visit to this same cafe the gentleman at the register gave me  a total and proceeded to go out back take a quick puff of his vaporizer and then come back for my card. One guest who was in line left because the wait was so long. The staff at the bar hangs out at the end of the bar talking and dont get me wrong this is a country club however the staff shouldnt act like they are the ones on vacation. Terrible food service whoever is in charge of managing the food…

title: Great facilities, Hotel itself needs updating
review: Thank you Sharlene for your visit and your post.  Please accept my sincere apologies for any inconveniences.  I will certainly bring to the attention of the Food and Beverage Director your concerns.

title: Event held at PGA
review: I stayed here in May 2017 for a family wedding; there were a bunch of us that had a block of.    First, the good: -Food was great; the breakfast, bar, and anything we had at wedding/rehearsal dinner was better than most hotel food.  Fresh, plentiful, and the staff were super friendly. -The facilities are beautiful, the pool/hot tub is perfection, the viewpoints are awesome, and the gym is huge for a hotel gym - even has it's own pool! The grounds are well maintained too! -The Spa services seem nice, although I didn't get to check it out. -The Bridal Suite on the first floor was stunning (we did hair/makeup in there), and it was MASSIVE, and open and airy. -Fancy lobby and nice bar area, and lots of pricey cars parked out front to show how “nice” the place is.  The Bad: I've…

title: Stayed here for a conference
review: Thank you Robin for your post.  Please accept my sincere apologies for any inconveniences you may experienced.  Please fell free to contact me directly at 561-227-2555 so I may offer my assistance.

title: Spa getaway with BFf
review: This hotel is not only absolutely beautiful with incredible facilities but also has the most wonderful staff. We had a week long event at the hotel and Jimmy & David and there teams went above and beyond to ensure that it ran completely perfectly, even with a lot of last minute changes and pretty demanding requests. They were always on hand to help with a brilliant attitude, making us feel like no hassle at all and our guests were incredibly pleased with their stay at the hotel. I look forward to returning for a non business trip one day to get some time to fully make the most of the hotel.

title: It's nice but not really for me!
review: The hotel was lovely, rooms large, view over golf course, pool area was nice, plenty of loungers, bar as you walk into reception area was ok.  I was not overly enamoured with the level of service. On our second day our room was cleaned but no coffee making supplies left or bathmat. Small things but it took quite a while to get the message understood that we needed coffee, coffee cups and milk, at one point we were brought a glass of milk for $8 (which we refused)!!! Then when we did finally get supplies we were passed a bag with an excessive amount of supplies which gave the message that we were annoying them....perhaps I read this wrong but it's how I felt.  Our experience was just that, our experience, needless to say others may think this place is amazing.  I think if you're…

title: Unfortunate
review: Thank you for being our guest.  I will certainly discuss with the housekeeping team the issues you brought forward.

title: Great Facility and Super Staff
review: We stayed at the at the PGA National April 19-22, 2017. The hotel and amenities were great! Unfortunately though, it seems that we choose to book our stay here at the wrong time. The resort had been pretty much shut down in the days leading up to our stay due to a large group renting out the premises for a Passover celebration. During the celebration, the resort restaurants were closed, and business seemed to cease. We arrived the afternoon of PGA's first official day back in business after the Passover celebration. Unfortunately, most of the restaurants were still closed, and we could only get a drink at one bar. They told us that the pool bar would be opening a half an hour later, which would've been around 11:30. The bar didn't open until almost 4pm. You would think that the…

title: Very Disappointing and Will not Return
review: Thank you for being our guest Julie and for your comments.  Please accept my apologies for any inconveniences during your visit.  Please call me directly at 561-227-2555 and we can discuss.

title: Beautiful Resort For Golfers
review: Recently spent a week here for work. The staff was fantastic and the resort is perfect for holding a large event. On site catering and restaurants were excellent. Plenty of rooms to have multiple meetings and presentations in. The courses are beautiful and the grounds are very well maintained.

title: For those of means
review: A beautiful place, well kept. Free high quality internet. Fantastic gym and racquetball courts. Expensive drinks, nothing for kids to do indoors except one broken foozball table. 20 minutes to the beach.

title: Overpriced
review: Thank you for being our guest.  We do offer great children's golf and tennis clinics along with a fantastic pool atmosphere.  Look for much more kids programming this summer.

title: PGA National Trip
review: I staying at PGA national for fours days with Sysco Foods and decided to play golf Tuesday morning. I called a few days in advance and got a tee time for 7:52am. I arrived at the Pro Shop around 7:15am  Tuesday morning and checked in. To my surprise I was charged over $420 to play the Champions Course plus I had to tip my caddie. I just can't believe someone staying on your property for four days would be charged that amount.

title: Carlos - room service
review: Good morning.  I'm sorry for any confusion with your golf round pricing, but we are still in season through April for our premier Jack Nicklaus designed course. So there is an added surcharge of $100 per player.   We do have other four other championship courses which are less expensive and don't have the added surcharge or caddie options aailable. The four caddie fee is only an additional fee if you wish to have the caddie service but that includes gratuities.  Any additional gratuities are at the players discretion.

title: Excellent hotel
review: Very disappointed. Poor service in all areas of the resort.   1) I called the Pro Shop a week prior to arrival for tee times. I was not told that the Palmer course was being closed for renovations and the fairways had been browned. By the time we arrived the other courses were booked. The same day I left my spikes to be repaired overnight. The next day I was handed them back untouched.  2) Left laundry at bell hop station for one day service. The next day I was handed back a bag of my dirty laundry with no explanation.  3) Our room plan included breakfast yet each morning I had to charge it to my room and then ask the front desk to reverse the charge. Why?  4) Food service was poor overall except for a few individuals. Orders were consistently brought out incorrectly.

title: Beautiful common areas but overpriced
review: I spent 3 nights here for a conference. I think the common areas like the lobby, pool, bar and restaurants were all very beautiful. The staff was all very helpful and had great attitudes.   The food and drinks are very good but extremely overpriced. Even for a resort of this caliber.   The accommodations felt closer to a best western than a four diamond resort. My room had visible stains on the walls, furniture and lampshades. I would have walked out and canceled my reservation had I been paying for this room out of my own pocket. I'm sure the more expensive rooms are more well kept but even the cheapest rooms are rather costly. My room was so underwhelming that I couldn't believe I was at the same resort I had checked into. I went from impressed to to brutally unimpressed in a…

title: Past Its Prime
review: Good morning "Tcadogan" and thank you for being our guest.  Please accept my sincere apologies for any inconveniences with your accommodations.  I would love to talk more with you at your convenience if you would call me direct at 561-227-2555.

title: Customer Service Needs Work
review: I imagine that this was once a five star resort but, sadly, that's no longer the case. Our room was dated, with shabby, chipped furniture. Hallways had stained carpeting and peeling wallpaper. Furthermore, our ground floor room was as dark as a cave ( I assume upper floors are lighter) and housekeeping was hit or miss ( dust bunnies in the corners, never enough washcloths for the 3 people in our room). There are no individually-sized toiletries in the dimly-lit bathroom, only large pump bottles, and we didn't receive any bar soap until our last day. The breakfast buffet is average. On the plus side, the pool is large and well-maintained, with plenty of lounge chairs. I'm not a golfer but the ones I met said the course was great. That's probably the only reason to choose this…

title: Inconsistent to poor service; staff  overwhelmed during Presidents Day week/Honda Classic
review: Thank you for your visit to PGA this past week.  Please accept my apologies for any inconvenience during your visit.  I will look into these matters with our housekeeping team.

title: Best Golf Resort
review: If you're expecting to be treated well (since the prices are nuts) you may be disappointed...check-in was a disaster. The room had been changed (somehow they decided we would rather have a different room than we had booked). Then we were "upgraded (for a fee) to a "junior suite" (which turned out to be a little larger room overlooking the front driveway where one checks in and all the noise from the valet process occurs). There was no information provided  at all on facilities, amenities or services except for the various restaurants. Finding out anything about the resort was like pulling teeth. The golf was OK. But it should have been discounted because there were hundreds of noisy laborers and their trucks and "music" everywhere removing stands and tented villages from the…

title: A triple bogie at best !
review: I have been coming to PGA for over 20 years and what it was,isn't what it is today. I have come with 4 to 8 guys per year staying at the hotel in individual rooms.i would rate the rooms currenrly, a little below average,service poor at best. My room was less than clean, no coffee or creamer. When I called  the front desk to request items I didn't receive, what I got was not what was requested. Used towels not replaced ,used glasses left with room cleaned late.Next day,requested room cleaned early and called housekeeping at 8am,returned at 12:30,still not          cleaned. Service was poor at the bar as well,bartenders more interested in talking to guests than serving them.The ONLY  place that food and service exceeded expectation was breakfast on the terrace. Angel is just  that…

title: Second visit as good as the first
review: Thank you Rich for your comments and being our guest.  I sincerely apologize for any service issues during your visit and would certainly welcome a dialogue with you to offer my assistance.  Please contact me directly at 561-227-2555 if you would like to discuss further.  Again please accept my apologies and hope to hear from you soon.

title: To Bill Horn
review: Top notch golfing and spa facilities. Slight mix up on checking in but quickly rectified. The I bar always a great happy hour, now with music in the evenings. Just a. Little disappointed no corned beef on St. Patrick's day. The Ironwood grille is perfect. Great service. Alex was too notch. Rob had the twin lobster tails, they were terrific. The wagyu steaks cooked to perfection. The she crab soup was delicious. The breakfast buffet has something for everyone. Every morning we were greeted by a smiling Angel who kept our coffee cups full and even had to go cups for our golfing hubbies. She started our day off right.

title: Fantastic Resort
review: Thank you for your comments and for being our guest.  We hope to see you again in the future.  Will share your comments with the team.

title: Incredible Find in the Heart of Golf Country
review: I am a frequent guest of hotel and golf courses. Golf operations are A+. Best factory golf anywhere. 5 courses often full and almost always play In 4 hours and never have to touch my bag. Members lounge terrific. The I Bar and service is often poor. I want to like this place a lot and just can't manage to. The service almost every time I am there is poor and management oversight is non existent. Not once in my many visits have I ever seen a manager overseeing the work force serving the customers. Bartenders are more interested in talking to each other and a few regulars then they are in pouring drinks. I understand regulars getting extra attention but with 3 bartenders you should be able to order a drink. When you get a bartender it is like they are doing you a favor. At the…

title: Nice Stay
review: The PGA resort is located in Palm Beach Gardens, about 30 minutes from downtown Palm Beach. The hotel was recently updated, but the rooms and facilities are pretty bland. While everything is perfectly nice, the rooms seem a little dark pool is often very crowded. Staff is extremely nice and food is good. We really enjoyed the cafe in the lobby, as they offered very good coffee and breakfast options. Overall a nice visit, but nothing special.

title: Wonderful resort!
review: Thank you for your comments and for your visit.

title: Golf Fantastic but Hotel and Spa Lacking
review: The service, golf, pool, resort are amazing. The food is mostly good, couple of dinners were average. Golf on Champion course w caddie was amazing. Staff exceeded expectations. Pool and atmosphere was well above what I expected.

title: Not quite 5 Star
review: Thank you for being our guest and for your post.  We have an amazing facility and incredible staff members so that you again for recognizing both and hope to see you again in the future.

title: Golf/Spring Training Trip
review: My friend and I came to PGA National to play golf for 4 days. Golf was fantastic and the course was well run and we were very pleased with the whole golf experience from check -in at the golf shop to turning our carts in and having our clubs cleaned at the end. The trip fell short with our accommodations and spa services. The hotel needs a serious facelift in the rooms especially the bathrooms (no amenities except soap shampoo and conditioner) and the spa needs to be gutted and completely redone.  The ceiling and light fixtures in the facial room were rusted and peeling and entirely unacceptable. It did not feel clean in the group room or anywhere else for that matter but dated and unapeeling considering the prices being charged. The facial itself was a joke. The aesthetician …

title: Long weekend at PGA National
review: My son and I got away for a long weekend at PGA National.  We had a great experience with a wide variety of high quality food options and the golf was fantastic.  Our room was very comfortable and in great condition.  Across our stay, the staff was consistently friendly and helpful.  We look forward to going back again sometime soon.

title: Will Definitely Return...beautiful property and great service and golf
review: Thank you for being our guest and for your wonderful post.  Hope you can make it again with your son soon.

title: this is clearly an acquired taste.....
review: Attended the Kappa Klassics Inaugural Golf Tournament at PGA.  The course was well maintained and the hotel rooms were really nice.  The bed linen was luxurious so I slept really well, much needed after a round of golf, drinking, dining, partying and staying up late a few nights in a row.  The steak restaurant is really overpriced but the quality of the food is good.  A new mixologist is needed or the current one needs to be retrained in how to make a lemon drop martini.  Conference site and set-up was well thought out and there was not a hiccup in sight in terms of golfing.  I hear there was some confusion regarding the SPA treatment scheduling but I understand the services were superb.  Valet parking of $30 per night is not worth it, just drop your stuff off, park in the…

title: Hotel tired and overpriced
review: Thank you Paula and for the entire Kappa group and foundation.  You guys are the ones who do amazing work.  See you again next year.

title: PGA golf event
review: i travel all the time. my wife and i just spent a weekend at the pga resort. it is a BIG property. its a long walk to the gym. its a long walk to the hot tub near the pool. its a long walk to many rooms (ours was easily a 5 minute walk).  i guess if youre a golfer this is paradise. we are not golfers, and recognize this is a golf resort.  however, people at the front desk ranged from wildly helpful to downright rude. one day we were waiting for our valet parked car to get to us. we were speaking to the attendant helping us. a gentleman showed up with his valet tag who the attendant clearly thought was more important than were my wife and i, and all of a sudden we were ignored. i, by the way, am ceo of a billion dollar company.  one morning my wife ordered tea. it came with no…

title: Honda Classic 2017 Stay
review: If you are thinking of staying during the Honda Classic there are some things I wish the hotel had been upfront and clear about.  We are seasoned sports event travellers, we have stayed in event hotels all over the world for golf, soccer, rugby, motor racing so we understand that it will be busy.  Because of this we researched on the hotel website and on the Honda Classic website about the events around the golf so we knew what would be going on and to make our plans.  We booked a premium room - a suite - so we had a base for the weekend.  Nowhere in either the hotel or event information does it say that the hotel lobby and bar will be reformatted to house a live band every and two bars every evening and host a party that invades all of the guest areas (bars & restaurants)  We…

title: Disappointed
review: We are at this resort for 3 nights and we were all excited about going to the pool and having specialty drinks like Pina Coladas etc and for the 3rd day in a row they don't have the ingredients!  Not what you would expect from a resort such as this.  Will not be returning!!

title: Honda Classic "Dan saves the day"
review: Please accept my sincere apologies from the F&B team.

title: No respect for repeat customers
review: I have stayed at this location many times but this time was by fare one of the best stays I have had.  Everyone did exceptional.   From Alex in reservation department to Victoria in the Spa area.  This is probably one of the single most busiest time of the year for this hotel and things were nearly perfect my entire stay.  Me and my significant other wanted to get away for the weekend and decided last minute on this location. We spent the entire time on location.  The food through room service was great.  Even though the hotel was full to the max, the quality of food never suffered. Carlos from room service was amazing and had such a great personality. I had one little issue with housekeeping upon checkout but Dan the front desk manager stepped right in and made sure that things…

title: Great time
review: Thank you JR for your visit and your comments.  Please contact me directly at 561-227-2555 so I may talk to you further about your housekeeping service.

title: Relaxing Weekend Getaway
review: My mom planned a last-minute trip to Florida to celebrate my birthday and she booked this hotel not really knowing much about the resort. We had such an enjoyable weekend! We were there the weekend leading up to the Honda Classic, so the property was very busy getting ready for the tournament. Even though there was a lot going on, the staff was very attentive. The front desk staff was very friendly, and anytime we were in the elevator with a bell staff member they asked if we were enjoying our stay. The service in the restaurants was also good.   We spent the majority of our time at the pool. We got to the pool later in the morning on our first day and most of the chairs were already taken. We did find chairs but made it a point to get to the pool early the remaining days to…

title: Pleasant Golf. Not a great place to stay.
review: The room was fine but the service everywhere in the hotel was lacking. We returned from dinner to find three housekeeping staff socializing in our room. The poolside cafe staff were rude to each other. The bell staff watched us carry several pieces of luggage into the property, then watched us load it on the cart. Once it was loaded on, one of them told us we better bring it back. They did not seem to think of offering to help. The only service-oriented people were the golf shop staff and pros.

title: Meh
review: First time here in 20 years and I think that's the last time they did renovations- hah! It's a nice place but very dated and just ok for the price. Not impressed. Had an issue w/ the booking but the manager was very helpful and got it sorted out.

title: Bday weekend
review: Thank you Jessica for your business and comments.

title: Nice...but I thought it would be better
review: Had a great stay for a friend's 60th. The weather was exceptional. The pool and spa were beyond great. Angel in the breakfast brunch was so welcoming. Karyn in the spa was fabulous. The rooms could use a refresh and it would be nice to have bottled water replaced...

title: First Class Property
review: Extremely lovely property...first class.  Excellent amenities , from valet parking to pool, restaurant, bars, etc...  Was not happy with assigned room on first floor with doors to patio on the parking lot.  Asked for a change, upgraded to junior suite for a charge.  Very expensive, but quality was there.  Conference facilities grest and food was superb!

title: Above average resort, interesting atmosphere
review: Thank you Gale for your business and post.  Please let me know when you return and I will provide you with a complimentary upgrade.

title: Ok hotel for anything but Golf
review: When pulling up to the resort, it is beautiful and stately. The grounds and pool are definitely the best part. We checked into our room, which was very clean but well worn. There was rust on some of the metal in the bathroom, and a knob on the shower handle was about to come off. A used cigar was on the table in the porch.   Even though it is a golf resort, we came solely with the purpose of relaxing. When walking around the grounds and relaxing by the pool, the crowd was mostly older, wealthy people with their families or significant others. There were no other minorities at the hotel (besides those working) and we received stares. The people working at the hotel were generally polite, albeit cold. There was only one rude encounter with the hostesses at the restaurant inside…

title: Ordinary everyday hotel...mediocre food!
review: The hotel is a bit old and not as well maintained as I'd have liked for the price. The room was large but run down, even the soap in the shower was from a main dispenser rather than individual soaps which says something about the quality of the place. Staff were very hospitable and the restaurants and bars were good as well as the gym.

title: The good and the bad
review: I joined my husband at a conference. No golfing, but I can see this hotel would attract golfers. Beautiful grounds and pool. The lobby and restaurant were ordinary and had no atmosphere.
