You could be anywhere in the world.  We ate at the Ironwood restaurant three times. The steaks were your typical pricey fare but they weren't hot or presented in any special way. The server we had on the last night was flippant and dropped the cutlery and in general was very sloppy. I found the lunch food to be very boring. The chicken cutlet sandwich seemed frozen and the waitress did not listen well. She brought sweet potato fries instead of fries. When I asked for a coffee she brought a watery coffee in a paper cup from the cafe.   The food needs to be upgraded and include some lighter…

title: Don't book the Honeymoon Suite..
review: The hotel itself I would say is a fair 4 star. The drive up in the gardens is very pretty. The room had a strong smell of cleaning products, there was a large stain on the carpet at the entrance to the bathroom, which had one sink! My main issue was there was fan in the toilet area which was impossible to turn off and made a noise all night long. There was only one tiny window to the whole room and hence not much light, leading to a tiny terrace. The bathroom of the spa suite looked much nicer online and was less expensive. Our bathroom was certainly not what could be expected for a honeymoon.

title: Overpriced resort
review: The rooms are OK, but old and need refreshing. The room had 2 double beds BUT they placed so that one could not open the closet to use the safe and refrigerator. Really stupid layout. The bath / shower had a curtain and for a place that calls itself a resort I feel that it was pretty tacky. Especially for the price charged. The food at our meeting was of very low quality. Also avoid the pro shop as the prices for merchandise are seriously overpriced by my estimation of 3 times normal retail. Avoid having a room on the lower floor as the cell phone coverage is very week.

title: Great Week!
review: My wife and I spent a week at PGA National Resort.  I have stayed there many times and this time it did not disappoint.  I played golf each day without a problem.  The courses are in great shape.  We had a junior suite.  Updated and very clean.  It faced the pool.  Very close to major shopping and tons of restaurants.  The staff is friendly and very helpful.  I enjoyed the spa.  It was clean and the staff went out of their way to be helpful as well..

title: The Spa was very nice but I felt a bit like a 2nd class citizen because I used a Groupon.
review: We were greeted at the front desk and then asked immediately to pay a 20% gratuity before even having our massages.  I found this odd since gratuity is given based on the favorability of the service.  I've been to the best spas around and have never been asked to pay a gratuity up front.  The facilities were clean and very nice.  There were adequate towels, lemon water, coffee, tea and orange slices provided.  My massage therapist was good although I was told since I was using a Groupon, she would only be using about 4 stones instead of the amount typically used in a hot stone massage.  The mineral pools were beautiful and the staff is very attentive.  We ordered cocktails and lunch which as very good and again a 20% service charge was added to the bill.  Since I always tip at…

title: Elegant Comfy Pleasure
review: PGA National Resort & Spa makes you feel pampered from the moment you step out of your car and are greeted by the friendly and accommodating valet staff to the professional, yet warm and friendly greeting and interaction with the Front Desk staff. On top of this the room was so comfortable and the grounds--well, let's just say, it's hard to beat palm trees, a gorgeous pool, delicious meals, and a famous golf course--all rolled into one resort.

title: Outstanding Golf Resort
review: Played all week on all the courses offer at PGA National Resort.  All courses are in excellent condition and a very friendly and helpful staff. They even allowed me (non-golfer) to walk with the boys to watch them play.

title: SBC Conference
review: Check in was so easy!! Customer service was out going and helpful.  While we had to take a room with two beds there were no king beds as requested we just made do.  Settled into our room then went out to explore the grounds.  The entire grounds are wonderful with many areas for long walks or a run.  The pool area is very nice, well kept and water is wonderful.  Room was very quiet, love the idea of a patio with each room to enjoy sitting outside for comfort and wonderful weather.   Great signs around the resort to assist you in locating any area  you maybe searching for.

title: PGA National Resort & Spa
review: Mid-January visit to PGA National Resort & Spa for Dave Pelz three-day school was a real treat.  The resort was very comfortable.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Dining options were plentiful and food was delicious.  The spa has some food service available.  Spacious design permits handling large groups without crowding the facility.

title: The Resort of Resorts
review: Thank you for your business and wonderful post.

title: Spa is a must!
review: What a beautiful oasis tucked away from the world in the middle of the golf greens. The staff was wonderful, from baggage, check-in, room service, restaurant waiter. The pool area was expansive and luxurious with cabanas. The room was large with 2 double beds, dresser and desk area. I especially appreciated the bath area setup with an additional sink/mirror outside the full bathroom. It was also nice to be able to open the patio doors and sit outside in the sun and view the luscious grounds.

title: "Golfers dream" with plenty to do for the non-golfer
review: The hotel has beautiful grounds and very private. The first room we had was disappointing because of the view so we requested a change and they were very helpful. The food prices were reasonable for the restaurant by the pool, and the outdoor deck restaurant and bar for a high end hotel. They also had live entertainment 3 of the 4 nights we were there. The performers were all terrific and the dance floor was busy. The rooms are large and have excellent beds. Our bathroom was a little tired so I would recommend some remodeling. The room came with a refrigerator and coffee pot. All the staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Nice resort but the people working here made it amazing!!!
review: Thank you for your post and business.  The great new live entertainment is amazing and were glad you enjoyed it.  Hope to see you again soon.

title: Great resort, excellent food and staff
review: We loved our stay here (we won it as a prize).  The rooms were beautiful and huge.  We were with our two girls in an adjoining room and the staff made us feel really welcome.  Especially the waitress Nadine in the Palm Restaurant.  Nadine made us smile literally every morning and was so helpful with information about West Palm Beach.    The food was really expensive though!!  But if you want an expensive, exclusive hotel then this is possibly the place to stay.  Especially now that my girls and I have left with our huge inflatable shark!!!  My girls are extremely polite and sensible though so please don't worry unnecessarily about other guests sharing their holiday with us, I promise!

title: Company sales meeting
review: Thank you very much for being our guest.  Nadine is a treasure in the Palm Terrace and she always goes above and beyond to make guests feel special.

title: extremely well run operation
review: Wonderful stay at PGA National Resort. Golf courses were fun and walking distance.  Very friendly staff.  Fantastic service by ANGEL in the breakfast restaurant. She went above and beyond every morning for us. She was very friendly and helpful. Always a step ahead of us!   Food at the resort was better than originally expected...delicious.   Dance band on Saturday ended too early! 10:30 (and earlier on Friday...10am) yet, there were lots of people on the dance floor wanting to dance longer. Not even a DJ after the band to keep the dancing going. Needs to play at least to 11pm!

title: A last minute wonderful surprise!
review: Being golf people, my husband and i decided to stay at the pga national resort and spa for a few days. The hotel is beautiful and elegant and the staff couldn't be nicer or more accommodating. However the valet charge was the first turn off. The room was really clean and large with a balcony overlooking the golf course. There is a large bar in the lobby that had four televisions. While eating dinner we requested they put the golf tournament on, being that it is a golf resort. We were surprised to hear its a first come first serve basis and before us the group at the bar requested football! I did not think that was so bad but on four tv's? The food was very good and the entertainment was fun as well. I just thought that staying at a pga resort there would be golf on a tv…

title: Large resort, pretty efficiently run
review: Thank you for your visit and your polite post.  I will discuss with the staff that we should always have a golfing event on TV on one of the TV's.  I apologize for that occurance.

title: Stunning hotel with great service
review: Four night stay for a golf getaway with my son. Booked a double twin bed Jr. suite. A slight problem when we checked into our room, maintenance was replacing the patio door, so we were given another same category room. Turned out to be a ground floor room behind the spa with no view whatsoever. If I was staying with my wife I would have changed rooms, but since staying with my son, not a big deal. Bottle of wine & fruit plate that was supposed to be in room wasn't, maybe because of the room problem, but was delivered when I notified the front desk. I usually don't like to stay in large resorts that host business conventions because you have hundreds of people around with badges, crowding the golf courses in the afternoon & the bars at night. Since we only played golf 1 day & the…

title: BUSINESS MEETING/DINNER/CELEBRATION
review: We started here with a family for three nights and don't have enough positive to say about it! Pool was stunning and had great poolside food and drink service, resort was clean and well kept. Rooms were updated and well stocked. All Staff here we encountered were customer focused and very kind. Would come again!

title: Very disappointed
review: Thank you very much for being our guests.

title: Room Service
review: We would like to complement Carlos of Room Service! He delivered our breakfast each day, and always gave us a big smile, fun conversation, and a great job setting up everything. Thank you, Carlos!  From Joyce and Stan of New York City

title: PGA National Resort & Spa at Palm Beach Gardens, FL
review: Thank you.  Carlos is a gem.

title: Excellent stay
review: First class service from all employees, very polite, helpful and smiling faces always when approach for needs. Will sure like to visit again same resort when in area. It's 100% recommended for young and old!

title: Like coming home
review: Thank you for your visit and hope to see you again soon.

title: Carlos
review: Friendly, professional staff, lovely rooms, good food, fun atmosphere, beautiful pool area, great location in beautiful Palm Beach Gardens.  It also has access to 5 golf courses, fitness center that was just renovated, and good tennis courts.  What more can one want for a satisfying getaway.

title: Tired
review: This used to be my favorite spa in the Palm Beaches. In fact, I'd take friends, enjoy a massage and celebrate birthdays around the pool. This visit, the third this year,  I realized the spa was much less accommodating and very tired looking. Attitudes of employees left much to be desired. Although others were served around the pool, I received no service--so I walked to the service area and waited to order, stood to wait to carry my own drink or meal. One of the best features poolside was cucumber or fruit infused water--now there is no water poolside. Seating is also dirty and worn. The boutique doesn't even offer a bathing suit for sale and inventory is so so. This spa has seen much better days. The Dead Sea salt pool and French water, normal pool and hot tub are still great.…

title: Nice hotel with some improvement areas
review: Thank you Dolores for your post.  We have just completed our 1 million dollar spa refresh which included all new refurbished chairs and umbrellas at the pools, and a completely new ladies lounge area that turned out fantastic.  Please contact me directly and perhaps I could offer my assistance on your next visit,  561-227-2555

title: PGA National Resort
review: I stayed there during a conference. I think it is a beautiful hotel with a nice location. The pool area and the gym is truly outstanding. I think I would have two areas they need to improve. First the room had little bugs in the bathroom. I know it is Florida but for a hotel this needs to be under control. And the second is the dinner choices. I know there are different restaurants but at the end of the day there is just the bar dinner option as the other is a high end steak house. But the food menu for the bar is not good enough. It is all fried and has not a lot of options.

title: Great Stay!
review: Just the best place in all of Florida! The views of the pool area and lake are perfect day and night. Very Cleans everywhere. Staff is top shelf. Golf is amazing and Driving range is perfect place to work out the kinks. hated to leave the place.

title: Great Spot When in Town for Meetings
review: Thank you for your visit.

title: Great place to stay with the dogs
review: We had to leave our home due to a flood.  PGA National allowed us to stay with our dogs during the ordeal.  Everything was great:  the rooms, the food, the pool, the front desk and housekeeping staff.  Just imagine if we were able to enjoy the many golf courses and or tennis facilities.

title: Nice place for conferences
review: Very nice place.  Grounds are beautiful.  Avoid ground floor rooms that back up to elevated front drive if you are security conscious or would like a view to the outside.  The pleasant and professional staff are great.  Conference facilities are nice and food servers are professional class.

title: Mixed feelings......
review: Stayed Five nights at the resort and played the 3 golf courses open at the time (Palmer course is closed). The resort itself is okay; not more, not less. Nothing fancy nor luxuriös. Depending on your booking you will get a room assigned with no view and very little light. Book a premium room with view on the pool, if this is important to you. Our room was nice with the view and sun exposure in the afternoon as we preferred. It might need some new furniture. We had some snacks in the afternoon on the terrace which wie liked. Only had a light dinner at the bar once, as it is always very cold in the lobby/ bar area. The breakfast buffet was okay as well; good omelettes. After the Thanksgiving weekend the buffet offered much less of a choice.... The service overall was very…

title: Italian Open
review: Thank you for your post and for your being our guest.  We will certainly review your thoughts and comments with our team members.

title: Enjoyable experience with longer stay time
review: Just got back from another phenomenal golf outing at the PGA National Resort and spa. Can't say enough positive things about my recent stay. I was part of a group of 120 guys on a golf trip and my total experience was top notch! From the room, to the incredible venue and most importantly, the attentive staff, PGA National rolled out the red carpet to our group and truly made us feel like family! Thanks again to all and I look forward to coming back next year!

title: Great golf resort and a great experience, once again
review: I went there for an annual tournament with over a 100 people from Mass. It was my third time staying there. The property was in amazing condition, there are always improvements each year. The golf courses were in tremendous shape, the I Bar had great music and entertainment at night. There is no need to leave the property, they have restaurants, a pool and other amenities. The staff was courteous and the owner Frank, checked on us and made sure everything was perfect.

title: PGA Resort in Palm Beach Gardens, FL
review: Thank you Dave for being our guest for the annual Italian Open and for your business.  Its a great group of golfers that enjoy themselves and all the amenities around PGA National.

title: Comfortable and Improving
review: Great stay, super friendly staff, and the accommodations are very comfortable, clean and a bit luxurious. Highly recommend the iBar for food and drinks on the balcony overlooking the pool area. We had delicious lobster mac and cheese and the lobster and beef rib sliders were the perfect easy to munch light meal.

title: Great resort average rooms
review: Thank you Kiki for your post and comments.

title: Spa disappointment
review: Was in business meetings for much of my stay, by the manicured properties and recently upgraded gym were excellent. Staff was accommodating.  Great steak dinner while the fish dinner was rather disappointing. Room was clean, bed was comfortable, weak on the amenities offered.  Had towels with holes and Folgers coffee is not my idea of the top ratings.  Coffee shop was limited and used capsule coffee...boo.  I think what has been renovated is fantastic, and they still have more to go.

title: The golf facilities were amazing!
review: My room was clean but somewhat dated with respect to the decor. The room was incredibly spacious which is important if you are bringing your clubs to your room. The pool , lobby bar and terrace areas were ideal for the apres golf drink.The terrace area was nice but not sure iI could have fired up a cigar. If staying for more than  a weekend then the need for more variety for dining venues will become apparent.

title: Superior
review: Upon arrival, the bellman were very friendly and helpful. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful at check in and upon exit. The front desk staff went above and beyond assisting with our business meeting issues. The room was very nice, clean and comfortable too.

title: Upscale Stay at the PGA
review: The PGA resort is found surrounded by golf courses on an upscale planned community. The hotel is comfortable. Rooms are roomy and well equipped. Lobby is nice and bar area lively. Restaurant is an upscale steak house with good food and service. I was not there for golf but for business and all in all enjoyed the stay.

title: Amazing resort
review: Travelled here with friends for a golf trip. We were located in the cottages I think the resort and they were perfect for a group of golfing guys. Upon arrival we were treated to first class service. The valet guys were great and advised us where to go. Check in was smooth and very helpful although the package rate agreed was not very clear, more of that later. We were directed to the cottages which you needed your car for, no problem though. The cottage was spacious and well equipped but we did think it was a little tired, the carpet in one of the rooms was very poor and one of the toilets didn't work. We reported this and it was fixed straight away. We went back up to the main resort to wander round and as it was getting towards the end of the day, one of the golf assistants…

title: Perfect Golf-Holidays
review: My Dad and I spent a perfect week of golf-holdays at the PGA National Resort. We enjoyed good organization of tee-times, well-kept golf courses and practice areas plus Relaxing time at the huge pool area. Thanks to ANTONELLA, the Concierge, we managed dining every evening in different restaurants, each very tasty. Also did ANTONELLA compliment me on my doctor graduation with a supersweet and personal present - thank you for that again!  If in Florida next time, we'll definitely come back again to PGA!

title: Wonderful Venue for an event!
review: We hosted our Kick-Off Party here for our annual Walk! Great Service, and attention to detail! The Vista Ballroom was spacious, clean and overlooked the gorgeous pool. Guests enjoyed a delicious dinner! If looking for a place to host a business event- look no further! Nickole was professional and with me every step of the way! We will be back in the future. Thank you!

title: Great concierge - great host!
review: Your concierge, Antonella is a great host. I needed a notary and got someone who took a simple transaction and made it personal as someone who cares about the resort guest experience.  She takes it to another level.  You are lucky to have her a part of your staff.   If she sees this...thank you!

title: Hole In One
review: Attention to detail is amazing.  Your experience on the resort will not be surpassed no matter where you are.  The iBar in the lobby is a great place for drinks, food, and catching the game.  A world class pool is a great way to unwind

title: Golf Haven
review: Very accommodating staff that are professional and friendly.  The golf courses are outstanding with many challenges so I recommend all of the courses as each brings its own challenges.  The resort is clean and well maintained and the rooms are modern and comfortable.

title: Nice
review: I like staying here. I have homework to do that requires intense concentration and my kids just don't allow that for me so I check into here about once a month and do homework marathons. The place isa almost always quiet and staff take care of anything you need. I once asked for brown m&ms in a brandy glass and who would have known the person I was talking to was a Wayne's world fan and they brought me brown m&ms in a brandy glass. Spectacular. Party on Wayne, party on Garth.

title: PGA Resort, hotel, iBar, Palm Terrace
review: From September 19th to 25 I spent 4 days golfing with 3 friends at PGA National Resort and golfed the Fazio, & Champion courses as well as The Medalist and McArthur Ranch courses in Jupiter. The Hotel , I-Bar, & Palm Terrace were excellent and accommodated our golfing schedules. The staff(Angel) at Palm Terrace, check in, & butler staff were great, service was superb.

title: Much more than a golf resort
review: For many years I have thought PGA National as home to the Bear Trap and The Honda Classic. There is much more to this resort than that. The resort boasts great restaurants especially Ironwood. The I-Bar is as good as any lobby bar in the area. On Saturday night we were thrilled to hear that there would be a band playing R&B hits but we blown away by the band itself. A replacement member of the Temptations and a guest appearance by an original Drifter performed flawlessly.  Yes, the golf is fantastic, all three courses and service is off the hook. The pool area was hopping on Friday and Saturday but calmed down as the week went on.  Service from check in to check out from all staff was superb….including the bartenders at the I-Bar which sometimes can be very busy. Golf, vacation,…

title: Excellent
review: I was here last Sunday, I have been invited for a 90 birthday party.! The hotel is amazing, the hotel is located in a great location at Pga National where the Honda Classic is held every year. Service and stuff great and helpful, meal excellent.

title: Nice place but expensive
review: Thank you for your wonderful post and for being our guest.

title: Top Notch Resort
review: Went with friends to spend the weekend and take this one out of our bucket list.  Played the Fazio.  Being from Florida I was a little disappointed.   The course was nice but not worth the price we paid.  There are many golf courses in the state in better shape for half the price.  Might have been because of the storm that hit the coast.   The resort is very nice and well kept but the dining and drinks are a little expensive.  Three draft beers for $23 is what I consider a little bit pricey.  That is with the mandatory 18% gratuity.  But, this is West Palm Beach so prices are a little bit higher. If I had to choose my next golf buddies vacation would definitely head out to Myrtle Beach that has a lot more to offer with nice courses.  Some with breakfast and lunch included

title: Beautiful resort, but not many visitors
review: There were 3 or 4 courses to choose from.  We stayed on a staycation promo that gave you a room for the day, and green fees.   It was perfect, our flight landed early AM. they allowed an early check-in, we slept, then golfed.  Course in great shape, good food at restaurants, and very pleasant staff.

title: Great place to stay
review: Thank you very much for your business and post.  Yes the new "stay-cation" experience is wonderful to experience both golf and our resort room product.

title: Great Property - Pricey Drinks
review: Recently stayed at the resort for 4 nights.  The room (Media Suite) was clean and well appointed.  We only used housekeeping one day but the day they were there they did a great job.        Went to the spa one day.  Everyone we dealt with was great and friendly.  Room service is fast and decent.  The bar in the lobby is hit or miss.   Sometimes it was packed and other times it was empty.   They add 18% onto the tabs which they always make sure you know so you dont over tip but the overall service was lacking.  Bartenders seemed to take forever even when it was just me and one other person at the bar.  Pool area was great and the valet was awesome.

title: Beautiful Hotel and pool
review: Thank you Matt for your post and your business.  Yes the Media suites are something of a cool specialty suite.  I will certainly pass along your comments to the Food and Beverage Director about the I Bar.  Thank you once again for being our guest.

title: Lovely
review: Wonderful property and amenities are top notch, child care at the gym, wonderful pool and bar area. Beautiful golf courses. However, the rooms were great value, but the drinks and food were incredibly over priced.

title: Hurricane Matthew
review: I stayed in the PGA national hotel while hurricane Matthew passed by.  The hotelroom was nice and modern. The beds were comfortable but a little small. The bathroom was clean and looked really nice. The staff was very kind and friendly in the stressful situation we were in.

title: Fantastic stay
review: Thank you

title: Great weekend at PGA resort
review: We had a great time at the PGA resort, the room was great (spa suite), the golf courses were in great condition, the swimming pool was brilliant and the bar area were perfect - but what makes the pga resort so good is the staff. The staff could not have been more welcoming and friendly to us. The receptionist at checkin (Paul) couldnt have been better, Angel at breakfast couldnt have done more for us, the guys in the golf shop were so helpful and couteous and Kevin O'brien, the golf starter, well you'd go back just to here him tell you more stories - he was great!!  The only critisism would be the food and drink prices - a little steep  Will definetely be back

title: a great place
review: Thank you very much for your business and your post.  Yes Paul and Angel are truly wonderful and amazing team members.  Thank you for recognizing there service to you.

title: My Home for 7 months
review: The overall experience is amazing.  If you get a chance to upgrade to a Jr. Suite it is well worth it, especially with kids.  The pool, golf, and food all wonderful.  The spa is always a good experience.

title: A haven for golfers
review: I accompanied my husband on a business trip, staying at this resort for 3 nights in September. We did not have a vehicle. My expectations and the resort offerings didn't match up well. It is a great golfer's destination, with several well-kept courses. The staff were courteous and friendly. The food was nicely prepared and good but expensive. There really isn't much to do other than golf...a couple of shops, again with ridiculous prices. A spa, which shows signs of wear but does have fabulous massage therapists and mineral pools, is available for the cost of a spa service (my massage was $120 for about an hour) or at $50/day otherwise. The resort does have many athletic/fitness activities which I did not attend. I spent about $50 in Uber fees trying to make my way to shopping…

title: A Thoroughly Enjoyable Stay
review: Attended a conference here over four days in late September. The resort property is spectacular. The view of the pool from the lobby is very appealing. Having the restaurant/bar in the lobby also makes for a great meeting place. The rooms are a little dated but quite spacious and comfortable . The bed was as comfortable as any I have slept in. I enjoyed a couple of very delicious lunches at Bar ninety one. The golf courses on the property were a real treat to play. Customer service all the way along from the front desk right through to the Pro Shop was top notch. I would go back in a heartbeat.

title: Comfortable resort, shame I hate golf
review: I was here on business and have zero interest in golf so possibly the big selling point of the place is lost on me. Certainly the September Florida weather has little to commend it - hot, humid and a thunderstorm each day at 3pm. I am told that you need to reserve early morning tee times before you go. As a brit I am interested only in tea and no American is capable of making a decent cup of the beverage.  The rooms were great. Comfortable, excellent sleep quality (what jet lag?), quiet, stunning views and the suite even had a pool table. There is a great pool to broil by and a walk outside is as good as a sauna.  Food was typically American at the bar but still OK. The conference catering by the hotel was superb and some of the best mass catering I have tasted outside of South…

title: Great Pools
review: Thank you very much for your post and your business.

title: Excellent customer service
review: The main pool area is lovely and the mineral pools at the spa were also nice.  The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  The spa is in great need of a facelift, but the staff was very friendly and attentive.  The food is good, but not great.

title: Upscale Atmosphere
review: We went to a wedding here.  It's not just a beautiful Golf  course, but a large quantity of  lovely homes as well.  It's an upscale community with a gorgeous clubhouse/hotel/spa.  The huge bar was crowded with thirty something singles. The pool was just gorgeous. Tropical and elegant.   The food at the wedding was very well prepared. Huge shrimp, filet mignon, etc. Very nice. All around we were very impressed.

title: The bear trap
review: Thank you Linda for your polite post and for being our guest.

title: Best Spa I've ever been to
review: Got to played the championship course..beautiful and very challenging course..the bear trap was as expected very hard ... Lost so many balls there .. But hey all should play from the tip in the bear trap it will humble you quickly.. If you ever get a chance to play do it

title: Good.....could be better
review: Thank you for the post and experience.  Yes the Bear Trap has taken many golf balls away from good golfers.....:)

title: I love this hotel for golf!
review: The hotel was fabulous. Great, large rooms. The pool was amazing with attentive staff. I visited the spa 3 of 5 days it was fabulous! I intend on traveling to this hotel again just for the spa services!!

title: A Beautiful Paradise
review: Friendly, professional staff, beautiful decor, great food. Excellent service. I came here from NYC with a group and we were all very pleased with level of sevice, the beauty of the grounds and the spaciousness of the rooms which were beautifully decorated,  I would definitely return on my next visit fto Palm Beach Florida. The nspa services are excellent!

title: Black Enterprise Golf and Tennis Challenge
review: Thank you for your business and your wonderful post.

title: Great Time, Great Property and Great Golf Weekend
review: Arrived on Thursday before the Labor Day weekend and stayed until Sunday. I loved staying at PGA! Friendly, courteous staff, beautiful grounds, beautiful hotel, beautiful golf course. There was nothing I didn't like. I had a great long weekend and I will definitely stay here again.  Next year I plan to bring my young adult children.

title: First Class
review: Thank you for being our guest from BE.  A wonderful group we enjoy coming back to PGA every year.

title: Great resort!
review: This resort was awesome with great folks around the property. Angel from the Palm Terrace made our daily breakfasts special. I will be back soon. All the golf courses were fun and we highlight was the Champ course.

title: Wonderful Weekend!
review: Came up for the weekend with friends from out of state.  I love it here.  The guys played golf until it started to rain...we girls lounged poolside and Shanna at the pool bar took good care of us Saturday and Sunday!!   Can't wait to come back again!

title: Great, but ....
review: Thanks Stacy for your wonderful post.  Yes we do have many great amenities for gys and gals  lol  Look forward to see you back.

title: Wonderful trip!
review: All in all, a fantastic place. Loved the room, the restaurant, the atmosphere, but absolutely hate the outside bar by the pool.. Other than that, I highly recommend this place, especially if you're into golfing. I also recommend the inside bar.

title: Lovely hotel
review: Thank you for your response and for being our guest.  Our goal is to exceed our guests expectations in all areas.  We will review with our team your comments.

title: 10 Day stay at resort
review: We decided to take a short golf getaway.  This resort was great.  Stayed 2 nights and played 2 courses.  The Fazio and the Palmer.  Golf courses were in excellent shape.  The resort was very clean, friendly staff and very helpful in suggesting places to eat off property.  We did not use the pool area but it was beautiful and looked inviting!  Rooms were good size and clean.  No problems with wifi but the cable did continuously go on and off.  Great value if you go during their off season.  Will definitely be back!

title: Cal Ripken World Series
review: Overall very accomodative.  Staff very pleasant and facilities were very nice.  Access to pool and work out facility was excellent.  Rooms and lobby are excellent.  Food options varied greatly.  Valet and bellman were very friendly

title: Great value for golfing trip off-season
review: We recently stayed at PGA national and enjoyed the incredible value for great service and atmosphere booking their golf package.  It's off-season, so its hot but well worth it.  We played the Champion course twice (same as Honda open) and loved the course and relaxing at the pool afterward.  I'd highly recommend getting a cabana pool side.

title: My Working Spa-cation
review: Thank you for your business and your post.  Yes I agree our new "Cabana" product at the main pool is a wonderful amenity for our guests and members.

title: Children, Children, Everywhere and Not a Drop of Peace
review: I stayed for two and a half weeks, while I photographed/covered a golf tournament. The crew (everyone from the valets to the bell-staff, front desk/reception, housekeeping to banquet and catering) is always pleasant, punctual, dependable and eager to make your stay enJOYable.

title: Comfy & Quiet
review: Thank you very much for your business and for helping cover the amazing Optimist Golf Tournament.

title: "Paradise"
review: The PGA Resort & Spa is an amazing facility!  Living in paradise every day we feel that when we venture to the resort it's like a mini vacation in our own backyard every single weekend...from the top notch service at the main pool always greeted "welcome back" or "my pleasure" from Adam Bryan, Jorge, Ann and lets not forget the ladies at The Wave Krista & Shanna plus the rest of the staff always greeting us kindly every time we are there.  The experience really starts when you pull up at the valet and the "welcome back" is always the first comment.  The employees from the IBar, IDeck, Ironwood, concierge etc...are always making you feel welcome.  Then if you venture over to the Spa that's a whole different elegant experience the staff there is amazing with the tranquility of the…

title: Beautiful resort, relaxing vacation!
review: Thank you very much for your business and wonderful post.  Our team members are the special reason why PGA National is so amazing.  They go above and beyond to make our guests feel comfortable and welcomed.  Thank you once again.

title: **AWEFUL VENUE FOR EVENTS**
review: Resort was beautiful, clean, great service, pools beautiful, food great, a bit pricey but expected.  My husband and son golfed every day and loved all of the courses.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom cottage and although the cottages are off the resort property, we really enjoyed having all of the room in the cottage including living room and kitchen, two big bedrooms and 2 baths.  Would highly recommend.  Two shout outs to Michael E. in reservations for being very patient and professional as we had to change the dates of our trip and Luis in housekeeping who was very professional and did a great job every day of cleaning our cottage!  Would definitely stay again ... just loved it!!

title: Relaxing
review: Thank you for your wonderful post and for your visit.

title: Amazing property
review: It is taking me time to write this review and time is money. In fact, I hardly ever write reviews and feel the need to address what happened at this establishment. If I could rate a zero, I would. I am a social event planner in South Florida and feel so embarrassed for your staff.  Do not waste your time planning ANYTHING at PGA National. Their event planner, Jenny barely returns any calls and did not even notify any staff that there were over 50 people attending. I even called with an update on event day and no phone call whatsoever has been returned to date! Not even a thank you. This is by far the worst venue I have ever chosen to host an event at. Nobody even knew we were coming and the staff was so unprofessional and unwelcoming that I ended up clearing out my guests and…

title: Nice hotel, great Gardens location
review: Our king room was spacious and comfortable.  The room was showing a bit of age in the bathroom ceiling as the paint was a bit bubbly looking.  The balcony was nice but went unused due to the Florida heat and the fact that it was facing a wall.  This did not impact our enjoyment of the resort.  We had drinks in the lobby bar and enjoyed the open lobby with nice views out toward the pool and golf course.  The front desk staff were friendly but became confused easily and could use more training.  Overall, a nice visit with proximity to great restaurants.

title: Spa day from groupon
review: Thank you for your business and post.  We will review your comments with our team

title: Great weekend getaway
review: My husband and I experienced a spa day better than what we expected. We were greeted kindly by the front staff and guided through the spa. The amenities in the locker room also were more than we expected. The showers were one of our favorites! The massage therapists, Lisa, were perfect and tended to our muscle concerns. We then relaxed pool side majority of the day. We sat under a covered cabana which was perfect.  We went on a Monday so there were only about 20 other people. Yvonne at the pool was attentative and the food and drinks, delicious. Alex & Isme were always keeping the area clean and organized and always making sure we were having a relaxing time.  Our only complaint was that you can see the pool area needs renovating.. Tile and resurfacing the pool. The pillows…

title: Golfing Paradise!
review: Thank you for your kind note about our Spa.  Our Spa will also be going thru a minor renovation in Sept/Oct so we hope to address some of the areas you mentioned.  Thank you once again for your business.

title: Independent Business Consultant
review: Stayed twice at the resort for a quick weekend getaway and it was amazing. The food and drinks are very good and they have pool side service. There's two pools one is a kiddie pool my son loves. As soon as you check in you get a voucher for 2 complimentary drinks from the bar. The hotel rooms are very nice and clean , staff is friendly and helpful. Many close restaurants and stores near by. If you're a good fan the lawn is beautiful .

title: Great Experience
review: I live local to the area and was looking to get away for a couple of nights. Since the PGA is just down the road and has 5 courses, it seemed like a no-brainer. Everything from checking in to the accommodations were great. My only issue was when I was there there was a little league tournament in the area where all the kids were staying. I love kids but not running all over the place and in & out of rooms. I quickly brought it to the staffs attention and they quickly made the adjustments to a quieter area of the hotel. All I could really ask for.   One this to mention is the staff. Simply fantastic! Angel at the Palm Terrace is the kindest person I ever met! I want to wake up to her smile everyday! Thank you Angel!

title: great pool, resort and hotel and spa
review: This is a great overall hotel. Nice golf , nice pool and good food all around!  Definitely go and make sure you hang out at the restaurants there too.  The spa has like 5 different types of pools (salt, mineral) etc and spa is wonderful.

title: Great golf, hit or miss service.
review: Had an amazing time on a much needed break. Golf at this resort was simply great and I will certainly be back for that reason alone. The service is hit or miss though. Depending on who you get and at what time of the day you'll be dealing with either amazing Breakers worthy service or a motel6. My housekeeper maria, Paul Jacob Dave at the desk and Carlos room service are all stars and they're disposition infectious. Then you have jaded service by the pool (older female attendant) a front desk manager (Hector) who clearly can't control his emotions. He left me and clearly those working around him uncomfortable. Then your spa simply spotty. Fix these things and you'll be the best of the best.

title: Vacation
review: Thank you for being our guest and for posting your comments.  We take great pride in training our team members to service our customers with the highest level of service.  I apologize if some didn't exceed or meet your expectations.  I will take this information to assist in any retraining efforts.  Thank you once again for being our guest and hope to see you back soon.

title: Fun Resort!
review: We stayed her on the recommendation of a friend because we had family in the area. The hotel is very nice & easy to get around. The pool is great for kids. It has zero entry & is large so it never feels crowded. Our waitress Angel, at the Palm Terrace where we had breakfast was the highlight. She made my kids feel extra special bringing them whip cream & having pancakes made special for them. She treated the adults just as well. She remembered our drink order & had our drinks waiting for us when we came down.

title: BAD spa experience
review: Beware when booking a swedish massage, If you want anything more than butterfly kisses, be prepared to pay an extra 12 dollars. The massage was good but when I compared notes with my traveling companion, she did not have to pay extra for firm pressure. I called and asked for the manager but she has  not returned my call or addressed my concern.

title: My son's wedding & reception.
review: Good afternoon Trish and thank you for being our guest.  Please contact me directly at 561-227-2555 as I would enjoy speaking with you about your Spa experience.

title: Golf vaca
review: The hotel was a beautiful setting, great staff, & service provided. Excellent accommodation's,& clean,  Many things to do, pool, golf, spa, tennis on property. The hotel was very vibrant, and pretty Great value. Valet attendants were most efficient & polite always using my name when speaking with me. Front desk was very friendly unpin check in and at check out. David that took my reservation over the telephone was most friendly, courteous, and efficient I will most certainly stay there again.

title: Awesome service!!
review: Thank you for being our guest and for your wonderful post and congratulations on your sons wedding.  PGA National is a wonderful place to gather for those special occasions.

title: Will Return Each Year!
review: Golf was awesome had a great time but watch out for the cleanliness of ur room ours was disgusting.. Other wise was an over all good time just don't walk barefoot in ur room apparently they don't mop often😁bars were nice but it is a bit expensive

title: Beautiful location, nice folks, but lacks attention to detail
review: I stayed here for a conference and am impressed by the location and the golf amenities.  Very nice staff who work to please the guests.  Facility needs some attention with a refresh though.  Bathroom had no exhaust fans for shower or personal hygiene, room decorations were limited and pillows appeared to be quite old, IMO.  It's not a bad facility it's just that I had expectations given its name and stature.

title: Fun golf guys get-away!
review: Thank you for being our guest and your post.  I will bring your comments to our ownership group for further review.  Thank you

title: Peace and relaxation.
review: Stayed at the resort for 3 nights recently on a guys golf trip with a group of friends that's been visiting golf courses every year for golf-our-brains-out fun.   The property is nice, well maintained and even though the courses were coming off maintenance they were still playable and a good value. Rooms are spacious and clean.  Never used the pool but it looked beautiful and wish we'd of had time to use it. The fitness center is really a cool set up, lots of cardio and weight equipment but it's in another building a few hundred yards away from the main building. Tennis courts looked inviting.   We only ate breakfast on property which was a plentiful buffet with a nice variety. Service was excellent at the buffet.   We did spend quite a bit of time and money in the hotel bar.…

title: Special Father's Day
review: Thank you Frank for your groups business and for choosing us.  I hope to see you and your friends here again soon.  Have a great summer

title: Great time!
review: Wonderful time at the spa . swimming in the  healing pools,,  then lunch at the pool then a great massage.  Pool staff is excellent. .All just perfect. room was clean and quiet. service was wonderful.  IBar food not up to my standards,  but the Ironwood Grille food was very good. I cannot wait to do it again.

title: Exceptional
review: Spending a week here at the resort.  We have a two bedroom cottage that is fully equipped with kitchen and laundry.  The accommodations are very well appointed, comfortable and relaxing.  The main hotel is very nice.  Restaurants and lobby bar is good but a bit pricey.  We are using the convention facilities for our group.  The staff are very easy to work with and helpful.  Services and golf exceptional.  Enjoying our stay.

title: ZEN!
review: Thank you James.

title: Lacking customer service..
review: Spent the day at the spa with some girl friends. We had massages, lunch, swam and relaxed for an entire day. It rained half way through so they gave us rainy-day vouchers to come back. We can't wait to go back! The food by the pool was great. Yummy salads and wraps. The facility was clean and the staff was fantastic. Great of girls day out or couples day out. OR by yourself!

title: Unexpected Vacations(Extending your Business Trip to Leasure)!
review: Thank you for your business Jennifer and for recommending our great Spa.

title: Fun 2 nights with golf
review: I have stayed in a lot of hotels/resorts. This was by far one of my families least favorite. Our resort fee was waived but then they individually added everything back on. First place in a LONG time that did NOT have wifi unless I wanted to pay 10$ a night. (this was part of the resort fee that was waived)also 10$ a day to park and again this was part of the resort fee that was waived.  Only had 2 washcloths even though reservations were for 3 people. Next day, I had 0 washcloth's and had to wait to be brought some. Fridge did not cool. I called to let them know that it wasn't cooling and my lunch meat and waters were warm to the touch. I was told it wasn't a refrigerator that it was more of a "cooler" and NOT for ice cream. I never said anything about ice cream! On the website…

title: Had a great time and service was exceptional
review: When we checked in the front desk gave us a complimentary upgrade.  It was such a pleasure to stay at the PGA National Resort.  I highly recommend the Hotel for any type of stay, either business or leisure or if you just want to get away.  Great place to stay.

title: First timer.
review: Thank you very much for your polite post and being our guest.  We hope to see you again soon.

title: Nice stay
review: Quite nice. Staff, For most part were quite friendly. Especially the restaurant/patio staff. One reception could have demonstrated some care when the room provides was incorrect. Although she made the change, not a smile or a "sorry". Actually she said nothing. A small matter but the front desk is the face of the resort.  Overall, above average and would recommend.

title: A great place to stay.....even for non-golfers!
review: Thank you Mr. Cornely for your stay and your comments.  Your group was amazing and thank you for the service that you and your police team provide.

title: Mother's Day gift
review: I was there for a weekend get away The golf looked good but did not play The pool area was great The rooms were very large but dated and abit dark The whole resort buildings needed some TLC Staff was great and food ok They need alittle of Trump way of doing things to make it first class

title: Beautiful Setting; Wonderful Amenities!
review: I don't think I've experienced a friendlier hotel staff - from the valet employees, to the bell staff to the front desk to the chamber maids to the restaurant servers - everyone seemed genuinely pleasant and ready to help make my enjoyable. I loved the layout of the property. The patio and pool areas provided plenty of space to relax and enjoy. No need to resort to desperate tactics to hold a favorite lounge chair by the pool as there were more than enough for everyone. A truly comfortable, pleasant stay.

title: Good, but missing a bit
review: Thank you very much for your wonderful post.  Our staff is very special and pretty amazing.  But thank you for being our guest.

title: Outstanding resort
review: Overall, I have to say our visit was satisfactory. The hotel felt very quiet and I am sure they are hopping in season. The rooms were fine. I like the double vanity areas. We got a great deal on two connecting rooms with a family rate. The food at the restaurants is better than average and we experienced good service at the steakhouse, ibar and breakfast area. The big disappointment was our check in. The attendant was not friendly, took forever, and just looked like she could care less. You also have to initial and sign a bunch of times (we had to for both rooms) which seems strange and different than other hotels. It makes you wonder what they are so worried about. This was our first impression, so it unfortunately set the tone. The other weird occurrence was despite the $25…

title: Expected a little more..
review: Thank you for your being our guest and for your response.  Our goal is to always exceed our guests expectations with a high level of quality service.  I'm glad we met those expectations in some areas, but disappointed we missed at the front desk and wifi.  We will certainly review these areas to correct any concerns.  Thank you once again for being our guest

title: Relaxing
review: I thoroughly enjoyed my recent 3-day stay.  Every staff member I encountered provided me with friendly, courteous service and exceeded my expectations every time.  The resort amenities provide relaxing entertainment options for all ages and the freshly-prepared meals excite and delight even picky eaters!  I highly recommend PGA NATIONAL RESORT AND SPA for luxurious relaxation for a reasonable price.

title: Overpriced
review: This hotel wasn't awful, but it did not offer enough to justify the price point. The beds were hard and uncomfortable. The water pressure was weak. The grounds were nice even though some of the flowers were fake. Housekeeping was fantastic. The bar and bar staff were top notch.   The rest of the staff was somewhat disappointing. The front desk wasn't very welcoming. The woman who checked me in wouldn't even respond to my requests for the fourth floor and double beds. She just glared at me and booked the double beds on a different floor.   We ate at the first floor cafe one day, and our server strongly discouraged us from ordering off the menu and pushed the buffet instead. The breakfast buffet was delicious and simple, but not worth $50+ for two people. The server barely showed…

title: Our son's wedding at PGA National
review: Thank you for your business and your post.  Please except my sincere apologies if we didn't meet your expectations.  We will discuss with our team leaders to address the situations mentioned in your post.  If you would like to contact me directly for further discussion you may do so at 561-718-0262.  Thank you once again for being our guest.

title: The Best of the Best
review: We had our son's wedding at PGA National on May 7, 2015.  We couldn't have asked for more.  The guests kept coming up to us raving about the service and the facilities.  The golf staff went out of their way to arrange for a group outing.  The food for the reception was exceptional.  There was not a misstep.  Nickole was the wedding coordinator and she had everything organized to the minute.  Jenny helped me plan the bridal luncheon and that was also perfect.  Thanks to all who helped to make this a perfect day for Mike and Amanda.

title: Nice experience
review: We are so pleased to hear that your son’s wedding, golf outing and bridal luncheon at PGA National Resort & Spa were so exceptional It means so much to us that you would take the time to share your positive experience. We strive to provide championship service to all our guests. I made sure to send a note to Jenny and Nickole to thank them for a job well done. We look forward to seeing you again soon at PGA National Resort & Spa.

title: Wanderlusting for MORE time!
review: I cannot say enough about how wonderful the staff are- they treated us like royalty. The concierge Antonella and the manager Ian as well as spa staff Bell and waiter Oneil went over and beyond excellent. We stayed in the honeymoon suite and Antonella surprised us with champagne and fruit and cared for our very need with elegance. I have not seen better higher quality staff in any hotel/resort I have ever been to. Period. I highly recommend the scallops at the Ironwood as well as the hydro- facial that I had at the spa. Wonderful salt pools and lounge area. Also, surprisingly the coffee at Cafe Pronto in the lobby is amazing and we are coffee snobs lol. We took a yoga class and the fitness center has new first rate machines. Mens locker room has a sauna and women's has a spa pool…

title: Golf Mecca
review: If you want to play golf this is the place to go. There are lots of course choices including the real test - The Championship Course - where the Honda Classic is played. The hotel and other facilities are well kept but are basically old facilities. Staff were friendly and prompt. We had two evening events for our group and both were done very well. The golf operation is the real hub of the hotel. It runs like a fine Swiss watch. I am not a great fan of Florida humidity so given an alternative site out of Florida to visit I would not choose PGA National. One big plus is nearby access to great restaurants.

title: Groupon Spa from H*ll
review: Thank you very much for your post and your business.  The golf certainly is a staple of the resort and for our clientele.  Thank you once again and hope to see you soon.

title: Comfort, luxury and fun.
review: So $600. Later & hands down the worst spa experience EVER. Not only was the place overrun with people there using their Groupon for a manicure that included use of the facilities, but they actually were holding painting classes in the area leading out to the pools. The smell of paint & the women you had to parade by to get to your "relaxing" water pools of the world was inappropriate for a real Spa experience .  My deep tissue Swedish massage was booked to be given by a male. They had put me with Paula who was nice enough but certainly was in no way a good massage therapist let alone had any strength to do a deep tissue at all. Ok, disappointment but I couldn't change it as it was 11am & she had come for me. Turns out it was the worst massage ever.  Then we had to wait 3 hours…

title: Vacation Disappointment
review: Please accept my sincere apologies for your experience at our spa.  Please call me directly if you wish so we can discuss.  561-227-2555

title: PGA National Resort & Spa
review: It is a beautiful place - wonderful pool, lobby and golf.  Staff is very helpful.  We played golf 3 times during the week.  The Champion is hard and beautiful (I lost about 10 balls trying to carry on water holes).  We had room 2100 at the end of a hall, which overlooked the lake.  Room was very large with a couch and large tv.

title: A hotel run by male accountants who pretend to like golf
review: Can't tell you how disappointed we were with this property. It began with the lobby, that was clearly designed by men, for men. It is a huge room filled with overstuffed chairs that only a group of golfers, drinking after just coming off the course could love.  The restaurant, Ironwood, is about the same with a menu of heavy entrees.  Think Mortons only with more options.  The real disappointment is the golf.  The courses are in serviceable shape at best, and with greens fees starting at $250.   From the PGA, you would expect more.

title: Brothers Golf Group Outing
review: Thank you for your business and for your comments.  I apologize if we did not meet your expectations.  We do offer a world class golfing experience that only resort guests and members can enjoy.  We also offer a full service spa, a brand new 5 million dollar sports and racquet complex complete with 19 hard true clay courts, and brand new pickle ball courts.  8 different style restaurants, and a wonderful and relaxing pool and Cabana experience to just name some of the wonderful amenities we offer.  Hopefully you will try us again when traveling in our area.

title: Not worth the money
review: Friends from all over the US came together in this resort for sun, fun, golf and fellowship.  All of our expectations were exceeded as this is one of the most beautiful resorts my wife and I have ever seen. The staff at all levels (front desk, room service, golf, spa, bar and dining) were very organized, professional and polite.

title: awesome experience
review: Thank you very much for your post and your business.  We hope to see you again in the future.

title: Holiday Inn Express was cleaner and more comfortable!
review: Maybe this place used to be nice but not so much right now. Low quality amenities, scratchy towels and stadium quality toilet paper. No service by the pool. Rude or disinterested staff. The TV in our room didn't have working channels, including CBS during Masters weekend. The food was not good and to top it off, my husband got food poisoning. They couldn't care less.  So disappointed.

title: AJGA Event
review: Hotel recently renovated.  Lobby area very well done.  Front desk staff extremely helpful and goes out of way to honor requests.  Our rooms appeared to be recently renovated as well and were clean with comfortable bedding and linens.   Valet staff very helpful and friendly.  Golf courses in good condition.  We ate in the lobby bar area a couple times and thought the food was OK at best.  The pool is nice but fairly vanilla....could use an additional family-style pool to make it a really great family resort. Great spot for a winter getaway if you want to play golf.

title: Nice location for touring
review: Thank you very much for your post and your business.  We love the kids from the AJGA!!!

title: Fordham Golf VIsits PGA National
review: The rooms are a bit dated.  The lobby bar is a nice place to meet friends.  Close to great food experiences.  Easy drive to the beaches in the area.  Honda classic golf tourney is held here in February.  Great event to watch if in the area at that time.

title: Fine, Not Special
review: Nothing but good things to say about PGA national. The team of workers, the golf courses, the lodging were all spectacular. Fordham golf has been going to PGA for five straight years now and the team has taken great care of us. We worked with the group booking team to figure out lodging and golf. We had a contact who took care of us every day with range balls, carts, and cleaning our clubs. The rooms are always in great shape, clean and modern. As our trip is during the march madness games, its great to have a nice TV in the room for the guys to watch all the games. We were able to compete on the Champ, Palmer, Fazio and Squire courses. They were all great in their own way and maintained perfectly. The courses are a good test of golf and allowed us to break off the rust before…

title: Golf vacation with our regular foursome
review: Thank you very much for your post and for your business.

title: Avoid Dinner at Members Club
review: We traveled from NJ to see my father-in-law who lives nearby. We decided to have dinner at the Members Club. We have eaten here numerous times before but not within the last year.  Bottom line was the food was under cooked, over seasoned, late by nearly 2 hours. The wait staff was poorly trained and not attentive to accommodating the customer. The management was apologetic and comped us for a round of drinks and dessert.  The had limited menu items and the creativity was severely lacking. On top of everything, they had loud live music and band members that could   not sing.  After more than 3 hours, we finally finished our meal with only a few patrons left. The final straw was their computer lost connectivity and had to estimate our bill. This evening was a nightmare and we…

title: Overrated
review: Thank you for your post and your business.  Please accept my apologies for any inconveniences experienced in the Members Club.  I will bring to the attention of the Club Manager.

title: We won't be returning....
review: We arrived late at night and at check in, seemed like an inquisition. Very big on making sure you know about checking out early, you still pay. You get tagged with a $25 per day resort fee. Common areas are nice enough, but our room was very sub par. In the basement, had not been upgraded in years. No maid service for two days, just ignored. The room style looked early 80's. Wall mounted toiletries were cheap, very much like cheap perfume. Service in iBar was erratic, drinks terrible and waitress apologized for computers going down, saying "well it is PGA National". Staff indifferent, rooms (certainly ours was not upgraded) are not impressive.   Halls narrow and musty. Tip: AVOID this overrated place. Poor in numerous areas and certainly far overpriced.

title: Exc lent resort
review: Thank you for your post and for your business.  Please accept my sincere apologies.  Please call me directly if you would like to discuss further.  561-227-2555

title: Initial impressions of PGA National
review: We stayed here for an industry conference and suffice to say the general theme of the conference was the lackluster accommodations and frustration with the resort.    Rooms:  The rooms themselves are adequate, and decently appointed.  A little past their prime from a usage standpoint, however no major complaints or issues.  Service:  The major issue with this resort was the poor service.  Essentially they had  standard way of doing things, and if you did not fall into that, you were out of luck.  Many issues here 1) We needed our dry cleaning back over  day later and upon calling the front desk we were essentially told you will get it when you get it.  2) The waitstaff was very slow and not highly communicative.  It would take 20+ minutes to get recognized at a table for…

title: Golf trip to PGA National
review: Our group stayed in one of the golf cottages.  The cottages are adequate but outdated.   The main purpose of the trip was to golf.  The golf facility is first rate.  We played the four courses on site.  The Champions course was fantastic.  The other three courses on site were below my expectations.

title: Honda Classic
review: clean place, good food, great golf. Well kept resort. Choice of 5 golf courses. Plenty of restaurant choices. great fitness area and spa. pool area great for family ,kids or just hanging out. been coming here for 7 years and will come back next year.

title: Very hospitable staff
review: Thank you for your polite post and business during an amazing week at the Honda Classic.  See you next year...

title: Antonella saved us!
review: I was staying at the PGA National for business and happened to be there Valentine's day weekend. Their restaurant was fully booked for holiday diners and the hostess was not helpful in seating me, although I was alone and all the tables were yet to be filled. One of the very kind waiters, Claudio, noticed my request and pointed out a cancellation, and had me seated and served a delicious starter within minutes. The breakfast staff, Nadine and Fernanndo were also extremely helpful and friendly.

title: Great place for golf
review: Thank you very much for your kind post and business.  I am glad we were able to get you in over a busy holiday seating in ironwood.  Hope to see you again soon.

title: Nice stay at PGA National
review: Stayed 3 nights at the resort together with my wife,mtrying out golf and the facilities while also looking for a condo on the property. Played golf on Palmer and Fazio courses. Both in excellent shape and pace of play was good and friendly at the same time. My wife tested the spa which was nice. Meals were best enjoyed at the terrace outside the bar in the reception area, with a great view over the swimming pool area. Menu was not big but ok. Service was excellent and in the evening fire pits (gas) and burners kept us comfortably warm. Hotel room and overall service were good. The only downside keeping me away from giving a score of 5 is the price level which is clearly on the high end of the scale.

title: Third time here.....unfortunately wasn't a charm
review: Thank you for your kind and polite post and for your business.  Golf is amazing at PGA National so I am glad you took full advantage of it.  We hope to see you back in the future.

title: Didn't stay. Golfed, ate and drank.
review: This is the third time in 6 months staying at PGA. Golf is great if the staff can find you're bag in time for you to make you're tee time. We checked in about 8:30 pm and we're tired and hungry went to the restaurant and waited as the hostess finished her long phone call then we were told no availability. We ate at the bar and that was actually a nice experience. I agree with another travelers review about the awful odor throughout the hotel and our room which was in fact over load of bleach. I could not  sleep the first night the smell was so intense. I had to ask the cleaning team to please not use anymore bleach in our room for the rest of our stay but unfortunately the odor was apparent throughout the whole resort. And I also agree with the same reviewer that the water…

title: Great Golf Courses - Service Doesn't Match Up
review: Thank you for your honest post and business.  Please give me a call when you have a moment so I may speak with you in more detail about your experience and can offer my assistance.  561-227-2555  Thank you

title: Golf Getaway
review: The golfing is world class. But you knew that. Staff is exceptional. Drinks at the pool bar are well made and the drink menu is fun. Could use a few more craft beer taps. To play the Champ course is special. It is not cheap but worth it.

title: Golf Galore
review: Stayed at the PGA National Resort February 2016.  Checked in before rooms were ready, so they held the bags while we went to play our first of four rounds over four days.  The check in was smooth otherwise.  All staff in the hotel, bars, restaurants and golf pro-shop and  course were friendly and helpful always without exception.  The hotel was very nice, rooms were comfortable and a step above the average hotel room.  A fairly nice breakfast buffet was included in the package.  Beautiful gym with pretty much anything you would want equipment.  The pool was pretty but not made for lap swimming and a Jacuzzi next to the pool overlooked the main lake in the complex.  The Fazio, Palmer and Esquire courses were all different from each other, all equally challenging and beautiful to…

title: Wonderful property in every way!
review: Thank you very much for you post and for your visit.  The golf at PGA National is truly one of a kind and we thank you for your comments and hope to see you again soon.

title: Hotel not as good as course.
review: Room was clean and comfortable, lobby bar, pool, piano bar, restaurant.....everything was fantastic!  The pool area is huge and staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The spa has its own pool area and is clean and comfortable.  Spa pool staff top notch!

title: Very enjoyable  stay....great staff?
review: Thank you for your wonderful post and for being our guest.  We hope to see you again in the future.

title: Rained but still worth the stay.
review: Though not a golfer I understand the lure of playing golf at this place. The hotel, though, wasn't the same level as the course. It was a little tired feeling. My room had a scent that I couldn't exactly pinpoint. It wasn't bad but it wasn't good either. The bathroom sink had low-water use regulator thingy on it and hardly a trickle of water came from the facet. It was more akin to a fog than a stream. The lobby and meeting rooms were OK but I came away non-plussed by the whole place. Needs some love.

title: More like an old Holiday Inn than a nice Resort
review: The reason I am writing this review is the nightly rate of $450 does not present any value! Had it been $150 I wouldn't be writing this. This place is old and tired. They tried to update the rooms a bit but its still very much the old cheap hotel style of room.  The golf is ok so if you are there to golf then you deal with the rooms but there is so much great golf in this area that you can stay anywhere else. The biggest issue is if you are going to use the spa. First of all the Men's wet area, Jacuzzi, steam and sauna are DISGUSTING! I mean old rusty frames, green slime all around the Jacuzzi, steam out of order every day, old worn out faucets in the showers. Really a dump, not sure how it even passes health inspection. Be prepared to wait in line for a long time to even get to…

title: The room ruined the rating ....avoid this...
review: Thank you very much for your business and your honest review.  This summer, the Spa is going to go through a renovation as the facility is in need of an upgrade.  I apologize if the condition fell under your expectations.  Please contact me directly at anytime as i would like to discuss more with you.  561-227-2555

title: Poor service & unwelcoming staff, not recommended for a couples.
review: When you arrive it looks appealing to the eye all around. Sweeping grounds.  Well manicured grounds and welcoming smells. The lobby looks renovated... So what is the issue. The rooms on the first floor are terrible. The views are awful, room is dark and musty.  If you go don't accept on on the dusty floor stay higher and you will be much better off.

title: Hmmm...not a business hotel despite hosting a conference
review: Thank you Paul for your response and your business.  I will share your comments with our corporate officers.

title: Beautifully groomed exterior
review: Upon arrival the valet was a little slow, but polite & welcoming once we had advised we would be checking in. The reception staff all looked miserable, no smile or polite welcome & when we tried checking in (early) we where told they only guaranteed check in by 4 o'clock, No attempt was made to check us in earlier. Not really a problem, just unwelcoming. The lady said she would call once the room was ready, however, as soon as we said we had a UK mobile, the answer was no we won't call unless you have an American number ~ slight problem as we were on vacation! It appeared that it was too much trouble for them. Once we checked in, the room was ok, everything was in working order, however, rooms & bathrooms are dated & look tired. We made a reservation with Ironwood steakhouse…

title: Very nice resort...concierge was GREAT!
review: Nice hotel with a centrally located and very spacious bar/lounge area. We visisted for a business conference and this was set up very well for such events, keeping people congregated for large amounts of time. The concierge, Antonella, was first class and essentially planned our dining for three nights of our stay. Every recommendation was excellent and she catered well to our needs for entertaining customers and friends. Being very knowledgeable of the area and actually dining at many of the restaurants recommended allowed for us to not only feel comfortable trying these places, but also helped us get into restaurants where reservations were hard to obtain on such short notice. Overall, I would recommend PGA National to anyone wanting a weekend away for golf activities or for…

title: Golf, Golf, Golf!
review: Thank you very much for your post and staying with us.  I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay and that Antonella was able to make your experience exceptional.  She is a gem.  Thank you once again and hope to see you back soon.

title: The PGA experience added to a wonderful Holiday Season
review: Very Nice resort. The only complaint I have was with the room. I reserved a Suite and was not impressed with the unit I had. It was dated. I was expecting more for the $500.00 per night that I paid. As for the rest of the resort, it was above average. A real Golfers paradise..

title: Poor Customer Experience
review: Thank you for your post and for your business.  I will review the suite situation with my team.  Thank you again.

title: Very Nice Resort, EXCELLENT STAFF
review: I have been visiting PGA National for the Holidays for a number of years and it only gets better.  The rooms, service, staff and food is second to none.  My wife and I particularly enjoyed dining on the new iDeck and the lively activity in the lobby bar is second to none. I will be making my reservations for this spring and Holiday season soon.

title: Nickel and dimed at PGA
review: We went to the PGA National Resort and Spa to attend a wedding.  The grounds were certainly lovely (though we don't play golf), and the bedrooms were not bad either.  What I objected to most was the constant nickel and diming.  For example, you get a promotional rate for the wedding, then get charged and additional $25 a day for basically being there, including you parking your car.  Now if you want an attendant to park your car, that's an extra $20 a day. Then, a bottle of water is $6.  And so it goes on.  And the service was very poor.  We complained twice about insufficient towels in the room, to no avail. On the third occasion, a large pile of towels was left on the bed, for us to sort out, which I interpreted to mean 'kiss my butt'.  The hotel manager did apologise, and…

title: Spa going downhill!
review: Thank you for your post and for your business staying with us.  Please accept my sincere apologies again for the situation with towels.  I will review with my team to correct.  The $25 daily resort fee covers many additional amenities that we feel improve the guest experience while on property.  Include in the $25 is high speed internet, sports and racquet club access, tennis court times, aerobics, yoga, pilates, spinning classes, newspaper, golf bag storage, in room coffee, two welcome cocktails at I Bar, and yes parking on property. Thank you again for being our guest.

title: Best Resort in Palm Beach
review: I have been coming to PGA National Spa for several years now and have to say this last visit was very disappointing.   I was embarrassed to bring a first time guest there after I raved about how nice the spa was.   Once we arrived  check in was fine. I showed my guest around. We decided to head into the spa/whirlpool area which was disgusting.  Dirty towels overflowing, the smell from the whirlpool had such an overpowering smell of chlorine it burned our eyes as soon as we walked in.    The floor had 2 inches of dirty water just sitting there.   Not sure if drain was clogged or what but a huge hazard.   Went to soak in the Dea Sea pool and noticed used gum that had been harden up around the edge for a least a few months.    Massage from Malle was the only saving grace. Nice…

title: Great location and very friendly staff
review: Thank you for your post and for your business at our Spa.   Please accept my sincere apologies for any inconveniences while at the Spa.  Yes you are correct as there was a drain clog we experienced in the locker room and had that engineering concern corrected.  We recognize the need for some capital money to be added into the Spa and have slated this summer to complete those renovations.  Thank you for mentioning Malle, your service provider.  Bill contact me directly (561-227-2555) the next time you would like to visit and i would be happy to assist with your booking.

title: golf nuts hotel
review: We stayed here due to proximity to Bascomb Palmer Eye Center. What a fabulous treat it was for us. Beautiful room, heavenly sheets & pillows, wonderful walk out views to water, sunsets and pool. The open welcoming room at the resort which included the best bar area ever, walk out to patio with fireplace. TV's, iinteresting people, friendly and small cozy gathering areas. Wonderful new feel. We loved it. Breakfast the best. Staff friendly and helpful always. We didn't even see the spa or play golf or swim this trip, but will go back to enjoy all of those great amenities. Hotel wwas fabulous.

title: Beautiful Resort
review: We actually live down the street from this resort. Checked in for a weekend of golf. Resort is beautiful, excellent restaurants and pro shop. Staff was willing to assist at any time. I am a fanatic about cleanliness and this resort had no flaws. Valet was professional and had your car ready in minutes. This is definitely a hidden paradise. Golf courses are the best in the country. You don't need to be a golfer to enjoy this hotel.

title: Good (property) but Not great (service).
review: Thank you for being our guest and our neighbor.  Its a wonderful time of the year and our golf courses are in amazing quality and shape.  Less than two months from Honda Classic.  Thank you once again for being our guest and hope to see you soon.

title: Above Average for Golfers - Just Ok for Non-Golfers
