review: We arrived really late - 1am on Christmas - and despite there being 2 people working at check in, we still had to wait to get our room. (There were no valet or bellman.)  Room is spacious and well appointed. Kids like the game room. Libby bar is lively at night in a good way.   Pool area is nice but there is NO service. You can't get drinks or food brought out to chairs and the small pool bar area can't accommodate the lunch time demand. Equally annoying is that every morning, fellow guests grab heaps of towels to reserve chairs but then disappear to the gym or golf course for hours. Literally 80% of poolside chairs had been claimed at 8am and as I write this at 10am, virtually all are empty. If there was staff at the pool, they could be managing this better. Or at least brining…

title: Lovely lunch too!
review: Thank you Rebecca for being our guest during the busy holiday week.  I do apologize for any inconveniences during your trip.  Please give me a call directly and I would love to discuss them with you.  My direct number is 561-227-2555.  Thank you

title: Pretty Cool Resort
review: We just returned from a five night stay at PGA National.  We were looking for a golf-centric resort that’s a direct flight away from NYC and for the most part this place delivered.    First the golf, since that is why we were there.  It’s really amazing to have four solid courses right on site.  No need to do anything except walk from your room to the pro shop in the morning, and be in you golf cart a couple minutes after that on your way to the driving range or the first tee.  There is a fifth course (The Estate) which is a 15 minute drive way – drive yourself or arrange a transfer through the resort.  I did the latter and it worked out seamlessly.  As for the on-course properties, I played 3 out of 4 of them and they were all fun.  The hierarchy is clearly:  Champion, Palmer,…

title: One-night business stay...just OK
review: I was initially really looking forward to staying here, assuming that it would be top notch. Sadly, I was disappointed. The lobby was lovely and the front desk staff were kind. I received vouchers for two drinks at the lobby bar and had dinner there, which was terrific! Portions were very large (I was warned as such by my server) and the food was quite good and arrived quickly. The lobster mac & cheese and pear & arugula salad were incredible!  My room, however, was fair at best. I killed half a dozen mosquitoes in the first hour I was in the room. The light in the shower was halfway burned out and the water pressure and temperature left a bit to be desired - took ages to get hot water at 5:00am. The toiletries in refillable pump containers struck me as odd for a supposedly…

title: World Class Resort That Offers Everything That You Could Want
review: Location is great, located close to the airport. Everything at the resort is a short walk away. Excellent golf instruction. Matt Denzer, the Director of Instruction, is completely customer focused. Bob Wuhrman, the Tennis Director is also extremely accommodating.  The Fitness Center has fabulous classes with top notch instruction. My massage at the Spa was left me feeling relaxed and ready to pursue more sports. The only caveat is they have world class tennis tournaments that can prevent you from getting a court. During The Little Mo event there were 400 kids which made the hotel stay during the tournament less than ideal.

title: Championship Golf
review: Very active lobby and  bar scene. Music was playing all the time, and pool area was especially beautiful. The golf courses are really challenging and many tournaments are played on them. If you are a golfer, it is the place

title: Very Nicely Done!
review: I had visited the resort for three nights recently.  I must add that I wasn't there to play golf.  However, some members of our group did while really enjoying the experience.  My room # was 1058 which offered a limited view.  The room was on level 1, ground level.  My particular room showed a bit of wear which I attribute to the room being a bit older than others in my group.  My room had Spanish floor tile throughout, with the exception being the bathroom.  There was an area rug under the King size bed.  Storage was ample with a large dresser serving as the home for the in-room safe too.  My room had a desk and chair, chair and ottoman, full size dresser with two side tables.  Lighting in the room was less than stellar seeming to always be a bit dim.  My room was well…

title: Wedding event weekend
review: Stayed at a PGA resort cottage with my family for my nieces wedding there. Cottage with two bedrooms and two baths was adequate for the 5 of us. Enjoyed the wedding venue although weather could have been better. Jogged around to work out area and tennis courts. Too cool to use the pools.

title: PGA National- Top Notch Resort
review: We were on a business trip for a few days during the first week of December and it could not have gone any better. The resort was beautiful and the people that worked there were excellent. From the bar service to the concierge service, there was never a moment where I wasn't getting taken care of. Antonella (concierge) was more than helpful in providing cab service to make sure we were on time for our flights. She was so sweet and so were all the bar tenders. Everyone really just made you feel welcome and at home. I would recommend this resort to anyone and everyone, especially golfers!

title: Great resort
review: The resort was recently renovated and the lobby, restaurants, and pool area all looked brand new.  The rooms have also been updated but you can still tell the hotel has been around for awhile.  We frequent the area to see family and feel that this is by far the best resort style hotel in the area.  The staff was great and very attentive to all requests.  Fitness center is brand new and the spa was nice with access to private mineral pools.  I did not play golf.  The main pool area is great with a nice bar and small restaurant. Lots of good restaurants right on pga boulevard within min of resort.

title: Great family vacation
review: We stayed at the hotel from thanksgiving to November 30th. The hotel is impressive when you arrive and the workers are all very sweet and helpful especially Jacob by valet parking. The hotel itself is a little dated but you can see they have made many updates. Check in was easy and quick but we got a first floor junior suite with connecting room to a double for my mom. I recommend staying on 2nd floor or higher. The outdoor patio was a view of plants and way too many insects. The room was dated but spacious.  We had an issue one night but was resolved by the manager in a timely fashion.  The higher floors had patios which were much nicer. The pool area was beautiful and never overly crowded however the pool was very cold. They had fun activities to keep kids occupied on the…

title: Could be better
review: We were there right before Thanksgiving to watch my nephew play in the Polo Junior Golf Classic. Very happy that this meant we didn't have to pay full price for a room.   The resort looks impressive when you arrive. We settled into a regular room because the suite upgrade we were offered only had a King bed instead of the two doubles we needed. Good thing I checked my bill closely before leaving because they had erred and charged us for a suite anyway. (The young woman at the front desk fixed that for me nicely when I pointed it out.)  The room is larger than average and mostly nicely furnished. Since it wasn't a suite, it didn't have a sofa. The armchair was missing the ottoman that the pictures show.   Water pressure at the sinks was low. Shower was fine, though the tile and…

title: Best Golf Resort in Florida
review: TOP NOTCH all the way!!  I read a previous review from someone that stayed in Sept this year.. This person is lying!!  When you pull up your bags are taken to your rooms and golf bags delivered to the course. When you show up for your tee time, they are on the card, clean and ready to go. The Pro shop is immaculate with an unbelievable selection of shirts, hats, shorts, anything you need.  It looks and feels brand new.  We played 2 of the courses and each one is meticulously maintained with some of the best greens in the country. The best staff at a resort that I have ever experienced, hands down! Believe me, I've done this before. The addition of the new pool is amazing and indescribable. Look at the pictures on line and see for yourself. We ate at all of the restaurants on…

title: Excellent Resort for Golfers and Non-Golfers
review: I just returned from PGA National Resort and Spa in Palm Beach Gardens. It was my third time at this great resort. Although it is known for it's 5 golf courses including The Champion Course which is home of the Honda Classic, it is so much more. All 5 courses provide different challenges yet with it's multiple tee boxes all levels of golfers can enjoy the courses. Dont't miss the 3 holes that are called The Bear Trap on the Champion Course. All courses are in excellent shape with smooth rolling greens. The Spa provides many types of services with a knowledgable, friendly staff. The spa has been recently renovated and also provides a full service salon. The Ironwood Restaurant offers a wide selection of delicious beef to local seafood. The IBar provides signature cocktails and…

title: First Class Golf Resort
review: Thank you for your great post and for being our guest.  The PGA has so many wonderful amenities for golfers, and even non golfers so thank you for posting your comments and about our great team of professionals.  We love our culinary team and they produce some amazing food in all of our restaurants.  See you again soon.

title: Great place with even better service
review: I went to PGA National for a four day stay, to play in a annual golf tournament with a bunch of friends from Mass. We were treated great, the staff was accommodating. The courses were great, we played three courses and found them in spectacular shape. Playing the Championship course, where the Pro's play the Honda Classic is great experience. The pool, bar area and entire resort looked modern and I noticed improvements since the last time I was there. There are plenty of bars and restaurants a few minutes away.

title: Great
review: Thank you Dave for your wonderful post and for being our guest.  The golf courses are in trememdous condition as we go into our winter season and we are all excited for the 10th Honda Classic to be played on the Champ course in late Feb.  Hope to see you back soon.

title: HORRIBLE!!
review: Spent a week at PGA National for a meeting. It has been a while since I have been there but I can tell you that the renovations have turned the facility into the a wonderful place to stay. The staff could not have been nicer. Plenty to do and many choices for food and drinks. I will hopefully return.

title: WOW!! Customer Service at its finest!
review: Upon arriving at PGA National for a little "staycation" with my new fiancé, we were warmly welcomed at the check-in desk by Lauren. She was all dressed up for Halloween and had such a warm personality. We were looking to upgrade and Lauren directed us to the PERFECT room with more than we had imagined. Shortly after, we had a little greeting to the hotel slid under our door. Lauren, thank you so much for making our little get away a weekend to never forget!!

title: Golfers' Paradise
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review. It so glad to hear that you had a wonderful experience and weekend getaway. I hope you come back and visit us again soon in the near future. I am going to make sure to acknowledge your positive feedback in regards to Lauren's service. We defiintely appreciate hearing about such a great experience!

title: I imagine this is a golfer's paradise.  I don't golf ;-)
review: This is a beautiful and luxurious resort with a gorgeous view of the pristine golf courses. The staff is very professional, friendly and accommodating.  The Ironwood restaurant was fantastic and the servers are top notch.

title: A magical place for golf nuts
review: Thank you very much for being our guests from our neighbors on the west coast.  Great to have you and thank you for the wonderful post.

title: Excellent resort at Palm Beach
review: This resort is a golfers dream come true. Unfortunately, I'm not a golfer ... Ha ha.  Located amidst a beautiful PGA rated golf course, the central lobby area, that has just recently been renovated, is where all the action happens. Day and night.  It's always great to walk into a dynamic lobby, buzzing with action.  The rooms are large and the pool area is appealing. The spa though was a bit dated.  The one thing that irked me in the room is that the towel rack in the bathroom was right above the toilet. You can't imagine how many times I knocked the towels into the toilet, from where I had to fish them out. Hmm. Who thought of this design.  Golfer or not, I did enjoy staying here for our 3-day business event.  The hotel and restaurants did a great job of taking care of us.

title: All about Golf...Service OK
review: Stayed for 3 nights. Rooms are ok. Weak water pressure, spacious room with balcony, mediocre front desk service, nice lobby energy and ample parking.  Expected higher level of service from a destination resort. Our hospitality suite did not get serviced one day. No apology.

title: Decent hotel/golf not so much
review: Thank you Dan for your business and post.  Please contact me directly to discuss the issue you stated in your hospitality suite.  My direct number is 561-227-2555.

title: Visit to pga
review: Decent resort. Rooms ok. Staff very nice. The Concierge, Antonella was awesome helping us make dinner reservations. Front desk very nice and valet parking staff great!  Problem is with the golf.  Came here on the golf package.  Played 2 days.  One on the Champion Course and one on the Fazio course. On the Champion Course...waited on just about every shot. Got to the 10th tee and there were actually 5 foursomes on the hole. 2 on the fairway, 3 on the tee. Quit after 9 holes. Talked to the guys in the foursome ahead of us. They stuck it out and it took them over 6 hours to play! Played Fazio today...same problem. 2 hours 40 minutes on the front. 10th tee backed up again. Quit again. We've played resort golf all over the country. Never experienced anything like this. Suggestion to…

title: Golf & Family
review: Dear Lynda C., We apologize for your less than acceptable golf experience during your visit.  Pace of play is a high priority for us and our Marshal Practices have been copied by clubs from around the country.  We have also recently invested in a ne GPS system to assist along with bolstering our Member Pace of Play Committee with Professional Golf Management Students from Keiser University.  I am sorry the two days of golf got away from us as our normal pace is 4:15 or less unless the carts are restricted to the path or we have extremely high winds.  I would very much like to invite you back to PGA to play as my guests at any time that is convenient to you so that we can show you a better effort.    Again, I apologize for the issues and hopefully will hear from you soon to book some additional golf for you.  Sincerely, Jane

title: Visit before the season starts
review: We visited this resort for a Honda/Acura  Financial golf tournament. It was wonderful! The customer service was amazing ! My husband played golf and I enjoyed the Amenities. They gave me the option of a  Late checkout for 1 so tommy went to my Room and I said to him can you please bring our luggage to the concierge his reply  Was I will bring your. Belongings to your Truck load it and send it back to valet .my Husbands golf bag was delivered soon After his game .to valet . I hope management recognizes tommy loicdic  And ziggy Wilson as outstanding and  Amazing

title: Best service ever!
review: My brother came here for a weekend getaway to celebrate his 40th birthday.   Given the milestone celebration, as a family we wanted to be able to do something special for him and "be there" since we all live far away.   I have to say, the Concierge Antonella Mancino was absolutely amazing! She helped us plan a little surprise for him, personally went and got a happy birthday balloon, arranged details with the Golf Shop so we could surprise him with his green fee... Everything!  She totally made a huge difference in what we were able to do, the details and making my brother feel this was a special occasion.   If you are looking for an experience that makes a difference definitely come here and talk to Antonella Mancino, she will make it happen!

title: Excellent golf resort
review: Thank you so much for your post and for being our guests at the PGA National.  Thank you for your celebrating a special event with us and for your kind words about Antonella.  She is a gem.  Hope to see you again soon.

title: Best Customer Service EVER!!
review: Attending a conference for business.  Accommodations were excellent.  The convention facilities were first class.  We enjoyed the rest of the property.  Golf was excellent, the restaurant was great.  I had a great room on the third floor.  Staff was attentive and helpful.

title: Relaxing, Beautiful
review: Thank you for your wonderful post and for your business and enjoyment of the resort.  Hope to see you again soon.

title: The Champion golf course was wonderful.
review: I would just like to say thank you to Ms. Lauren at the front desk.  She was a joy to deal with and she made everything perfect!  This is my 2nd time at this gorgeous resort and she made my business trip feel more like a vacation.  All of the PGA staff should take a few classes from her! Thank you Lauren for a job well done.

title: Peaceful Place with flair
review: everything was perfect from check in to check out. Food was fantastic, every staff member was professional and courteous.  The grounds are beautiful and the pool is very well kept.  We are not "pool" people and typically never swim in them when at a resort, but this pool was amazing.  We are beach people so this was a different kind of vacation for us but well worth it!!  The golf was fantastic, but we are not regular golfers. We enjoyed the resort and all of the other amenities.  The gym is fantastic with everything you need.  The resort has some real flair with a great lounge/bar in the lobby where the drinks are fantastic and the food is terrific.  The poolside food is wonderful, with many choices for lunch.  We will be back if in that area!

title: Golf Holiday
review: Thank you very much for your business and your wonderful post.  We just finished a 4.5 million dollar renovation of our Sports and Racquet Club and we are getting rave reviews.  Thank you once again.

title: Nice place though a little away from the beach
review: We arrived at resort we were met by the bell hop who took our luggage and arranged for our clubs to be sent to pro shop. Check in was quick and enjoyable, friendly, personable employees. We took advantage of breakfast the package which included custom omelets served by very attentive waitresses.  Golf was another great experience, pro shop, starters and cart attendants were all excellent. Courses were great enjoyed golf on Squire and Champion. The resort was nice but a little pricey.

title: Great Christmas vacation
review: Thank you very much for your business and polite post. The golf is wonderful.

title: Bravo to Hector
review: I like to go to the beach when possible. This is a great hotel but it's not easy to get to the beach from here. The parking was abundant but it would be nice if there were a regular shuttle that could take you to a nearby place right on the water.

title: I really wanted to like this place, but come on...
review: Came here for a quick weekend getaway.  On first glance, it's beautiful.  Just refurbished and very nice; great pool area, very meticulous, great bars areas, but... The staff needs to focus on more attention to detail if this place wants to be a high end resort.  Very JV.    Here's an example.  We went to the pool bar for lunch.  The place was in total disarray.  Tables misaligned, chairs scattered every which way.  I got up and personally organized the space to make it presentable, and the bar tender didn't get the clue. Condiments strewn on tables.  Half the umbrellas not opened.  And the place was empty.  I ordered a Mai Tai that cost me $13 and it came out with no fruit despite a large quantity on the bar... Seriously?  The Food was cold and mediocre.  My wife got peel and…

title: Excellent conference facility
review: Thank you for being our guest and for your post.  Please accept my sincere apologies for the experience you had at one of our outlets?  We are reviewing with our team and am confident we will right this wrong.  Please contact me directly if you have a moment so we could discuss your experience and I could offer my assistance.  My direct number is 561-718-0262

title: Great Resort for Golf
review: Upon driving onto the property reveals a well maintained and groomed grounds.  The staff greeting you are extremely friendly and helpful.  The different types and locations of the rooms are very pleasing.  Views include the golf course itself or the large inviting pool. The rooms are comfortable.

title: Spa Service
review: Thank you for being our guest and for your wonderful post.  We believe we offer one of the prime conference facilities in all of South Florida, including all of our other great amenities.  Thank you once again for being our guest.

title: Nice Place
review: The hotel is a large style resort and has 5 golf courses, which are great, especially The Champion Course! Hotel food is OK and there is the option to get your own breakfast on the ground floor in the Cafe (croissants etc), i.e. room only is fine. Pro Shop is large, allow plenty of time. All in all definitely worth staying here and it is enjoyable. Pool & Spa area lovely.

title: Lousy catering team
review: I have attended numerous business events at PGA and I continue to be astounded at the lack of respect by the catering wait staff to speakers in the ballroom. Clearing of dishes, scraping plates, pouring coffee - all with too much noise and disturbance while the program is underway. For years I have attended events at this hotel and keep thinking it is not the norm. But it is. Each time I am appalled by the disrespect. If you're considering an event at PGA, make sure your wishes are conveyed to the F&B team and direct the wait staff to refrain from turning your event into a distracting, noisy mess.

title: Even if you're not a golfer - still a nice place to stay.
review: Thank you for being our guest and for your post. And please except my apologies.  Please contact me directly to speak more about your experience.  561-227-2555

title: Pretty relaxing
review: My room was clean, comfortable, and well appointed.  The staff and servers were friendly and helpful.  One particular standout was Stefan, my server at the hotel's Ironwood restaurant.  I was dining alone, and despite the uncomfortable self-consciousness inherent in that sort of situation, he was so friendly and attentive that I had a very enjoyable meal.  He made excellent recommendations when asked, and accommodated my requests as well. The one slightly negative experience involved the spa.  It IS beautiful, and the short massage I got was great, but I barely managed to fit it into my schedule because the spa closes at 6pm - not convenient at all if you've been busy all day and are looking for a way to relax in the evening.  It would have been wonderful if it had stayed open…

title: Very Good for groups
review: The room was nice. I didnt have the best view but it was nice. The elevators are pretty loud - I was the first room on the first floor and could hear them. The pool area had a few too many black birds but I think that was because people tend to leave things lying around and the birds become attracted to that. They were working on a few areas. The bottom floor near the pool and recreation area smells really badly. The ibar food is just ok. The other main restaurant food is awesome but its pricey. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. I got an in room massage and it was just ok as well. The lady was kind of noisy. She moved a chair while giving me my massage to sit down and massage my feet - please just stand up next time. The hotel gives you 2 complimentary drinks to the…

title: Nice resort great golf
review: Our group of 16 people had a 4 day tournament, the golf and hotel logistics were excellent! We even had a complimentary suite as a command center for our tournament. We played the Fazzio, Squire and Championship courses, the championship course was exceptional but the other 2 courses had been plugged and the greens were in rough shape. The golf staff was exceptional and accommodating but with the exception of the tall young lady at bar 91, the rest of the staff was rude or indifferent, the same goes fort the bartender at the lobby bar the day we got there and the servers at the breakfast buffet. For such a great property their staff needs a lesson on costumer service.  The rooms were good, not spectacular but very adequate. I would recommend it to other friends because all…

title: 1 Year Anniversary Staycation
review: My husband and I stayed at PGA National to celebrate our one year wedding anniversary. We got married at PGA National last year and thought it was a perfect way to spend the weekend. As always, all of the staff was helpful and very friendly. We always feel very welcomed when we visit or stay there. We had a fabulous dinner at Ironwood Grill, relaxed by the pool and had a few drinks and meals at iBar. Everything was wonderful! Can't wait to celebrate there again next year!

title: PGA National - Great for a long weekend!
review: Thank you so much for choosing PGA National Resort to celebrate such a joyous occassion. We are so glad that you choose us to make memories that will last a lifetime to come. Happy Anniversary to you both and many more. We are glad to hear that you felt welcome by our staff as it is our number one goal to provide our guests with a championship experience. We cannot wait to celebrate with you again next year!

title: Golf for the Weekend
review: Enjoyed this property for three nights as part of a conference.  Loved every bit of it... Great tennis facility and instructors, Good food/bar options and sufficient accommodations.  Staff was very pleasant and helpful.  Pool area is large enough and a major plus was to find that it was a salt water pool. (Great for the skin).  Didn't do a spa treatment but area appeared to be high quality.  Got to enjoy the spa pools - also salt water.

title: nice getaway
review: The PGA National Resort and Spa is a nice property.  They did a very good job with the recent rennovation of the resort.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The golf course was beautiful in tip top shape with plush greens etc.  The SPA was quite nice as well.  The resort is in a convenient location for travel from the PBI airport and the Mirasol shopping center is close by the property.

title: Hotel was just ok
review: A friend and I stayed at this resort for 1 night for a quick getaway. The rate was very reasonable and the room was very large with a small balcony. We received a $25 resort credit which was easy to use (they deduct it from any charge you have on your bill at the end of your stay) and 2 free glasses of wine at the lobby bar. The pool area was nice and the lounge chairs were extremely comfortable. There is some construction going on near the pool so that is something to be aware of if you plan to stay for more than a few days and take advantage of the pool area. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would come back again.

title: Great stay
review: Excellent place to stay whether there for golf or just relaxing. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Service was pleasant and helpful. Was upgraded complimentary. Very convenient to all of Palm beach. Will come back!!

title: Craft Beer Bash at PGA Resort and Spa! 4 1/2 Stars!
review: Attended the annual Craft Beer Bash. Got the room package and Beer Bash tickets for $149. Great value. $15 extra for VIP tickets is well worth it. Get to taste and extra hour before general admission.Jason , the parking valet, was the best! He made us feel right at home. Nice spacious room and nice friendly staff.Got a double not the reserved king room, but it worked out better!  Nice pool too. Had lunch at the iBar. Very good. Had a burger and lobster sliders.Couple of beers. Steven and Corey at the bar did a great job, cause it got real busy later. Beer Bash was great fun,bands were good, met some new friends and after we tasted enough, it was back out to the iBar for shots! Tasting got just too crowded, but overall very good. Abita's Turbo Dog and Diver Down ales were our…

title: Always a Nice Time
review: We stay here every year when we visit our family.  They recently completed a renovation.  The rooms are beautiful as well as the resort itself. The Spa is nice but a bit on the pricier side. The only negative feedback I have is that the lobby bar can get extremely loud when they have a dj or a show.

title: Average
review: We stayed at a 2-bedroom cottage.  It was clean, but old with old furniture.  The cottages definitely need to be renovated.  The pool was nice, but mostly closed for thunder.  The food was good.  Parking is convenient.  Staff were nice. Overall, an average hotel.

title: Awful
review: Worst hotel experience ever . Staff is rude , inept , provocative and unknowledgeable about any hotel services. Particularly the spa director , Stephanie is incompetent and nasty . Insult to injury , there was construction at the pool (a booming bulldozer ) from 9:00 to 4:00 . The manager never mentioned this when my husband an avid golfer booked our reservations. They also lost his golf clubs but they were found . The decor is dated and even the pillows in the lobby had stains. Spare yourself , don't stay at PGA.

title: Very disappointing
review: Overall we were quite disappointed. During our stay almost all amenities were closed. The retail shops we never saw open. Palm Terrace, Bear Trap, Piano Bar, Waveside, Bar91, were all closed. Only real places to eat was the Ironwood and iBar. iBar was always packed and extremely loud. Service was overwhelmed - so not an experience worth the price tag of our meal. We ate on a couch without a table. For a 60 lunch I would expect a table and a pleasant waitress. Pool was closed almost the entire weekend. We got to swim in it once for 1 hour. I have been a Floridian all my life and the pool was closed for 'thunder' way more than necessary. Spa I asked for my discount but it was never applied (apparently). We were definitely disappointed and feel we should have gotten a substantial…

title: Awful stay at the PGA
review: I had a booking for a 5 day stay with 2 rooms this past week at PGA. No where on their website did they alert you to the pool which is basically a construction site from 8 am- 4 pm every weekday. There was heavy machinery and concrete breaking right next to the pool grounds , not very relaxing for a family that waits all year for their holiday & then cannot even speak to the person in the next lounge chair due to the noise. Does PGA really believe that guest want to sit buy a pool with the constant roaring of the machines? I asked the front desk to have the manager Bill Horn speak to me about the pool condition and see me at the pool which is right near his office behind the front desk. I never saw him after my request nor hear from him, guess he was hiding out in his office…

title: Overnight stay for the Craft Beer Bash
review: PGA National is one of our favorite staycaction destinations! A to the pools, a sip at the IBar, a coffe at the lobby coffe shop or a great meal at the Ironwood Steakhouse. Highly recommend for a staycaction or an amazing place to house your out-of-town guests

title: Costruction site!!
review: Very disappointing experience.Not sure what they are referring too when they say they have undergone a million dollar renovation?? We were not told when booking that the hotel is currently undergoing construction..Pool area is basically a building site...Very loud ..only 1 entrance in or out of pool area which requires you having to walk through main lobby and bar!  Bar staff at IBar not very attentive waited at the bar for 12 mins to order a drink,Sam at poolside no staff available to bring drinks or towels.. Did complain and checked out early.Manager was very apologetic but seemed like he had heard it all before.  Upon checkout we stood beside our car for 10 minutes waiting for our golf clubs whilst 4 of the valet guys stood chatting completely ignoring us,My husband actually…

title: Affordale luxury never felt so good!
review: Thank you for being our guest.  And please accept my sincere apologies for some of the service areas that didnt meet expectations.  We are building a brand new I Deck for outdoor dining and beverage which is located on the back of the main lobby.  We are sorry if this caused you any concerns.  Please call me directly at 561-227-2555 as I would love to discuss your experience to help correct areas of concern.

title: Fabulous convention/vacation
review: The resort is lovely and has many nice amenities.  The pool area was beautiful.  I do not golf but we did have a 5K on the golf course and the course appears very well maintained.  Rooms were lovely, the bed was super comfortable and the comforter was amazing!  All food was very good as were conference and banquet facilities.  I look forward to returning again in the future.

title: Beautiful grounds, delicious food, great staff!
review: Thank you for your wonderful post and for being our guest.

title: Used to be Great
review: Comfy beds, friendly staff, great food although a bit pricey and not enough seating in the main bar area and be prepared for a loooooong wait for your order.  (upstairs bar)  Can't speak for the other dining options in the hotel.  Nice gym facilities and fun shops.  Internet connection was a HUGE issue.  Suuuuper slow and I noticed many of us taking our laptops all over trying to find a good signal.  Almost none in my room so I went to my floor lounge.  Took ridiculous amounts of time to load, a tad better in the lobby but still...for a hotel of this quality with business clientele I would think they could beef up their internet connections, speed, and access for patrons.  That was my only, but HUGE issue.  Loved the pool and Paul, the pool waiter, was super friendly and always…

title: Third visit and big dissapointment
review: Thank you for being our guest and for your post of your experience.  We recently had a lightening strike at the resort and it took out some phone and internet servers so we are just now getting everything back up to speed.  Sorry for any inconvenience, but thank you once again and we hope to see you back soon.

title: Relaxing weekend at the PGA
review: We visited the resort for 3 days and played golf on two of those days.  The courses are average to good.  Unfortunately, you will have condos/villas on every hole practically.  The grooming was acceptable but not pristine.  We got the weekend for cheap so we can't expect perfection.  The rounds took way too long since the courses were overbooked.  We did have fun playing golf and would try again.  As for the resort, the valet arrival went smooth and reception was good.  We did have to wait a little for our keys but in defense, we arrived around noon.  The rooms were okay, better than most 3 star hotel chains but not 4 or 5 stars.  I'm not sure what they were thinking on lighting since the rooms are dark with only a few dimmered lamps.  The bed was comfortable. My wife didn't…

title: Great place
review: There is not much to talk about. I was happy hotel guest. I liked the place. Clean and spacious. Part of my group was playing golf and they loved it. I spend lot of time in pool area which was very nice, clean and well maintained. Stuff was very friendly. I loved the little coffee shop in the lobby. You can buy some snacks or fresh breakfast sandwich .There is a huge parking lot in front of hotel and it is free. I love hotels where they are not trying to squeeze every penny out of your pocket.

title: Family visit for Optimist golf tournament
review: Thank you for being our guest and post the great experience you had when visiting.

title: Golf, golf and golf
review: Not sure where to start... We were told several times this was a 5 star resort- it's not! We had two adjoining rooms for the four of us. We were given a double room and a king room, even though we asked for 2 doubles! Nice sized rooms but not the cleanest. Ours looked like it had a blood stain on the ceiling snd sheets had some stains and hairs. Some days our room wasnt even cleaned until late afternoon. We had a meal plan there to eat breakfast and dinner buffets with the Optimist tournament. The food in the banquet rooms was mediocre at best. Our best meals were lunches every day at Waves restaurant by the pool- great fish tacos, beef hotdogs, and burgers! Anyways the pool was nice...Except my Prada flip flops were STOLEN from the pool!!! REALLY?? Who gets their shoes stolen…

title: Best Golf Resort
review: Thank you for being our guest and for being part of the Optimist group.  Im sorry if some of your experience didnt meet your expectations.  We strive to give great customer service to all who visit.  Please reach out to me if you have a minute so we can discuss your experience.  My number directly is 561-227-2555.  Thank you once again for being our guest.

title: Overpriced and dirty
review: If you love golf, there is no better resort. Five courses, including the Champion, where the PGA tour plays the Honda Classic each year, is awesome. The pool is like a postcard and the whole atmosphere is 5 star. I've been fortunate and gave been here 3 times...and walking into the lobby was like coming home.  Golf, food, pool, spa, activities.  Great.

title: Groupon Fiasco for a non Groupon Guest
review: I was at the spa this past Sunday and we found it to be an absolute circus.  I have frequented this spa in the past but I have never experienced such disregard for serenity and hospitality. I was there with two other girlfriends. One of which was celebrating her 60th birthday and the day was to be a treat to her as a special serene experience. When I phoned, no one mentioned a groupon sale going on which mustve been the difficulty to schedule our treatments.  Still, we were happy just getting appointments at the same time and planned to make an afternoon of it and enjoy lunch by the pool while relaxing before our treatments.  When I rec'd my confirmation call, no one mentioned the whirlpool being shut down or that the pool restaurant would be closed due to the fact that they…

title: Simply Over the Top
review: Dear Diane, thank you for speaking to me and once again let me apologize for your experience and hope the next time you return we will be able to exceed your expectations.  Thank you once again for sharing your experience.

title: Dated
review: I had just come from the Hilton Riverfront in New Orleans. It was wonderful there. But where the Hilton had polish and chrome, the PGA had elegance and warmth. My room was twice as big, the food was incredible, the bartenders and servers were very "Cheers" like. And the Spa, incredible. The golf courses were outstanding. It's been a long time since I've been treated like that.

title: Summer Stay
review: Thank you very much for being our guest and sharing your experience.  We hope to see you back soon.

title: Gator alert!
review: Stayed at the PGA National Resort & Spa over the weekend for business. The website boasts of a $100 million renovation but I sure didn't see it. Rust in the bathtub/shower, musty/moldy-smelling everywhere. Very loud lobby (at night) with hit & miss bar service. Toured the spa but was very unimpressed so didn't make an appointment. Valet parked our car and it was clear that it had been rifled through though nothing was taken. Food was decent and they did a really good job at a banquet for 200+ people on Saturday night. I wouldn't stay here again unless I truly had to.

title: vaca 15
review: PGA National Resort and Spa is a large property.They have plenty amenities for couples, families and the golf guys.  The golf courses were great. We played the Palmer and the Champions courses. Our room was very nice.  The only complaint was that it was dark.  It needed more lighting.  Food wise we ate off property except for the buffet breakfast that came with our package.

title: Decent hotel - wish it was better
review: Thank you for being our guest this summer.  We have wonderful "Weekend at the Wave" packages and programs for the summer that our great for the entire family.

title: Paradise
review: We stayed here for a weekend and wanted to like it more than we ultimately did. The golf - amazing. If it's good enough for the Honda Classic, it's good enough for me. And, at the PGA national resort, they better do golf well. The hotel and the rooms, despite supposed recent renovations, still seem dated. The lobby bar can be a lot of fun - DJ spinning at night. BUT BEWARE, the service in the lobby is painfully slow and the staff often extremely inattentive. The pool is nice but a bit small and again the staff are very slow at getting you drinks or food whether you are at the poolside restaurant or by the poolside itself. The rooms are size able and overall clean. We had poor service in terms of cleaning. When we called to address it, the return visit was acceptable in terms of…

title: Golf & Spa luxury!
review: Dear Nikhil, thank you for staying with us at PGA National and for your post.  I apologize about the F&B and Hsk service as we normally get rave reviews.  We will look into immediately.  Thank you once again for being our guest.  If you return to the area, please contact me directly and I will be happy to ensure that your next visit meets your expectations.

title: Amazing
review: The location is amazing and relaxing. The staff are warm and make you feel at home. The golf is the best. Love the Ibar and look forward to the new Ideck. You cannot find a better hotel with 5 word class golf courses. And of course the swimming pool with music over the weekend end is relaxing and a real treat.

title: Nice place
review: PGA National resort is very clean and updated.  Surrounding area is extremely nice, as well.  Lots of great golfing.  It's a large resort with a very nice pool area on a lake.  Rooms with a lake view would be very nice. Great place to stay in the Palm Beach area.

title: Not that impressed
review: Upon check-in, the staff wasn't friendly.  Not rude, but certainly not friendly.  Poolside bar didn't open the three days we were there, so no poolside food or drinks unless you went inside to the restraunt, which didn't have a blender.  Charged a resort fee which includes coffee and newspaper, but only received one packet of coffee for a three day stay and no newpaper.  Internet was intermittent.  Would recommend staying at another nearby property where they focus on their guests.

title: Ironwood fine dining
review: Dear John, please accept my sincere apologies.  I beleieve the week you were there we encountered heavy afternoon rain and thunder, with lightening strikes in the area so there are times we need to close down outside operations such as pool bar, pool, and even golf until storm passes thru.  I certainly will address with my team.  If you have a moment, please feel free to contact me directly at 561-227-2555.  Thanks

title: Fabulous Experience at PGA Resort & Spa
review: Another good experience. From the valet to the desert, we had an unforgettable 4th of July dinner party at Ironwood at PGA National. Stefan waited on our party and he was Tip-Top! I have nothing but compliments. The chef made a fantastic family-style desert for 10 that was amazing.

title: One night Anniversary Stay
review: Recently I stayed at the PGA Resort & Spa with a group for business.  It was such a great experience.  The resort is beautiful.  The hotel and spa staff is amazing and so friendly and helpful.  The rooms are comfortable and spacious.  My treatment experience at the spa was superb.  Great spa retail too.  Every need I had was taken care of.  I will definitely go back and bring my family!

title: Beyond Expectations!
review: My son and I went here for Father's Day to play the Champions course, the last course we needed to play on the "Florida Swing"  Excellent staff, room and beds well above average, the golf exceptional (played the Squire course the next day also).  The food was the biggest surprise.  We ate at the Ironwood and was amazed.  Risotto was perfect, steak excellent and tomato and mozzarella salad tops.  The pool temperature was perfect and the food at the poolside was crazy good.  Combine all this with a great price and a great son and you have an exceptional Father's Day!

title: Business meets pleasure
review: I recently visited PGA Resort for a company-wide meeting. My room amenities were great, the staff was prompt and professional, our meeting room was stocked, clean and well-accommodated. I have always enjoyed my visits to PGA, but this most recent experience was a cut above the rest. I can't wait for my next visit, and I hope it's simply a leisure visit!

title: Great place to stay
review: I had a great stay here.  The rooms are huge!  You also get your own balcony with every room which is a great touch.The little store in the lobby is way overpriced but you can walk to a store in about 10 minutes.

title: Lovely hotel far from the beach
review: The hotel was clean and well maintained.  We were upgraded to a suite and it was very nice.  The air goes off when it senses no movement so when you go out and return it is warm in the room.  At night, when you are sleeping, you have to get up and move around for the air condition to come back on.  This is an expensive hotel for meals or drinks.  An automatic gratuity is put on your bill so it does not promote good service.  We had good service at breakfast but I observed a different waitress who was mean to a family and was constantly looking angrily over all the patrons in the restaurant.  She made me nervous so I left and took the rest of my food with me. Maria in the Pronto deli was a delight and the chicken pecan salad was wonderful!  The waitress at the I bar was…

title: Exceeded Expectations
review: We just returned from a two night stay at the Resort, and would have stayed longer if possible. The resort is in great condition, very beautiful, the staff really impressed us. Justin, one of the bellmen, was very helpful with area information, and there was a gentleman named Carlos who remembered our names two days later on our way out (feels so nice!). Amazing service.   We took advantage of a little bit of everything. The pool was beautiful and clean. A tiny bit of updating going on but nothing that encroached on our stay. My husband played golf (he said it was one of his favorite rounds to date), and I went to the spa - which was much more extensive than I expected. Really happy with our stay, and definitely going to stay again in the future.

title: PGA National
review: Book through last minute travel or spend a couple hours researching other sites for the best deals. Don't book through the hotel or else you'll end up spending full price. I stayed 3 nights for under $300!

title: PGA Resort
review: We recently had our sales conference at the resort and we couldn't have been more pleased.  The staff was extremely friendly, courteous and helpful.  We needed some minor changes to our meeting room and they took care of it immediately.  All the meals were served on time and although we had several people with dietary restrictions, everything was perfect.

title: Pga resort
review: I went to the pga national as a holiday with my wife to play golf we played the fazio which was 40 dollars each with buggy only because the greens had been worked on and where very slow ,the next we played the palmer coarse very similar to the fazio but better greens but it was 289 dollars for the 2 of us a disgrace it 40 dollars each for a buggy ,so I booked some coarse s around the area which are better and at 30 dollars each with buggy shows just what a rip off the pga national is everything you buy is taxed there also put 25 dollars a day on your bill for WiFi,pool,tennis,etc,the hotel is nice rooms good but to isolated unless you have a car there have you by the short and curlys you pay for the name avoid it

title: Very Nice Even for Non-Golfer
review: I am tagging along with a Non-golfing husband who is at the PGA National Resort & Spa for an intense business Summit. Since I also am a Non-golfer, I am looking for things to fill time & my own food.  So far, everything has been as expensive, with gratuity added, as I expect in a Resort. Happily, high quality has been delivered there for.  Room service was quick & pleasant. Maria who cut & colored my hair today in the Salon at the Spa delivered magnificent styling with great attitude, as did everyone I encountered in the Spa. The only downside is the inconvenience from construction. Like one other reviewer, I very much dislike having to feel I am on "parade" to get through the lobby, by the bar, to go down to the pool.  Also, WiFi is always going down in the middle of any…

title: Fantastic Resort
review: The pool is gorgeous. Prices are what well-travelled folks would expect from a destination resort. The service was fantastic, from valet to front desk to Alyssa for dinner and Angel for breakfast. Overall, this resort has a good crew in place. We played the Palmer course and had a wonderful time. The beds are very comfortable- we look forward to returning!!

title: Not great....pretty poor service for a "resort"
review: We recently attended a wedding at the PGA National Resort, and it was hardly worth the cost of the room per night. I wish we would have stayed at one of the other hotels in the vicinity.  On top of your room rate, you are charged a "resort fee," which I am assuming covers the use of the pool and tennis courts. The pool was hardly more than you would find at a Holiday Inn, and you had to walk through the main lobby, where everyone is checking in and out, to get there. We never even saw the tennis courts, they must be located away from the main resort. Not worth $25 a day, by any stretch. And forget trying to order drinks or food poolside or at the bar--service is nearly non-existent. $15 for a cocktail, $5 for iced tea, and $20 for a hamburger (which was not even very good) even…

title: excellent attention from the concierge antonella
review: we are very happy with all the help we received from antonella the concierge in may 29 2015 thanks antonella you make people feel like home.for sure we be visiting pga national resort. also a big thanks to mr hector santiago and buddy finch

title: Almost Perfect Golf Group Trip
review: My group of 12 golfers recently spent 2 nights at the PGA National Spa and Resort.  We all had a great time playing the Championship and Palmer courses.  Hotel and hotel rooms were great.  Complimentary brunch was fantastic.  Our server, Nadine was the best.  Overall, one of the best resorts my group has visited.  Almost perfect until checkout.  We were told that we had a complimentary late check out until 1:00 PM.  Finished our round of golf at 12:30 and our keys would not work.  We had to trek back up to the lobby and get someone to come and let us into the room as we could not get anyone working on the floor to open room for us.  Extremely frustrating for someone who was anxious to just pick up their bags and drive back home.

title: Best bed!
review: We just stayed here for one night as a stop over and are non golfers. the bed was incredibly comfortable. The man that checked us in is an amazing employee who takes pride in what he does. Wish the staff by the pool were the same. They were unfriendly, slow and at one point i counted 2 bar tenders and 6 other bar staff standing around talking. Was a little frustrating and didnt look very professional. The hotel was good for the price we paid on Expedia but if we had paid full price i would have been less impressed.

title: Beautiful hotel
review: We stayed here on May 30th as part of a softball group. Very welcoming when you arrive into a huge very pretty lobby. The hotel is so big and spread out. The rooms were spacious and the beds are comfy. They do charge a $25 resort fee and that includes use of grounds, pool, internet. Golf is separate and I have no idea of pricing because we were not there for that. They have a bar inside and by the pool. Drinks are pricey and food outside was $10-15 for sandwhich/burger. Food was good though. They had a DJ in the evening which the kids loved. A hot tub and huge pool that had different lights at night. Very pleasant fun atmosphere. We are planning to stay again.

title: Best Golf and Resort
review: Great staff all around!  Everyone was so helpful and friendly.  We had a wonderful room upgrade that was clean and very comfortable.  The golf staff was excellent and really enjoyed our stay there.  Would highly recommend this resort and will definitely go back soon!

title: Our golf group has visited this resort many times over the past 17 years.  It has always been 1st class.
review: This trip was special in that one of our "brothers" was recently diagnosed with terminal cancer and when I shared this inrormation with the reservation specialist, Evette Campbell, she extended courtesies to us that were off the books.  I hope Evette symbolizes the entire staff but I can tell you that this woman has a GIANT heart.  I give this 10 stars out of 5....you get it?....DOUBLE!!

title: Lovely Stay
review: A very relaxing and enjoyable stay here!  The rooms are very spacious and well-appointed.  The staff is incredibly friendly, attentive, and professional.  Don't miss the spa!  Our treatments were wonderful and the spa pools are quite wonderful.  Even if you're not a golfer, this resort will please!

title: This Hotel is a Destination in itself
review: I was staying at the PGA for a Softball Tournament for my daughter.  I only slept in the Hotel.  This Hotel offers so many activities, Golf, Spa, Fitness Center, Restaurants, Bars, fantastic Pool, etc.  That this Hotel could be a destination in and of itself.  We really enjoyed it but were a little put off by the letter at check in stating we would be evicted from the property if we brought in food or alcohol from outside sources.  This Hotel is a resort and as such has really high prices on food and beverage.  I did not come for a family vacation.  I cam for one of 6 travel weekends for Softball from Key West and had to drive 5 hours to get here.  There is no way I was paying those prices to feed my family.  In this case the Hotel's Bottom Line came before the needs of the…

title: Golf Package
review: We wanted to play the famous Champions golf course so we had to stay at the resort. The golf course was in perfect condition but unfortunately the pace was extremely slow making this challenging course even more difficult to play. The hotel facilities and specifically the room look old and in need of a full renovation. The golf staff was very attentive.

title: Beautiful Resort
review: The rooms are very modern and clean. We loved the pool and the kids had a blast.  It has the walk in pool, which is great for toddlers. The pool area is huge with a DJ,  pool bar with food. The frozen alcohol drinks were overpriced at the pool.  My strawberry daiquiri was $12 for a regular sized plastic cup. We had breakfast at the restaurant next to the pool and it was great.  It was a breakfast buffet with an omlet station. It was $21 per adult for the buffet. The hotel offered 2 free drinks at the bar to offset the resort fee which I thought was great! The resort offers world renowned golf courses and a spa, which I did not use at this visit although we have used in the past years.  Great stay!!!

title: Golf is the Name of the Game Here
review: Thank you Bridget for your wonderful post and comments.  The pool area is a huge hit with the Florida weather and its big enough for everyone.  We also offer a great Weekend at the Wave promotion during the summer on Saturdays with games, entertainment, food and drink specials and themed events.  Please come check us out this summer if you can.  Thank you once again for your post and business.

title: Beautiful
review: If you love golf, this is the place for you.  The hotel rooms are spacious & clean.  The service is impeccable.  The restaurants are excellent.  There is a spa to workout the kinks after a day of golf.  And there are 5 championship golf courses to play.

title: PGA Golf Resort is excellent for its great conference facilities, rooms, staff and dining.
review: Thank you Fred for your wonderful post and your business.  Have a great summer and see you again soon.

title: Perfect golf getaway
review: We have stayed at several locations and keep looking for the perfect place in this area.   Positive: great pool and lounging area,  grounds are beautiful,  close to many restaurants, fridge,  best safe in room (love that it was a drawer; so much easier to put things in), balcony.   Big neg is the automatic 18% gratuity added on.   There is just two of us.   Got a drink for each of us to take to our room from the bar and 18% was tracked tacked on.   Ridiculous; natural lightning in room is very dark.

title: What a wonderful resort, and the golf is great!
review: You can tell from the title that we really enjoyed our stay here! I am a golfing 'nut' so I really felt I should play at the PGA National resort, and nothing disappointed. The hotel is lovely and comfortable and the food just great - the steak in particular was superb. What a shame we had to leave and go home - hopefully we'll be back again one day soon!

title: Extremely friendly staff from arrival time to departure  at all tyne facilities we used
review: Thank you for your post and comments.  We get a large amount of European golfers that visit the PGA National for the golf experience.  Thank you once again for your business and hope to see you in the future.

title: Great Resort but Terrible WiFi!!
review: If you want a relaxed and enjoyable week end or longer stay for you and your family it would be hard to beat all that the PGA national resort offers. It has the most friendliest staff. The rooms are clean, and all the facilities like  the pool the spa, the golf and the exercise facilities are all top of the line. Did not have time for a full found of golf, but the practice area is great with clean and almost unlimited practice balls available. All in all  see had a great week end

title: Trip for week long business meetings.
review: Thank you for your positve and polite post and we appreciate your business.  Need to get you back to experience the amazing golf courses.  Have a great summer and thank you once again.

title: GREAT FLORIDA RESORT DESTINATION
review: I spent one week at this beautiful resort , the rooms are nice and the facilities are amazing including the golf, tennis, spa and gym.  Just don't come here if you plan on trying to do business from the room.  The WiFi is so poor and frustrating that you will just give up trying to work.  I was on the phone with the WiFi provider and they could not help.  I'm not sure how a resort like this is frugal with the WiFi, it's something every traveler expects and they really drop the ball on this.

title: Wonderful Resort
review: Just returned from a conference at this resort and it was excellent.  Food was good, the room was comfortable, clean and well appointed.  The staff is helpful.  The health club and tennis facilities are fantastic, and I understand are closing for renovation so they'll be even better!  Pool area was nice and clean. 2 minor complaints was - I kept getting kicked off the wifi in the room, and there was no conditioner available...just a combo shampoo and conditioner.

title: Awesome Resort
review: Thank you for your post and comments.  I will review your comments about the wireless to our IT team.  And thank you for your comments about the conditioner.  In the next 3 months they will both be available in our guest rooms separately.  Have a great summer and hope to see you again.

title: Quite dissapointing and over priced
review: Recently stayed at the PGA National for 4 nights/5days.  The resort is beautiful, the grounds are very well maintained, and the staff is exceptional.  Played golf each day and each course is terrific. Conveniently located to PBI airport.  Great pool, bar, and restaurant. Have been going to this resort at least once a year for the past 8 years.  Look forward to it each time.  Has never let me down.  I will be back again (and again!).

title: Ryder Cup PGA National Style
review: Thank you very much Gina for your repeat visits and gracious posting.  The courses are truly amazing, and with 5 to choose from, you have many options as a golfer.  Thank you again for your post Gina and will look forward to your return visit.

title: Excellent ! Excellent !! Excellent !!!
review: When I heard I would attend a conference at the PGA National I was excited about the venue. However, it did not take long for me to realize that the 100 million dollar renovation missed the mark.  The rooms were fine though nothing special. I was, however in a base room so I cannot judge their higher end accommodations.   What bothered me the most was that the service was very poor. I would call down to the front desk and I would let it ring for several minutes and not have anyone pick up. The restaurants were ok. I would recommend their Steak House but it is on the higher end but worth it.  Their wireless network was very unstable and frustrating. I was at a tech conference as a speaker and one who needed constant access. It was quite the challenge.  I played one round of golf…

title: Great Golf Destination
review: Great destination for an upscale golf vacation.  Easy access from airport.  Fabulous choice of golf courses on site (1 off site), great food options, relaxing pool environment for post golf and perfect lobby bar and deck for hanging out at night.

title: PGA National Fun for Everyone!
review: Thank you for being our guest and your post.  The I Bar in the evenings is very relaxing and very entertaining to all guests who visit so thank you for your comments.

title: Very good golf holidays for fair price
review: We have been to the PGA National many times over the past several years.  We have taken clients to play golf, we have taken our friends and their family for a 30th Birthday Party Celebration  and we have just returned from enjoying our friends for a weekend of golf and fun.  Needless to say, we keep returning for pleasure as well as business due to the beauty of the resort, the friendly and efficient staff and the many amenities at the resort.  We continue to recommend PGA to our friends and family for all occasions.

title: Don't worry about the golf
review: Thank you for being our guest and your wonderful posting.   Golf has been fabulius this month with the courses in great condition after the Honda Classic.  Have a great summer and hopefully we will see you soon.

title: Great visit to a beautiful resort!
review: We spent last two golf holidays in Miami. Once at Trump Doral and once at PGA National. While almost everything is comparable there is huge diference in prices. In average PGA National is 30% cheaper than Doral and more customer oriented. One example: on last day of our holiday we decided to play an extra round of golf on signature courses (Champion at PGA National and Blue Monster at Doral). While Doral asked for full price around $500, PGA National gave us 50% discount as a thank you of being their hotel guests for a week and we paid $150. PGA National is a top choice for golf holidays near Miami. Great golf, good hotel and friendly staff.

title: Nice but not awesome!
review: Spent 10 days at PGA National and have to say that the place is nice, but nothing about it is awesome.  Making golf times is pretty much a nightmare and the system is antiquated at best.  Certain days are not for hotel guests on certain courses, but they don't tell you that until you try to make a time.  Main driving range is closed most days.  GPS in carts never worked for the entirety of my trip (don't know why, someone just needed to flip a switch somewhere but it never got done.) Overall, it seems as though hotel guests are treated as second class citizens by the golf staff, except for the guys cleaning clubs after your round.  Pro shop merchandise is expectedly overpriced and for the most part, food is not too good.  For all I know, GPS worked for members, just not for…

title: Thank you Lauren,!"
review: Thank you for your comments.  I would love to speak with you personally about your experience.  If you have a moment, please contact me directly at 561-227-255.  Thank you

title: Pretentious barstaff; automatic 18% gratuity is tacky!
review: Lauren was so kind to  give my wife  some of her personal feminine products after the sundry shop was closed . It was so much appreciated that we didn't have to go out late at night to a pharmacy. So nice, what southern hospitality! Thank you Lauren"

title: Much better
review: Thank you very much for your kind words and our staff.  Lauren is a newly brought on staff member of less than 6 months, but we feel she really brings the energy and team attitude of our entire resort team.

title: Killer experience!
review: My sister and I went to the iBar for a drink (and to escape the heat from the PGA Pig Out); the bartender had a snotty attitude and was trying to quickly dismiss us from his "area".  Our drinks were pretty good and our server was nice, but she was a ghost for 90% of our visit. Here's the reason why: They automatically add 18% gratuity to EACH bill at the bar (at least, for liquor.) So, they don't care if you like them or not - they're gonna get a tip either way. Super TACKY, folks.  The only saving factor was the nice young lady at the Smoke Inn (cigar bar) downstairs; that's why you're getting the polite minimum of 3-stars.

title: fantastic concierge - Antonella
review: The property is good to great, but like with many trips, some of the details go clink and when they do it's often at the worst time and when everyone is off premise and unavailable.  in our case there was a lost car, a lack of availability of the room we wanted and a few lesser disappointments all at a late arrival hour due to modern flight overcrowding... To the rescue Antonella a fantastic, wonderful, hero of a concierge who made her way BACK to the hotel to accommodate our every need with a smile and comforting words matching flawlessly to exacting deeds.  Hurray for Antonella.  We will be raving fans of PGA because of her efforts.

title: Very Nice Stay
review: Thank you very much for your post and your acolates of Antonella our Concierge,  I will share your comments with her and hope to see you again soon.  Please contact me directly next time and i will assist you with your room accomodations.

title: Well done.
review: I was nervous going in because of the mixed reviews.   Hubby and I have traveled quite a bit and we tend to stay at very nice hotels (Ritz, Hyatt, Four Seasons, Westin, etc)...    So here is the good and the bad.  First -- I absolutely would recommend this hotel and we do plan to go back.   Keep watching the hotel rate on trip advisor and the hotel website... the rate did go down and they honored the lower price.    Upgrade to the Jr Suite.  The room was much bigger than a regular room and we had twins with us (who slept in the pull out) while we slept in the king bed.  There was PLENTY of room for us to spread out in the room and it was nice to not feel crammed in the room.  Don't worry about a view (its not on the beach etc...) we had a "resort view" which really was a parking…

title: Golfing experience !
review: Thank you very much for the kind and thoughtful review you posted.  I'm glad you were able to upgrade to a Jr Suite which makes the stay that much more enjoyable with the extra space.  I will let Albert know he was a hero for finding the extra extention of your stay.  Sometimes if we are booked, we wont know until the day of if we get a cancellation.  Once again thank you for being our guest and we hope to see you again in the future.

title: Golf and Spa Delight
review: I visited the hotel in conjunction with a customer supplier conf. Although I didn't have a chance to play golf i found the event nice including the ibar on Thursday evening. They brought in a DJ to liven things up. Great food at the several rests on site and great fitness center. Next time I'm staying longer!

title: Outstanding location, outstanding staff, and Great golf
review: The only negative was the lack of eating options while at the resort. Rooms are outstanding staff was very helpful and the golf courses are spectacular. The resort is very accommodating and caters to golfers. Very relaxed and comfortable environment. Heading back the end of March 2015 and really looking forward to the return visit

title: Great golf weekend, minor bumps
review: Thank you for posting your comments and experience.  And thank you for being a returning guest.

title: Not for Business Travellers
review: Came here on a guys golf trip...  upon arrival the lobby area is average, lot of seating area, quick bar access and checkin was painless.  The rooms are nothing special, very plain, could use an update; however, I really didn't care because we were barely in them.  The breakfast buffet I found to be really good and the staff there was awesome, we enjoyed that the one morning we made it.   What sets this resort apart, as you should expect, is the golf... we played the Championship, Palmer, and Fazio.  Coming from New England, it was an amazing experience and I hope to return to play them again.  The staff in and outside the proshop getting you setup and on your way, and receiving after a round, was awesome and we appreciated the level of service.   The only two issues we…

title: Expected More
review: Thank you for being our guests and posting your comments.  The golf is truely an amazing experience with 5 Championship golf courses to chose from, including The Champ Course designed by Jack Nicklaus and home of the Honda Classic in March.  Please contact me directly if you have a moment so I might discuss with you the pricing and F&B situation you described as i would like to learn more and hopefully assist you in this matter.  My number directly is 561-718-0262.

title: Needs attention to detail
review: Maybe a good place for golf outing or a conference but not for pure business. I travel a lot to PBG for business and decided to try PGA. Won't come back. Rooms are tired. Phone and clock in room didn't work. Restaurants overpriced and noisy. Few places to collaborate with colleagues. No space in rooms to do so either. Staff was superb and very friendly -- kinda felt bad with the property they were given to manage.

title: a bit tired property but good
review: just spent four nights at PGA National and had a good time. The hotel, while well maintained, is an older property. The staff was very accommodating, the pools were fine and the golf was great, especially the Championship course. Had lunches and one dinner at the hotel restrurant and it was fine. easy to get around and overall a facility that I would go back to again.

title: Average at best
review: Thank you for being our guest and experience the many amenities at the PGA National.   The resort has been open since 1982, but the current owners have invested close to 100 million dollars in the past 8 years to revitalize the facilities.   Our service team professionals are wonderful try to connect with every guests they encounter.  Looking forward to seeing you again.

title: Maybe the golf is good!
review: Check in was delayed and I was told they would call me when room was ready.  After an hour I went back to the front desk, stood in line again for 15 minutes, and my room was ready.  Thanks for the call, oh wait, they didn't call.  The upgraded room was very nice until you pull back the shower curtain and see that the fixtures, including the very nice instant clothes line, still date back to the early 1970's which wouldn't be that bad if the mold and mildew in the grout wasn't from the same era.  The iBar in the lobby was good with good bartenders, the highlight of the entire place.  The Bar90 was never open when we attempted to visit not sure why it's there.  There is an 18% service charge added that not one server noted as they handed the check to me for signature.

title: Wonderful Vacation at PGA National Resort and Spa
review: Thank you for your comments and for your business.  We appreciate your selecting us and I apologize if certain areas didnt meet your expectations.  I will review with our staff professionals. Please contact me personaly if you are in the area again as I would like to assist you during your next visit.

title: Nice for business travel
review: Had a recent opportunity to visit this high profile property for a small business convention, and was looking with great anticipation to see whether the substance matched the hype. Most of the hotel staff seemed very accommodating and the property itself was nice but dated.  The water temperature and pressure in the rooms left a lot to be desired, as discussed by a number of people in our group. I had a large dinner party at Ironwood, and the food was excellent.  Our waiter, O'Neil was also very good at what he did and made for a wonderful experience. However, he was the exception to what I and others found, as a somewhat lacking intensity in the bartenders and wait staff.  It might be that an 18% gratuity is already included in every food/beverage bill, but getting a drink at…

title: PGA Vacation rentals
review: My wife and I stayed at a condominium at the PGA Resort & Spa for the month of February 2015. We rented the condo through the services of Justin Varner who is the sales and rental manager at PGA (pgahomerentals.com) who acts as the intermediary between the homeowner and the renter. All negotiations and checks are done through the PGA resort so the tenant has no trust concerns. We told Justin what we were looking for and he met our exact needs including the rental costs. I met with him several times during our stay and was greatly impressed with his efficiency and professionalism. I played 24 rounds of golf having purchased from Justin a 30-day golf pass to play all 5 courses. My wife and I are looking forward to working with Justin next year

title: Great service
review: I stayed here the weekend of the Honda Classic.  The staff bent over backwards to accommodate every need of mine and my family.  Antonella, the concierge, in particular.  My flight home was cancelled and she went out of her way to make other travel arrangements for me.  I would highly recommend this resort to anyone.

title: Hotels.com to the rescue
review: Stayed here for one night back in Feb.  All the hotels in South Florida were booked or way over priced due to the Valentines weekend. By shear luck, we found one room for one night at a ridiculously good price on hotels.com for the PGA National Resort and Spa. The rate and this resort saved our tired selves as our previous hotel in South Florida could not find our reservation.   Even if it was for one night, it was well worth it. The grounds were beautiful, the staff extremely friendly, the rooms were modern and clean as was the bathroom. Side note and worth mentioning to those who own an electric car, the parking lot has charging stations for electric cars.   Took a morning walk outside to see the pool and the greens. They were setting up for the Honda Classic so that was…

title: Golf Heaven!!
review: When I finally leave this earth and go to golf heaven--I can only hope that I wake up at the PGA National Resort and Spa during the Honda Classic!!  We are two golf fanatics who stated at the Resort during this year's tournament and we had an absolute ball!  The staff are great from top to bottom.  The facility is clean, beautiful and well run.  The rooms are classy.  The beds are perfect.  I woke up early in the morning and walked out my patio door to watch the pros putting on the practice green a few hundred feet away and then sauntered down the walkway a little further to watch them hit balls at the practice range.  We were so close to the course that I was able to come back to my room one afternoon and take a shower before returning to watch the action in the afternoon. …

title: Visit
review: We had reservations at another facility in Naples, and our daughter, who is showing and training horses in Wellington said that we should try the PGA National Resort and Spa. A great recommendation.  The hotel was excellent and the staff was exceptional.  We would recommend the resort to anyone interested in golf.

title: Winter Visit
review: We had an enjoyable five day winter escape at this massive resort in Palm Beach Gardens.  The huge hotel is in the middle of spectacular courses, about 25 minutes from PBI airport. While we were there, the resort was preparing for the Honda Classic and the Championship course was in top condition. The rooms are large and each has a patio or balcony overlooking the pool area or golf courses. There is a separate spa which we did not have time to use. There is also a health club with tennis courts, workout facilities and a lap pool. The main pool complex was very busy and by early afternoon no lounge chairs were available. The pool, including hot tub, are in a beautiful setting overlooking one of the lakes. Self parking and valet parking are available, but the resort runs out of…

title: Wonderful resort
review: My husband and I stayed three nights here while on a business trip. I found everything to be above "par" here!  From reservations to the beautiful, well appointed rooms, excellent food in the ibar, very nice staff, we had a wonderful stay here.  The Spa is wonderful as well.  The very nicest part of our stay was Carlo who went out of his way to bring complimentary tea and honey to my room when I was sick.  I cannot say enough about how much his kindness meant to me.

title: No management
review: This is a poorly managed property. Reservations are not well-handled. Room assignment is terrible. The rooms are very dark, with circa 1980 decor.Our television was frequently "no signal."The front desk has no idea where cottages or rooms are on the hotel grounds.  The cottages on property should never be assigned to any guests. These cottages have no quality control.  We had a fire alarm with fire trucks, and no manager was ever seen. In face many guests stayed in the hotel lobby during the alarm, which lasted for an hour. There never was an apology for the inconvenience.  We had no idea that there was a spa on the grounds until we searched around on the day that we were leaving. Why would management keep this a secret?  I don't know their connection to the PGA, but I know the…

title: Golf trip
