review: Stayed at this resort: dined, drank a little  and played plenty of golf. After playing most key golfing resorts in the US I was really looking forward to a PGA backed resort. The PGA run the golf courses and the resort is owned by another entity. Unfortunately however there seems to be a common strategy for both sides; grab money at every possible opportunity - even if it means that famous U.S.A customer service has to go out the window. On the resort side everything is astronomically over priced. You can see that staff are under so much pressure to gather money e.g. You need to sign for breakfast when they hand you your juice, seriously. On  the golf course side the PGA are forcing 4 hour golf down everyone's throat. They even go as far as threatening to call security if people…

title: Bostonians at PGA
review: We had a wonderful experience at PGA National for a 5 day stay. The place is MAGIC!! We plan to return for sure since it was an outstanding resort!! We love it and the management team is very friendly and they run a great resort.   From Boston

title: PGA National - Top of the line vacation
review: My girlfriends and I decided to get out of the Northeastern freeze and went to the PGA National Resort and Spa.  Four days and five nights of the most relaxing, pampering and deferential treatment followed, led by Director of Operations Bill Horn and his fantastic staff.  Each of us visited the spa (and the spa 'waters of the world' pools which is what I'll dream about now that I'm back in 2 degree weather.  A standalone entity, there is a strong personal connection by the staff to their work, and an easy-going desire to be helpful.  We only left the resort to explore restaurants at night, although the iBar and restaurant are also top notch. The singer and piano player in the restaurant were fantastic.  Tennis, golf, gym, spa, sun, pool = GO.  We're going to make it an annual…

title: Golf trip with 20 friends
review: Mediocre trip. We have been to Arizona, California and Florida over the last 15 years and this has been our least favorite location.  Service was as best abysmal. Servers are all nice, but just overworked. Co-ordination between the bar and other serving areas is non-existent.  Managements response to this issue is confrontation. Really! PGA National needs to look within. Your system of service and management is flawed.  Rooms were nice, but everything else was substantially over priced. $6.35 for a bottle of water. Please, and $6.50 for a bottle of Pironi!  One good golf course will not bring us back.

title: PGA National - a Great Destination for Golf Groups
review: I recently visited PGA National...I was the primary organizer in a group of 19 golfers. This was a pleasure trip not a corporate outing...although the resort clearly caters to large corporate groups. This was not my first trip to PGA, having been there with my spouse and another couple approximately a dozen years ago. The resort has gone through a makeover and added a Spa.  Here are my general comments of praise:  - It is a wonderful venue for a large group as there are 5 courses on site and you do not need to leave the resort to travel to other course locations.  - The courses are beautiful, fair, and challenging, with the Champion course (and it's noted Bear Trap) the standard-bear, hosting an annual PGA event. - The rooms are attractive, roomy and comfortable. - While I did…

title: Farewell to PGA National Resort & Spa
review: Had a Resort King Junior suite on 4th floor.  Suite had a spacious balcony, spa products in walk in shower.  All rooms were completely remodeled in the renovation.  Hot tub & pool area were desolate on a cooler night but privacy was appreciated on this pre-Valentines trip.   Enjoyed Couples massage in the Spa with Joseph & Abe.  Thanks to Cecilia Tate & her amazing staff at the Spa.

title: AVOID PGA National
review: Serious golfers, AVOID THIS PLACE.  The Champions Course, walking, is a wonderful experience, no denying that. But everything else is designed to extract the MAXIMUM amount of money with the MINIMAL regard to service or the total golf experience. Went for a week with a group of golfers, intending to play 36 per day, as we have done for years elsewhere.  First, unless you are the first grouping off the tee on the other courses, you are playing a 5+ hour round.  Then there is no time available to play the afternoon 18. We didn't play 36 one day!  And the people there didn't care.  Second, they are pushing groups off every 8 minutes, which is just too quick and, sadly, there are enough suckers like us out there that they don't HAVE to care. And that is a shame as it could have been…

title: Beautiful resort
review: I visited this resort for work and it was wonderful. Staff was very friendly, rooms were beautiful and food was good. I'd love to go back for a true vacation and bring the family. We didn't get to use the pool or the golf course but it looked amazing.

title: A great place for golf and conferences
review: Just finished running a conference at PGA National. The golf is great, the hotel is in nice shape and the spa is fantastic. It is a great place for golf and conferences - not so good for families. We played the Squire and Palmer courses both were in excellent shape, tough and fun. Staff is very attentive.

title: Down to Earth
review: I'm staying here as part of a conference, and have no idea of the cost of staying here. But it feels like it's an expensive hotel, and yet I haven't had a sense of it being 'stuck up' once. And it's surrounded by golf courses, and that always spells 'stiff'.   Everyone who works here has been down to earth and relaxed. There's wifi everywhere, stuff works, and it's got everything I needed.   If I was a golfer I think I'd feel like I was in heaven :-)

title: Average Resort
review: In all fairness we are not golfers and if you don't golf there is absolutely no reason to stay here.  We came for a conference and to meet friends from Wisconsin with their 2 small children.  Pros: the facility was clean, room was decent, your typical room, nothing fancy, bedding was comfortable.  We had no problem with our TV as other stated.  Staff was friendly.  Pool area is nice.  Cons: this is not a particularly kid friendly place, which is fine, I realize it's a golf resort.  I think the rooms are pricey for such an average resort and we had a conference rate no less.  I despise resort fees when I am not a consumer of the supposedly covered things.  The steakhouse was good but overpriced. They charge fine steakhouse prices and our steak was good BUT, when our steak arrived…

title: First class experience
review: An amazing hotel with all of the amenities.   Spectacular golf courses, great restaurants,  awesome spa and white glove service from everyone we encountered during our stay.  Playing the "Bear Trap" was a thrill and now off the bucket list. We can't wait to return!

title: Why this Beach lover and NON golfer didn't miss the beach..
review: My wife and I ALWAYS  go to the beachfront properties. Except when we go to Palm BEach area for vacation.  Our last visit was for staying for my birthday (December 30th), as well as the the New Year's Gala  at the Resort.  First time at the Gala...and the food was excellent, and the band was phenomenal!! Most importantly, Nadia and i loved the dancing and meeting new friends and making connections with other CEOS and Executives we met there.  Bsck to the title of this review....  Why we didn't miss the beach? Because we relaxed so much just sitting at the beautiful pool facilities at the PGA NAtional Resort, plus the ultra relaxing separate Private Spa pool, adjacent to the Spa Facility there.... that we didn't miss it!.  Sure, the last time we vacationed at the PGA resort, it…

title: Excellent golf resort
review: Renovated rooms are super nice and spacious. Lovely outdoor pool area and great dining. Great pro-shop and great golf courses. Top service and a resort full of amenities... definitely one of the best golf resorts in Florida! It definitely has its price but I recommended it.

title: Six Dollars for Water, Really?
review: One of the pet peeves we have about high end resort hotels is when they nickel and dime you to death after charging you a fortune.  PGA National has committed this sin in spades.  In addition to the room charge, there is also a "resort fee".  But on top of that, they don't provide you any free bottled water, like MOST even mid-level hotels do these days. Instead, they have a large bottle in your room with a little card notifying you it will cost $6 to quench your thirst.  This at a golf resort of all places, where you just might need some water after several hours on the links. We will say that the food here was quite good, with a lot of variety.  Just as an example, the lobster sliders on the bar menu in the lobby I-bar were stuffed with good lobster meat.  Service in some of…

title: Championship Course is FANTASTIC!
review: Went here a few years back and played the Championship course for the second and third times and it was absolutely fantastic!!! Loved every aspect and moment that was spent on this course. It is by far one of my favorite golf courses I've ever played. It is pristine, scenic, and just utterly amazing! My favorite course in the Miami area!

title: More Staff needed to Meet this Resort's Potential
review: I understand that a resort can be busy during the holidays.  However, better planning and more staff could have paid off in terms of customer service, and maybe even more revenue for this beautiful hotel.  This resort is pretty, from the Pool to all the common areas.  Food at the restaurants were a bit pricey but what you would expect at a resort.  Music in the lounge on the weekends.  However, the service levels especially at the pool was lacking.  I believe it is due to understaffing or at least the way staffing is allocated in the outdoor area.  For a couple of days at the pool, here is what we found:  1)  Hard to get towels in the morning.  One day we had to wait until 9:30 AM to get towels, even after pestering the manager.  He said he was waiting for housekeeping. 2) Staff…

title: A shabby facility
review: We just spent a weekend at PGA with our children and grandchildren. Having been there before, we were excited about returning as we have fond memories, of previous visits. The staff was helpful providing 4 rooms in close proximity.   Our displeasure began immediately as we ended up at the end of a long corridor on the first floor. The views were of a walkway and fence around the spa pool, or the parking lot, not the golf course. These rooms are dark with inadequate interior lighting and a large overhang from the balcony above the small patio prevents light from reaching the patio, and of course the room. In addition, we found the exterior door to the parking lot and spa was unlocked day and night, even though it said Key Access only. The hotel is located in a community that is…

title: A BIG LUXURY GOLF FACTORY
review: The place has great service, nice grounds, amazing golf so I am told and if you are a golfer it is heaven. If you are there and not a golfer it is a huge soulless place with nice rooms, an older demographic (welcome to Florida), pastels, good food and friendly service. The place is an upscale convention center for golf.

title: Terrible Internet
review: My hotel room was in need of some maintenance. I understand from other attendees at our conference that their rooms also needed some work. Nothing major but a venue of this caliber I expect better. The room is general clean but the bed throws at the end of the bed had crusty dirt on them. I pointed this out with a note to the maid and all she did was fold them and place them on a chair where we had a piece of luggage.......really! I guess the next guests can wonder what the mystery crust flakes are. Internet is slow and we got knocked off all the time in the bedroom and conference rooms. The pool and spa is nice. All together a nice place but management needs to have a periodic inspection cycle of each room and cleaning staff should be instructed to look out for things that…

title: Bottled water $6, diabolical TV system, over the hill facilities
review: The staff are great, and so is the food. But, the place needs renovation and a new attitude with regard to customers. Bottled water in the rooms is $6. How can any resort hotel think this is anything other than a huge irritation to clients? There is a Publix supermarket not far away -- where bottled water is $3.80 for a huge shrink wrapped bundle. I found this out when I complained about the in-room price. Turns out the staff view the bottled water price as a huge embarrassment and all seem to recommend the Publix or grab a bottle of water from the bellmen who have a bucket of bottles on ice out front -- and give it to you, with the bellmen happy to have this happen.  Then there is the TV system. It take seven clicks and very careful reading of the screens, to get to channels…

title: Very underwhelming !!!
review: The pics make this place look great but I think the pics are from 2000. It's dated and is in need of major updating. The service was poor and the managers tried their best to make up for it. If you are going to golf and get a great rate then this is your place. For anything else I suggest try somewhere else. The golf courses were great.

title: Incredible Golf Resort ! ARLO the best Caddy !!!
review: If you love Golf, This is your place !!  Played today on the Champion Course and If anyone wants a very Knowledgeable , Respectable  Caddy with an  awesome Personality  then ask for the caddy named ARLO. He is an outstanding caddy that I have ever encountered throughout my travels throughout the USA . Great Golf resort , 5 awesome courses and PGA Blvd with a variety of great restaurants .  Don't forget to visit City Place only 15 minutes away . Please remember that the caddys are working for 4 hours while we are blessed to play !!   So please pay them a good per hour rate that they are so deserving of .... Especially ARLO

title: Great golf but slow pace of play, great steaks and happy hour, some very poorly trained and dumb staff
review: Spent four days at the PGA this recent MLK weekend. Played the Champ each day. Golf was excellent despite the non-stop construction as the stands for next month's Honda Classic are being assembled. Even managed to birdie and par the Par 3 17th as other members of our group hit into the stands (a free carry out). The pace of play for most rounds was ridiculously slow (as in 5 1/2 hours or more), which meant that a 1:30pm tee off could not be physically finished prior to sunset. At this time of the year, we recommend a tee time for a complete round beginning no later than 11:30am. And watch for tournaments that can clog things up even more. We had booked six months in advance and still ended up having to scramble at the last minute to get a decent tee time.  Happy hour at the main…

title: This resort is absolutely ready for 1995
review: This resort is absolutely ready for 1995. Unfortunately, it is 2015. The internet access here is pitiful. Yes, I realize that the primary reason that people come here is for the golf, given five golf courses. However, if their only focus for service is golf, then close the rest of the resort. I will give the pool four stars: clean, well attended, good for the families who are visiting. The remainder of the resort needs updating and managerial attention. The wifi: even golfers have to connect, when they are not on the golf course, to work, home, etc., and golfers bring non-golfing family members who may be counting on working online while here. The wifi in the room varies from non-existent to barely acceptable. There is no wifi by the pool. On rare occasions, inexplicably, the…

title: Review of Spa
review: I have frequented this spa many times and I feel at this point,  it is in need of a thorough renovation.  The furniture in the waiting room is worn, ragged, torn and stained.  The robes provided have threads hanging, belt loops missing and are thin from being washed so many times. The sauna was nice but the steam room was very dated, stained and cracked tiles, etc.  This is no way a first class spa.  The salt pools are nice, my massage was excellent and service by the pool was good.  However if you intend on getting a first class luxury spa experience, this is not the place.

title: The concierge was amazing!
review: I am writing this review especially because the concierge, Antonella Mancino, at PGA was so amazing.  I arrived at PGA with my golf bag in tact.  It's a dual purpose bag, one that carries clubs on a day to day basis and also serves as a travel bag.  After a fair amount of use at the resort's 5 courses, the zipper broke.  Nobody at the golf shop could fix it - understandably.  On the off chance that the concierge might know something about where I might get it repaired, I stopped by and introduced myself and asked Antonella if she knew a shoemaker or someone who might fix the bag. Rather than view this as a job our of her realm, she enthusiastically said there must be someone who can do it.  She tried calling about 4 or 5 shoemakers, but all said they couldn't do it in the short…

title: A relaxing Retreat
review: PGA National Resort has always been a favorite of mine.  The spa is wonderful and offer 3 different outside pools, wonderful spa treatments and great lunches poolside.  The hotel is wonderfully located near good restaurants and shopping, not to mention the restaurants inside the hotel which are great!  It is  located in the beautiful PGA development and is surrounded by a wonderful community of homes.   If you love golf, it offers one of the best golf courses in the area.  You will not be disappointed by your stay at PGA National Hotel and Spa Resort.

title: Nice resort but a bit lacking in standards and issues with transportation information.
review: Stayed for 3 days while my husband had a work event.  Room was lovely and we had a beautiful pool view.  I've been lucky enough to stay at some amazing resorts so I may be a bit more critical, two days the maids were unable to leave a bath mat (probably ran out which is a mgmt. issue) and left a hand towel instead, the lovely satin spread at bottom of bed looked as if it had a oil stain and many of the areas looked like a really good scrubbing was needed--not filthy -is was just in corners and crevices.  We used the concierge and she was terrific and twice we needed to arrange a car service to have a larger group leave the resort and the service was wonderful.  My largest complaint was front desk info regarding taxis-- My husband arrived first and when I was to fly into West…

title: AGAIN,AGAIN AND AGAIN
review: i song once said if you like why change it  well this year we chose the PGA as the venue for the28th consectutive family vacation at christmas and as always we were not dissappointed  with everything always mad busy at this time of the year the shear size of the resort turns it in to a haven of normality Once again the best strength of this Hotel is it personel From housekeeping to the front desk and from the valet to the pool it is alway the same amazing friendly nothing is too much trouble lovely service  we justed booked 29th year for this Xmas

title: Conflicted about this hotel
review: Stayed as part of a large conference party in early January.   Firstly I have to say that my experience of the hotel was reasonably good. On my first morning I found my hairdryer didn't work but it was replaced quickly by reception. The replacement hairdryer broke again a day later, leading me to believe it was a faulty power outlet. I didn't try using it again with the second replacement so I don't know if they tested or repaired as they offered to do. On the down side, the bedroom was dark, the tile floor in the bedroom is very cold underfoot, the air con in the conference rooms is freezing, despite adjustment and the bar is extremely expensive (nearly $40 for three drinks, and one was a bottle of beer!)  Two similar incidents within our party really marred the whole…

title: Very Fine
review: First visit........holiday week.............full week with golf-package for two............great summer-like weather of course enhanced experience. We thoroughly enjoyed spacious room and found hotel service to be friendly and helpful overall, even during busy time.   We kept sliding door open to enjoy fresh air considering gorgeous weather........however there was no screen door. Luckily we found almost complete lack of mosquitoes and other intruders, but they should provide screens.   Bathroom had sliding door which is ok, but could be problem for some.   Setting is quite attractive. Parking is easy.   Large bar is front and center in large main lobby..........with numerous large chairs and sofas all around. Dinner is served at bar if you like..........service is good, but can…

title: Need to work on their service
review: We have stayed in this resort for the past 3 years over the Christmas holiday.  Each year, we have issues with the service.  The hotel itself is very pretty, the rooms are a nice size and the common areas are pretty.  The pool area is pretty, but can get very crowded, although this year seemed less crowded than in years past.  The towels at the pool need to be replaced and the workers in the pool area need better training in the service area, they can get pretty rude.  We ate at both the Wave and Bar 91 near the golf area.  The Wave food is consistently awful.  They added a buffet this year to try and help with the poor service, but it looked very unappetizing.  The food at Bar91 was much better, although still could be much better.  The kids activities were completely…

title: ok
review: impressive property (golf, tennis, swimming).  however, found the service to be lacking.   checked in and went to my room and found door open and room a mess.  went back to front desk and was assured it would be taken care of immediately - should take no more than 20 minutes or so.   90 minutes later i got into my room.   lack of communication was unbelievable.   really colored my view  of my visit.   might try again but hope the service is a bit better.

title: I love this place
review: I've been coming here for 3 years and each year I walk away happy. This place has everything. It offers activities geared towards men, women, and children. Great food. Great lobby and atmosphere. The pool is large. During December, they have live music. The rooms are large and spacious. They provide complimentary passes to a very nice health club, which includes fitness classes. There is walking/jogging trails. Plus, everything you could ever need, want is 5 minutes away. I have a feeling this is the start of an annual Christmas tradition.,

title: Nice but could have better service
review: My main complaint with this hotel was upon check-in. I got in a bit early, around 10:30am, and there were no rooms available. No problem - they asked for my cell phone number and would call me when a room was ready. About an hour and half goes by and still no call. I finally went up to the desk and low and behold, there were rooms available. I later found it this happened to almost everyone else at a conference I was at. If you're going to take our phone numbers, then call!   Other than that, the hotel was perfectly comfortable. I did notice that there didn't appear to be any room service, which was a bit weird - or at least there was no menu in my room. Like most resorts, it's not in a particularly happening area either. Perfectly fine location for a business conference, though…

title: Global service local feel
review: As a reasonably well travelled d'hôtel user I found this hotel to be excellent . It's big yes but the service is great, the poolside is well landscaped and there's even live entertainment on a Saturday afternoon to sing along to. Plenty of space at mealtime, around the pool, in all the facilities ....free parking and good food selection A golfers delight of course but also tennis yoga and several other fitness activities. A good business centre, free papers and good cafe if you don't fancy a big brekky

title: Excellent
review: I was here attending a conference for 3 days. I enjoyed every minute of my stay here, from the moment I drove in, looking at the grounds, every meal to the room view to the pool, the warn and friendly staff they have, and my experience at the spa.  I just missed the golf lesson I wanted, but I did not have time. I needed another day!

title: Perfect!
review: My daughter got married in Palm Beach Gardens and insisted on having the wedding room block at the PGA National. At first, we disagreed because the room rates were significantly higher than other local hotel chains. BUT, after having spent the past weekend there, it was worth every penny and more. PGA is a resort with all the expected resort amenities . . . , gorgeous lush grounds and pool area, luxurious room accommodations, beautiful spa, awesome workout facility, tennis, championship golf courses. . . I could go on and on.  The service on all levels was exceptional.  We had a catered breakfast on Sunday morning and the room was beautiful, service perfect and food delicious.  PGA National Resort is the difference between having an overall experience and just sleeping overnight…

title: A spa diva at a golf resort??
review: My recent stay at the PGA property was mixed. There were some aspects of the resort that were excellent; there were other parts that left me wondering about whether I was at a 4-5 star resort. The positives--I always like to start with the positives: *the staff worked hard to make sure that your needs were accommodated. I'd say that 90% of the staff with whom I interacted went above and beyond in their service *the spa had some interesting treatments and the service providers were excellent in their ministrations. I had a hot stone massage that had the little details that I love--stones that you can hold in your hands as you are being massaged, tiny stones strategically placed between your toes. The staff at the spa pool was really attentive and the food was fresh and delicious.…

title: I really wanted to like this place...
review: I was here on business, not to play golf.  I suppose if I was a golfer I'd be more enamored?  PROS: There is an actual gym here, with kettlebells and squat racks.  This is HUGE in my world, where I'm usually stuck with a treadmill and perhaps a few hand weights if I'm lucky.  Unfortunately, the gym is only open until 8pm. The staff were very pleasant, the bed was comfortable and the room was clean, location was very convenient to where I was working.  CONS:  Nothing says "we don't care about you" like getting a different room than what you initially booked because they "almost sold out" afterwards.  They offered to move me the following night, but as I was only there for two, it didn't make any sense so I stayed put.  The first floor is convenient, but cave-like with only a view…

title: Overall stay was great!
review: A lovely place to relax, play golf and enjoy a good dinner at Ironwood Grille! Golf facilities were great.  Palmer course was fantastic with beautiful settings. Only one negative comment:  considering the overall cost of the stay, range balls should be included for guests.

title: Great golf resort
review: I was here recently with 3 other guys for 4 rounds of golf over 3 days.  From the valet to the front desk to the golf starters and wait staff, this property understands service.  The room was large with very modern furnishing and a great balcony overlooking the pool.  We played 4 different courses, all great.  The lobby bar had a DJ and the nightlife was good without leaving the property.  Highly recommend this resort for a golf get-away.

title: Great Golf - great People
review: 4 guys in our 40s arrived for a 4 day golf trip. Upon arrival we were advised we booked rooms incorrectly. The woman immediately made a bad situation great by upgrading us to meet our needs. All of the people we met at the resort were extremely helpful, pleasant and seemed to genuinely enjoy their job. Even though the courses get a lot of play they were in great shape. The food was excellent and the lobby bar is a great meeting and social atmosphere. The two negatives I have is the cottages need to be updated...the detour is still 1970s and didn't seem all that clean...pricey...pretty much everything is above average pricing. As long as you know that you should have a great time.

title: Now this is what I call a RESORT!   AAA***
review: Finally a truly AWESOME, remarkable place!  Great service.  Bellman that are on top of their game.  Room service that is spotless and imaginative.  Meals are top notch.  The rooms are large and very well appointed.  A large desk, mirror, iron, coffee, lg flat panel, balcony with chairs and table, grEAT VIEW, comfy beds with plenty of pillows.  Soft sheets, lots of fluffy towels, 2 bathrobes, reading materials, lighted makeup mirror, two sinks in separate rooms.  I loved everything!  Thanks for making this a terrific stay for Thanksgiving in Florida!

title: November golf at PGA National:  terrific!
review: Despite clouds, wind and occasional rain, our three days at PGA National in late November were terrific!  Champ was in very good condition; Palmer and Squire more than acceptable.  Good at this resort is outstanding and the entire service/support team knows how to take care of customers.  Highly recommend.

title: World class golfertainment!
review: The attention to every detail and customer experience was fantastic. Having the opportunity to play 5 courses , each with their own unique signature , makes this must stay property for business and family. Highly recommend!!

title: very spread out
review: We were attending a dinner there and the ball room was quite a walk from the main entrance.  We did not expect to take such a long hike to get to the area where our festivities were being held.  The food was ok - short ribs which could have been a little less well done.  The salad was a good size and very tasty.  At the end of the banquet, the dining room staff noticed that I was having a difficult time walking and I was trying to sighted guide by blind husband as well.  We were offered a wheelchair.  It took a little while and when Christopher from security noticed that it hadn't arrived yet, he personally went to get the chair and personally brought us from the ball room to the main entrance.  Christopher demonstrated the customer service that a world class resort would offer…

title: Good facilities,  rooms average
review: Nice pool and facilities. Hotel rooms need updating, mainly bathrooms and beds. Furniture was fine.  Room had balcony with table and chairs, but large spider webs all over on chairs, table, slats of balcony, etc. Double room are twin beds, very, very small. A/C turned off every day, so unable to keep room at desired temp as had to turn back on, not sure if maids do that or if it's automatic. Meeting rooms nice and food good. Stayed for business, obviously this place is great for golfers and they do have many lodging options from hotel rooms to condos, houses, etc.

title: Really nice!
review: We were here for a 3 day golf tournament.  Room was excellent...clean and comfortable.  We attended group meals, with about 300 other participants in the tournament or their spouses.  The food was great, the service was great.  Of course, resort pricing prevails, and buying a coke at one of their little coffee shops for over $4.00 was, IMHO way to much.....other than that, we had a great time!

title: Customer Service?
review: Impressive. That's one word to describe this place when you drive up and walk into to this beautiful resort. What is disappointing is the complete lack of customer service. For the price you pay I would expect a lot more.   On day one I went to the pro shop to check in for my tee time. They did not have it in the computer. After showing them my confirmation- they made the reservation for the wrong week, we were rushed to the course for immediate tee off. We were given a sleeve of golf balls for our troubles. How was the golf? As you can see from many of the reviews, the GPS units are junk, resetting multiple times per hole. The course was booked- over 150 golfers, yet the cart girl had been stocked with just 8 sandwiches.   Day two, I asked to speak with a manager and was told…

title: A "must stay" if attending on-site Pelz or Leadbetter schools
review: What a beautiful place! My room was a deluxe king overlooking the driving range and a practice putting green. It was clean and the furnishings were lovely. I was there for 3 nights for golf school, but would love to return for a vacation! Because classes started early, I requested room service to deliver breakfast between 6:30 and 7 am. Breakfast (The Golfer's Express - bacon, egg and american cheese croissant, fried potatoes and coffee)  was hot and delicious. Lunch at Bar 91 was equally wonderful. I shopped in the golf proshop...great merchandise and service. The hospitality of the all staff was superb, especially the guys out front...and especially Chris George!

title: Fun spot for wedding/reunion
review: We stayed at PGA for a wedding.  Such a great facility for that type event - so many places to mingle, visit with family, and enjoy being with people.    The lobby is inviting, looks out over the beautiful pool and includes a bar to the side.  Very modern yet comfortable.  We stayed on the ground floor, on the golf course side.  Room was fine - looked great, beds extremely soft (cozy, but not best for back).  Patio small but adequate.  Bathroom was tight but again updated and fine.  Awesome fitness center.  More like a real gym as they cater to the people who live on site all year or for winter.  Only real complaint was that the billing was sloppy.  We had about $150 in erroneous fees and charges on our bill at the end.  I was thankful to have checked over the bill.  They did…

title: Nice & Friendly
review: Spent almost a week at this resort which is geared to golfers and I am not one. They have great tennis courts for those non golfers.   The hotel is large and the rooms are big enough, bigger than the average. The grounds are beautiful as is the pool, they have too of them. The main restaurant which is open for dinner only is very good. I'd come back again!

title: Golf Heaven
review: The PGA National is golf heaven as it has great courses right out the back door that has every level of play available.  The rooms are well done recently and have nice appoinments.  The service was great and friendly.  The food was really good and the lobby bar is enormous and pleasent to visit. The pool is the center piece of the resort next to the golf.  A tremendous spa with pools of salt from various parts of the world make for a relaxing day.  The tennis / fitness center is expansive with every type of training you could ever want with a great staff. Really nice place to get away and play golf and relax.

title: Could be outstanding - with work
review: I came to PGA national to immerse myself in the golf for a week.  On the whole my stay was excellent and just what I was looking for, some great, testing golf in good conditions, a nice room and at times lively bar area, with good service and good food. I also made good use of the pool area and spa facilities. My interactions with staff from concierge to golf marshals to bar staff were all positive, bar 1.  Things that held the experience back and where I feel they could improve to match the price tag are: 1. Pace of play at golf, my round on the Palmer course took over 5 hours despite supposed intervention from the Marshals. I think sending out 4 ball after 4 ball, in carts only 8 minutes apart is recipe for disaster and doesn't feel necessary with 5 courses to play. 2. There…

title: Great Resort that Offers A lot On-Site
review: PGA National is an upscale resort well-suited for business travelers, families, friends and couples alike due to the on-site offerings. They have golf, tennis, croquet, spa, pool and restaurants. The hotel portion underwent a major reno a few years ago so the lobby is updated and modern. iBar is a popular spot for golfers coming off the course and the Happy Hour/nightlife crowd. Ironwood is a nice dining experience. The spa is large and offers a variety of spa and salon services (though honestly it could use a face lift in terms of the furniture and whatnot). The golf is phenomenal with multiple courses including the coveted Champion Course. The pool is resort-style and beautiful with lots of seating. PGA is located just minutes from the Gardens Mall, Downtown at the Gardens,…

title: This place is lovely
review: My husband and I are not golfers.  We were here for a conference.  The hotel grounds are beautiful, the hospitality was lovely, and the food was good.  The best part was the workout facility.  It's a full blown well-stocked facility complete with a full class schedule with amazing instructors. It contained every kind of equipment, weights, tennis courts, pools, spin studio - even a Pilates studio available for private sessions.  And...it was free to hotel guests (except the private Pilates sessions).

title: Leaving with mixed feelings
review: My wife and I just concluded a three day stay at PGA National and while on the whole it was a pleasurable experience there were a couple of glaring problems that diminished our enjoyment considerably and caused me to rate the overall experience as average. Here is why, with the good, the bad and the ugly.  The Good  1. The $100 million dollar refurbishment has made this into a very cutting edge type of place. The large open lobby with the square iBar on one side and the reception desk on the other is very well designed and a pleasure to look at and be in. 2. The rooms are equally well designed. After having a stay at Innisbrook last year almost ruined by a really crappy room, I opted to upgrade to a suite and it was worth every penny. The room had a great view of the fountains…

title: Not only for golfers
review: Stayed 5 nights in a mini King suite.. Large spacious room; flat screen a bit small for size of the room. Very comfortable. The resort is golf centric however it has an excellent health club and gym. It has a fantastic stand alone spa with mineral pools, cabanas, etc.. making spa day very private and special. Treatments are expensive but making a day of it is worthwhile. Good choice of restaurants on premises and within 10 mile radius.

title: As good as it gets for golfers
review: Stopped as part of the golf chanel event.even though I had to pull out with injury had a superb time at this exceptional resort. Fantastic golf..great facilities. .draft top notch..A true 5 star experience in the florida sun.

title: Very enjoyable and comfort!!
review: We were in resort for a golf tournament and the my whole family came. Enough room for two kids( one a teenager) ha ha. And our dog. Resort is spacious and great walking around. Food was excellent and atmosphere was great and lively. Stay again!!

title: Upgraded PGA!
review: This was my 3rd stay at the pga and the rooms were recently refurbished. The rooms are large and very contemporary. My one complaint is the lack of electrical outlets near the desk. One is not enough for people these days for gadgets. Other than that it was a pleasurable stay.

title: The place is a beehive but worth the visit.
review: We had a group of 30 professionals who meet annually somewhere warm with golf.  This place met the needs.  Golf is pricey, but multiple courses to choose from, starting at the same pro shop, and they have it down to a "tee" (pun intended) with many staff members directing the traffic and keeping pace going.  Golf is the main attraction from its heyday in the 1980s, but they are keeping it maintained well.  The pool was very nice, and I heard that the fitness center was very well appointed.  Very nice clay tennis courts as well.  The rooms in the main resort have been renovated and are large, each with a balcony.  However, age has mad the sliding glass doors barely able to slide.  The clock radio was so old that the LCD display had worn out and was not visible.  The maid did not…

title: Unclean, terrible service...
review: Staying here for 5 nights, at check in i was moved 3 times for filthy rooms, smears on dressers, dusty, bugs on linens and stains on sheets and decor.  Upgraded to suite with VIP cleaning and i know for sure that they do not know what that means... If you want 5 star this is definitely not it, spoke to several people who feel the same.  My husband said the golf is amazing, but other than that forget it!!  Front desk not helpful, even if you speak to management.  Only gem is Antonella in concierge!!  My advice stay down the street at a Hilton.

title: food, Rooms, Service & Price
review: Thank you for your posting and talking to me Mrs. Daniels and please accept my sincere apologies again for the incovenience.  I have spoke to my team and am confident the situation has been resolved.  Thank you for being our guest and I hope we could bring you and your husband back in the future.

title: Romantic getaway weekend - not a chance
review: On arriving at the hotel this is a golfers paradise! The entrance is excellent and since we last visited there is a better feel about the hotel. The rooms are very good. Golfing here is excellent the courses are stunning. The pool area is lovely to relax by and all in all the price is reasonable and the service is very good. A tip is to ask for breakfast to be included if you want the main restaurant, which is quiet possibly due to the price. The Palm Terrace staff are excellent and nothing is too much effort. Upstairs the small cafe is also good for breakfast and very reasonable, they serve croissants too.

title: Great stay @ the PGA!
review: The room rate was great and it was big, quiet, clean and modern! My husband & I live in the area and booked a night for a "staycation" and really enjoyed the hotel & amenities. The spa is excellent and the gym is also quite nice.  The Palm Terrace has a great breakfast and courteous staff, however, we would advise not to waste your money at the Ironwood Grill. It is a bit pricey and the food didn't taste fresh; not worth the money.  Overall, we would definitely return and recommend this hotel & spa.

title: Love this resort!!!
review: We just returned from 6 nights at this beautiful resort and simply cannot say enough great things about our experience here! The pool area, outdoor bar and lake are as beautiful as any we have experienced! Upon forwarding pics to friends...everyone thought we were in the Caribbean. The pool and grounds are maintained beautifully and on top of that the entire staff is wonderfully friendly! Our room was always made up promptly upon  leaving to go out to breakfast, etc. So, if we wanted to stop back, housekeeping was already gone amd the room was in tiptip condition. We received a huge bowl of "treats" on the day( candy, snacks, bottled water, chips, etc)...which was a very nice touch! (not sure if everyone gets this or it was because we were repeat guests). Rooms have been updated…

title: Great Spa
review: My wife and I spent the day at the PGA Spa for our anniversary this year. We checked in a little early and ate lunch pool side. The pool area is beautiful with a number of different pools, hot tubs and pools filled with mineral waters from around the world. The locker rooms are nice with steam room, sauna, whirlpool and showers, but they're a little small and if it's busy it can be cramped. My service was fantastic. I got a deep tissue and it was great and very relaxing. My wife liked her treatment as well. The therapists and locker room attendants friendly and helpful. However the pool side wait staff were very slow and the front desk staff were indifferent and barely even looked at us let alone smile. Those are just some minor complaints. The facility is wonderful and we had a…

title: Great Spot
review: Excellent facility and staff.  Good food.  Clean modern rooms.  Beautiful pool are with very comfortable chairs.  Nice lobby bar will good bar menu and well prepared drinks.  Get a room with a balcony if you can.   We will be back.

title: Horrible Experience at PGA Resort
review: My husband and I booked a weekend last year for our 1 year wedding annivesary and it was great.  We went this year exactly 1 year from the date of our initial visit and it was horrible.  I must say the Spa personnel were great, as well as the Pro Shop at the golf course.  There must have been a change in the Food & Beverage Dept, as a considerable decline was expierenced.  First, my credit card has been overcharged by over $200.00, still trying to get them to fix this issue!!  Secondly, we complained so much that we ended up with $250.00 in credits (on each room) we had another couple that was experiencing PGA for the first time!   Long Story short-we are all local patrons and we will NEVER come back.  We even had a free night's stay and told them they could keep it, we were…

title: A bit disappointing for the price
review: I had a bad feeling walking up to the front desk when I saw a woman on the phone telling whomever was on the other end that, "No sir, your company waived the resort fee so you don't get free WiFi.' Upon arriving at my room, I noticed it was a comfortable size and appeared clean. There was strange smell in the closet so I kept that door closed. Probably one of the biggest, yet easily repairable, problems I noticed with my room was the balcony sliding door. The track wheels were obviously worn out, which made sliding the door very difficult, and loud. At night it was easy to hear that my door was not the only one needing new wheel. Hotel staff seemed confused as to how many towels and washcloths went in the room as my number changed each day. A word of caution if you like bringing…

title: Golf Paradise
review: Thank you for posting on our property and for being our guest.  Please accept my apologies for any inconveniences you may have experienced.  I will bring your comments to our IT manager as well as other managers of the staff you mentioned to review with there team your concerns.  If you wish to discuss further, please dont hesitate to contact me directly at 561-227-2555.

title: Nice but dated
review: My recent experience at PGA National was fantastic.  We had a staff meeting there.  Employees were great to work with specifically Antonella the concierge.  We had a bad experience with Enterprise Car Rental but Antonella provided the customer service that Enterprise was lacking.  Antonella also recommended great restaurant choices for us.  Barolo was fantastic as was Anthonys Pizza.  Back to PGA National.  We played the Champions course twice and it was a great experience.  I have great memories of the course and will enjoy watching the Honda Classic on TV even more.  The room was very nice.  Facilities were great especially the pool area.  I have nothing but good things to say and I have played golf at all the top golf resorts in the US.  I would love to go back.

title: Marvelous!!!
review: Thank you for sharing your experience and for your pleasant response.  We hope you enjoyed your golf experience on the newly renovated fairways on our Championship Course.  Please come back and see us again.

title: Overrated
review: I went to PGA National because I was given a spa day with a free night. The rooms were nice , but even though I was told they had put several million dollars into this resort, it must have been on the golf course. I ordered a late lunch at the i bar it was grilled fish and after taking one bite I had a hair in my food,which was in my mouth. YUK! the bartender suggested that it might be my own. Really!!! Wasn't even my color./texture. So needless to say that was not a Good experience . Will not be eating there again. Our room seemed a little musty as well. Did not go to the pool as it was raining.  Don't think I will stay at this resort again. It just wasn't all that. My spa day consisted of massage, facial, mani, and pedi. Well I have gel nails so I could not use that portion of…

title: Nice but too pricey
review: The property is very nice but furnishings in the room were dated.  The staff was friendly and courteous.  Restaurant was not open during the day for lunch, had to settle for bar food which is over priced.  Looking for a golf resort this is a good place if you have lots of cash to spend.   Here for a 5 day conference and enjoyed the visit but would not be our first choice if returning to the area.

title: Par for the Course
review: Thank you for your review and comments.

title: Dirty Sheets
review: I have stayed at a few Florida golf and spa resorts.  PGA National is really no better or worse than any of the others.  The hotel is older, but the rooms have been updated nicely.  Two sinks in the room is nice and the bed was really comfortable.  The grounds were expansive and in great shape.  In my opinion this is better suited for a couples getaway, although the pool is large and there is a game room, there are not a ton of activities for children unless they play golf.    The iBar is a madhouse...we ordered room service one night and the food was really good.  Just be ready for the usual resort fees, prices and add-ons.  Very similar to other resorts so no real issue there.  They also have a breakfast buffet each morning with a ton of options as well as an omelet bar.  The…

title: Nothing but problems
review: Thank you for your comments and your business.  The resort does offer many amenities for traveling guests, but many guests do come for the amazing golf experience.  Your comments will be shared with our team members.  Thank you once again for your comments and your business.

title: Nice but over rated
review: We stayed at this hotel for its convenience to the Cruzan Amphitheater. We wanted a hotel that had the amenities of a nice pool and comfortable rooms. What we didn't expect was dirty bloody sheets on our beds when we returned from our concert at midnight. We called front desk to ask for housekeeping to replace the sheets and were told that there is no one on staff to do that at that time. After 45 minutes and 3 calls later, we were brought replacement sheets and told that we had to replace them ourselves. However, one of the replacement sheets were way worse than the original ones that were on the bed. The first sheets had what appeared to be dried up blood stains. The new replacement sheets had dried up smeared blood stains. I was very disapointed with the night staff handled…

title: AMAZING WEDDING WEEK!
review: My husband and I recently got married at PGA National Resort. We had over 70 guests attending from out of town so we thought this would be the perfect place for everyone. And it definitely was! The staff was absolutely amazing! Every staff member at the hotel was great from the valets and bellmen, to the front desk staff, bartenders & servers and the conference services team was spectacular! Everyone who attended the wedding said it was one of the best they every went to and PGA Resort was the perfect place to stay. We cannot say enough about this resort and the wonderful staff. We highly recommend staying at PGA for a weekend getaway and definitely booking space for your next event!

title: Great staff!
review: Just spent a few days here attending some meetings. The staff is EXCELLENT! Very friendly and always helpful, and my room was spotless. At the Concierge desk, Antonella goes out of her way to make sure the guests have no worries. She even sewed a button on a jacket for me, which I appreciated very much. I will visit this hotel again when I'm in the area.

title: One stop fun and relaxation
review: My husband and I spent 4 days at the resort mainly for fun and tennis.  The resort does have it all.  Although I don't play golf, there was everything one would want for golf.  Tennis pros, Debbie and Ian were outstanding instructors.  When we were not  playing tennis, we relaxed by the beautiful pool.  The food at the restaurants was great and the staff was extremely attentive throughout the resort.  Everyone was extremely professional.  The rooms are quite spacious and arranged nicely.  I would recommend asking for a room that faces the lake or golf course.  I can't wait to return next year.

title: Spa with a twist.
review: Great way to spend the day.  Choose a massage and enjoy the various international pools and poolside lunch.  There is an out-door salt water pool--the water is imported from the Dead Sea.  Then, there is an outdoor mineral pool--mineral water imported from France.  Also, there is a circular outdoor fresh water, and jacuzzi pool.  Indoors, steam bath, sauna and jacuzzi.  So, with a service, all of the pools can be enjoyed throughout the day.

title: Great place for a visit
review: Attended a conference here recently and was very impressed.  All staff were friendly and courteous. My room was spacious and nicely appointed with a large wall mounted flat screen TV.  Food served in the conference rooms was excellent. I would definitely stay here again if in the area.

title: Bday Weekend
review: Just had a very nice overnight stay at PGA Resort in the cottage for my birthday. Got a bunch of friends together and we had a good time by the fabulous pool. A bit rainy here and there but nothing we couldn't handle. The food was pretty good at the Wave bar but only disadvantage was having to eat in that area and not by the pool.   Antonella M. was such a doll! She was the resort concierge and we kept in touch by email and phone. She helped accommodate all my needs to make my birthday a success. She handled everything with such professionalism and ease. She made my stay so much nicer because I didn't have to worry about a thing! I walked into my cottage with fruit and cheese platter, balloons, a card, and sparkling wine. Such a nice surprise! I will definitely be returning back…

title: They got it all!
review: They got it all.  It is full resort.  The pool is amazing.  We also enjoyed relaxing massages at the spa, then time at the Pools of the World.  All the staff were attentive and friendly.  Leo was especially nice, we saw him all over the resort.  Dinner at Ironwood was outstanding. Our server Diana had great recommendations and excellent service.  We enjoyed everything from the pools, bars, restaurants and golf.  Highly recommend!

title: Spa day with Mom
review: I looked hard and long for a day trip to take with my 88 year old mother. I purchased a spa day with a Groupon for the two of us. We had luxurious massages. Sipped cucumber infused water and hot tea. Had a light but filling lunch poolside. A refreshing frozen drink. We dipped in each of the mineral pools. Had delightful conversations with other guests. It was wonderful, relaxing, calming, and something really special as a treat not just for her but for me as well. Maybe next time, I will add a stay at the hotel.

title: Amazing weekend getaway!
review: Booked this resort for my boyfriend who loves golf. He played with his buddies while I relaxed at the spa and pool. We had a lovely dinner at the ironwood restaurant and lounged all weekend. It was great! We are definitely going back!

title: Vacation
review: My husband and myself had a great time at PGA Resort. It was so nice and peaceful. I so look forward to going back there in the future. Everyone was so nice.  From the time we stepped out of our car. From the guys parking the cars to the check in. We really enjoyed our stay.

title: A beautiful place
review: We traveled to and stayed at the PGA Resort in October 2013 for a wedding. The property is absolutely beautiful and easily located near shopping, the gym, and restaurants.   Our room was beautiful as well. We had a walk out to a little patio with two chairs surrounded by beautiful greenery. The bed was super comfortable although we only stayed two nights. The pool was nice and a fun place to hang out during the day. We ate at the clubhouse where many golfers did. It was decent.  We didn't eat breakfast there. We ended up exploring the area a bit and found some local spots. We did have some services done at the spa. I had a pedicure and my makeup done for the wedding. I was happy with the nails, but wasn't crazy about my makeup. The spa though, is absolutely beautiful! The…

title: Great Tennis
review: Our interactions with the tennis pros, Ian & Debbie, were the highlight of our very enjoyable stay.  They remembered us by name from our trip previous visit last year.  Although we are just beginners we were made to feel special.

title: Golf, Tennis, Spa oh my!
review: If you're into all or one of the above you'll love this property. It's not a mammoth resort like the ones in Cancun and I like that about it. Rooms are spacious and had a mini fridge. Beds were comfortable. The food at the outlets we're ok; I can't say I had a "great" meal; but you won't starve. The staff was really good. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. If you're going to hang at the pool I recommend getting chairs on the side where the hotel is; near the shallow "beach" end. You get maximum sun and you don't have to turn your chair. Plus it's close to the bathroom.

title: Great Resort Atmosphere with Friendly Staff
review: My fiance' and I stayed here over Labor Day weekend.  This was her first time there and my 4th or 5th.  I was a bit nervous as I kept telling her how great it is but you're always afraid maybe something may not be as good as before.  I worried for no reason.  The friendly staff are as professional as any I've come across.  It has the complete resort feel.  The pool, iBar, and poolside bar, are great, welcoming, and relaxing.  This is a great place for stayvacation or any other reason to be in Palm Beach Gardens.  If you're a golfer then it's even better.  We will return.

title: Good But Not Great
review: I booked this 3 night golf Getaway for my wife and I because of the tremendous deal that they were offering. We played 3 of the 5 golf courses at the resort with breakfast included every morning. We also ate dinner at the resort one evening. All in all for the price it was a good value and an enjoyable trip. We upgrade our room to a junior suite and were happy with most aspects of this room. The bathroom with 2 vanities was very nice. The rest of the room was not up to the ratings this resort has. While clean and comfortable, issues such as cabinet doors that would not close, to the small refrigerator that was missing a leg cheapened the experience. The bed was ok but the pillows were the hardest and most uncomfortable  I have experienced in a "quality" hotel. The breakfast…

title: Outstanding Experience - we will be back!
review: Recently, I had to go to Palm Beach on business. My hubby, retired, decided to come along. As an avid golfer he really wanted to play one of the PGA National courses (while I worked of course!).  We tried to book a room there instead of the hotel where my meeting was, but they were sold out according to their website.   So we booked the other hotel - who was kind enough though to get a tee time for my hubby at PGA.  The first day we got there, we decided to go check out the Resort.  We are native Floridians but had never been there.  We were blown away!  Gorgeous, first class, every staff member you talked to was professional, warm and friendly.  You felt like a celebrity just walking in the place!  The IBar was hopping and so much fun, the pool area stunning..I wanted to stay…

title: PGA National Resort - this is the place
review: If you like florida - if you like golf - if you like tennis - if you like excecise and amenities - if you like luxury at somewhat reasonable prices then the PGA National Resort and Spa is the place to go

title: Beautiful resort ... BUT ...
review: This was our first time staying at this resort.  We stayed for two nights.  The resort and the grounds are beautiful.  The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. Our first night was great, the woman who assisted us with our check-in was very friendly.  The i-Bar bartenders are fabulous!  HOWEVER ...   Upon preparing for bed on our 2nd night, I noticed something all over the bathroom floor (looked like coffee grounds) ... ANTS.  ALL OVER.  It was midnight, my husband goes down to the front desk to notify them and is told that they will have us moved to another room ... supposedly, an upgrade (there was NO noticable difference in the rooms).  My husband obtains his own luggage cart ... there is NO offer to assist us with moving our belongings to the other room.  The only offer…

title: Lovely resort
review: I was at the resort for a conference.Large comfy rooms hotel, Excellent food though pricey, Lovely pool. The conference accommodations were great. Friendly staff. Upscale area. Great for golfers. There is a spa on site and a large conference center. Selection of pillow types made me happy.

title: Beautiful hotel. Terrible service at the outdoor restaurant
review: We got a very good rate and stayed for one night on our way to Hilton Head. I was blown away by the beauty if the resort and my 10 yr old lived the pool. My only complaint is that we waited about 25 minutes before a waiter noticed us at the outdoor restaurant - and then it took about 35 more minutes to be served :(

title: Disappointing golf experience
review: This is a golf resort,  right? It's recreation, right?  Then they need to do it better.  First, the starter was a hot mess. We hit I not the fairway on one but he let the group behind hit right into us. Then a ranger races us to us with a lot of attitude to complain  about us being off the cart path but there were no signs and the ranger had not said anything. I really wanted to smack him his attitude was so bad.  Then the bathrooms were locked with a combination, which no one had given enough us. Ends up that we had a five hour round-- ridiculous.  This is supposed to be the PGA? shame on you.

title: Perfect R & R Spa
review: I had the wonderful pleasure of having a very relaxing 2 night stay here including some spa time. The rooms are huge and have everything you could possibly imagine. You have multiple view choices and I had the golf course side with nice balcony. So quiet, peaceful, and comfortable.   Then there is the spa. So amazing that even half a day here makes you feel as if you had a tropical vacation. Waters of the world pools are magical. Your skin, body, and soul all benefit from a soak. The cabanas are all around the spa pool and are free to use. I felt like a queen lounging in one. The umbrella covering can be retracted to allow as much or as little sun as you want.   Had an amazing deep tissue massage with Vicki who made me feel wonderful. The signature scent lotions and soaps are…

title: Spa is my favorite in the world, hotel good, but sneaky fees detract.
review: I love the PGA spa!.  I've hunted out spas literally all over the world, and PGA remains my favorite.  Great theripists, love the Waters of the World Pools, the staff is great. I know golfers love it.  That said, I wound up paying about $75 dollars more than I expectedat the Spa, because I called to make my reservations and did not clearly understand exactly what I was getting.  I asked for an email confirmation, which when it arrived had no prices on it.  The website has no prices on it.  Tricky. The hotel was also very nice.  Nice pool, nice bar, good breakfast(pricy!).  But again I didn't check on line and was unpleasantly surprised by the $25 daily resort charge, and the $20 valet over night parking fee.  The non-valet parking is available, but not very convenient.  Great…

title: Great staff, old hotel
review: Let me start by saying the staff was wonderful. Check in was smooth and they even offered me an upgraded view since the hotel was fairly empty. I had forgotten a few toiletries and they were quick to offer me shaving cream, a razor, and a toothbrush, at no charge. The downside is the mandatory $25 resort fee daily. This is a hefty charge which, if you are only using the room to sleep in at night after a long day on the town, then its just not worth it. I am sure if I had time to enjoy the amenities it may have been. I did take advantage of my free two cocktails included once during your stay at the lobby bar.   The hotel itself is old. It reminded me of the 1980's. Something about it, just gave me that old 1980's feel. My room was very nice, and the bed very comfortable, but I…

title: Great value -- wonderful rooms.. nice staff.. great location
review: We visited the PGA National resort several years ago.... they've done so much work recently it was hardly recognizable inside.  Well done!  We travelled as a family of 4 -- and had a JR suite connected to a regular room with 2 queen beds. The space overall was amazing.. and the rates were really low for such a hotel.  The rooms were clean and neat... the hotel was quiet.. and it was very restful.  My husband and son played on one of the courses and it was easy to get a tee time. They have 4 courses onsite to choose from. My daughter and I worked out in the fitness club.. it was a pretty standard facility. They also have a large number of tennis courts if tennis your thing.  In the hotel lobby is a coffee bar (like a Starbucks only not Starbucks) as well as a bar and at least one…

title: Amazing Place!
review: We have been to the PGA Resort for several occasions already and absolutely love it.  It is just gorgeous and all the people that are so nice, they make you feel at home.  It's a great place for families and couples, whether you're going for business or pleasure.  Highly recommend going there.  The SPA is also amazing!!!!

title: Sweet Treat Weekend 2014
review: Beautiful resort with a peaceful golf setting! We were visiting for the Sweet Treats family event weekend and had a great time. The rooms are clean, property is well kept, great pools and wonderful spa experience with adults only mineral pools. (Chocolate Affair Massage with Joseph) Even during this busy event weekend, everything ran smoothly and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Check-in/out was fast and efficient. I'm sure we will be back for future events.

title: A Day at the Spa
review: Nothing like a trip to a spa for rejuvenation. This spa is spotless. The front desk staff is courteous and the treating staff professional. They have beautiful lounge for you to relax in before your service, wonderful shower facilities and an outdoor area with several pools. The only thing that would add to the spa experience is music.

title: Exceptional wedding destination, not just a golf resort!
review: We recently were married at PGA National Resort and Spa in Palm Beach Gardens, FL.  The resort is close to the turnpike and I-95, with easy access to hundreds of amenities close by.  Everything we could have possibly wanted was provided for us.  All of the staff who helped with our wedding were excellent!  They were extremely attentive and ensured our needs were not just met but exceeded.  I have been to many weddings in the past and have heard the horror stories of how on the day of the wedding there were so much that the bride and groom had to worry about, they did not have time to enjoy their day.  Well I can say first hand that the people at PGA National ensured we did not have to worry about a thing!  From the rehearsal dinner at the Palm Terrace, cocktail hour after the…

title: Great Stay!
review: We had a great stay! The property is beautiful and loved that we had a private balcony. The pool activities were fun -  DJ, limbo etc. The staff was friendly and helpful. Shout out to the Concierge Desk, they were GREAT!

title: Great Weekend Getaway
review: We had a wonderful stay! My son and husband played golf and I had lessons at the David Leadbetter Golf Academy. The golf courses were in great condition and the golf academy was amazing!  I walked around to enjoy the amenities on the property. The pool looked fun and the spa was very busy.  The food & drinks were also great. The room was beautiful and clean. The staff was amazing; very warm and friendly.  We plan on coming back in the future!!

title: Wonderful Romatic Retreat
review: This is the first review I have ever done for any facility I stayed at.  I have stayed at many resorts and this far exceeded any expectation.  The hotel was beautiful, like I would expect from this type of resort but the sizes of the rooms and the private balcony was such a nice extra bonus to this resort.  I can't say enough kind words about the staff.. everyone was so friendly and helpful, I was more than IMPRESSED.  Roosevelt at the waters of the world was so helpful, kind and friendly. Our waitress at the Palm Terrace was excellent remember our names and drink order every morning.  There was an issue with our room.  But it was corrected in a fast and effective manner but going above and beyond to rectify the situation and make the stay enjoyable.    The golf was great (even…

title: "Awesome  Anniversary Experience"
review: We were celebrating our 22nd Anniversary and this resort was the perfect place! The staff went out their way to make us feel special. Tara at the front desk was so accomodating with making sure she placed us in the perfect suite.  Antonella at concierge desk sent strawberries and champagne to our suite.  It was a pleasant surprise! We love this place and can't wait to book our next stay!

title: Great Getaway
review: First class resort for a golf getaway.  Service, Service.  Service.  Only criticism is the lack of a "medium" restaurant.  Either burgers or haute cuisine available.  It would be nice to have a bistro type restaurant on site.  Plenty of neighborhood restaurants available just down the road but when you pay for a resort part of the attraction is not having to get in your car for dinner.  Great golf!

title: I will be back.
review: Please take advantage of the concierge service. Willie was fantastic and Steve the Limo driver made our trip to dinner extra special. The pool was wonderful, clean and relaxing. Service throughout our stay was friendly and efficient even though the resort was very busy during the Optimist golf tournament with 200+ kids and their parents.

title: Great Experience
review: I had a great stay here! Although I don't play golf I did get the chance to ride a go cart around the course and it was pretty impressive. All the amenities on the property were also great and although pricey - the food and drinks were amazing. I'll definitely be coming back in the future.

title: Return every year
review: Thank you Jessica for your kind words and for being our guest.  Perhaps we need to get you started with golf lessons the next time you visit.  Thank you and we look forward to seeing you in the future.

title: Great Birthday Stay
review: We come back every year for our anniversary. While there has been an issue with our room for the past three stays, the staff is quick to correct it and ends up upgrading us for the inconvenience. Two were minor issues, TV not working once and leak in the bathroom once. The only thing that was really difficult was two years ago I requested an accessible room due to a broken ankle. Although we gave plenty of notice, we had to switch room three times before everything was ok. Despite the issues we have had, we plan on returning next year. The staff is extremely professional and always willing to make things right. This is a beautiful resort with so much to offer.

title: Great stay! Great Property! Great Staff!
review: I took my wife to the resort to celebrate her birthday and we had a great over-nite stay. It all started with Ana Esquivel at the front desk. She was terrific and made us feel very welcome, she even sent a very nice birthday gift to our room from her and the front desk staff. Ana recommended we upgrade to an available Media suite which we did and it was one of the nicest rooms I have stayed in. Very unique with the 2 55" flat screens,  Bose surround  sound and plush seating. The pool area was very clean with helpful attendants for food and drinks. We ate at the I Bar and had outstanding bacon cheeseburgers and service by Kelsey Schultz(make sure to ask for her). We had a wonderful stay and will return soon.

title: Beautiful place
review: Thank you Keith for your wonderful comments.  Ana is a fanatstic service manager and kelsey is a great service professional in F&B, and I am delighted they exceeded your expectations.  The Media suite is our newest creation of specialty suites, and I agree its pretty unique.  Thank you for being our guest and look forward to your return.

title: Great Service
review: My stay was fantastic thanks to all those employees serving me from:parking, desk check-in. restaurant ,bar, spa ,golf pro shop.& room service to cleaning. I wish I knew everyone's names' but I only got 2. Thanks so much to Antonella for the great welcome which encouraged my friend & I to finish our last week in Florida to move to the resort. And Sandi in the bar who was very helpful also. As I said all employees made our stay great. Definitely will return and tell others.   Donna & Collene

title: Outstanding!
review: Thank you for you impressive response and for being our guest.  Thank you for pointing out our team professionals as we try very hard to exceed the guests expectations. We hope to see you again soon.

title: Beautiful hotel
review: My husband and I visited last week, meeting our son for a golf weekend. The staff was very helpful. There was a misunderstanding about renting a golf villa with our dogs. The manager gave us a suite at the same cost with an adjoining room at the same cost. We are already planning our trip back!

title: Great Place but Hot Nights
review: Thank for for writing your review.  The individual cottage owners dont allow pets in there units, but the main resort at PGA National is pet friendly and welcomes all four legged friends.

title: World Class comfort and delightful Staff!
review: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. It is a beautiful property.  The rooms are nice, a little larger than average. Comfortable beds, beautiful pool. The Staff is very friendly and accommodating.

title: Great Conference Venue!
review: Attended a conference at the hotel and thoroughly enjoyed all the beautiful amenities.  The conference center was spacious, clean and the staff was always ready to help when needed.  Stayed in a Junior Suite by the spa pool, was nice and quiet at night.  Loved that there was a mini fridge - a small thing to some, but very important to me!  Overall would absolutely stay here again.

title: So many fees!
review: This was an average stay hotel with small rooms, much less nice than a Marriott for double the price. I was not heavily disappointed until check-out came, and I had roughly a hundred dollars of extra fees of which I was not aware. After questioning what they were and why they were there, all of them were taken off. A week later I look at my credit card statement and there is yet another fee for a service in which I did not participate. After calling numerous times and being placed on hold (the ordeal totaling a full day's time), I got the charge removed. This hotel runs its business dishonestly, would not recommend.

title: Wow!!
review: Wow! This resort is huge!  Many golfers and Tennis players stay here, but we just went to get away for a day.  Our room was room awsome!!  Nice furniture, the beds were comfortable and cozy and there was a patio to sit out doors if we chose to.  The shower has hot water!!  As hot as you want it...this may seem petty, but you don't get good "hot" water in many hotels.  The Lobby is big and beautiful and has a bar, coffe shop and retail shops and restaurants.  The main attraction which of course is the main pool was beautiful.  We decided to go for a swim in the evening, but unfortunately because of the heavy use by so many people during the day, the pool was cloudy.  Didn't get to try the spa, but I bet it is great (I love massages) :)  Be prepared to pay good money for drinks…

title: Really Enjoyed Our Stay
review: Good location, quiet, our room was near the lobby, with no noise Pleasant spa Gentle and well-done pedicure by Maria Would definitely stay again & highly recommend  Close (7 minute drive) to our favorite fabulous restaurant Olympia Cafe

title: PGA conference
review: I was the hotel chair for a conference with, for the most part, 1.500 20 something's.  The resort's was outstanding to work with and together we were able to resolve any issue quickly and with mutual satisfaction.

title: Visit with friends
review: While we have never been to PGA National before, the staff made us feel like we were among old friends. The facility was excellent, the service impeccable, and the atmosphere made us feel right at home. I would strongly recommend staying at this facility.

title: Great Meeting spot
review: This was my second time here. The rooms were very clean. Most staff were courteous. The last time I had more interaction with the staff but this time everyone just did their job. Nothing over the top and friendly but their job which was expected and accepted. Awesome gym facilities better than anywhere that I have stayed.  Overall great meeting and stay.

title: hat,s off to the beautiful concierge antonella
review: i had 3 different groups of family travelling at different times and all needed special attention for rooms. antonella ,was the complete professional ,she helped with all the details ,friendly, always smiling.explained all the activities available for adults and children. she made this trip worth every penny,and we will be back.by all means use the pool. and have a drink at the I bar

title: Take a break - Nice place
review: Stayed there with a friend for a conference. Nice lobby, good lobby bar - indoor and out door. Good choice of restaurants. Nice courteous staff. The arrangements for the evening cocktails was fantastic. Next time would take a break there.

title: Tom's PGA resort golf package experience
review: We just spent a couple of days at PGA, and had a great time. The resort is lovely, clean, and the staff most welcoming, friendly, and eager to please. From the moment we drove up we knew we were in good hands and never stopped smiling. Other than our golf skill level, the courses were terrific, the rangers attentive,and everything went off like clockwork.If you want to know about the area or restaurants outside the hotel  just ask Antonella the very special concierge. Breakfast at the resort was excellent as was lunch at Bar 91. We'll certainly do this again.

title: Nice resort with very good service
review: What can I say? all the resorts in Florida are terrific and this one is no exception. I paid a special rate of $200 and stayed for 4 nights on a business trip. The rooms are big but not fancy, all the rest was just plain good. Breakfast is excellent.

title: M & M
review: Our entire three day golf getaway at PGA Resort was a total success. The staff couldn't have been more friendly, helpful, or knowledgeable. The facilities were impeccable. We truly can't find a thing to complain about.

title: Paradise Found!
review: This hotel offers a tranquil environment, beautiful views and a perfect spa.  If you love golf, you will love this resort.
