It has 4 on site golf courses and one off site golf course with varying levels of expertise.  There are several restaurants on the property.  The staff is great, very friendly and eager to help.  Definitely a place to check out!  Love the fact that the rooms have ceiling fans too:)

title: Excellent service
review: What a wonderful trip, our family was there while my husband attended a conference at the resort. My kids and myself had such a great time, the pool, food, waitstaff, housekeeping, room and exceeded my expectations!!!

title: Great Trip
review: Great trip, greeted by Chris George in the valet, he was super nice and helpful, big smile and super nice. Checked into hotel, and the desk was very pleasant, the entire staff was great... but the big surprise was just how nice the kids support was outside by the pool, Miss Iris was AMAZING !  The kids loved her and she was absolutely perfect...  It is so great that PGA offers something very nice for the kids... Miss Iris was very sweet and wonderful with our children.  Helps to have a great team of people who care , Chris George the Valet was super nice, and made us feel right at home, to the sweet lady by the pool Miss Iris, we trusted with our children made this trip extra special !!   Overall a great trip, only one day of rain but great golf good fun...

title: Second time, and it was Great!
review: I was there June 11 for 3 nights. I got a terrific Florida rate. It was very hot...but, not their fault. The staff was nice. I was by the elevator and heard it but, not so bad. Nice food in every restaurant!  Nice check in and check out.

title: Wedding
review: Our daughters wedding reception was at the hotel.  Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful.  We had a sit down dinner with 120 guests and all the food arrived at the same time and was so delicious.   There was staff everywhere and the chef was fantastic. Ty had everything planned down to the smallest detail.  I would recommend you ask for him.   The rooms were fantastic and could not have ask for a better experience.     We can't wait to go back for some R&R.

title: PGA is in the heart of beautiful Palm Beach County
review: I am not a golfer but came to the hotel on business.  The layout is spacious and you feel like you are on a cruise ship.  It is really lovely to see the luscious grounds, the greenery everywhere.  The streets are lined with lovely manicured homes and lots of retirees abound.  The hotel is nice,with large rooms and views of palm trees and swimming pools.  The sunrise is lovely and worth getting up to see.

title: Do visit, but only if you're a golfer
review: Fantastic golfing facilities and, to be fair, a bargain hotel rate even for off season. Champions course was under construction, so we played Fazio. Generally, golfing facilities were really good - pro shop, carts, GPS, course itself, bag drop, range etc. Hotel spa pools were OK, not fantastic. Hotel itself is enormous, given its multiple golf courses. Breakfast was the low point - small buffet, very un-American. Basic room was OK, free wifi worked but not fast enough for VoIP, bar/restaurant in reception was good, generally feeling around the place was good.   Would I go back? Probably not, as so many other great courses in the area. But, with a golf-inclusive rate in the $1xx, it's very good value.

title: Friendliest staff
review: Spent a long weekend at PGA resort and was very happy I did.  The pool area is beautiful very colorful and the staff are the friendliest people. The rooms are nice and clean and the beds are super comfortable.  I highly recommend PGA National.

title: Great Resort
review: Other than the Champions and Jones courses being under construction (which is understandable), the rest of our stay was excellent.  The food and drinks, while very tasty, are a bit pricey, but that's also understandable when you stay a high end resort.  Tara (at the reception desk) was extremely polite, courteous, and helpful.  We definitely plan to go back after the courses have completed their reconstruction.

title: Good Golf But Hit and Miss on the Rest
review: The golf courses were nice enough, the course marshals were reasonable and the cottage was comfortable.  The men's locker room is tired at best, and they do not always have toilet paper in the stalls in the morning.  Service in the bar was acceptable, but at breakfast was below par on some days.  Having read the reviews, we did not try the restaurants for dinner. Nothing was truly outstanding.

title: Fantastic Getaway
review: Planned as a romantic long weekend, both my fiance and I decided on PGA National. We dedicated one day for couples massage and use of the spa facilities. Our expectations were exceeded!! Both deep tissue massage (Joseph) and deep cleansing facial (Rachel) absolutely changed my body and mind.  The Spa facilities are immaculate and beautiful. Yvonne is truly one of the best servers, at the Waters of the World Cafe, as she somehow made a rainy afternoon eating indoors so special and memorable. Ironwood, the PGA Steakhouse, was unbelievably delicious. Karen, our server, had gone over and beyond to have us enjoy our celebratory dinner. Joliene at the Palm Terrace was genuinely happy when we were happy enjoying our breakfast there every morning. Antonella at Concierge was outstanding…

title: Excellent Staff
review: The staff of this hotel is exceptional! Each member not only was exceedingly helpful, but also visibly happy to do so. Tara is a great example of the many members of the staff who cheerfully helped with even the smallest needs.

title: Beautiful! Fun for the family!
review: Thank you very much for your kind post.  And thank you for mentioning our amazing staff.  Like Tara, we all try and exceed our guest expectations by using a personal service approach as we try to offer assistance to every guests needs.   Thank you very much for being our guest.

title: Expected More
review: The lobby and rooms in this resort were really nice. All staff was very pleasant. Had lunch at the Ibar and it was really good and service was attentive and pleasant.  The Spa was a great let down for me though.  Had to pay 25 dollars just to use it for an hour. That was ok, I got over that. The outdoor pools were great and I enjoyed them. Very relaxing and clean.  The spa itself had no aromatherapy smell at all. Half of the reason I love to "spa".  The spa products were horrible, felt like I was using Suave . The smell was like cheap hotel products. I expected so much more.  They didn't even provide conditioner for your hair.  I was sad they did not have an aromatic steam room at a spa rated the # 3 in the Southeast. I did use the showers and enjoyed the spa quality showers.…

title: Tennis and spa vacation at PGA
review: Thank you very much for your post and your comments.  We appreciate your thoughts and your business, and we take your concerns very seriously.   Some of the items, like patio chairs, are on our summer Capital punch list and will be addressed.  I will work hard with our Spa team to review your post to make corrective measures to improve those areas.  I thank you again for your post and hope to see you again in the future.  Please contact me directly for assistance.  Have a great summer...

title: PGA experience
review: We return to the PGA Resort and Spa every year and every year we say it is the best stay we have ever had. Friendly, safe, comfortable, great recreation, wonderful spa and waters of the world. We played tennis every day, swam everyday, shopped at the pro shops (both tennis and golf). We worked in the room, excellent high speed wi-fi.

title: Destination Wedding at PGA National Resort
review: Thank you very much for your post Mrs. V.  Its always a pleasure having you as our guest.  And such a short drive from the other side of the coast.  Thank you for being our guest and we look forward to hosting you again in the future.  Be well...

title: Long in the tooth
review: Great resort for family or groups.  Many functions being held over this past weekend.  Great for golfor to use spa. Had a great dinner at steak house on site (forgot name/ Iron?>?)  Pool was fun with many chairs to support guests.  Beautiful grounds for wlaks, runs ar bikes.

title: Who says you need to golf to appreciate PGA National?!?!?
review: Best girls weekend ever! Myself and five of my girlfriends had the greatest time. Starting with a fabulous lunch at the Ibar upon arrival on Friday, while the bellman was carting our luggage etc to the rooms, our bartender Michael hands down makes the best Bloody on the planet and the food was great too!  After lunch we headed to our connecting pool side rooms (which were so clean and spacious!) to find all of our items carefully placed and ready for us to just change and head to the pool :-) ,,, Not that the weather can even be planned or guaranteed but high 70's low 80's and not an ounce of humidity, I thank PGA for ordering that up for us as well.  Saturday was pool side breakfast and Spa treatments for all, I admit to being a massage snob and my tech Joseph was one of the…

title: PGA NATIONAL RESORT SPA
review: Thank you for your very positive post.  It is a wonderful time when you can just grab some of your friends and stay for a long weekend.  I agree with your comments about Mike at the IBar and his bloody mary's as we receive many similar comments.  Thank you for being our guest and hope to see you and your girlfriends in the future.

title: Excellent NEW installations
review: We attended a conference in May, 2014, and had a great time.  We had requested a Jr. Suite, and was not satisfied with the view.  The front desk worked with us until we were completely satisfied with our room.  My husband had the best day of golf ever in his life (right), and the bar inside the hotel was great (thanks again Maria).  We met the most interesting people and will definitely return with friends!!  Highly recommend!!

title: PGA National Resort and Spa
review: Thank you very much for your post and kind comments.  Tell your husband he will have to return to see if he can beat his best round :)  Thank you once again and hope to see you soon.

title: Not a golfer
review: I went two times to this hotel in 2010 and 2013. The new installations are excellent. We spent only one night and we played Golf in the Champions Course.  The breakfast was delicious, room clean and big. Big pool and bar pool. Yummy burgers at the bar. If you like to play golf and relax is a very good option in West Palm Beach (1.30hr from Miami)

title: Better like golf because that is what is here.
review: Got here really late one night with luggage lost from airline and staff was super nice and front desk guys really great and got us toiletries. Food from room service was ok.One of the staff named Ziggy was so nice and put our luggage in our room for us when it came during the day while we were out. Lobby bar area was really a happening place all day and all night long.

title: 4th year
review: Thank you for your kind post.  Im sorry the airlines mispleaced your luggage, but Im glad our team assisted you until it was returned to you.  And we hope to see you back in the future.  Have a great summer.

title: Helpful Tips for PGA National Palm Beach Gardens
review: My family and I, along with our Passover group of 900-1100 people, have been coming to the PGA National for 4 years now. The updated rooms are nice, however the water pressure/volume  in the room sinks are a disgrace. They installed water saving aerators in sinks and the shower. Big disappointment. I removed them only to discover the drains are slow. Maybe maintenance needs to snake the drains. The accommodations are nice but the beds need replacement in guest rooms as they are aged. LED TVs are nice size. Balcony comes with table and 2 chairs. In room safe maybe confusing to most since if it's not fully closed it will not lock. Lobby is very large and allows for hundreds of guests to congregate at or near the ibar. Pool area and bar is equally nice. The meeting rooms are…

title: Disappointing
review: Thank tyou very much for your kind and thoughtful posts.  We are very proud to host the Kosherica group every year and many more in the future.  Have a fabulous rest of 2014 and see you next year!!

title: Relax in style
review: If golfing, tennis, or the spa is your thing in Palm Beach Gardens then this is the place for  you. Here are some helpful tips.  1) LOCATION - really conveniently located just off I95 and/or main toll road - I mean just minutes from the highway 2) Parking - FREE for hotel guests 3) SPA - there is a really nice spa on site (I think it's called Medicus?). In any case, they offer a variety of treatments, have nice lockerrooms with sauna/jacuzzi and steam. There is also a unique outdoor pool area which has 3 different pools filled with different 'waters of the world' including dead sea salt, waters from france, and some mineral waters. There is also a cafe at the spa pool area where you can get food/drinks with good service >>5 stars for KELLY in the spa - she was very professional…

title: Great staff and service!
review: My son, friend, and I recently stayed in a Media Suite at this resort.  The room was spacious and nicely appointed, although a pull out chair or couch would be ideal.  It would be a great room to entertain guests but having some additional sleeping space would be nice.  The resort itself is very nice.  The grounds are well maintained and the staff are exceptional.  Willie (I believe), from bell services, went out of his way to make our stay comfortable.  He made sure we had the right room and our requests were met.  The front desk manager made sure that everything was taken care of and even called the golf manager on our behalf to make arrangements for golf lessons for my son.  The service was top notch from the childcare director to the front desk manager.  Anything we asked…

title: Relaxing stay, Beautiful resort
review: Thank you very much for your kind words in your post.  We are delighted our staff made a difference in your experience and we hope to see you again in the future.  Have a Championship Day!!

title: Good But Could Be Great
review: The PGA National Resort and Spa is first class resort.  The grounds were beautiful, the staff was attentive, dining was great...I have only good things to say.  We were there on business; however, managed to sneak in quite a bit of pleasure as well.  The pool was gorgeous and well maintained.  However, on the weekend there were lots of children, so if you're looking for a romantic weekend getaway this might not be the place.  The beds were extremely comfortable and the rooms, although not huge, were well appointed. The buffet breakfast downstairs was very good and the staff was wonderful.  We also enjoyed massages at the spa and I cannot say enough about how lovely the spa and private spa pools were.  It was very quiet and tranquil...I nice escape from the more crowded main…

title: Golf vacation
review: Thank you very much for your kind post.  And we are delighted you and your significant other were able to experience some of our amazing amenities while on a business trip.  The Spa is an amazing experience, and Im glad you were able to enjoy.  Thank yuo very much for the post and we look forward to having you back again in the future.  Have a great summer!

title: Does Not Get Better!
review: I just returned from a 4 day golf vacation with 3 of my friends. My opinion of the resort is a little mixed. I think the resort could use a little updating. When we first started coming here a few years ago, it seemed very high quality and modern. It seems not much has changed since then and a little modernization of the rooms would be welcome. We played Fazio, Palmer, Squire and The Champion course (twice). The Champion course was disappointing considering we paid an $100 surcharge to play it. Many of the sand traps were light on sand The fairways were in rough shape as they are being replaced shortly so why cart path only. That seems unnecessary. Plus, there were no towels for golfers. They told us there had been a fire in the laundry room a couple of weeks ago. It's hard to…

title: Couples get away
review: PGA National was the best! We couldn't have had a better experience, or a better time.  The golf was outstanding. We played The Palmer, Fazio, Squire and of course, The Champ. What a thrill to play at the site of the Honda Classic! The staff was knowledgeable, and very helpful. The rooms were clean and spacious. The pool was awesome.  After round cocktails in the I Bar is not to be missed, and dinner at the Ironwood Grill was outstanding.

title: Amazing Experience for all
review: Thank you very much for your fabulous post.  We are so happy that you and your guests had a wonderful experience.  The golf experience is second to none so we are happy you were able to get out on 4 of our 5 Championship courses.  Thank you once again for your kind words, and have a Championship Day!!

title: Private dining room at PGA
review: I just returned from a trip to PGA National in Palm Beach Gardens.  I took this trip with my wife and a few of our couple friends.  The experience was unbelievable from beginning to end.  The staff at PGA National was amazing.  They took care of everything.  The hotel was so impressive from the rooms, to the pool, to the restaurants and, of course, the golf courses.  My friends and I spent much of our days playing golf, while our wives enjoyed the pool and the pool side bar.  The golf course were in incredible shape.  We played the Champion course a few time.  It was so cool to be able to play the same course that many of the world's best golfers have competed on.  We also played the Fazio, Palmer and Squire courses.  Each was challenging and in great condition.  The restaurants…

title: Worst hotel ever
review: Thank you for your kind post.  And were glad that you had a wonderful experience with the resort and you discovered the many amenities the PGA National offers.  Thank you for being our guest and we look forward to hosting you again next year.

title: wedding venue
review: The service was excellent and so was the food and wine. Kids menu could have been better. Great we had the room as we (and they) didn't have to worry about all the children (travelling with 3 families) getting excited/making noise. The hotel was pretty fab too.

title: Beautiful Resort
review: We stayed three days.  This is a busy convention hotel.  The grounds are sprawling and beautiful.   The location is thirty minutes from Palm Beach so this is likely a destination hotel with wonderful, golf, pool, racquet, croquet and fitness facilities.  We had a pool side junior suite which was very nice.  Our friends had a run of the house room that while smaller, was also very well done.   The bar was active and very good.   We didn't have dinner in the hotel but we did have breakfast in the Terrace Restaurant on two occasions.  I would rate the breakfast as the low point in the stay.   The buffet on Monday morning had an omelet station which was just ok as was the small limited buffet.  On Tuesday morning the omelet station was missing so it was canned fruit, oatmeal,…

title: GOLF @ PGA NATIONAL RESORT & SPA
review: Thank you for posting your comments about your experience, and for noting the service and friendliness of our staff.  Thank you also for your points about the breakfast restaurant, as we are currently reviewing with our team some positive ways to improve that experience for our guests.  We look forward to hosting you as our guest again.  Have a Championship Day!

title: Best staff in Florida and the golf out of this world
review: My wife and I enrolled in the Leadbetter Golf School and stayed at PGA National Resort. The food & beverage prices are a little on the high side bordering on outrageous BUT the friendliness and first class service more than made up for it. The golf courses are some of the best we've ever played on and the resort staff bend over backwards to make sure you have a great experience. The food IS great, however expensive, and the rooms are clean and all and all, it is a great place to stay and play golf. If you need golf instruction I recommend the David Leadbetter Golf Academy as the ratio of instructor to student is like 2 students per instructor. Our teacher, Bob Hite, is the best I've ever had and I've played golf for over 40 years. What he taught me in two days was worth every…

title: Long Weekend at PGA National Resort and Spa
review: Thank you for your kind response to your experience at PGA National.  The entire David Leadbetter team, including Bob, are really true golf instructor professionals so thank you for mentioning that personalized experience.  We truely appreciate your comments and hope to see you back soon.  Have a Championship Day!!

title: This review is of Ibar only
review: Stayed last week after the Honda Classic. I expected the staff to be worn out...not! I have never been treated better at any resort. I have stayed in Delray and Boca at resort hotels. This is the first in South Florida that treated me like I mattered. The others were doing you a favor. Golf, restaurants, pool and spa were all outstanding. I will be back.

title: Worth every penny!
review: We just got back from a 5 day stay at the PGA National. This is one of the best resorts I have ever stayed in. Everything was immaculately clean, the entire staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The food at the ironwood was incredible with lots of choices from steak, chicken, fish. seafood to my favorite a 2LB Lobster. The Spa is world class and pool area was spectacular! My kids never got bored with all the choices of things to do This is definitely a hot spot in FL for World Class Golf We will be going back for sure!

title: Very nice stay!
review: Thank you for your kind post and were happy you enjoyed your stay, and our fabulous warm weather.  I was excited to hear that your kids enjoyed the resort as we always continue to create special programming for kids to keep them having fun.

title: Love PGA Resort and Spa!
review: My husband and I stayed here two nights in March because he attended a conference here. The room was on the ground floor, clean, and quiet. We were invited to a buffet dinner as part of the conference and it was the best buffet ever! There was a great variety of foods from chicken to beef to fish. The salads were fresh, as was the shrimp cocktail. We did not use the pool but it did look beautiful and very inviting. I have two small complaints...the breakfast buffet served in  the Palm Terrace Restaurant is extremely over priced at $26.00 per person (18% gratuity added to bill automatically.) My other complaint is poor internet signal in the ground level room we had. Other than these small complaints our stay here was lovely and we would definite,y stay again. One does not have…

title: Great all around resort!
review: Thank you for your friendly post.  Our Chef and Banquet team really strive and work hard to provide an amazing food experience, thank you for mentioning.  I apologize for the poor internet connection and I will certainly pass on your comments to our techical support team to review...

title: Great all-around experience, making this an annual visit
review: Everyone was very friendly and helpful.  Everything was immaculately clean and the recent renovations are beautiful!  The pools are extremely clean and relaxing.  We would definitely stay there again! We hated to leave!

title: Great destination..................
review: Went here with 3 buddies for a golf get-a-away. It was awesome! The hotel was great and convenient to several airports. The facility is VERY impressive to drive up to. The rooms were incredibly clean, and the Ibar (in the middle of the lobby) was vibrant and really fun. We went to the steakhouse for dinner. The food was delicious and the service was excellent.    Although we were there for golf, I utilized the gym every day. It was full service and plenty of equipment. One of the best hotel/resort gyms around.   Now the golf. Needless to say, its unbelievable that there are 4 terrific golf course right at your finger tips. Walk out the lobby door, jump in a golf cart (with your clubs ready to go) and you are off. And the courses are great to boot. We played Fazio and The…

title: Great time with friends and family
review: Thank you for your kind post.  There always something special when you get away with a group of buddys to come play golf!  The courses are in amazing condition and we are ecstatic that you enjoyed the dinning and Fitness facilities and felt a real sense of energy and comfortable atmosphere in our Resort.  Thank you for being our guest...

title: Disappointed after 20 years of visiting this facility
review: We totally enjoyed the pool, fitness area, spa and the legendary golf courses.  We had so much fun biking, playing tennis and just hanging out with friends at the good restaurants.  The spa was so nice and relaxing

title: This is a very nice property with many activity options including golf
review: Thank you for your kind post Cheryl and we are happy that your enjoyed your experience at PGA National.

title: Great hotel, Fantastic Staff
review: We have been vacationing at this resort for 20 years. I must say that our most recent stay was very disappointing. We stayed the week before the Honda Classic. The hotel was packed with vendors and the hotel was busy getting ready for the event. Understandable, but please pay attention to loyal paying guests! During our stay there was absolutely no service or attention to detail...other than for the Honda Classic.  Once in our room we realized the hairdryer was not working properly. It was impossible to reach any of the hotel services by phone. Every line was busy for 1 hour. Finally I went down to the front desk. When I asked for a replacement hairdryer I was asked if my telephone in the room was working. I explained that all the service buttons attempted were busy. Eventually…

title: PGA Resort - Awesome Every Time
review: I stay at the PGA Resort several times a year and I am never disappointed. From the moment I drive on to the property, I am instantly relaxed. The hotel is beautiful, with a total refurbishing recently completed. The Golf is second to none and the Spa is one of the best in South Florida.  The iBar is a great place to unwind featuring generous pours with a very substantial "upscale" bar menu. The Ironwood Restaurant is a real treat and would hold its own with any of the areas more pricey stand alone steak houses.    I have never had a bad experience at the PGA Resort

title: Over 25 years and still love it
review: this is my 25th year of coming to this resort and i still love it Golf is great and i have not experienced anything but great service especailly with Valet,front desk(ask for Hector he is a treasure)and of course the Golf is unbelieveable play theChampion Course it is great I still love this place it is amazing i know it has had some bad reviews i have never experienced that and have booked again for this year

title: Still here and regretting it. Waste of money and time.Not what was expected and guests not a priority.
review: Laurence D., Thank you for taking the time out of your busy schedule to write a review. We are so pleased to hear that this is your 25th year of coming to PGA National Resort & Spa and that you enjoyed the Champion Golf Course and that the staff met your service expectations. We will be sure to pass your kind words along to Hector and the golf team that work so hard to make guests like your experiences memorable. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future.

title: Upsetting
review: If you are hoping for golf, forget it. There are much better places in Florida based on golf alone. The Palmer course costs 250$ per person and there is no twilight fee and you can't play after 3pm. Our bags were not ready or brought from storage our first round and we have been waiting for them to be delivered to our room since 3pm yesterday as we cancelled our 3rd round and will not play here again.  For 250$ You are given only a scorecard, no GPS or hole information, a plastic cup to get your own ice and you are lucky to see a cart girl once per round.  SLOW PLAY: the marshals allow 10-15 minutes between shots even after several complaints and witness of above and beyond poor etiquette. They just drive around and smile and do absolutely nothing.  The Marshal actually sat with…

title: Fore!!!
review: Don't stay here!!  Booked a buy 2 nights get 1 free directly through hotel reservations but when checking in they wouldn't honor it even though I showed them the online confirmation !! Food was only average with premium pricing. Seems to have very poor management.

title: Excellent Hospitality.
review: Room was beautiful. Ironwood Restaurant was delicious, a little steep in price. The pool was like an escape to paradise........The spa was great, my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our treatments and the salt pools were extremely relaxing. Even the mens locker room was above par.  Finally, the Fazio course was in excellent shape and a nice challenging course.

title: Absolutely awful
review: Hello!  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We work really hard to provide the best service to our guests, I'm glad to see those efforts shined on your last visit! We're also glad you enjoyed our spa and pool services! Thank you again for taking the time to write a review and we look forward to hosting you again!

title: Really 3.5 Stars, not 4 but better than average.
review: This was one of the worst - probably the worst - hotel experiences I have had. We stayed at the resort for a three day golf trip this weekend just gone, and everyone in our group was taken aback by how poor it was, particularly for a hotel that markets itself as "luxury" and is not particularly inexpensive. On check-in the room I booked was not available and I ended up in a twin (not king) room with a very limited garden/golf course view and 1980s/70s style terracotta flooring. Not an impressive renovation. The front desk staff seemed rushed and apathetic to the inconvenience of the room not being available. The lighting in the room was bizarre - halagon-type bulbs that gave no light on a low dimmer setting, but a very stark white light on a high setting. The water that ran from…

title: Look elsewhere
review: This is the PGA resort. So at the very least everything revolving around golf should be seamless..it wasn't. Our bags were misplaced twice, transportation from the airport and to and from the off site Estate Course was completely screwed up by the travel staff wasting much of our time, and the main hotel range closed at 5pm the day we arrived with the ball machine actually being unplugged while we were still hitting though we had paid for tickets in the pro shop. I must say however, that when we told a manager of our bag and transportation issues he immediately offered to take care of our return airport transport gratis and extended our rooms for a very late checkout the following day so we could comfortably play that morning. He was a gentleman to deal with and not at all…

title: Fabulous resort for a weekend get-a-way
review: I'm lying in my 'premium' room right now, reflecting back on my stay. I travel a lot and am fairly eyes wide open about where I will be staying, whether it's the 4 seasons or a basic hilton for a quick night of rest. When some friends suggested this place for our annual guys golf trip I checked out the website, read some reviews and thought it'll be a near luxury, close to 5 star level resort with all of the trimmings. It's not. It isn't even close. I was blown away to hear that $100mm of refurbishments had been invested, I cannot see much evidence of that and can't fathom what this place must have been like beforehand if this is the face lift. I suspect a decent percentage of that went into photoshopping their website photos. Ok, let me get down to brass tacks:-  The rooms are…

title: Terrible service and rooms
review: Unfortunately, my husband and I were anything but enthusiastic about this resort. Our golf view was really a view the old man in his tight whities sunning himself and a heavy guy hacking away while chain smoking across the way. The ugliness of the interiors with inadequate lighting and uncomfortable seating did not help matters. We stayed for 5 nights in a jr. suite and never got clean sheets, our sink was cracked, we had terrible water pressure, very little hot water, and poorly maintained paint and equipment. All this for about $400 per night. NEVER AGAIN! Oh and I called and left a message for a spa service and never heard back from them. I had to go down to make an appointment. Service was awful!

title: Amazing Golf and Pool Area
review: Went here for a business meeting, but got some days of pleasure in also.  Golfed the professional course on Monday, it was amazing.  They are getting ready for the Honda classic so the course was in great shape.  Top notch.  The hotel is nice, rooms are nice and big.  Restaurant did a great job of all our events.  Food was fantastic, service was nice. Spent a day at the pool, which is well outfitted and very large.    What else would you expect from Palm Beach, right... :)

title: The perfect place for our Super Bowl Weekend Getaway
review: I've stayed at PGA National a dozen or more times for work functions, and they've always been great, so it was a no-brainer to have the Annual Super Bowl Weekend Getaway here. The only thing that wasn't absolutely perfect was my golf game !

title: Redecorated rooms adds a much needed improvement
review: TankMan, Thank you for taking the time to write a valuable review for our hotel! We're so glad that you have chosen to stay here again due to past experiences! We're glad we've exceeded your expectations and look forward to hosting you again!

title: Mixed reviews..
review: As usual a first class resort. Five well maintained golf courses,excellent Spa services and gym, plenty of children's activities(pool, game room, sports lessons etc) are available .golf school and short game school offered also.Room service, housekeeping and valet very responsive.restaurant and Lobby bar are very good also.well worth the stay.

title: Only go if your a golfer
review: We were here for the Super Bowl weekend with frineds and stayed two nights. The Ironwood was great and the breakfast was good but lacked in service. Servers just kept walking past us until one stopped and apologized after we left and went upstairs and then returned as this ws the only breakfast in the hotel. Other than that the room sevice was terrific and clean and the Super Bowl party if you can call it that was below average. Most at the Super Bowl would have preferred to watch a golf match than the game but like the caption says only go here if you like golf. We did enjoy the workout room across the street.

title: Over the top service!
review: I played golf at the PGA National Resort and spa today and had a fantastic day with the quality of the course, the service and F&B. We played the Championship course and had a fore caddy (Marcus) that made the whole experience a ton of fun. The reason I had to write this review was that Josh Cole and the golf Operations team saved my connected world by finding my phone that I left in my cart 6 hours earlier. Long story short, I was in a cart but moved to join a friend. At the end of the day, we and all the courses were rained out and the clubhouse was a madhouse with everyone from everywhere coming in to escape the rain. I called the pro shop from the road (borrowed phone) and they tracked the missing phone down shortly afterwards. It would have been so easy for them to take my…

title: Service Makes Up for New Soon-To-Be-Dated Decor
review: Rhoking,  Thank you for the great review of our resort! We work really hard to provide you with the best service! I'm so glad you enjoyed your day on our famous Championship Course! I will make sure Marcus and Josh get the recognition they deserve! We're so glad our staff made your visit a memorable one and we look forward to hosting you again in the near future!

title: Nice but not excellent
review: Great and busy golf resort with a beautiful and relaxing pool area overlooking the lake and courses. Genuine and gracious service from housekeeping to restaurants  where the food was also good. (although the mandatory 18% gratuity for all parties regardless of size (we were 2) was irritating - that's fine for PGA National club members, but not hotel guests. I normally tip 20 to 25% for exceptional service, but with the "mandate" I did not do that).  The conference services and amenities were also very good.  What turned me off was the very-soon-to-be-dated interior design of the recent multi-million dollar renovation.  Sort of the current trend in Flintstones meet Jetsons decor of many mid tier chain hotels (dark carpeting, uncomfortable seating areas, generic abstract art and…

title: nothing superior for type of hotel
review: Just completed my second stay here.  The rooms have been updated in the past few years and are kept clean.  The hotel staff has been helpful on both visits and the food was A LOT better this year than last.  Last year the food was disappointing this year the food was good but not excellent.  Grounds were very well kept and clean.  Would come back again. Champion course was also in tournament shape.

title: Service needs to improve
review: First of all the golf is great. Courses were very busy and we played in under 4 hours every day. The greens on the Palmer were running 12.5-13. After the Champion that is the best course followed by the Fazio. Public spaces are great. The food at the resort is good and the I-Bar has a lot of buzz at night. The resort has one failing and it is service. The resort adds an automatic 18% to everything and I think it hurts service. Our group always tips large for good service and not once to we have the opportunity. The bars is staffed with enough people but they work slow and spend to much time talking to each other.  The Bar 91 broke some new ground. We ordered three drinks at the bar to take outside. The tall blonde bar tender was talking to the chef for 5 minutes before taking…

title: Quick Florida Getaway
review: Stayed at the PGA National Resort and Spa in January 2014.  I had an excellent and relaxing stay.  We had a very prompt check in and were given a nice double room on the ground floor with easy access and a view of the pool.  The rooms are nice and are stocked well. The best part of the trip was the Spa.  The spa is so relaxing and the treatments were wonderful.  The sugar scrub was one of the most relaxing treatments I have ever had. Also loved being able to wind down and relax after my massage. The food is good but expensive due to the 18% gratuity that is added to everything along with the tax.  Favorite meal was the thai salmon salad at the spa. Took advantage of the spin class one morning and it was great!

title: Well done
review: uraqc, Thank you for taking the time to write this valuable response for our resort! We're so glad you had a relaxing stay at the resort and spa! We work really hard to provide you with the best service and I'm glad those efforts shined! Thank you again for your review and we look forward to hosting you again in the near future!

title: Spatastic!
review: I attended a business conference here and was most impressed with staff and property. My room was large and comfortable.  I found the staff friendly and quite helpful. The food was quite good although most of my meals were in a banquet setting with other conference delegates.  It's too bad my schedule didn't permit me the opportunity of enjoying the extensive leisure activities available at the resort.

title: Great golf environment!
review: The regular rooms are nice , the Junior suites are very nice , the suites are super nice, but the Spa Suite was fantastic!  Decorated in soothing gray tones, this suite looked onto the greens. The bathroom was divided into a double vanity area with water closet, and the other half was a separate tub and enormous spa shower. The glass tiles added to the spa effect. I spent 2 days enjoying not only the spa at PGA, but the room as well!

title: The Hotel
review: Great rooms, with very comfortable beds. The service of the restaurants is good but the actual service of the hotel managers is awful. Pool area is mediocre, however, the overall golfing facilities is fantastic. Similarly, gardens mall is very local. Good hotel in general, just a shame about the managers.

title: Kind of a Golf Mecca
review: Very impressive for a European . When you exit motorway and enter into PGA Boulevard you realize this place has a certain importance . I found it obviuosly very nice . I staied only one night so did not have time to experience all the opportunities but there seem to be a lively organization for golfers and non golfers and mostly important to me also for kids . Very nice pool . Not being used to high end US pricing for green fees I was actually shockked in heating 300 usd for the green fee and  limited myself to practice on an excellent driving range .

title: Great hotel experience from the moment you walk in...
review: We have stayed at the PGA for several years and each experience is better than the last.  The hotel just underwent an amazing multi-million dollar renovation; the rooms are modern and welcoming.  The staff is absolutely first class.  Dan and Mark are great valets, Adam at the pool makes everyone feel at home, the housekeeper staff is great, turndown service is excellent and a really nice touch.  The staff have created many hotel events for children, for adults and for families.  We feel at home at this hotel.  We can't imagine staying anywhere else when we are in the Palm Beach area.  PS The golf and the spa are wonderful as well.

title: Amazing Wedding!
review: Paul, Thank you for writing this very valuable review for our resort! We're glad you enjoyed our renovation as well as our staff! I will make sure Dan, Mark and Adam will get the recognition they deserve! We're thrilled you've found a second home with us and look forward to hosting you and your guests in the near future!

title: Very nice resort & great golf
review: Catering manager, Anna Erickson, went above and beyond to make sure every detail of our wedding celebration was taken care of and I didn't have to worry about a thing! She and the staff at PGA National helped us to plan and carry out the ultimate wedding weekend experience with family and friends from all over the US! Whether it was sleeping, eating, drinking, or playing poolside at the resort, we were comfortable, had a blast, and were taken care of with the friendliest service everywhere we went! Celebrating our marriage in the British Ballroom was perfection. PGA knocked it out of the park! THANK YOU, PGA!

title: Stat here if you need to
review: Holiday stay because family in area. Is overpriced but does do extras for kids at holiday time. Golf is expensive and other golf resorts are superior. Rooms are large but housekeeping slow to clean them. Add on 25 dollar resort fees daily Area nice for restaurants not for beach Will stay again next Dec cause family here suites differ. Some with couch and fold out bed some not. Hznducsp bathroom big but only one sink. Jeep that in mind when and if requesting suite

title: US kids golf trip
review: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. We were there for a US kids golf competition. The courses are great, the staff are friendly and efficient and the room was lovely. We had a gorgeous view from the balcony. The housekeeping was excellent. The room was spotless. The food was good and they have a happy hour for drinks most days where the beer is $2. Really hope we can afford to come back next year. Would highly recommend.

title: Great staff
review: Kevin, Thank you for taking the time to write this valuable review for our resort! We're so glad you enjoyed our world class services from the staff to our food services! We work really hard to provide you with the best service so I'm glad these efforts shined through! Thank you again for reviewing us and we look forward to hosting you again in the near future!

title: Comfortable conference stay, worked well, didn't feel exceptional
review: I was at the resort this past week for a Sales meeting and found the resort to be clean, very user friendly but the most amazing part was the staff. Front desk, Bellman, valet, banquet servers to the management team were top notch and professional. Anything you asked was in arms reach. The bellman were the friendliest and most efficient. Not surprisingly I dealt with two and they were both from Jamaica.  Good job PGA.

title: Just perfect!
review: I stayed at the PGA for a conference. I'm not a golfer, so was not overawed by the location.  The staff were efficient and helpful. The room was comfortable, but not exceptional. I was concerned to find that in the bathroom, though on the face of it clean, there was a dried contact lens on the floor and some very small pieces of trash.  I left them to see what would happen, and the next day the bathroom was perfectly clean.  The conference food was good. Not exceptional, but nothing to complain about.  Overall I can't really fault the hotel, but had a niggleing suspicion that it could be better.

title: Not impressed.
review: I had high hopes but it wasn't impressed. I went to check in 3 hours prior to the stated check in time (my choice, I know). The reminded me that checking time was 4pm and said that they would call my cell phone. We went for a drink by the pool then went back to the lobby to read. While we were in the lobby, I watched party after party checking in. I went back to the desk at 315 pm and asked if my room was ready and the front desk agent said yes it's been ready for awhile (where's was my call????). After I checked in, I requested a bellman to bring our bags to our room(checked the bags with them when I found out we couldn't check-in early. They were promptly brought to our room. I have to admit, the rooms are pretty and modern. I liked the robes in the rooms and having a extra…

title: Will definitely be staying here again..fabulous!
review: Rooms were clean & big. Hotel was fabulous. All staff was friendly & helpful. Spa was very relaxing and wonderful. There is a lot to see and do. Many restaurants on premises. Beautiful grounds. You can't go wrong staying here..worth a trip.

title: Awesome Experience!
review: I have stayed at PGA National 4 times this past year. I can't say enough about the 5 star treatment I receive every time. I have played in the Italian Open twice and Bear Trap Open once. The staff is awesome and really goes out of their way at all times. Chris Berry does a phenomenal job running everything for the golf tournaments and makes it extremely enjoyable. I'd also like to comment on the great service provided by Chris George. Any time I need anything at all related to transportation, restaurants etc, Chris always has great ideas and goes above and beyond helping me out. It really is a good feeling to know that he genuinely cares about my experience at the resort.

title: Cottages Need More Attention
review: Just stayed here for the first time with the family for a Junior Tennis tournament. The two bedroom cottages looked perfect for a family of five, but in reality, the one we stayed in at least was in need of some deep cleaning. After running around the unit barefoot our kids' feet were dark with dirt. The mattresses were fairly ancient feeling, and there were even VHS tapes under the TV, but no VHS player.  I get a feeling that these may be individually owned and rented by the resort, but if so, that should be made clear. It is a little concerning to be staying in a unit next to units that are clearly occupied by full-time residents, especially when you have small kids.   The rest of the property is pretty nice and the tennis courts are very well maintained.

title: Italian Open at PGA
review: This is the third year running the IO at PGA. The numbers have grown each year and this year we had 70 golfers. The staff and ammenities at PGA were First Class. Every detail was handled and even though they cant control the weather the staff was creative in moving our Bocci tournament inside to the ballroom. Its details and accomodations such as this that make PGA the place to be. Our Clambake in Bar 91 was over the top good. Food and selection were better than any 4 star restaurant. The Glow Ball putting was a Huge hit. I cant wait for next years event. Keep up the Great work.

title: Doesn't get much better for serious golfer
review: Not many do it better than PGA national ...everything is first class ....almost. The rooms ...pool...food...and golf are as good as it gets in Florida....but the clubhouse service and front desk don't quite match up. Clubhouse is overwhelmed at times and doesn't quite get it when it comes to service. The front desk is a little better but also isn't quite five star. Innisbrook in Tampa should give all golf resorts in Florida a video on how both  are done.

title: Great service support
review: I have used the hotel for a variety of events and entertaining. I have always been greeted well by the valet staff. Sergio has been especially attentive to any needs I have at the hotel. He goes above and beyond to locate necessary equipment needed. He welcomes my guests and assists them with any hotel needs. It is a wonderful facility to host events.

title: Great guys golf trip
review: The resort took care of all the details for our annual guys golf trip  They made going out at night easy. With plenty of cars and vans to pick us up at various locations thru out Palm Beach.  The rooms were clean and neat  Great lobby bar and sports bar on the lower level  Even the pool bar and staff were helpful

title: Nice week-end getaway!
review: The hotel had lovely grounds with a beautiful golf course.  The staff members were attentive and friendly.  There were several restaurants from which to choose.  The food was good, and the prices were fair.  The rooms were a good size, and furnished nicely.  My only criticism is there was no turn down at night.  It appeared that the housekeeping staff did not come into the room in the evening.

title: italian open golf tournament
review: my first trip to this event. it was everything promised then some. room was great food was very good event was awesome a golfers delight. if you are thinking of holding a golf tournament look no further

title: Italian open
review: Great facility with terrific golf courses. Staff was attentive and helpful. This is a great place for a golf outing. You do not need to leave the site once you arrive. Drop your clubs at the door and pick them up on the golf cart.  Palmer  and championship course were fabulous and all the golf you can handle. In great condition.  Rooms were spacious and up to date. I Bar was the place to meet and talk golf.

title: PGA National Resort has it all!
review: Golf, Food, Spa. Great staff, all lead to a wonderful stay at PGA National. Fun for whole family. There is so much going on you don't have to leave the resort for a great time. Met many locals who come to I Bar lounge for music and to meet friends. The food and service was excellent.

title: Golf weekend
review: Great set up overall. There are four golf options right out of the lobby serviced by a well stocked pro shop. Rooms have been nicely renovated and well kept. The food was very good and the service in the restaurants was excellent. Plenty of nightlife within minutes of the hotel and convenient to the airport. I will definitely be back.

title: THIS IS THE PLACE !!!
review: I recently spent a few days here with a large golfing group (about 65 players). PGA National Resort and Spa put an amazing package together for us and each day was perfect. The facility has seen a major upgrade is simply top shelf and is staffed by dedicated, friendly and caring employees who are there at every step to take care of anything you might need. If I were to select the most impressive employee who assisted me during my stay I would need to list at least a dozen. The banquet staff had put together events for our group that made for the most enjoyable and fun experience. Golf here is truly an ace with great courses and again a staff that is so well coordinated that everything from the Pro-shop to the cart personnel who have every bag on a cart with your partner and…

title: The Great Italian Open
review: Just got back from the PGA National Resort and Spa where I recently participated in the annual Italian Open golf tournament.  I can't say enough about the total experience.  The attentiveness of the staff in everything they did including making sure I had transportation to and from the hotel to planning my entire itinerary was first class!  The room was great, the golf was great and even though the weather didn't fully cooperate, the staff still went out of their way to make sure we had the best experience.  Wonderful job and I look forward to coming back soon!

title: PGA National
review: Played in a Golf Tournamnet, It was an outstading venue, great staff in hotel and Pro Shop. They were accomotaing to all of our needs and requirements from golf to dining on and off resortr.  Top Notch!

title: Dinner at Ironwood Steak & Seafood
review: What a fantastic experience!  Last night I met a friend for dinner at the Ironwood Steak & Seafood in PGA National. The ambiance alone is worth the trip.  First of all, they took a last minute reservation, for a Saturday night at 7:30, and believe me, they were packed, yet we were seated upon arrival.  The table was perfect, looking out onto the full bar/music area, but quiet enough to still enjoy conversation. The service was terrific and the food was great.  Our drinks were brought to us right away. It's stone crab season and they offered it by the piece so we could sample it as an appetizer.  We both ordered steaks, medium rare, but more rare than medium, (we weren't easy) and they came out exactly as we ordered them.  The meal was perfect.  We weren't rushed and even after…

title: Perfect golf getaway
review: PGA National was the perfect spot for a long weekend of golf with friends.  The ammenities were terrific and the service was top notch.  The lobby bar provided a nice close to day's activities and the Ironwood Grill served a mean steak.  The five golf courses were unique and always in good condition.

title: Excellent place to stay for a golf weekend!!!
review: I recently stayed at PGA National Resort & Spa for a great weekend of golf with a large group of friends. My room was excellent....quiet, clean and in perfect condition. The staff here is phenomenal...extremely warm, friendly service and always willing to help at all times. The golf courses were in excellent condition. the spa was fantastic. the food & beverage in the Ironwood Grill and the I Bar were outstanding and extremely tasty. The pool was perfectly clean and a peaceful atmosphere to relax around. PGA National is 100% hands down the best place i have evered stayed for a golf vacation weekend. I cannot wait to go back every year....and i just cannot say enough great things about the staff, service, golf, food/beverage, spa, pool and accomodations!! I highly highly highly…

title: Great stay
review: I periodically stay at the resort for business trips to Palm Beach, but also have stayed there on several occassions for golf trips with friends.  On each occassion, I have found the service to be excellent and attentive.  The golf courses are all a lot fun to play as well and offer a good deal of variety.   Every room that I have had has been large and comfortable and the upgrades completed during the years I have traveled there are great.  For the golf trips with friends, the staff did an excellent job organizing and making the group's stay enjoybable and hassle free.  I look forward to heading back to the resort in the near future.

title: "Getaway golf weekend with the guys"
review: Why PGA National when there are so many resorts to choose from in Florida?  To sum it up: staff + service + execution + top rate facilities = worry free golf weekend.  The staff was incredibly friendly and were great about anticipating our needs.  Golf bags were unpacked and in our rooms when we arrived, and the on course staff ran a flawless tournament for 40+ guys over a four day period.  The food was top notch and the amenities were four star.  The courses were in excellent shape and offered challenges for every player as well as variety.  Looking forward to the fourth annual trip next fall!

title: Golf Trip
review: Had an excellent two nights at PGA National Resort and Spa.  The staff was extremely friendly and accomodating.  The rooms were modern and clean.  The golf was challenging but fun.  The hotel itself is well designed with a nice pool area and bar in the lobby.  Would definitely go back.

title: Excellent Venue for golf group
review: Recently spent a few days with a large group at PGA National. This was my second trip to the resort in the last two years and both experiences have been exceptional. The staff as a whole is friendly and very attentive to the group's needs. The restaurants on site are top notch, rooms are great and the golf is excellent. I would highly recommend PGA national whether you are playing with four or forty.

title: Great golf weekend
review: Just returned from a great long weekend at PGA National with a big group of guys.  Everything was perfect -- the accommodations, food, and bar -- and I can't say enough about the staff.  The hotel staff was responsive and welcoming, and the pro shop staff was just fantastic.  Somehow they managed to keep us on schedule for a 2 day, 54 hole tournament, using three different courses, and they couldn't have been more pleasant.  They were dealing with a lot of different groups over the weekend, and they maintained a great personal connection with all of them.  Will definitely keep PGA on my list for future trips.

title: Great golf trip
review: Great golf, food, weather and rooms.......all walking distance?  The courses were all top notch.  The staff was very attentive to all our needs.  We pulled off a trip with 48 guys, and it felt like 8 the way they treated us.

title: The accommodations, grounds and staff where all exceptional.
review: My four nights at PGA National could not have been more enjoyable.  What truly separates resorts is the level of service and the staff at PGA National accommodated my family's every need.  I look forward to returning as soon as possible and would highly recommend it for golf, pool time, nightlife and anything else you could look for in a vacation

title: Great spot for a guys golf weekend
review: I just returned from a golf weekend with a large group of guys at the resort.  The facilities were excellent and the staff was incredible.  We played three of the courses, all of which were fabulous.  The on-course staff took great care of us as did everyone inside the resort.  Highly recommended!!!

title: Great stay and great service - for 3rd straight year!
review: I was at PGA Natl for a guys' golf trip in Nov-13.  The resort is well suited for such an event with excellent golf courses (and management of logistics of our large group), great amenities/rooms, and numerous quality options for food and drink.  The staff was helpful and attentive at all times and made for a great weekend.  I'd highly recommend the resort for your golf trip or even a family getaway.  Given the scale of the resort, there is ample space to enjoy family time or a more boisterous armosphere - something for everyone.

title: Golf Experience with Group of Friends
review: Great getaway to Florida with over 40 of my friends.  The rooms have recently been upgraded and are very nice and comfortable.  The golf was first class. All the courses were in excellent condition and the staff at the PGA did an amazing job with getting our group coordinated for the entire trip.  The resort itself is in excellent condition as well.  The pool, the spa, the restaurants, and the bars are all in great shape and we had excellent service for the entire weekend.  We had large group outings for dinner throughout the resort and the service was really good.   This is a great place to getaway with a small or large group of your friends.

title: Can't Go Wrong: A++
review: Just home from a 50-man golf trip and PGA National made the event a huge success for our group.  You would be hard pressed to find any one of our 50 with a complaint.  The golf was fantastic; the restaurants and bars in the resort worked out perfectly; and the whole team at PGA National kepts us organized and running smoothly.  You can tell they spend a lot of time focusing on the guest experience - the service and attentiveness we received throughout the weekend were outstanding.  The staff was friendly and the rooms were perfect for our needs - clean, spacious and comfortable.    I would hugely recommend a stay at PGA National and can't wait to go back next year.

title: Perfect Weekend Golf Getaway
review: I recently spent 3 days/3 nights for a trip to PGA with a group of guys for golf and little fellowship with a few good friends.  We looked at several venues for our trip, but settled on PGA for a few reasons.  As we had many guys coming at different times from different locations, PGA has many direct options into either PBI or FLL.  Also, as we were coming from Midwest, we wanted good odds on weather.  You are almost guaranteed to get warm weather at most times of the year, our trip was in the fall and the weather was great.  Also, you have multiple courses at PGA and great services/restaurants at the resort.  The rooms were excellent, although we played so much golf, we didn't spend much time in the rooms.  The rates are very reasonable for the amount of golf played and overall…

title: Great trip with first class service
review: had a group outing and every activity - tee times, meals between rounds, dinners in the evening - went flawlessly.  great course and great environment - no need to even leave "campus" during a several day event due to multiple courses and dining venues.

title: Fantastic golf venue!
review: Spent 3 days at PGA with a group of 50 guys in November - was over the top. Courses and golf staff were really excellent, as usual, but the hotel (dining, bars, outside venues) was really exceptional. I've been here a few times over the last 5 years, and they've now renovated most or all of the hotel since 2011. We ate out one night and did 2 dinners at the hotel (Ironwood and a catered meal), both of which were outstanding. I've now stayed at a dozen or so golf resorts in the SE since 2008, and this was my best experience.

title: Great Corporate & Guy Trip Location
review: Over the last 10 months I have done two trips to PGA National.  The first was a 30 person corporate sales outing and the second was a 50 person guys weekend.  I must say that the resort did a terrific job with both outings.  On the corporate outing.. in one word I would say "simple".  The corporate planning team made the three day event really simple to manage and I literally didn't have to worry about anything.  We ate at all the different restaurants which made it a nice change of pace without having to leave the campus.  The meeting rooms were really nice for a group our size.  The golf and extra activities were simple for us to offer to our people and very easy to manage.  If you are thinking about a corporate outing, definitely consider PGA National as you don't have to…

title: First Class Resort
review: Just had the pleasure of spending a long weekend at the PGA National Resort and Spa and wanted to comment on what a tremendous destination this is.  The service from the staff was outstanding, the food was fantastic, the rooms, restaurants, and bars were top notch.  This is a first class resort and a must hit destination.  The golf courses were in terrific shape, and presented great challenges / fun for golfers of all handicaps.  I highly recommend PGA National Resort and Spa.  PS - Huge fan of the breakfast!!

title: consistently great service
review: i've visited several times in the past 3 years and the staff is -- without fail -- top shelf!  from the golf pros to the bartenders and waitresses, the commitment to service and quality is readily apparent.

title: Guys golf weekend
review: Just spent a great weekend at PGA National. It was my first time there and I will go back for sure. I played 4 of the courses and 3 were in great shape. One of the 18's looked like it was getting a lot of work done on so I assume it will be in good shape soon. The staff at the hotel was solid and very attentive. Pool looked great but I didn't get a chance to hang there. Bar was fun with a good DJ mixing it up. Top Notch all the way around.

title: Spectacular Resort and Spa!
review: Service, staff and amenities are First Class.  Having stayed at the resort before and after the renovation, the improvements are outstanding!  The golf is fantastic and Buddy Finch (tournament director) is unmatched in coordinating small and large outings.  Great job again Buddy, you're the best!

title: Great golf experience
review: PGA National is great all around golf experience.  Ever since they remodeled the property I have spent 3-4 days per year there.  The food, accommodations and of course, golf, are excellent. It is also very reasonable in terms of price.

title: Hotel Feel
review: The Hotel is lovely and well laid out. The only criticism is that the staff do not seem to be too happy or know about golf. The downstairs restaurant does not feel warm but the staff there were lovely. Wifi signal is good. The rooms are also nicely decorated. Golfing also is excellent nearby.

title: Great Resort
review: If you are looking for an excuse to get warm this winter travel to Palm Beach Gardens, Florida to enjoy the full service resort, PGA National. It really starts with golf. They have 5 challenging course including "The Champ" where the Honda Classic is played in early March. The grounds are beautiful, the dining is top notch. There is a world class spa and plenty of places to relax around the pool. Great shopping, the beautiful seashore and other fantastic restaurants are all a short drive away. For a resort that has it all visit PGA National.

title: Getaway Weekend
review: This resort is so wonderful!!! We stayed from Fri Nov 1 to Mon Nov 4. From the time we pulled up the bell staff was friendly and helpful took my husbands golf clubs to the Pro shop since he was golfing the next day.  We went to check in and our room wasnt ready but by the time we walked around and finished our first drink at the pool we got the call that our room was ready! We went to our room and it was EXCATLY  the way it was shown on the web site.  It was clean and the view was beautiful! We had a jr suite. My husband golfed on Sat and Sun while I did the spa.  My husband had a great golf experience(golf clubs on the cart, cart girl that came around enough etc) and the spa is top notch from the time you walk in the door your spa experience is relaxing.  The facilities are…

title: Great Resort
review: This was our second trip to the PGA National Resort. The resort has made some improvements in the accommodations. The staff was very responsive to our needs and took great strides to make sure we were comfortable. The grounds were well kept and it was very relaxing!

title: Nice hotel
review: We stayed one night for a wedding held on property.  The grounds are beautiful and made for a perfect location for the wedding.  The room was a nice size and had a nice feel to it.  We enjoyed the pool (could have been a bit warmer), but the ability to walk in was great for small kids.  The atmosphere was good for a weekend with live entertainment at the pool and bar area at night.  We had a good stay and would enjoy coming back to play a round or two.

title: Rip you off every step of the way
review: It starts with the lovely $25 resort fee when you check in. Luckily they give you a card outlining the "$100" value for the services associated with the resort fee. Included are luxury amenities like a newspaper, access to the gym, self parking, etc.  I would call these services simply a "hotel".  In addition, my bar dinner was $100 for a piece of fish and two sides.  Water in the room? 6.50.    These guys definitely took their pricing strategy from the airlines. And that's exactly how you feel staying here.

title: Pleasant experience
review: We stayed one night for a girls getaway. The grounds were lovely, pool was fun, and lobby bar was a nice socializing spot. Front desk was friendly, beds were comfortable and room was very clean. I would stay again for 1 night with significant other so we could both enjoy more of the property including the golf, spa, driving range, and more. However, one night would probably be all we would need as we like to venture off property and would probably prefer staying at a hotel that's more centrally located.

title: Wonderful Experience!
review: I was here for a conference and everything about my stay was heavenly.  My bed was comfortable, the room spacious, the balcony had comfortable seating and a table with lovely pool and lake view.  The lobby with the bar was beautiful and such fun at night.  The facilities for the conference were top notch. I would love to return for an actual vacation and plan to take my husband for golf and tennis.  Fabulous experience!

title: A weekend wedding..
review: We just returned from the PGA this holiday weekend. We went there for a wedding. I have to say the place is absolutely lovely! The room was clean and extremely spacious. I loved how we had a little patio to sit on outside our door.  The Ibar was a pretty cool hang out spot. We had dinner at the Ironwood and it was very good.  I wasn't crazy about the clubhouse lunch spot. It was basic food that was extremely overpriced. We did not eat at the breakfast restaurant. The food was buffet and had been sitting for a few hours by the time we arrived. We opted to go off premise and find another spot. The wedding food was ok. I can't say it was great or that I left feeling full.  All the drinks though made at the bar were fine.  The pool was nice too! I enjoyed lounging there with the…

title: Gorgeous property, staff needs a happy fix
review: I was here for the incredible Dave Peltz Scoring School and stayed onsite.  The downsides:.  all aspects of the checkin were unpleasant - from the attitude of the concierge to the reservation staff not handing me my Interernet code and additional resort materials for the extra $25 per day resort charge.  The room was nice and clean and about as far from the Dave Peltz school as you could get.  No one could actually tell me how to get to the Dave Peltz school from my hotel room.   Cafe Pronto handed us absolutely the worst coffee we've ever had.  Prices quoted for tennis lessons and ball machine were inconsistent with what landed on my bill.   The upside?  Cafe91 the restaurant next to the pro shop - had amazing food and great staff.  Tennis and fitness facility was great.  Main…

title: Kind Staff, Beautiful Amenities, Splendid Experience
review: It is rare to come across a Resort and Spa like the PGA National that strives to provide the utmost standard of customer service and quality environments. If you're for a place to stay in Palm Beach Gardens then you need not look futher than the PGA National Resort & Spa.

title: Excellent getaway
review: My son and I enjoyed the excellent hospitality of PGA National.  The staff was excellent throughout the property from the time you walked in across each of the multiple courses we played.  The facility was clean, friendly and welcoming.  Would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to get away for a golf excursion.

title: Meeting with some golf
review: I was here for a conference that included a round of golf. I also came a day early ot get in  a round of golf. The hotel is beautiful and the golf is good. I played the Squire and the Palmer. The Squire was a little tighter and less forgiving but all of the fairways and greens were in good shape. The rooms were very clean and modern. My dresser had a drawer that would never stay closed. The staff was very helpful. I left my iphone charger at home but I had the cord. The front desk girl loaned me her personal power block! A friend of mine who lives in Miami and drove there bought me one at a convenince store. Very nice place for a meeting. Needs a better shop gift shop though.

title: Great Hotel, Staff Issues
review: I have been here a couple of times and I love the property itself, it is secluded and relaxing, I love the pool, there are plenty of chairs and it is well kept. The rooms were just upgraded with sleek modern interior which is nice and calming. My issues are with the staff across the board from check in to the restaurants an everywhere in between they just dont care. We arrived around 7PM on a Saturday, there was a man standing at the check in counter but didnt want to check us in. Finally when no one else could take care of us he agreed, it took a half hour to check in for one room?!? The next day we were eating lunch at the pool and got to watch our server throw herself at every male waiter around. It was very uncomfortable. The waiter in the steakhouse was inattentive and…

title: Great vacation
review: This is one of my favorite places to stay in Florida. The staff is friendly and helpful. We had a junior suite with a great view from the balcony. It was also quiet and peaceful on the balcony. The room was clean and spacious with modern decor. We ate in palm terrace and ironwood restaurants. They were both costly though the meals were great. The ibar was noisy in the evening for me but it was always filled with people. The fitness center was updated since my last visit but could be bigger. My husband loves the tennis courts here. I would return again and recommend this resort.

title: PGA National Resort & Spa
review: This an exceptional property! Beautiful grounds. The staff from housekeeping to conference services were extremely helpful! PGA is a green hotel with recycling containers throughout the conference center as well in the guest rooms.

title: Expected More
review: I will be totally up front: I don't golf. So the amenities relating to golf are totally lost on me. That being said, there was still plenty to do! With your resort fee, you get access to a great fitness and racquet center, and the pool is fantastic. The food is pretty standard hotel fare across the board.  The rooms are a little below what I would have expected. My bed squeaked, the showers aren't great. The balcony was a nice touch (though could use some spider removal) and the rooms are very spacious. The bottled water in the room is expensive, and at least during my stay was a complete necessity to use. The water was green, and not in an environmentally friendly way. Maintenance claims it was because they just put in new filters and everything was fine, but with no warning to…

title: Hoodwinked
review: As the golf chairman of a recent golf outing with 15 business owners and 3 corporate executives, I can't tell you how shocked and disappointed I was with the management @ PGA National and the Champions course on our recent annual golf outing.  While the resort facility is a very impressive, the Championship Course is under heavy construction and was a joke to play.  In a nutshell, we were had. Our golf group flew in from all over the country for a long weekend of business meetings and golf.    At no time in the booking phase of this outing (or later) were we advised that the premiere Championship course would look like a Kubota construction equipment auction.  There were huge Kubota shovels on numerous holes manned by dozens of workers who were actively rearranging the green…

title: September 2013 visit
review: Attended conference and tournament.  First class facilities - comfortable, luxurious. Great golf, even though they had been killed with over 11" of rain the previous week.   Excellent restaurants, and they did a great job with the reception and buffets associated with the event.  Will definitely revisit during a future south Florida visit.

title: $25 A DAY RESORT FEE
review: If your company is paying, no problem, who cares? Are you very wealthy? If so, who cares. For those trying to impress others, money is no object. Unfortunately, none of the above apply to me. There is no question that this place is clean, well managed and a golfer's paradise. I am just an average middle class schmo that made an offer of $100 on priceline.com for an un-named 5 star hotel. The non-refundable offer was accepted. I then found out that the room would cost $125 (100+25), not $100. I could have stayed elsewhere in a comparable room for much less money.

title: Fantastic Spa & Resort
review: This is truly a full service, top notch SPA.  The spa is gorgeous, spacious, first class operation that also has 3 outside small pools.  You can spend the entire day here and really relax.  The food at the spa poolside location is fantastic.  They offer a full variety of services, including a hair salon, a cute boutique and numerous private massage/facial rooms.  The staff is second to none.  I can't wait to go back!

title: My only complaint is that my stay was too short...
review: Stayed here this summer for a short two night stay.  The hotel is lovely - big spacious lobby, friendly staff and large comfortable rooms.  I didn't have time to check out all of the facilities and take advantage of the golf/spa/fitness since I was there on business, but based on what I did experience I am sure they are top notch.  We had drinks at the hotel lobby and dinner at the steakhouse.  Excellent service at both and the food was amazing!

title: relaxing
review: We were very happy with our stay.  We didn't go golfing we just hung by the pool & went out around the palm beach area.  Hanging out by the pool felt very relaxing with a DJ one day & live acoustics the next.  It was nice for the kids to play also.  The room I had over looked the pool which was a beautiful view.  I did notice on Sat night that the music was still blasting at 3;30 am but was still able to sleep, worth the view.  Room was clean & nice, the staff was very friendly.  I felt the prices at the restaurant & the bars were very prices but I guess that's expected being a golf resort.  I really have no complaints about my stay.

title: Long term favourite!
review: I've stayed at the PGA for business dozens of times over the last 10 years. Have seen it develop itself to a 5* resort! With all the great improvements to the rooms, the iBar, the Ironwood restaurant and breakfast restaurant. Always had a great time and felt welcome. Mostly stayed for 8-12 nights and staff went out of their way to make me feel comfortable. Excellent!!!

title: Great Golf Resort - restaurants expensive
review: We stayed here for a golf tournament.  The resort itself was really good.  Although our son played the Champions Course, which is under renovation - do not pay to play until is it finished there is construction all over the golf course - therefore, spoiling the experience a little.
