The room we stayed in was on the ground floor level.  It was nice and clean partly refurbished, but the tiled floor was cold and gave the whole room a damp dungeon feeling.  The rest of the hotel and the main reception areas are great.  But wow do they know how to charge in the restaurants, 4 people 8 beers and 4 appetizers - $150.  Go eat elsewhere the food is not worth that amount of money.

title: Nice Hotel - Service Could be Better
review: Stayed in the hotel 3 nights for a business trip. Enjoyed the food and found the meeting areas to be comfortable.   I had a room on the first floor - close to the pool area. The room itself was large and had plenty of storage.  Issues that I ran into: No book of "hotel information" in my room. Had to call front desk..."are there any vending machines" - answer : "no, our market area is closed so any food or drink would need to be ordered from room service"  Hotel has an app that can be downloaded to get info, but my iPad did not have the version of software needed to support.  One night I needed to order from room service so I had to call them and 20 minutes later they brought me a menu so I could call back.  Had problems with my hair dryer not working - called front desk. They…

title: Surprise for partner
review: My partner has played every course at PGA  in the past when he was physically able, but never stayed at the hotel. This was a surprise overnight stay while we visited the VA Hospital in West Palm Beach. For us it was a perfect setting, not too busy giving us some down time before big day at the VA. Although the rooms were a bit dated, they were exceptionally clean, roomy, everything operated correctly, and the air conditioning system was great in our room. The staff was wonderful always taking a minute for us, and always offering a hand, and also listening to an old golfer's past glories.....Thanks again PGA National, we had a lovely experience.

title: pleasant stay at pga
review: stayed at hotel for business.  wasnt in season, so property was quiet and reasonably priced.  rooms were fine, but could do with some moderate upgrading particularly in bathroom.  service was very good.  fitness center was dated and equipment seemed to have seen heavy use.  still worked fine, however.  end result, i enjoyed the stay and location.  am not a golfer, but presume that golf course is a big draw for property.  end result, would recommend the resort particularly in the off season when room prices are very good.

title: PGA National
review: Visited resort in September with friends and couldn't have been more pleased. Husbands played golf and were very happy with the courses and the treatment they received.  Even though it rained much of the time managed to get in enough rounds to find it worthwhile.  From check in to check out the experience was more than expected.  The facility is beautiful. The rooms were golf side view and the balconies were a nice plus. Complimentary drink at I Bar was a pleasant surprise. Much to do in the area. Plenty of wonderful restaurants and shopping.  The pool was outstanding and we had it to ourselves most of the time we were there. A fun and relaxing vacation.

title: Could be Better
review: Wife and i stayed for a quick weekend getaway.  The grounds are beautiful so is the property, but as many reviews stated, attention to detail was missing.  As a world traveler, the rooms were a little dated with lots of potential for improvement.  The bathrooms need modernization and the cleanliness of towels were very poor.  There was noise between the rooms.  Bed quality was excellent.  One of the key things about this place is the friendly and knowledgeable staff.  Staff is 5 stars, facility 3 stars.  Lets pull these together and it will be a superb resort property.

title: A NON-GOLFER REVIEW
review: I stayed at PGA for 3 nites over the Labor Day weekend for an organized event.  My problem was with the reservation process.  I booked a jr suite at one rate and never received the confirmation.  When I called back the rate had increased by $70 per nite.  After much back and forth, a supervisor finally decided to honor the rate that i was quoted initially, but they made it quite painful even though they told me that all reservations are recorded and they confirmed that the rate I was quoted was correct.  The jr suite was spacious and very nicely furnished, but faced the parking lot - room 2033 on the lobby level.   it was upsetting because I could not open the curtains for any natural light because there were constantly people walking back and forth to their cars so I kept the…

title: Nice resort
review: We played golf 3 times which was included in our room cost.  It was hot but the breeze made it tolerable.  Resort is nice but on the weekend a lot of kids are at the pool.  The drinks are way over priced.  The food was good.  They said it was the slow time of the year but the place was packed at night.

title: Good value for an off-season stay.
review: We got a great deal for two nights.  One day included unlimited golf for two, as well as breakfast.  The property is in great condition and the staff throughout the resort is friendly and efficient.  The rooms are well appointed and everything worked.  The Ironwood Grill was a little pricey, but the service and food were excellent.  We will be back!

title: Could be better.....no attention to details
review: First let me say that this is a nice location - and a beautiful course if you are into Golf.  I think that we chose the wrong weekend to stay here.  First the Hotel which just went over a recent renovation is a beautiful place, with lush gardens and and a beautiful course.  With that being said, their are still items that are rough around the edges and could be improved up that would bring this Hotel to a new level of luxury.  We stayed in a Deluxe Junior Suite.  This is bigger than the regular rooms as it has the added room of  a sectional type of sofa and a table and chairs.  Here are the little things that stood out for me.  - The room is just OK for going under such a renovation.  Even though the things are new, I guess because of the frequency of the guests, the rooms still…

title: A relaxing retreat in Palm Beach
review: My family stayed at the PGA Resort for three days. My golf-loving dad unfortunately was unable to play because of his shoulder but he enjoyed taking in the atmosphere. There was an additional cost for an upgrade with a pool view, but the front desk person found a better room in our category. Our room on the fourth floor was excellent with a partial view of the lake and greens from the balcony. The facility is quite spacious with a fancy pool and hot tub and the perks are nice. The $25 resort fee includes use of the health club with daily classes, a gym and a small pool. I took yoga and dance classes and the members were very friendly and encouraged me to come back again. The food options can be pricey, but there are lots of restaurants nearby (highly recommend Talay Thai) and…

title: Spa is enjoyable but needs improvement
review: We've been going here for many years now and always enjoy the spa services and relaxing outdoor pools, which include minerals from the Dead Sea and France. However, during our last visit, I noticed that the place is in dire need of upgrades, better maintenance staff, and improved customer service. For example, in the women's area, the frayed couches had seen better days, and the jacuzzi by the two saunas could use a good cleaning. There was a a ring of grime just above the water line. Also, when we first checked in, the clerk behind the counter was pretty cold and unwelcoming. That's a bit unusual for a spa.

title: Perfect Girls Day Out
review: Ventured here with a few female family members for a ladies spa day. Luckily, PGA had a Girls Day Out special, which included lunch, a choice of either a half hour massage, facial or mani/pedi, and free usage of their spa facilities. This is the perfect deal for a group of ladies who want to spend several hours feeling pampered and relaxed.

title: Excellent. I had the best time.
review: I found the resort excellent in all aspects. Yes the food was pricy but it was very very good.  Good quality. Good presentation. I encountered the friendliest most helpful competent staff there. I did valet parking. It was excellent. The bell service was excellent. The front desk people has personality and were hilarious and made me feel special. The place is bussling with activity and they can handle large crowds with ease. The beds are fantastic. My view of the lake from my room was the most calming thing. I am planning to return. I was there for a conference. I will return for a vacation and spa treatments.

title: Better than expected but still some issues...
review: I found a great deal on living social for this resort, so I think the price I paid through living social made all the "cons" of the high priced hotel ok.  PROS: Great customer service (Andrea in reception and Willie the bellman were AWESOME), beautiful pool and great for families, nice size rooms, nice decor, lots of restaurants, beautiful golf course, I was in room 2060 and it had a nice view of lake and golf course, they are going green, and fairly recently renovated.  CONS: If you pay full price for the rooms, I think it is too expensive for what you get. Although it recently went through a renovation, the door lock was broken, sink had cracks, bathroom faucet was broken, some restaurants allow cigar smoking and it penetrates through to the Bear Trap lounge where kids can…

title: Met and exceeded all expectations
review: My daughter, myself and another junior golfer had to opportunity to stay at this beautiful resort last week as part of a junior golf tournament crew. The grounds, the staff and the amenities were all terrific! I particularly enjoyed the Happy Hour at the IBar. The majority of our meals were served in the banquet facilities and the food quality was first rate. I can not say enough about the staff, they really do make the place special. We were always greeted with a smile and a polite inquiry as to whether or not we needed any assistance. I used the shuttle to come back from the grocery store, I did walk there. It was just over a mile but in the blazing mid day sun and humidity, not one of my better ideas!! The golf courses are spectacular, the pro shop one of the nicest I have…

title: Fabulous
review: My husband and I spent 7 days there the beginning of April 2013. My son and his wife met us there for a long weekend.  You never had to leave the hotel.  The food was great.  We ate at the pool bar, lobby bar and Ironwood restaurant and all were superb.  The rooms were immaculate.  The gym was amazing. It was one of the nicest hotels where we have stayed.  Definitely go back.  We liked the amenities so much we are looking to buy a property in one of the 39 developments they have surrounding the hotel and golf course.  You will not be disappointed.

title: Nice hotel but poor mattress and expensive...almost a 3 star
review: 2nd time staying here. The room was clean and spacious. Nice bathroom and I overlooked the pool on the balcony. There was a teenage golf tournament this week so that was a slight pain. The lobby bar didn't any wait staff which was another small inconvenience. I stayed in room 2070 and the bed is horribly dented, you are constantly sinking towards the middle - note to management: time to change the mattress!  Don't want to give the impression that it isn't a nice hotel, but it doesn't meet my criteria for a five star. Valet is $20 and the breakfast is $28...just be aware going in too.

title: Clean, fun & full of activity
review: I stayed at the PGA National Resort for a girls R&R weekend and it was the best. This was a great room design for sharing.  Pros:  The bathroom included a spacious sink outside, plus a spacious sink in the shower area; again perfect for sharing. The beds and bedding were comfortable. We were especially pleased with the multiple class offerings at the gym.  We were able to take a spin class followed by a yoga class and these instructors were excellent.  The onsite restaurant was decent, but lacked a variety of offerings for children. If you are looking for entertainment on Friday or Saturday evening, the onsite restaurant had a live DJ and the guests were not shy about getting the party started.   Cons: The deck off the room was small, but I guess with such a nice pool area, most…

title: Beautiful
review: My son attended the national optimist tournament and we stayed here for five nights. It is very beautiful inside and out. Loved hanging out in the lobby and by the pool. Also very comfy outdoor seating in front of the practice there's. the resort is quite expensive for our budget but for those who can afford it it is great

title: Avoid this resort!
review: Do not waste your money going to this resort!  The service is very bad and there are "hidden" costs they don't bother to tell you about when making reservations.  We played 5 rounds of golf at the resort.  The first round we played, there was NOT A SINGLE DRINK CART to deliver any drinks in 90 degree weather and only one place on the course to get water.  The other four rounds...two of them we saw a drink cart once, and the other two twice each.  When I ran into the ONE marshall for ALL FIVE courses (we had 4 groups on one hole at one point), he complained about his own management, letting me know that have cut service to the bone at the resort and that they don't begin to have enough staff for the resort or to serve people at the pool or the golf course.  They charge a $30 per…

title: Great stay for DMB concert at the PGA
review: We stay here on a regular basis for the annual Dave Matthews Band weekend at Cruzan Amphitheatre. This year we found that the entire hotel has been renovated since our last stay. Rooms are modern and the pool is awesome! Food/drinks obviously expensive but great. The hotel catered to the numerous DMB fans staying there. They had a cover band playing by the pool on Saturday. At $127 per night, this is one of the best values in the Palm Beach area.

title: Caring staff and great conference location
review: It was great being at a hotel where all greeted you in a nice friendly manner. The staff was super pleasant and caring. I made a mistakes with the dates when making the reservations and when I  called the hotel to explain they were very understanding.

title: My go-to place in Palm Beach
review: Stayed at the PGA Resort with my fiancé for the weekend while in town for the Dave Matthews concert. The location was great and the hotel was wonderful. We got a pretty good rate and had to pay an extra $25 a day for a resort fee. The fee included wifi, self parking and two free drinks at the iBar, among other things. The room was modern and nice and the pool area was great. The gym and health club was very nice for a morning work out. The hotel had a lot of events for concert goers, including a tribute band at the pool and late hours and special late night menu. Every night after the concert, the iBar welcomed us with a DJ and great service.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stayed and can't wait to return for another getaway!

title: Great conference location
review: Just recently attended a conference at the PGA and had a very good experience. Since I was accompanied by my husband, he was able to enjoy the amenities, particularly golf. The pool and spa areas are wonderful and have a great ambience. Mostly dined off the grounds, but did enjoy IBar. The staff also very attentive.

title: 5 STAR Palm Beach!
review: A wonderful, easy-going 5 star golf and spa experience..  Stay here year after year, always clean, convenient and enjoyable.  Recent room renovations are great.  Fabulous pool and spa, good food and bars.  Only negatives were a difficult time getting through to the front desk while in the room, and a few extra "resort charges" that were not disclosed until check in.  Otherwise beautiful and fit the bill for a pleasant stay.

title: Great getaway
review: I enjoyed my stay at PGA and will definitely return. My room was spacious and very comfortable. I had a nice balcony overlooking a tropical setting. The pool area was fabulous. The resort fee of $25 per room(not per person) includes wifi , 2free welcome drinks, discounts at spa and restaurants... Well worth it. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I'm looking forward to my next stay.

title: Perfect resort for the entire family
review: Had a business trip to the area so I decided to bring the family and stay the weekend before the business trip.  We are glad we did.  First priorities; golf.  Played two of the courses and enjoyed the practice facilities, they are first rate and we enjoyed the country club experience.  Did not play the Champions Course but promised we will return.  After golf, the ibar and the other bar were a nice way to unwind.    Ate dinner at the ibar and had food off the ironwood menu.  We were all satisfied with our meals.  Breakfast buffet was also of high caliber.  The kids loved the pool and hot tub and ate from the poolside restaurant.  I certainly enjoyed the hot tub after golf and work. The room was a suite and was large and comfortable with nice amenities and a balcony.  Service was…

title: Not as impressed as before
review: I was a guest at the PGA again this year for a conference we'd held there three years ago. Much of it is absolutely unchanged. (Have you ever noticed that it's comforting when a hotel hasn't changed -- like coming home -- but it's more fun when upgrades and changes catch you off guard?) Unfortunately, the rooms have changed, and not particularly for the better. While the furnishings seem to have been made more hotel-contemporary, this has not been an unqualifed success. First, they've added refrigerators to all rooms, which should be good. But these are "electric coolers" filled by just two water bottle six-packs. A bottle of wine would have been very difficult to chill. The outdated and ineffective "filter" in the ceiling of the bathroom was velveteen with dust, and when I…

title: Extremely Poor Service, Food Quality and Management
review: We're glad PGA Golf Assn isn't rating this hotel for originality, service standards or decor.  The main lobby is bland, outdated and in need of remodeling.  Walls near the elevators have cushioned sections that appear to be 20 year old decor.  Food and drink in the lobby offers very overpriced menu items which offer horrible service and extremely poor service.  Bellman are "only" interested in tips and are often seen eye-ing down women walking the lobby with critical comments about their figures. One day we decided to spend the day at the pool which then led us to eat at the poolside restaurant.  They were offering an all you can eat lunch buffet which should never have been approved by the Executive Chef.  The buffet food had no sneeze guards, the hot food was sitting in…

title: Average Locale in Palm Beach
review: We stayed Mother's Day weekend, the buffet the morning of at ironwood grille was ok, plenty to choose from, and plenty to go around.  Our Suite was marginal at best. Due to the fact that the balcony was not screened in we had well over a hundred Mosquitos in our room by the end if the night even though the door to the balcony was only open for short periods of time a couple of times throughout the day. The concierge desk we would later Learn was not staffed by someone on the concierge staff but rather someone who was " just filling in" so when we asked for dinning options very little guidance was available through the concierge- not expected for this caliber hotel/resort.

title: Was a big fan, not anymore!! Beware of the Spa front desk staff!!
review: Rooms redecorated & very stark. Before they were elegant & classy. They no longer "stick out" as above standard & now mimic those of chain hotels of average standards. The bartender at the iBar was sooo slow & there were only 2 people sitting there. Check-in was fine & housekeeping ok along with porter, but the Spa experience was a major disappointment. A spa employee who had just returned from 3-wks vacation was rude, rude, rude- on the phone & in person at the check-in desk. Not just to me, but also my friend (2 separate incidences) When my friend, who was also staying in the room with me went to join me at the spa, they would Not let her in without charging her $50. (This fee did not include a spa service) since our room was under my name. That's ridiculous! They made such a…

title: Update- One year since I last stayed there and it is even better.
review: I stayed there last summer and there were some renovations going on.    Everything seems to be done, and the hotel is even better than last year.    The service is always very good, and the front desk is accomodating.  The pool is great and the family loves staying here.  Beautiful golf views from everywhere.  I look forward to my next stay at the PGA.

title: Perfect venue for a wedding
review: My daughter was married this past month at PGA National Resort and Spa in Palm Beach Gardens, FL.  Working with the catering manager, Anna, along with the chef, we planned my daughter's dream wedding. PGA National Resort and Spa is home to 5 golf courses, has a beautiful series of pools, many rooms for functions, including ballrooms for events. The grounds are kept beautifully, although June is off season and it was already humid.  Good thing we had the ceremony inside!    We had 155 people at the wedding and PGA National Resort went out of their way to accommodate our many out of town guests.  They worked beautifully with our wedding planner (Danielle, from Creative Touch Party Design - the best!) and our outside vendors.  The food was exceptional and the staff made the wedding…

title: Horrible custumer service
review: Booked a overnight stay for a wedding at the Resort, arrived at 2pm and my Junior suite was not ready which is ok cause check in is not til 4pm. At 2pm when I arrived front desk told us they were cleaning but could not promisse will be ready anytime soon (lady that helped me barely look at my face), now is 430pm and room still not ready and weeding starts at 530 and 4 of us still need to get ready, anyways they gave us a temporary room to get ready and the Junior suite with double beds we booked we never got it, they switched us to a king size room and a joining double bed room and then tried to charge us resort fee for the extra room. A total nightmare!! What was suppose to make our lives easier staying there for a weeding on site ended up a total waste of $$$! And dont waste…

title: The Great Escape
review: My wife and I had a fabulous time as we do every year when we come for Fathers Day weekend. We love the newly decorated rooms and everthing from the service to the facilities was top notch. The breakfast buffet was delicious, the grill cheese at the poolside bar is the best you'll ever taste, and the Delmonico steak at the Ironwood Grill was cook to perfection. The golf course was in pristene condition and my wife says the Spa alone was worth the trip. PGA always does a superb job of making you feel welcome. We love it here and intend to visit as often as possible.

title: Amazing!
review: We spent a wonderful 5 days at the Resort. We have family that live in the resort and with a 3 year old, we thought having a room of our own may be a better option. SO glad we did! The room was perfect! We had a kitchen table, fridge, a leather sectional and a large balcony! The bathroom area is great with 2 sinks (one in the shower area, one outside) and the only complaint I had was no bathtub. Not only do I enjoy a nice bath, but convincing my son a shower was fun, didn't really work. The lobby is beautiful with a coffee shop that served a nice assortment of hot & cold coffees & breakfast items that we brought back & enjoyed in the room, along with lots of sitting areas and a fantastic large bar. The Spa was wonderful. We took turns going for massages and enjoyed the private…

title: Had a good Stay at PGA
review: We stayed at PGA in June 2013, it is a pretty nice property. The grounds are very clean and manicured. The bellmen and valet are very attentive, the check-in went very smooth. We were in rm# 4042 the room was clean and fresh, looks like a recent renovation. I think the room amenities were lack luster and could have been better quality. Housekeeping service was a bit slow, but that is to be expected now days my guess is it's like every other hotel ( they pile the rooms on the housekeeper and limit her cleaning time instead of having enough staff to do the job properly) Let me guess: 18 rooms and 30 minutes per room, yea, that's not enough time to clean a room properly! We did not eat in the restaurant, there are plenty of great eateries around the area, and hotel restaurants are…

title: Great Father's Day Escape
review: This is our second year going for Father's Day.  The resort does a great job making Father's Day Fun.  The Burger and Beer Bash was fun.  The spa is amazing and the special salted pools make it the perfect place to relax and unwind.  I used my Hotel Inspector UV Stain Finder to examine the cleanliness of the room and it was perfect and clean!

title: Best golf resort we visit
review: Our golf group of 40 players visited PGA Naitional for the fourth time just last week.  The golf courses are first rate and the Ironwood restaurant, the lobby iBar, and poolside facilities make the after-golf experience very enjoyable.  The golf staff takes care of our every need with a smile and asks if there is anything else they can do.  Re-modeling of the lobby, iBar, and rooms looks great and for the most part is very comfortable.  Our bed was a little soft, but that's the only negative among many positives.  We have visited other resorts around the country and we love coming back to PGA National!

title: Burgerbash & Beerfest
review: We stayed at PGA because they had an event held there.  Lovely resort. It was hot outside so we enjoyed the afternoon in the lobby's iBar. The resort itself boasts friendly, helpful staff, delicious food and comfy rooms. I would definately stay there again.

title: Resting on their laurels
review: I'll start off saying I'm not a picky traveller. One learns that not everything is perfect and you strive for a relaxing, enjoyable experience. The impression I get from my stay at PGA National is that the resort thinks it doesn't have to work as hard as its competitors. This visit is part of a 3 resort tour my son and I are taking as part of a golf odyssey. The contrasts are interesting and disappointing. First and foremost is the condition of the golf courses. Each of the resorts are "premium", but the PGA resort is the only one of the three which did not inform of the on-going maintenance on their courses. In fact the other resorts went out of their way to emphasize this during the reservation process. I was able to switch some dates around to maximize the experience. Not so…

title: Second time around
review: We had not such a great time the first time we stayed here back in 2012, this time much better! We had a great meal in the Ironwood Grille, the Champions course was in great condition, although a little wet after all the rain we had recently.  Our room was near all the amenities, breakfast was good, my wife's spa treatment was thoroughly enjoyed evidently, so all in a great couple of nights stay in the resort.

title: Amazing resort, helpful staff, great value!
review: We stayed at the PGA National Resort & Spa on recent family vacation. The golf courses are beautiful, and for the non-golfing family members, there was plenty to do, both on and off site. The resort is located in a great neighborhood, a close distance to many restaurants, two larger malls, and convenient grocery stores. We were so impressed with the staff and how pleasant everyone was that worked at the resort. The on-site bars and restaurants are worth the money, and they do attract a great deal of people, so some nights we chose to get dressed up and go down to the lobby because it was so fun. Would recommend for a couples only OR family trip, you can't go wrong!

title: Beer and Burger Bash - good deal!
review: We took advantage of the Beer and Burgers Bash even being held at the PGA Resort special deal to include the room as well as two tickets to the event.  DEal was great, we were able to enjoy the air conditioned room during the event, and hang out at the pool the next day after brunch in the room, all for a great rate!

title: Excellent Experience
review: My wife and I went down to Disney for our niece's wedding and decided that since we hadn't been able to get away for our own honeymoon (married in Dec. 2012) this would be a perfect time to do just that.  After much research, we choose PGA National as we are avid golfers.  What a great decision!  The staff were all so professional and exceptionally accommodating.  We had such a wonderful - romantic experience. We were originally scheduled to stay there 5 nights, but extended our stay an additional 2 nights as we loved being there. We played golf 4 of the 7 days we were there, relaxed by the pool, and enjoyed several wonderful meals and drinks. We can't wait to come back!

title: Nice stay.  Great Beer and Burger Bash
review: Friends had attended last year's Beer and Burger Bash and also stayed at the hotel.  They talked about how much fun they had so we joined them this year.  We had a great time at the Bash (great promotional deal) and later at the pool.  The property was well maintained and the staff very friendly.  We plan to attend next year's Bash.

title: PGA Resort & Spa
review: PGA Resort & Spa is a complete golf resort. If you want to take a trip to play golf, and you can afford it, this is a great destination.  Rooms and golf are not cheap, but the packages often are very reasonable out of season (January - April). There are five golf courses, one of which hosts the Honda Classic PGA tournament. There are several restaurants on the property and most are pretty pricey ($50-100 for dinner without drinks). Service in all restaurants, the Spa and golf shop was excellent.

title: Great Experience!
review: My wife and I spent our 10 year wedding anniversary at PGA National and enjoyed every minute from the friendliness of the staff, the room accommodations, the Spa (outstanding massage and facials), fitness center, golf course and poll area.  The took exceptional care of us at Ironwedge restaurant and the multiple bars making you feel like a member of their family.....  My wife must have said a dozen times that she can't wait to return to PGA National, considering we were still there it must mean she was really enjoying herself!!  A must stay if you want to get away or have an amazing "stay-cation"!

title: Nice hotel, staff very friendly!
review: I found this hotel thru living social promotion, bookedthis hotel on a whim needing a mini vaca. Staff was very friendly! The supervisor was accommodating towards my son and I. I discoved when i arrived home i left my diamond and gold watch in bathroom at hotel, i called security and they informed me that they had it safe and sound along with my sons suit!! Its nice to know there is still honest customer service that still exists. We happened to be there when trop storm Andrea was in town so therefore we only could use the amazing pool once:( i was slighty worried since my son is 7 and became bored just going out to eat, we asked front desk if there was anything to do for familys in the hotel and she shrugged her shoulders and said there was a pool table downs...(the same…

title: Disappointing Spa
review: I attended a conference at PGA National and tried the spa in the afternoon.  While other areas of the resort are nicely updated, the spa was a huge letdown.  Many areas were dingy with chipped paint, and the bathroom door did not even close! Finishes were so basic in the shower area: it looked like a low-end GYM's shower area. The salon and treatment rooms were nice, as was the waiting room (and they better be to support the prices charged), but the rest of the restroom and locker room desperately need an upgrade.

title: Great golf, good rooms, moderate value.
review: I really enjoyed it here. We were here for 3 nights for a tennis event, and the room rate we got was very reasonable. Everything else here is pretty expensive, which is the only reason for the 4 star instead of 5 star. In my opinion, resorts would actually generate more revenue with different tiers of value in their restaurants. I'm way more inclined to hit up the high end on site restaurant if I haven't been 13 dollar martini'd to death. Once I spend 22 bucks on breakfast and 100 bucks at the pool, I'm ready to go outside the resort to eat dinner and have drinks. So we did, going to the Yardhouse which has above average food for a chain, the Thai place around the corner(excellent) and some place on the water that I'll have to find to write a review for because it was awesome.…

title: Favorite Resort in South Florida
review: The PGA Resort is by far one of our favorite resorts in the world ( and we travel quite a bit to Switz, UK, ect.) The rooms are lovely and spotless. The staff is amazing and always friendly. The spa is a MUST! My husband is a golfer and it is also one of his favorite courses. The pool is our favorite spot and has a great lunch area/bar. The Ironwood Grill is fabulous... My favorite being steak and the lobster ravioli.  We go as often as we can because it is one of our favorite vacation spots! I give you my word you will not be disappointed!!

title: Nice remodeled resort
review: We've been going here for several years and the remodel is complete !  Very nice update and I love the modern contemporary look!  The pool area is very inviting with red loungers all around and a nice relaxing setting.  The lobby is my favorite part of the hotel - very upbeat and cool.  Tons of places to sit with coffee in the morning or drinks and food the rest of the day.  The iBar has the best food in all of the hotel.  Seriously!  Ironwood restaurant very nice ( and very expensive too).  The rooms are nicely furnished with comfy beds.   Lamps that dim, an iHome for your iPhone to charge and play music - little touches like that.   I like the poolside rooms - and the walkout from the first floor is great if you like to go to and from the pool straight from your room.  The…

title: Great stay and great golf
review: Stayed three nights for an annual golf tournament.  A recent $20M renovation really made an already fine resor truly outstanding.  The lobby was beautiful, the pool area stunning and restaurants all high quality.  The room was clean and spacious, the bed comfortable and the staff extremely courteous.  It doesn't hurt to have four high end golf courses attached to the property.  Recommend highly.

title: Spectacular renovation!
review: After a fantastic last visit years ago, we decided to head back to the PGA National Resort for the Memorial Day weekend.  The big surprise was their incredible renovation.  The impact of walking into the exquisite lobby was stunning.  What a great job the management has done in taking a great golf resort & only making it better!  The rooms were beautifully appointed as well.  Their golf operation is second to none.  Service was top-notch, overall.  We will gladly make the drive from Miami to once again enjoy the incredible PGA National experience!

title: Wonderful Time!
review: PGA National offers everything you need and want in a resort! Centrally located to shopping and the beaches! Love the Spa and the golf courses are the best around! What more could you ask for?!? Quick little getaway for us!! We'll be back!!

title: 3 of 5 Stars for what calls itself a 4-star hotel
review: Perhaps this would be a better review if I were on a business trip, but for pleasure, I give it 3.5 of 5 stars based on the caliber of hotel this hotel considers itself. And, it depends what you're looking for. To contrast, we stayed at the Four Seasons in Palm Beach later in our trip and it was an entirely different experience - 5 of 5. We chose to spend a night here for what seemed like a wonderful spa/golf package.  The decor is dark and a bit dated. Lots of testosterone flowing in this joint. Staff is friendly and accommodating, but doesn't go out of their way to do anything unexpected. Which is fine. It's a bit cheesy/Vegas-feeling. And there were some things that just didn't work for me.  The gym is dated and a bit of a walk from the hotel. The spa is beautiful, but my…

title: Great experience
review: Annual golf outing with 7 friends,best outing in years.Golf villas were older but clean and comfortable.Golf was well organized and staff was knowledgable and courteous.Would highly recommend and will return.

title: Amazing Spa
review: From the first moment I walked into the Spa I was treated like royalty. My lomi lomi massage was complete heaven followed by the rejuvinating waters of the worlds pools. The cherry on my heavenly spa sundae was being delivered drinks while I enjoyed the pools!!! I loved every minute of my spa day and booked my next one that same day!!

title: 2nd time, and there won't be a third
review: We were a group of 10 staying in the Villa for a friends 40th birthday spa getaway.  2 years ago, most of us were in the same 2 villas for a different friend's birthday.  There haven't been any changes. Word to the wise, if you book a villa, they are privately owned, so the resort seems pretty detached and not very involved in the overseeing of the villas.  We were supposed to be in an updated villa and it wasn't...so they switched us to a different villa. There were not enough towels, and took almost 2 hours for towels to be brought too us.  At the spa, we had several issues, some of the girls were not happy with their treatments, they made a mistake of another appointment and didn't book the correct time.  The best part about the spa was the pool attendant who works so hard,…

title: Factory - Best as a corporate outing/stay
review: We reserved a room for one night. Though there weren't any real problems with anything it was underwhelming. We live nearby so it was all very easy for us. But if we were flying down for some golf and a vacation we would have been very let down.  The room was small, dark and one old sliding door to a balcony that was almost all wall and looked out over a small courtyard filled with mud and water. The service I have to say was efficient, if only moderately pleasant. We played the Champion course...be prepared for a 5+ hour round. They are constantly shuttling people out on the course, the others courses are fine but very forgettable. The Champion Course is solid course, if unattractive.

title: Nice resort sub-par room
review: We stayed here for one night to get away from the children. Overall the experience was nice but the major drawback was the room. The room was a nice size  but had a horrible patio area. I would request a different room if you are given room 1001. The back patio backs up to a 10 foot concrete wall. The room has carpet floors as well which isn't great for allergies. Otherwise the facilities are nice. The golf was fun the bar's, resturants, and spa was great. I would go back again for the right price.

title: Underwhelmed
review: I was very excited to take this trip to PGA National Resort.  Unfortunately this resort is resting on its name alone.  Let's just sum it up like this.  Newly refurnished rooms were reasonable, but not on par with other top end resorts where we have stayed.  The staff was horrible at the IBar.  When one of our group asked if they were adding 18% gratuity on his bar bill, the bar tender mocked him and said "The 18% is just the start, you should tip me more just for waiting on you!"  The service was the same every where other than the spa and fitness center.  I would give that crew an A+.  The Manager of the Resort needs to go back to training regarding customer service, and then hire a new team.  We also asked for a car to drive us to the Gardens Mall.  $60 round trip, are you…

title: Outstanding Resort Experience
review: From the time of arrival to departure the staff and facility at this 1st Class location continued to impress us.  The friendly staff was more than curteous.  After the first day servers in the restaurant began to call us by name and made us feel very relaxed as we enjoyed great meals in the IronWood restaurant as well as the Ibar and Terrace Restaurant.  I found this to be very impressive considering the number of guest and the size of the facility.  We played 3 of the 5 golf coursed and each was in top notch condition and presented their own unique layouts and challenges...watch out for the Bear Trap on the Championship course!  The rooms were beautiful and very comfortable with attention to every detail.  If your a golfer, don't miss the chance to play the courses where the…

title: Relax and be pampered
review: For a restful, relaxing and pampered vacation the PGA Resort and Spa is for you. The spa is noted for the variety of treatments and the Waters of the World mineral pools that silkens your body. The golf is world renown as is the tennis. Fitness facilities, endless pools, a choice of delicious eateries, and the delightful Ibar serving the drinks of your choice makes this resort one that you will not want to leave.  But if you like shopping there are luxury malls close by. My suggestion is to stay and enjoy every minute of this fabulous resort.

title: Great experience
review: Excellent experience, children- pet friendly... Cleanliness was a plus... Our group package was excellent!! We were treated with courtesy & professionalism! Kids had agreat time and enjoyed their stay.. Safety was also a plus..

title: Poor service and isolated.
review: After spending 12 hours recovering from horrific food poisoning received from eating fish tacos at the pool, I found the location to be isolated.  We thought we would take a taxi down the road 5 miles to the mall and spend some time shopping and eating food not prepared in burning sun.  The hotel was kind enough to offer us their car the. Told us it was 30 each way!  We waited for a 10 dollar taxi. I think the most burning issue was the very poor service received at the pool.  Not once in 5 days to anyone ask if they could get us a drink or water or anything for that matter.  So whenever we wanted a drink we got up from our spots and hiked to the bar where we were charged an immediate 18% gratuity.  Had any of their emoyees standing around watching the Arias murder trial stopped…

title: Simply the best!
review: My second time at PGA Resort and Spa.  Golf was the primary focus of our trip and again everything from the pickup at the airport through every meal, drink, round of golf was simply THE BEST you could ask for.  The employees are amazing, professional, efficient and friendly. You will want for nothing. The 100 million dollar renovations to the Resort and Spa left nothing out. Golf - what can you say five courses including the new Fazio and of course the Champion are beautiful and fun for any golfer.

title: Golf Vacation
review: We spent a 4 day golf vacation here and thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. The golf courses and staff were all above average. We also took advantage of the pools and exercise facilities. The restaurants and lounge areas were excellent as well. We would all come back again without question.

title: Repeat Visitor - Unreal Changes!! Love Palm Beach and PGA National
review: Has been nearly a year since I have spent time at PGA National. I prefer the golf experience here over almost any other domestic resort trip I have taken. I was floored by the changes to the resort. The lobby was the first hint that things had been upgraded, with new finishes in many of the public locations including a fantastic product in the elevator. I had booked a Junior Suite and it was completely upgraded, new rooms, fantastic colors, televisions, bar area, and everything looked great. Then I played the courses, the Fazio has been completely redone and is my favorite, the greens were incredible. Played the Champ for a PGA tournament golf experience and it still tests every part of your game. Play the right tees and you will have a great time. I won't wait over a year to…

title: Great location for a confrence
review: I stayed at PGA last week for a corporate event and while I did not think that the hotel itself was anything special, it was an enjoyable stay. The best think about PGA is the staff and of course the golf (I do not play). I blew a fuse in my room and was told you cannot use the coffee pot and hair dyer at the same time or the fuse goes and all the lights go out...not fun when you are in a hurry getting dressed in the morning for presentations that you cannot be late to. Oddly, there were also not enough bathrooms in public areas and I spent more time then I would have liked walking to the ladies room or waiting in lines. It was a small detail that made my stay less pleasant. Overall this is a nice place, but at this price point there are some details that need to be tended to.

title: Golf getaway and more
review: With 5 different courses to chose from you are bound to enjoy your golf trip. They all play differently, and the signature Champions course is truly something special. It is great to be able to walk out of your room and onto the course. There is 1 course 7 miles away and it is worth playing. The restaurant there is also excellent (Ironwood) and they were always able to accomodate our large group of 10 guys. And the I-Bar is a great place to meet for dinks, inside and out.  **** take advantage of the coupons in the passport they give you at check in. You can save a bundle on alcohol, especially with a large group.  In between rounds the pool is a great place to chill out. And the restaurant at the pool offers a better menu than the one at the "19th hole".  This was my second golf…

title: Clean and comfortable
review: Nice facility...clean rooms and helpful staff.  The golf/pro shop employees, courses and practice facilities were great!  If you are a pool person, best to pay a small fee for the "Waters of the World" pools that are part of the spa than the "main pool" at the hotel...it is quiet and has more attentive & personal service...and you can use the spa steam/sauna/shower facility, too.  The spa services were top-notch, I had a massage and facial - and even got a haircut...talented, experienced and professional staff at the spa.  The lobby bar is a great place to people watch and grab a bite to eat.  The Ironwood Restaurant was excellent.  The difference at this hotel vs. others is the friendly staff!  From eager-to-please housekeeping to Roosevelt (the smiling pool attendant), from…

title: Beautiful hotel, wonderful facilities and staff
review: I attended a meeting at this hotel and I was really impressed with how beautiful the hotel, the restaurants and the grounds were. All of the staff members that we encountered were pleasant and very helpful. Berlin in the restaurant was particularly helpful with special food needs. We will be back to spend more time here!

title: Nice remodeling and great service
review: The whole place feels brand new, carpet, restaurants, even the golf courses were redone. Lobby bar is cool and steakhouse is great.  Champions course is in better shape than Pebble, Doral, and St. Andrews.  Staff is very friendy, feels like a Four Seasons.  Rooms are average in size but clean and the remodel has a good design (lighting, outlets, etc).

title: Friendly Staff
review: The staff are friendly and are always helpful. It's a good place to stay and very clean as well. I wasn't sure of the dates that I would actually stay there but they were all patient on me. Thanks so much!

title: Extra costs for business travel
review: Enjoyed the beautiful lobby and comfortable rooms. I'm not sure if it was because my group was on the government rate, but they charged extra for both the wifi and to use the gym. I think the gym closed pretty early too. So I just ended up just running the flat 5 mile loop around the hotel. It was a sidewalk run around the neighborhoods with views of homes and the golf courses. Nothing too spectacular, but it got the job done. Overall, it's a nice hotel with a cool lobby and fun outdoor pool area.

title: All I can say is wow!!
review: Very nice resort! The front desk staff was VERY helpful and friendly. The bar in the lobby is perfect to relax after a long flight or a long day of traveling or work. The rooms...impressive! Plenty of space and everything you need is right in the room. Nice size tv mounted on the wall. I had a deluxe king room and the king size bed was AMAZING (so soft you didn't want to get up)!! Beautiful pools, great dining options on site (though I chose to drive to Friday's a few miles east)...overall very nice!

title: Decent stay - a few minor issues with 20% extra charged to credit card for all purchases for no real reason
review: Nice clean comfortable rooms. Overall nice hotel for non golfers. Place was noisy at check in as there was a "social meetup" going on in the looby/bar and a lot of people were getting pretty hammered. We got to our room OK, parking was free but there is a $25 "resort fee" for wifi, a newspaper that I never received, and because they have a fitness center or something? Anyways, we got room service for dinner, it was really good actually, much better quality of food than I expected. It came out to $70 with 6% tax and 18% gratuity included, but they charged 20% over that to my card ($84). Upon inquiring why that is at checkout, the front desk clerk replied that it is standard to charge 20% over for everything and surely my GF checked her iphone and her card was charged extra on the…

title: Great Bartenders
review: I enjoyed several excellent evenings at the I-Bar where Kate and Marie were both very attentive to our party's needs, acted in a professional manner and made my stay very enjoyable.  I highly recommend this stop as part of your PGA National experience.

title: Ashley is the bomb shiznit
review: For a golf vacation the place is great. play the champions course if you have the opportunity. Be ready to spend some money though. Great place, great golf. Bar is a good time.  Ashley treated us like family and always had a smile on her face. Would go back all the time if I lived closer.

title: Nice Property and Good Service
review: This was my third stay at the PGA National, and the property continues to impress.  The rooms were updated nicely since a year ago, as were some of the common areas.  All in all, it's a very pretty property, and it makes for a very pleasant stay.  The service level was also very high.  The staff always tried to be helpful, and to attempt to go above and beyond.  In a place like this, unfortunately, the minor glitches stand out.  It seemed like it had the world's slowest wireless Internet connections, the air conditioning units seem to be programmed to shut themselves off periodically (annoying when coming back to the room on a hot day, and more so when Engineering seemed to have no idea how to get the units to stay on), and who was it that decided that bathroom doors in the…

title: Golfer s paradise with excellent spa!
review: My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful week of golf and relaxation!  We played one to two rounds each day and enjoyed the salt bathes each afternoon.   The spa was excellent and the manager Cecilia was great!  Loved my facial and massage.  The staff made me feel so relaxed.  Our room was lovely and very southern sophisticated decor.    The food was just okay at the resort.  The highlight for us was playing golf.   We hope to be back very soon!

title: Nice Resort away from the Beach
review: This was our 4th trip to PGA National and it is definitely a full service resort.  Even though we didn't golf on any of our trips we found plenty to do on the resort when we weren't attending Cardinals Spring Training games.  My wife LOVES the Spa and they have a separate "quiet" pool that Spa guests can use all day long if the have a service scheduled that day.  The main pool has a nice bar/restaurant so you can hang out all day.  The iBar is a happening place nearly every night and the Ironwood Grille is a nice restaurant if you just want to stay on the property.  The only detraction is the wireless capability doesn't extend out to the pool so I wasn't able to access some content on my iPad when we were pool side.  The rooms are nice and fairly large.  All in all a nice place…

title: All about the Golf
review: Traveled here with a group of friends to play some golf. Overall a good experience, although I would not stay here if it wasn't for the golf. Golf was very good, courses in great shape. Our preference in order: Champion, Palmer, Fazio, Squire.  Rooms were clean and perfect for what we needed. Very comfortable beds. Food as expected was a little pricey. Pro shop a little disorganized each morning we checked in to play. Four individual slips for the starter, plus slow computers, and as advised we checked out prior to playing on our last day and this cause a delay. No big deal, but I've seen it done more efficiently. Sometimes golf bags were waiting, sometime only a couple, other times none. Pool was super busy and no chairs were free. Lots of towels, shoes, and other objects…

title: Golf courses are great. The rest of it, not so much.
review: I've stayed at PGA National for business meetings three times now over the past five years and I always come away only moderately satisfied with the experience. The hotel is fine -- about on par with a run-of-the-mill Hilton or Marriott property. The lobby is large and loud with the bar planted right in the middle.  The golf courses are great once you get out on them. The pro shop is always crowded as they are trying to get groups out on their several courses from one desk. The staging area is a sea of golf carts and frenetic energy, with members and resort guests scrambling to get to their respective tees. The pool areas are good, with ample space for sunning, but no food allowed on the pool deck due to scavenger bird issues. Overall, PGA National is an acceptable place for a…

title: Loved PGA National Resort
review: Even though I don't play golf, I loved my five-night stay at PGA National Resort and Spa. My room was larger than the typical hotel room, had a long desk ideal for netbook computer set-up and also had a refrigerator, balcony, and double vanity. Microwave would have been nice but not critical. Resort features free parking plus proximity to Florida Turnpike, I-95, Atlantic beaches, Roger Dean Stadium, malls, and West Palm Beach International Airport. Despite an active, noisy lobby, guest rooms are soundproofed well and there are lots of TV channel choices, as well as pay-to-view movies. PGA staff is professional, polite, and willing to go beyond the call of duty, as they did on several occasions. That training stems from the top, so GM Joel Paige deserves high praise. Loved the…

title: Sub-par (pun intended) accommodations
review: Although the golfers in the group were happy with the courses, the hotel left a lot to be desired. Slow check in, room keys did not work and required multiple trips to the front desk, Internet password did not work (despite two calls to the front desk), coffee bar in the lobby left on unstaffed and guests stood around waiting to see if someone would show up. The room was only partly made up one of the four nights we stayed. The spa was more of a "run 'em through" than an experience and there was an odd added charge at the end of the facial for something was only casually mentioned during the procedure. Check out was also messy as a golf lesson was double billed. Apparently the facility's getting a renovation but much of it was well worn and clearly needed updating.

title: Great Place but poor service diminishes rating
review: I went to PGA Resort  for a convention, arriving a Saturday for 4 nights. Front desk staff was nice and found us a room early in the day allowing us to settle in our room before our 11:30 Tee time. Well that was the only good experience with staff until the last bellman who finally located our golf clubs after they were "misplaced" for over 12 hrs.  We played golf 3 times in 4 days and the staff at the pro shop was bordering rude and surely didn't care about helping. Tournament personnel for our group outing was adequate... but after the games even the people at the bar were not very friendly. Many of the people part of my group were exchanging stories of bad service throughout... maybe we were spoiled from other venues and we shouldn't expect so much but still at the price you…

title: Excellent service
review: Pool staff was extremely helpful, friendly and understanding (on an unexpectedly cold Jan. day). Staff members provided plenty of towels and free hot chocolate for the kids who, despite the cold weather, were determined to keep swimming (much appreciated by us parents).

title: Too focused on squeezing every dollar
review: This was my third visit and regrettably it was very disappointing as it seemed to me that the quality of the hotel has declined in so many small ways while the price keeps on going up. At check-in, the Front Desk staff couldn't deal with that one person in our annual group made all four reservations and they mis-assigned the rooms including leaving one of our group without the junior suite that we had booked. Lunch at the pool was pedestrian at best and overpriced. At the lobby bar on two nights, service was almost impossible to get and the waitress was surly and complained to us that they were understaffed. To add insult to injury, the hotel charges a $25.00 per day Resort Fee and they include a coupon for two drinks (non-premium liquors only). Several attempts were made to use…

title: Nice resort, rooms could use updating
review: We stayed here for a few days for a conference just before the Honda Classic and were put up in one of the Club Cottages. The room itself was impressive although a little pricey. Our room was nice too in that there were two full bathrooms and two bedrooms each with two queen beds. there was a kitchenette, living room and dining room as well. Unfortunately it's quite apparent that the rooms need some updating. Apart from it being basically an apartment I would say it's really only equivalent to 3 star accommodations. Nothing to complain about certainly, but not worth what they're charging either. It's not terrible, I was just expecting more from them.  Another thing that disappointed me was the customer service. At the resort, no problem. However, I believe I lost something there…

title: Will stay there every time.
review: This hotel is wonderful. The room was very clean. All the staff were attentive, they knew your name and had such a pleasant demeaner. Helpful in everyway. The decor was excellent and just the whole atmosphere is relaxing. The pool area is phenomenal. The spa staff are friendly and professional and get you in right away. Spa facilities are beautiful and the spa pool area is incredible.

title: Fun Time at PGA National
review: Recently spent three nights at PGA National right before the Honda Classic. Our room was nice but somewhat dated in decor. Bed and bedding was very good. Their in room WiFi was awful and very undependable. Tried three times to get connections and spent way too much of my time with a Tech guy over the phone trying to get it working. Grounds are first class and golf round was outstanding. The place is very pricey everywhere but then it is high season for them. Maybe go back at some lower season time.

title: Amazing place, can't wait to come back
review: Stayed here  September23-28 2012 and I can honestly say the staff here are amazing, after a mild mix up with my room the staff did everything they could to make it right and that they did!!!!!!! They went above and beyond to make sure our stay was enjoyable, after all mistakes happen and I feel it's all about how they are dealt with and handled.The staff are super friendly and after the first day the gentlemen in the Pro Shop knew you by name and always greeted you in a professional manner.  Can't wait to visit again soon!!!!!!

title: Uniquely able to make everyone in the family happy
review: This is the 4th time I've stayed at PGA over the last 6 years.  What makes the hotel great is this: they have great golf, a great spa and a great pool, so everyone in the family is happy.  The facility was freshened up about 8 months ago and it shows, especially in the breakfast room downstairs, the lobby and the opening of new facilities, such as 91 (a restaurant by the pro shop). The hotel is right off of the Florida turnpike and also easy to get to from I95 (about 15 minutes from PBI).  The hotel, in general, is masculine leaning, from the overall style to its cigar shop on the premises (though its not owned by the hotel) but is feminine enough to deliver a nice, friendly feeling.  There is a great bar area right in the lobby with live entertainment on the weekends.  The bill…

title: Business and Pleasure
review: Outstanding resort. Gorgeous grounds. this was a business/pleasure trip. Enjoyed myself thouroughly. Food was scrumptious. the spa..the spa oh that was to die for! The pool area was gorgeous. Very professional staff. Smoothie bar excellent!

title: PGA Spa Day
review: My friend and I were not staying at the resort.  We were in a private home and just visiting the spa.  What a great experience.  First class all the way.  We never felt rushed and everyone was so nice.  After our services, we went outside to the mineral pools for the afternoon and enjoyed a wonderful lunch.  What a great relaxing day.

title: PGA Resort and Spa Unbundling
review: Nice place overall for the convention I attended.  Golf courses of course are excellent.  Room and food okay, nothing to rave about.  The issue I had was that even the front desk is not aware of new charges they are imposing on their guests...charges you are not advised of when you check in.  Sends a very bad message as to who is in charge.

title: Fun bar inside and great pool
review: I wasn't staying at the resort, just visiting. On a Thursday, we went to the iBar and it was a pretty hoppin' place around 10:30pm. I had two Mojitos and they were great! Also tried the quesadilla...it was good but over priced. My mom ordered the chili which looked fantastic. Earlier they had great happy hour prices and specials..too bad we missed those due to flight delays :( It was a fun bar, some people were really dressed up and others were very casual. Anything goes. On Sunday we checked out the pool area. What a lovely pool with nice padded lounge chairs. The pool grill didn't open until 11:30 but they were nice enough to make us daiquiri's anyways. We had lunch there later and it was good too.

title: Conference at the PGA National
review: Great place to have a multiday conference.  Accommodation and services are excellent.  Great courses as well as activities for spouses and children.  A vacation spot to combine with a conference and have something for everyone.

title: Not upper class, very high class
review: This hotel was very high class and since I booked through Expidia they charged me 25.00 per night for what the called a hotel fee charge, that includes the coffee in your room,2 complimentary drinks from the bar, parking(had no choice to park the hotel is 10 min. Drive from the main road)' use of the facilities,. We checked in at 11 pm and checked out at 8am. We were told that if we stay 2 nights the service fee would be waived. Very nice place for people with very deep pockets.

title: Needs a facelift
review: Great spa for spoiling oneself. But the rooms need a facelift. Also the rooms need soundproofing. I thought my room was under a disco, but then the next morning realized it was only another guestroom above me. In the hallway I heard several peoples private phone conversations from their rooms. I was walking down the hall and could clearly hear them talking on the phone. Not the place place for discretion.  The staff however was superb.

title: Updated property with a beautiful pool and GREAT food.
review: Stayed for a conference for 8 days. I didn't golf but its an absolutely beautiful course. The rooms are recently redone and they are fresh.  The food was excellent.  My #1 complaint is the automatic gratuity added to everything. What it means is slow and I believe poorer service because they get a grat of 18% regardless of the service provided.

title: A lovely property - with room for improvement.
review: Just returned from a 3-night stay at this resort. Was there on business for a conference. It is a nice hotel, especially if you play golf. Since I cannot yet count that among my talents, I generally prefer to stay at beach properties. That said, the PGA resort is definitely a great place to stay, to enjoy the atmosphere and relax. There is a world class spa (which unfortunately I did not have the opportunity to experience, and their swimming pools are well maintained , with the lounge chairs all around getting terrific sun exposure. I think a big plus for families with small/young children is that the main pool has a zero-entry.  The front desk was helpful and professional and courteous, as was the rest of the hotel staff in general.   The decor, especially in the main lobby,…

title: Golf facilities are high quality but the hotel management need to understand that customers need good service at these prices!
review: My wife and I had a 3 day stay with 3 rounds of golf that included the champion course - total cost $2500 - so we would expect good standards and great service. The organisation of the golf was first rate with your clubs and buggies ready and waiting for you, practice facilities great and drink stations and buggy food service all working well. Playing the Champion course 2 weeks before the Honda Classic you have to expect the rough to be penal and....it certainly was! Only the Squire course had greens with rogue grasses in places but they still played well...it also had a resident alligator that was just massive! The hotel however has a few issues mentioned by previous writers - the foyer / bar area is far too noisy & difficult to get served between 6 -8pm. The piped music in…

title: A very nice place to relax, even if you don't play golf
review: This resort is very expensive, but it's worth it. The grounds are immaculate and the landscaping is beautiful.  The lobby is huge and has a very nice bar/eating area.  The main pool area is really nice.  There are plenty of lounge chairs, so you don't have to grab one early, and the pool is warm.  There is poolside bar service, as well as a very nice poolside cafe for lunch and beverages.  Most of the afternoon, there was very pleasing live music.  My friends were impressed by the PGA golf courses, but my wife and I are not golfers.  Instead we enjoyed the Spa area and Waters of the World pools.  The Spa has two very small pools and a Jaccuzzi that are in a relatively secluded part of the resort.  The Spa has poolside bar service, which I particularly enjoyed.  My wife…

title: Relaxing at the Spa
review: Always enjoy the professional level of the Spa at the PGA. The Waters of the World Pools add to the experience with a healthful lunch served by a friendly staff. I have been going to the PGA for many years and will come back soon. Rooms have been renovated comfortably with a modern appearance, very nice. However, the lighting in the king suite room is inadequate. Great staff will accommodate your needs. Great value for this lovely Golf and Spa resort.

title: PGA Resort below the par
review: From not being given a room with the bed size guaranteed to a $50 shuttle ride down the street for a quick trip to the mall, many aspects of his hotel did not add up!   The "upgrade" to the available room with the king size bed was an up charge to us regardless of the hotel's ill planning so confirm your confirmation when booking.   To top it off, we were given a handicapped accessible room without inquiry as to our choice of it. It was inconvenience for my husband, who is very tall, with all the lowered accommodations.  I had to iron on the bed since the board was not standard size.  Further, on numerous occasions the card keys for the door locks did not work. Then we could not get the door to lock upon leaving! This is always a sticking point for me in a hotel!    The most…

title: Golfing is good but cottages are mediocre at best.
review: My friends and I just recently came back from staying and playing at the PGA National Resort and Spa.   First of all we found the service to be very good and professional.  As soon as you pull up to the bag drop off, there is someone there to greet you and to get you all squared away with your stay.   Just remember to bring a lot of dollar bills because you will likely be tipping a lot during your stay.  You'll probably tip the guy taking your clubs out of the car.  After each round they will have someone come up to your cart right away and they will start cleaning up your clubs.  If you use their van service to get you to and from your cottage expect to tip.   The only downside of this resort is the cottages.  They need some updating and new beds.   Our cottage was a 2 bedroom…

title: Not the quality one would expect for the price!
review: The number one reason to visit PGA National is to play golf, and there are multiple courses of variable difficulty to choose from. My complaint isn't with the quality of the courses. It is with what you get for the money. We were charged a premium to play the Champion Course, but as they were readying it for the Honda Classic, the greens had been sanded, and the resulting putting conditions were terrible. We had a group of 20 golfers for 5 days and 7 rounds of golf. Arrangements had been made months in advance, yet PGA was "unable" to give us rooms anywhere near each other. We were spread out over 4 floors. This was problematic the last day as they made us vacate our rooms before our morning round (no late checkout) and move all of our luggage to 3 rooms separated by 2 floors. …

title: A luxurious room, great food and a fabulous golf experience
review: I stayed two nights at the PGA National Resort in the "Media Suite", which had more TVs than I have eyeballs, a Bose sound system, a luxurious bedroom and bath, and a charming little balcony overlooking the pool, shaded by a massive palm tree that provided great privacy.  Service was fantastic, starting with the great doormen and parking valets, to the reception and bell desks.  The housekeeping was immaculate.  I was particularly impressed by the breakfast buffet in the 1st floor cafe.  The scrambled eggs were buttery and delicious, the best I've ever had from a buffet steam table.  My server, Nadine, was most gracious and friendly.  Additionally, my dinner with friends at the Ironwood restaurant was extraordinary.  Our server, David, provided wonderful recommendations for wine…

title: Golf staff dismissive and unresponsive
review: I've played all the courses here more than once.  This resort has very good courses on site, but overall still a poor value. We had our tee times changed without notification and got no apology when we asked why.  They claimed to call us at which time we pulled out our phones and showed our call history.  We were then just told very dismissively that we were re-booked 2 hours later.  We also got no response from the teaching director when we tried to sign up for our pre-paid clinic.  We spent over $2000 for 3 nights stay and golf.  There are much better values and either the 4 Seasons or Ritz provides much better service.

title: Amazing!
review: We greatly enjoyed our stay at the PGA.  Although we didn't have enough time to enjoythe Spa and Golf grounds, it all looked spectacular.  The rooms are gorgeous with modern finishes.  Best part, we had the chance to bring our dog with us!

title: Great golf destination that your significant other will like too.
review: Outstanding golf resort. All courses on site and very enjoyable to play. Atmosphere of resort is relaxed casual. Ironwood Rest quite good.  Service throughout resort was excellent. My favorite coursed in order were Championship, Palmer and Fazio. Pool restaurant was a great spot after golf

title: What a place
review: i have been coming to this great resort for over 25 years it is fab  Amazing Golf on the course that has hosted Ryder Cup,PGA seniors and now Honda Classic Rooms have just been refurbished,great new food outlets and quite simply the most attentive staff around  Terrific value and also tennis spa and fitness centre are all world class see you there next xmas

title: A Great Stay
review: After many years the hotel has undergone a major much needed renovation. The rooms, common areas, restaurants and pool area are beautiful.. Service in the lobby at I bar was excellent. The food at Ironside Restaurant was very good but service poor once the restaurant got busy. All in all a nice stay.

title: PGA National
review: My wife and I attended a trade show in Jan., 2013. The hotel just completed a multi million dollar remodeling and it showed. The furniture was new and the room was spacious. The room lighting in the bedroom was marginal, but the living room was bright and cheerful. The cost was high, even by Palm Beach Gardens standards in season, but we were very comfortable. The meeting rooms were in good condition and the chairs were comfortable.  The golf was awesome, albeit very expensive!! Four golf courses on site, with the Champion being the best by far (also the most expensive.

title: Very poor value and below average customer service
review: I am specifically addressing the hotel.  The golf is top notch, but still a marginal value.  The room was $300/night (with tax and "resort fee").  The room was old (the door and doorknob were beat up), ants were everywhere, and the noise insulation is poor.  After I checked in, a maid barged into my room as I was changing (in my underwear thank goodness) and she acted like I was squatting; she clearly was not aware that someone had checked in.  Approximately 30 minutes later, a couple keyed into my room because the front desk did not know I was here.  The whole set-up in the check-in area is chaotic: There is a huge (albeit nice) open space bar in the reception area, but is very odd.  The concierge service is poor:  I needed a cab to the airport, but the concierage would only…

title: Over priced
review: We stayed here for a conference and were quite disappointed. It might be renovated but I wouldn't call it luxury. The rooms weren't very clean and many details were overlooked. I have stayed at nicer Hampton inns for much less.

title: Great golf destination with plenty to do!
review: The beds were so comfy! The pool area is awesome and the golf courses were great. We played 4 out of the 5 courses and they were all in great shape and we spent our afternoons relaxing by the pool.  The ironwood grill was tremendous and the entire staff of the whole resort were great. Our experience could not have been better

title: great place to stay in palm beach gardens
review: Stayed here over Thanksgiving and enjoyed it all.  The original hotel must be about 30 years old, but appears that it was completely remodeled in the past 2-3 years. Pool was warm enough in late November, which was great for the kids.  Also the poolside bar/café had decent food at reasonable (for hotels) prices. We would stay here again

title: Golfing heaven but an average resort
review: We booked fall golfing packages and stayed at the hotel for a week between  1-7 Dec 2012. The golf experience was nothing short of perfect. The pro shop, very professional, well informed and courteous at all times. The 5 golf courses well maintained, and managed. The service at the Bear Trap cafe, prompt and courteous. The second round of golf available on request (we took advantage of it being free included in the package, and always available). If you want to play golf and do little else, there are very few places in Florida to match the experience. This gets the golf experience a 5 star rating.   On the other hand, the hotel/resort experience was rather average. The rooms were made late in the day, the live music at night was loud, the 2 sports TV screens blasting at the same…

title: For what they charge, they could do MUCH better.
review: We stayed for a few days during the week and what a disappointment.  We had to wait for everything and the golf was the biggest disappointment of all.  We drove over to the golf course (which is next to the hotel) because our clubs were in the car and we were out anyway.  We were told they would take the clubs but there was no room for the car so we would have to go back to the hotel and walk over ( really?) They then charged us $378 PER PERSON to play on the "Championship Course"  not even remotely worth it considering Pebble Beach is cheaper. The caddie although very nice, didn't really have a clue, he would take my husbands putter to the green, but not mine.    Then at 4:00pm the cartgirl came by to tell us this was the last time we'd see her ( we still had 9 holes to go- at…

title: Classy home away from home with fringe benefits!! Worth the price, promise!
review: PGA is a great, quick w/e getaway.  It's a place that embraces style, professional courtesy & laid back luxury among those who enjoy camaraderie in hobbies worth sharing with friends & strangers alike. A must stay for the happy weary looking to embrace the beauty of life in a w/e jaunt. Or, you could take up residence there, if so inclined:-) Go & enjoy your stay every time!!

title: Amazing place for a Vacation or Stay-cation!!!
review: My family and I had the pleasure of spending this past weekend at PGA National Resort and Spa. We could not have been more please with our experience! From the moment we arrived, we were greeted and treated with the most generous display of customer service. Our room was spectacular and very modern looking. We have stayed at the Resort several times in the past and were thrilled to see the improvements not only of the rooms, but the "facelift" of the entire resort was done with such style. Their slogan Undeniably Hot, Unexpectedly Cool is a perfect description! Very classy, yet not stuffy. This is the first time we brought our children to the Resort and found it to be very family friendly. The pool area is spectacular and a great place to lounge for the day. The iBar and…

title: Good for golfers and kids(at Christmas)
review: They go out of there way to make this kids friendly. Slides. Glows tick golf petting zoo pony rides. Good golf though need package because overpriced otherwise. Rooms good size but housekeeping very poor. Left area unclean,didn't remove dirty glasses and didn't even make up sofa bed but rather kept the sheets and blackest as they were and just folded the sofa. The housekeepers don't speak English well and sign on housekeepers cart states that and says to call housekeeping if you have problem rather that speaking to the housekeeper who is here

title: Superb Family Golf Vacation Value
review: My husband and I and two teenage children traveled down to the PGA over the Christmas holiday to play some golf and take some lessons.
