The hotel was offering a special rate which included the golf rounds, carts, club storage and breakfast buffet.  We had early tee-times each day and our carts and clubs were ready when we checked-in.  The breakfast buffet offered both hot and cold selections, enough to satisfy different tastes. There is also the Cafe Pronto to get a quick breakfast bread and coffee, if in a hurry.  We ate at Ironwood on Christmas evening which offered a price fixe menu, the Palm Terrace, Bar 91 and ordered room service.  The food was tasty and the service was friendly and expeditious.  We enjoyed several spa services, including the salt pools. Although check-in…

title: Festival Field Hockey Stay
review: Travelling from Orange County, CA I was surprised to see that West Palm Beach looked a lot like home just more spacious with bigger buildings, LOTS of gated communities and much less traffic. (like Murrieta)  Unfortunately, since we were here for the big Field Hockey event, visiting the beach didn't happen so I cannot compare the beaches. We also did not play golf. With that said, I can say that the International Polo Fields are exquisite.   Our stay was during Thanksgiving week and the hotel was mostly booked up with field hockey players playing in the largest field hockey tournament called Festival. The front desk said they were sold out the whole week. (I felt sorry for the golfers who came for a golfing Thanksgiving week as they were overrun by teenagers)  Our Junior Suite…

title: Will not return
review: Charging $6 + tax for a bottle of water when the tap water was undrinkable was cruel. Charging over $50 for a "complimentary" pick-up at the airport & another $50 for return when there is no other means of transportation is not cool.  The "Ironwood" restaurant was way over-priced.  We are gourmet diners, this was not.  No, we will not be returning to this so-called resort. Ever!

title: I'll never go back
review: This hotel is in desperate need of renovation. The fitness center has equipment from the 80s, old carpet, old towels, just overall a terrible environment. The lobby looks worn as well. Our rooms were big and decent, comfortable beds but hallways have low ceilings and are dark and dingy.   The pool area is nice and big, but the restaurant at the pool is undersized,overpriced and pretty disgusting. If you bring in food from the outside into the pool area the attendants chase you out, however revolting cigars and dogs sitting on chaise lounges are acceptable. The buffet breakfast is passable but also overpriced. The staff at the front desk is unfriendly and could not provide any concierge type service when the concierge was not around, which was essentially never.   Stay as far…

title: Big NOOOOOO!!!!!!!!! CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK TO LONDON!!!
review: We came to this resort after a junior golf series of competitions to celebrate New Year's Eve with the family.   We had dinner at the Ironwood restaurant, we had never experienced such agony. It took forever, 4 hours. We are a party of 6. 2 of the steaks were great, the other 2 dry and burned and the fish was literally CREMATED!!!, the rest was nice to be fair. The Manager was very apologetic, and sorted things out for us very efficiently but, still, our dinner was an expensive   spoiled experience! We booked two cottages 809/ 810, as the hotel rooms were full. My goodness!!! It is hard to believe how they still dare to offer them to clients. The state of these cottages is appalling. The worst is the SMELL of dirty filthy carpets , sofas the pillows!! watch out for the smelly…

title: Great value in palm beach area
review: I was recently in the palm beach gardens area visiting friends and had the good fortune to stay at PGA national resort.  The last time I was there was almost 15 years ago and things have changed for the better.  Totally renovated inside and out I was happy with my decision.  The only issue I had was with the quality of alcohol served at the lobby bar,  when at a resort the drink selection should reflect the overall experience and a "top shelf" selection of scotch and burbon was missing.

title: The best SPA!
review: It was definitely a treat! I had a "WOW" moment starting with hospitality. There were smiling faces everywhere as soon I entered the SPA. Having a "girls day out" with my mom was very special. I immediately had other friends in mind for my next trip so they can experience what I loved at PGA National Resort & Spa. The service was impeccable and food was superb! Palm Beach is lucky to have a place like this!

title: Perfect Holiday Experience
review: We enjoyed a wonderful holiday experience at PGA. My husband and myself enjoyed a week at this great resort. Staff, from the bellman on, we're a pleasure. One of our particular favorites - our room service waiter - could not have been nicer. WE WILL BE BACK!!

title: "Definately a 5-Star Resort in our Book"
review: PGA National Resort has been a favorite of ours for years. Now with the completion of their major renovation, this hotel exceeded every expectation. Rooms after the recent renovation are fantastic and every service was outstanding. Not one negative.  We enjoyed tennis and the beautiful pool and she enjoyed the SPA. The service from the poolside bar was top notch and the atmosphere makes you feel like you’re in the islands. After a long day on the boat, we returned and had dinner in the Ironwood restaurant- The service was impeccable, and food was absolutely delicious. From the valet, the bellman, the front desk staff to housekeeping, everyone was at the top of their game. This is one place you will be glad you stayed if the "Best of the Best" is what you're looking for. We…

title: Wonderful stay.
review: We stayed at this hotel because our friends own a condo on the property.  Apparently the hotel just underwent a $65 million renovation.  The lobby is beautiful and tastefully decorated.  There are many staff persons in the area ready to be of assistance.  The grounds are gorgeous with clay tennis courts, beautiful pools, great health club, and close proximity to many restaurants and theaters.  The actual rooms were fantastic.  They feature 42 inch flat screen tv's, separate granite sinks in the bathroom, nice closet with plenty of hangers and robes, good smelling toiletries, nice color scheme, big comfy bed with cozy pillows and duvet, good air conditioner, big chest of drawers for clothing as well as nightstands and a huge desk.  The room was huge and had a nice balcony.  The…

title: Christmas at PGA - doesn't get better than this !!
review: Just returned from 8 days and had a very memorable and enjoyable stay.  From the moment we arrived, the quality and friendliness of everyone contributed to one of the best vacations my wife and I have taken in years.  The wait staff, the staff at the pool, the desk staff ( I could go on and on) were all very helpful and accomodating and always gave us the impression they were only there to make our stay pleasant - and obvioulsy it was. I will go back there everytime I can and especially every Christmas.

title: Great Stay at PGA
review: My friend and I took advantage of a special PGA was running, if you bought a $300 spa gift certificate you received one night free at the hotel so we made it a little Girlfriend Spa Getaway.  What a great time we had! We happened to check in on "Ladies Night" so PGA had different vendors selling jewelry, clothes, shoes, handbags etc. in the lobby.  We went to iBar that night and had a lot of fun with the friendly bartenders and other patrons there that evening.  The room at the hotel was very nice, it reminded me of the hotels in the past where the rooms were much larger and very nicely appointed, with a country club style look.  We had two queen beds, standard hotel furnishings and a small balcony that overlooked the gardens.  And there was still plenty of space to walk around…

title: The P G A Pleasure
review: Just finished our 5 night stay at the PGA Resort and Spa. Everything about the property is first class.  The rooms, food service and grounds are all beautiful, with a great staff!  You will not be disappointed with this property.

title: Okay hotel but pricey and service could be better
review: My husband and two daughters and I stayed here over Thanksgiving for a field hockey tournament for four nights.  Our team was assigned to this hotel.  I had to book two rooms since this hotel is not set up to accomodate more than two persons per room.  The rooms were next to each other, but not adjoining which was a little inconvenient having to run out into the hall and unlock the door each time you went from one room to the other.  The lobby is gorgeous and the rooms were nice.  The view was a walkway and other balaconies were across the way.  Our group never gets the rooms with the best views and that was the case once again.  On Thanksgiving day, the fuse blew due to everyone getting ready at the same time for dinner.  My daughter tried to call the front desk from her room…

title: Spacation!
review: There is nothing nicer than getting away for a few days and relaxing. The PGA resort and spa is the perfect get away. Right now for the month of December, they have a great deal on spa gift certificates. If you buy $350 of spa girt cards, you recieve a complimentary nights stay. I love the spa and my room was newly and beautifully decorated with I phone/I pad charger, large flat screen tv and outlet on the desk to charge your other electronic devices. It is one of my favorite get-away places!

title: PGA Golf haven
review: Just spent a week at PGA National with a bunch of buddies and as usual the hospitality was great along with the food and the service. Bill Horn has gone above and beyond the call of duty and we all look forward to going back next year.  Thanks Bill

title: Worth the trip
review: Just came back from a 3 day trip to PGA National. Absolutely a great experience. The staff is friendly and helpful, the golf was top notch and the IBAR was jumping every night. The re-designed rooms make a big difference. I had a suite overlooking the pool that was excellent. Every aspect of the room was brand new. Got a couple of good work outs in the health club which is a huge facility and had dinner at their signature restuarant IronWood which was excellent. Did not get a chance to use the Spa but heard from other guests that it was quite good. Planning a trip back in the spring to catch the Honda Classic. I highly recommend the PGA National. Incredibly well run.  Larry R.

title: November field hockey festival stay
review: Booked this hotel as my daughter was staying in a few of the cottages with her field hockey team.  I was in the hotel - very spacious room, lovely grounds.  Unfortunately I do not golf and I did not use the tennis courts, spa etc.  Loved the Ibar in the lobby for casual dining and drinks after a day of field hockey.  Excellent value as part of field hockey pricing.  Cottages were okay - perhaps owned and rented by hotel.  Some were definitely better than others with respect to furnishings but a good option for cooking your own meals/laundry and larger group.

title: Italian Open Golf Tournament
review: From the planning to the execution the staff at PGA exceeded our expectations. The renovated facilities including deluxe Guest rooms as well as the New Bar 91 were two of the highlights of the trip. The golf cources were in Great shape as well as the first ever Bocce tournament held under the lights. As always added value was Ladies night out at the Ibar. The staff made us feel welcome from check in to departure. Cannot say enough about the whole experience. Looking forward to next year already.

title: Not what it's cracked up to be
review: We stayed here for a week in November as part of a group.  Although we received the "group rate" our room was not what I expected.  We opted for one of the larger suites, but it was still small and the floorplan was inconvenient.  The couch-bed, when opened up, prevented one from retrieving items from the low closet.  A small table w/ four chairs was positioned beneath a ceiling fan, but no light source.  Ambient light in our room in November was almost nonexistent, as our room was always in the shade.  The bathroom was small, the shower door opened in, and the closet space was small, with few hangers. With the exception of some strange "bang" noises that we discerned were from the heavy door in the stairwell next to our room banging shut, we did get a good sleep.  The rooms are…

title: Golf and more
review: We had our annual 16 man golf tournament at The PGA resort, and once again we had a fantastic time, everything was well organized and Bill Horn and his team did an outstanding job in making sure we had a great event. I was also impressed on the recent renovations done to the bedrooms as well as their restaurants, well done the the staff at PGA!!!! they run a first class opertation. Great place for a vist with friends or family.

title: Could not have asked for more!
review: Stayed here for a few days and played three of the courses (first visit). Everything and everyone was amazing. Service is simply the best, employees and I mean everyone I had any contact with including those simply in passing go out of their way to make sure you are enjoying your stay and always offer unsolicited assistance. The PGA Resort and Spa - Thanks to all employees - great job!  Golf - What can you say Home of the Honda, a Long history of PGA events. Courses are great (playable by all). Again, the employees are the best. The coordination of the golf center is impressive, 300 carts and 1500 bags and travel bag in and out every day. I had forgot something in my bag I asked one of the employees if I could get to my bag which was already stored for the night. One minute…

title: PGA National "A Class Act"
review: We had our annual golf trip , for the third year at PGA National in West Palm Beach the first week of November 2012. As usual Bill Horn(from PGA National) organized our trip and Alex and his staff made sure that the starting times,carts and bags were all ready when we showed up in the morning. All first class, the facilities,the food,the service (all with smiles) and the accomidations. 16 guys on a trip is hard enough to manage internally but given the expertise of the PGA National staff, it was a huge success again. Thanks for everything.  HL-trip organizer

title: Great Golf Getaway!
review: This hotel was 1 stop fun. Golf, pool, restaurants, breakfast bar, cocktail bar... Newly renovated, the rooms were clean spacious & pleasantly decorated.  If planning on visiting Palm Beach this hotel is a must.

title: Golfing trip
review: We had our annual 16 man golf tournament at The PGA resort, and once again we had a fantastic time, everything was well organized and Bill Horn and his team did an outstanding job in making sure we had a great event. I was also impressed on the recent renovations done to the bedrooms as well as their restaurants, well done the the staff at PGA!!!!

title: PGA National Resort & Spa was a dream!
review: My wife and I spent four wonderful days at the PGA National Resort and Spa in Palm Beach Gardens, FL in early November 2012. From start to finish, everything was first class. The courses were in great shape - the greens rolled true and the courses provide challenge with strong playability, even for average golfers like us. The bar, restaurants, and pool were inviting, classy, and fun, with top-notch food and drinks. The room was large and comfortable, with especially comfortable beds - more so than most hotels we have stayed at. Staff was attentive, friendly and very professional throughout the resort. My wife treated herself to a massage and a full facial at the spa, and raved about the experience. We enjoyed every minute of this trip and are very much looking forward to going…

title: PGA for Meeting and Pleasure
review: I booked PGA a few years ago for a meeting for our Association. We had over 70 total attendees and utilized many of the food outlets and more. I did a site in May and was pleased this go around it was great. they have just undergone an extensive renovation and their room product is fully new as are some of the public areas of the hotel. The pool bar was excellent and the fish tacos are my ultimate favorite. I did get a little bored with the food choices as this is a resort and not easy to leave if you don't have a car. The room service was different though I ordered the same item twice. there was a lack of room service options as well. The spa was wonderful and the treatments were fantastic. The director, Kristin was top notch. The hot tub at night was great and quiet which is…

title: Absolute luxury experience.
review: Do not skip the spa or the waters of the world pools!! Poolside service is wonderful. Nice menu choices. Staff is very attentive. My husband thoroughly enjoyed the golf course and I enjoyed the spa. Nice fitness center, though crowded. We jogged the "trail" that was really just a sidewalk, but still on property.

title: Great resort for stay while attending car show
review: Our friends car club had their event at this resort. The hotel was booked to capacity so we were glad that we book in advance. Room was large and updated. Very quiet while in room and if you wanted entertainment the main bar was the place to be! Many come in to golf from all over the world so you will see lots of people in bar area. Food was good even at the bar and be prepared to par hotel prices. Hotel pool was inviting and wish I had more time to check out the pool.

title: WONDERFUL Wedding Weekend at PGA National!
review: We spent the weekend at PGA National for my daughters wedding weekend and it was WONDERFUL!!! Although she did not get married at PGA, she and her bridesmaids did get ready there. Our family came in from neighboring states and all had a wonderful experience at PGA. We did patronize the IBAR and Ironwood Grille as well as the pool bar. The food was wonderful as well as the service. NOTE: That the Ironwood Grille does not include the tip as the other food service areas of PGA does, so make sure YOU DO! The servers are polite and fast to fill your request. There is a lot to do around the area too! Shopping is WONDERFUL at the Gardens Mall and Downtown at the Gardens. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Wonderful backyard getaway
review: Only a short distance away from where we live, but feels like a real getaway. Love the pool area and spa! The PGA mall and other shopping areas are so close. This is a great place for a special event banquet, which is what we were attending and/or a couples weekend...golfing, shopping, spa and pool!

title: Everything in one place
review: Full service resort destination.  A golfer's paradise with plenty of other activities including spa, tennis, pool, cigar lounge, great restaurants and great rooms.  Best massage ever was a deep tissue massage by Nancy in the spa.  The bar in the lobby is a great place to unwind and have a meal and watch the flat screens.  The Ironwood restaurant next to the bar has wide variety of items that were very good. Steaks, shrimp, scallops were all good.

title: Wonderful time
review: My husband enjoyed a wonderful break and enjoyed every minute of it.  The stay was quite please  Pleasant. The staff was very friendly and always helpful. I enjoyed the spa. Peggy was wonderful. She has been there for 17 years. She has magic fingers. The food and service in restaurant was wonderful as well. Rooms were very well decorated and lovely view if golf course. Great course as well. There is no hotel shuttle service so make those arrangements on your own.  And it is some what pricey as there is only company that has airport service. Take the shuttle over the taxi

title: Nice spa, great food & no surprise: golf!
review: We're non-golfers, but stayed as we got a good deal. Excellent service in all areas & great, varied restaurants. Enough to do as non-golfers that we didn't get bored. The spa, pool & gym facilities are really nice. But, it's not the Breakers....

title: Newly Renovated Resort and Rooms-Well done!
review: I spent the weekend at PGA National for a business conference and it was much improved since last year.The rooms had a new stylish renovation and the bed was extremely comfortable. Since this was a business realted stay I didnt get to experience any of the pools and outside activities. The food at the banquet dinnner for 500 was superb and commendable on delivery, taste, and presentation. They served a filet mignon with grilled asparagus and a risotto cake with 2 large shrimp on top. The renovation at this resort was necessary and made a tremendous difference to the quality of my stay. Also, I did make time to visit the spa for a hair service and the hairdresser was top notch. The staff was extremely friendly and accomodating.

title: Firefighter's Golf Tourney was AMAZING!!!!
review: My husband and I stayed at PGA as part of an annual  firefighter's golf tournament.  The event travels to a different golf destination every year.  PGA was a superb venue!!!  The hotel was modern, beautiful and luxurious.   I really enjoyed the ipod dock/alarm clock , refrigerator, super comfy beds and bedding in the rooms,  and the extra vanity area outside of the shower-toilet room.  The room also had an easy to use safe and ambient lighting fixtures.   The lobby and bar were lively and had oodles of seating for hangin with our long distance friends.  The pool area had plenty of chairs and was gorgeous.  We had lots of great food and drinks by the pool and enjoyed excellent service. We were served 3 breakfasts and 3 dinners as part of our package in some of the banquet rooms. …

title: Good hotel (even for a non-golfer)
review: When i stayed at this hotel, they were in the middle of a major refurbishment, so there was quite a lot of noise throughout the day.  I was in a room that had already been refurbished to a very high standard.  The room was enormous - two large double beds.  As a European, I'm always surprised by the way that US hotels have two such huge beds... do they imagine that there will be two couples staying in one room?  or that there will be one couple but each of them will need a whole double bed to themselves?  Anyway, as I was in Palm Beach without my wife, I had a choice of beds each night. The bathroom was large with a shower over the bath, and two sinks.  Unfortunately, in either sink, it took a good few minutes of running the tap before any hot water came out. The hotel is…

title: Great golf and conference hotel
review: I hadn't visited in over 10 years.  The hotel has undergone some reservations.  The rooms are upgraded and smelled like new carpeting.  The design is quite contemporary.  I stayed on the main floor just off the lobby - not a place I would normally stay, but it provided easy access to the conference facilities.    Rooms - contemporary; sink near closet and one inside bathroom with pocket door.  Nice touch.   Beds were comfortable.  Pillows were not top of the line. Sliding doors to small balcony.  A/C goes off when door is open.  Very energy conscious.  Perks:  Provided two complimentary cocktails coupons on arrival.  Nice touch.  Not sure if if was a perk from my conference.   Food:  Hotel food was exceptional at the conference dinner that we had - salmon, filet and shrimp…

title: Worse the second time
review: I so hoped this review would be different!  I stayed at PGA National 6 months ago while they were about to embark on a renovation and that stay was not the greatest but I was somewhat charitable in my first review.  This trip was worse.  The hallways and rooms are indeed renovated and I think the towels, sheets and furniture are a big improvement.  But that is quickly overshadowed by the poor service - 15 minutes of standing waiting to check-in, no glasses in the room (and multiple calls to the front desk with requests for them), opened soap packages upon arrival, an abysmal driving range (old balls, no distance markers, a poor short game area and apathetic staff) and a non-working business center.  If I can avoid staying here again I will.  Isn't this supposed to be the…

title: Great Experience - Sleeping room, Food, Pool, you name it
review: I recently stayed at the PGA National Resort on business and truly enjoyed myself. The hotel was on the tail end of renovations so a little construction going on. Sleeping accommodations were top notch! The carpet, decor, mattress/sheets, bathroom amenities were very nice. All meals served whether it was part of a large conference or in the restaurant were excellent. The pool area was beautiful. Lounge chairs were very comfortable. On Sunday they even had a guitarist by the pool playing all kinds of music for every generation. Music the other days was piped in and soft so you can relax. The spa was also top notch. Everyone very friendly and not pushing product. The mineral pools were relaxing and something different to try. The lobby bar - iBar was the place to be. It was…

title: very mixed feelings
review: stayed 3 nights at hotel for a local event as a single traveler. The good: friendly valet and pool staffs; Starbucks coffee and nice take-away options at Cafe Pronto in lobby; pretty and lively  lobby area and bar; lovely pool. Cynthia in spa salon a great hair blow-out (lasted 3 days)! Needs improvement: Uninterested front desk staff at check-in offered a newly renovated room that positively reeked of paint, on first floor where ongoing renovations meant hall floors were partially covered in plastic, otherwise needed vacuuming, and work crews over weekend were assembling fixtures in halls! Hard to understand logic of putting a guest there when plenty of alternate rooms were available, and since hotel guests would logically traverse those halls to get to spa more attention to…

title: Excellent Pool and Jacuzzi
review: We enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi sooooooo much!  Would love to stay here again.  Three co-workers shared a room during a conference,  We didn't think they should have charged us extra for the roll-away bed.

title: Very nice Hotel
review: Got this one on priceline at a great discount.  They were doing a major renovation but it didn't effect our stay to much. This was a family trip with kids. The lobby and lobby bar were a popular hang outs.  The room was very nice.  We were upgraded as it was low season.  The  pool is excellent.  I didn't golf so can't comment there.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Parking was easy and included in the resort charge.  Great for a couple of nights.  Would be a cool place to do the golf trip with friends.

title: Endless golf
review: Great locale, especially if you like to play lots of golf. With 4 courses at the resort and 1 more off the premises, there's no shortage of choice, including the Championship Course where the Honda Classic, (a PGA Tour stop), is played. The only wrinkle to the courses is that they're all flat....no elevation changes....it is Florida after all. Our package included a great buffet breakfast every morning, use of the exercise facilities, and no-charge for the second round of golf everyday. The accommodations were first-rate, and they'd just finished a complete refurbishing. The staff and service are also top-notch.....I guess that's why we keep going back.

title: Top Notch!
review: Once again, the PGA National Resort and Spa proved to be a wonderful experience.   Even though they are going through a renovation of the Resort our stay was never inconvenienced.   We look forward to returning next year when the Resort upgrades are completed to enjoy all the newly reopened restaurants and amenities!  Fabulous and I highly recommend this resort for a wonderful pampering vacation!

title: Pleasently surprised
review: Last year we attended an event at this venue and were very disappointed to say the least. I said I would not return; however the event was once again held here and I held my breath.  Much to our surprise and enjoyment this year was a 180.  The valet was friendly and quick even though very busy. At the front desk we were greeted by Hector who was very friendly and helpfull to as the least. Bellman was quick and courtious and knew the property.  The food in the bar area was very good and the service even better.  The breakfast was great; quality was very good, service very good but a little pricey.  The room was not a king as requested but Hector gave us an upgrade to suite in a newly renovated room.  Everything was perfect unlike last year. Our second room was also good with a…

title: Relaxing Spa Day
review: Spent the evening at the Ironwood Restaurant enjoying wine and appetizers with some of my closest friends. Spent the night at the Club Cottages with friends and then the next day with a friend celebrating my birthday with a massage, manicure and pedicure.  It was the best!

title: Very Nice Place
review: I attended a function recently at the PGA National and decided to spend the night.  It's a very nice hotel.  They are foregoing a $100 Million renovation right now, and yet, everything was seamless with my stay.   It took a little longer than expected to get checked in, however, it wasn't such a big deal. The iBar (Lobby Bar) has a nice appetizer menu as well as a nice cocktail menu that is priced for a luxury hotel. Not to be taken the wrong way, but its worth commenting on the fact that the iBar staff wear shirts that say "Sexy, Savvy" and another word that I don't remember.  This must be referring to the bar itself, because the staff certainly didn't fit the description (but they were extremely good at their jobs).  The service at the function was very good, everybody was…

title: Second time's the charm...
review: After a disappointing visit to PGA National last January, my best friend and I decided to give it another try this August - different season, totally different stay.   The highlights of our last visit were an incredible meal at the Ironwood Grille and a heavenly afternoon at the Waters of the World inside the spa. Once again our meal at Ironwood and our morning spent floating in the WoW were easily the best parts of our trip, but this time we returned home with a bit more to brag about.   On this trip we decided to do it all and get to know the resort a little better. Instead of just sitting by the pool we had lunch at the poolside bar. That was a good idea. Fish tacos and boneless buffalo wings, margaritas and pina coladas, and we enjoyed every bite and sip. Very, very good.…

title: Amazing Property - Worth the Visit
review: I just finished a two day stay at PGA National and I came away thoroughly impressed.  We had an amazing experience, the room was perfect, courses in great condition and exceptional food at different restaurants throughout the resort.  I highly recommend this resort to anyone looking to relax or for a great vacation.

title: PGA National . . . Great Golf, Great People and Relaxing
review: Took my wife here as part of our trip for our 30th wedding anniversary. Yes, she's a golf fanatic!   Our room was large and comfortable with a king size bed and nice bathroom facilities. We were on the ground floor and had our own patio.   Service at the restaurant on site was very good, the food for breakfast, which is included in your stay, was cooked to order or buffet. They are updating their other restaurant and it should be back open soon.  Golf on site, they have 4 courses, along with 1 off sight, was challenging with each course having it's own unique character. On sight you have the Palmer, Haig, Squire and Championship, where the Honda Classic is played. Off sight, but very close by, you have the Estates Course.  The pool is large and very accommodating and if you want…

title: Not perfect, but a Very Nice Suprise... much better choice than anything nearby.
review: We stayed here several years ago and now again in 2012. You have to keep in mind that the property is sort of a golfing icon and has been around a while, however I believe they do a good job at keeping it in shape and up to date. They were actually in the process of renovating various guest rooms but they kept it isolated and we were NEVER disturbed by it.   I found Valet, Bellmen & Desk staff super friendly. Rooms were clean and beds felt crisp & fresh. One missing detail was that although there was a firdge in the room there was no "mini-bar". It was not a big deal, but wished we had it available one afternoon.  We ate off property so can't comment on  their food, but the "IBar" downstairs is a big step up from your average "hotel bar". It was enjoyable to start and/or finish…

title: Gathering of Friends at PGA National
review: My husband and I met up with three other couples for five days of fun in Palm Beach Gardens.  We all stayed at PGA National and found the resort to be very pleasant with friendly staff.  The resort was in the midst of renovations, so there was no room service, a couple of restaurants were closed, etc., but our rooms were nice, lobby and iBar were beautiful, resort pool was exceptionally clean with a nice grill and bar menu, spa was first rate with a pool area exclusive to spa guests (meaning no kids!!!), and a well-equipped fitness center that guests can use at no additional charge.  Service overall was very good and staff were helpful and friendly.  Location is central to tons of things on PGA Boulevard and we were able to be in a shopping area in minutes, as well as to…

title: Peaceful and relaxing, met expectations.
review: I found the rooms were very clean, beds were very comfortable - which you don't always get even in nice resort/spas.   I was very happy with the service that was provided, the staff is very professional, and eager to please and serve their customer with a smile.   My room was poolside, two double beds which was very comfortable for a family of four.   The staff in the restaurants and bars were very fast in serving, the quality of the food, especially in the Ironwood restaurant was exceptional.     I had a nice three day stay, and it was relaxing and quiet atmosphere.    Will return again!

title: Doesn't get much better!
review: This is one of the finest spa/golf resorts in Florida. Top notch service, utterly amazing secluded spa services, golf courses were stunning and the pool areas just totally encompassing of everything you are looking for in a top tier resort.  Top quality and service does come with a cost; but at the PGA you definately get what you pay for.  When I checked out and paid the final bill....I had no regrets and loved every minute of the stay.     This place is amazing.

title: Not up to PAR!
review: We have frequented PGA Resort quite often over the years but somehow this time I noticed a difference of inadequacy! It started when I tried to make a reservation and was asked to LEAVE A MESSAGE and someone would call me back which they never did! I must be fair and say their is a big renovation going on so improvement is in the works! This is the home of the HONDA CLASSIC and an upscale large golf resrot with all the amenities in the heart of Palm Beach, Fla. The IBAR  which is their main bar in the center of the lobby is just average for a high end resort. I  had an issue wih the  warm bread pudding as a desert coming out cold with liquid ice cream and sent back the second time same thing. There is a DJ in the lobby with LOUD music kids running around and women dancing on the…

title: One of Palm Beach's Best Places
review: PGA National Resort is currently renovating its property to retain its status as one of the best resorts in South Florida.  I recently spent a weekend there with a group of friends.  We had a fantastic time!  My pool-view room contained a very comfortable king-size bed, free wi-fi, flat screen tv, his/her sinks in the bathroom and lots of space.    The lobby i-bar is hip, comfortable and sociable.  They have a good wine list and plenty of premium liquors, all reasonably priced.  Their own wine label, "PGA" has young wines.  Although I'm a Cabernet Sauvignon fan, the Cab was a bit light and very acidic.  The PGA Sauvignon Blanc was the best of this "house" brand.  Prices on bottles of wine are VERY reasonable, with a low mark-up/corkage fee over usual retail prices.   The pool…

title: Very relaxing
review: The wave pool had 2 pool parties while I was there and it put a fun, cool vibe while still being relaxing. The staff was very friendly and welcoming! The restaurants where very good with a great romantic feel.

title: Great Trip- Thanks PGA National Staff
review: PGA National is a terrific destination golf trip. Our group has taken every trip imaginable, Pebble, Whistling Straits, Doral, and we keep coming back to PGA. The staff understands golf, and they treat everyone like a member. The food is terrific weather you want a sandwich and go back and play another 18 or you white table cloth dining, PGA has it all.   The pool scene is one of the best around. The bar is always happening, food is great and the tropical theme with the swaying palm trees is one of the best in Florida. Great place to spend time if you are not into golf. I would recommend the resort to golfers and non players alike.

title: "Nice Place, Good Golf Experience "
review: We're just arriving from PGA NATIONAL, my kids were playing a Golf Championship; we've stayed at a Club Cottage and our experience was very nice. My family and I loved the place and we would love to go back again. Great place for golfers!!!!

title: Pricey, but nice
review: We've stayed at this resort twice in July, once this year and once the year before. The resort is nice, there's no doubt about that. The pool is the best feature if you're traveling with kids and not playing gold. The rooms are large and each has a balcony. The room prices are also very reasonable, but the resort restaurants and bars are unbelievably pricey. We would have liked nothing more than to stay at the resort for all our meals and order drinks by the pool, but the cost prevented us from doing so.  One concern are the sizes of the beds, which are full, not queen. They just weren't large enough to accomodate my family of three. On this trip, it was just my husband, daughter, and me. We were able to make do by ordering a roll away bed for my daughter (at an additional $10…

title: Golf Package and Cottage Stay July 13-15
review: Our recent stay at the PGA National Resort in Palm Beach Gardens was fantastic.  The staff and facilities were without comparison.  Our party of sixteen players was treated as well as any "member" could have been.  We were very pleased and already planning a return trip.

title: Met All Expectations
review: What a wonderful resort.  The hotel met my request of ground floor accommodations which were located overlooking a pond with waterfall and close to the pool which is where lots of time was spent with family and new people I met.  The room was large, clean and had all the amenities one would expect.  I don't golf but after talking with people I am told the beautiful courses are challenging and fun.  The area has everything you could want from dining, great shopping and things to do.  If you have a chance definitely check out the Food Shack for a great casual dining experience.

title: A great place to be ......
review: Attending a convention, I had the pleasure to stay 4 nights at this incredible resort. Everything was first class, the reception, the room, the view, the pool, the restaurants, the food and the limo transfers from the airport. The beautiful weather of course added to that experience.

title: Excellent and way above expectations
review: The very best service from each and everyone we met through our six nights stay - using all the facilities t hat this very very good place have to offer. I recommend anyone and all to go here for relax, fun, food, spa, GOLF, tennis and gym and the most attentive and friendly service minded staff I have ever experienced. just love the breakfast ladies so much :)

title: Nice hotel in the area.
review: They offered a very good group rate.  The hotel is conveniently located off the Florida Turnpike and is very nice.  It is a little dated, but they seem to be making renovations.  The lobby and pool area are nice, and the hotel is family friendly.  Stayed for several days and really enjoyed it.

title: Great wedding venue
review: We recently had our wedding at the resort and overall was very pleased.  They are updating the rooms a section at a time and you would never know.  The rooms overall were very clean and the staff was very pleasant and helpful.  We originally were booked to have our wedding somewhere else and they cancelled a few months before.  It worked out to our advantage.  The catering staff and banquet staff were exceptional and the food top notch.  Everyone at our wedding raved about the staff and food which helped us to enjoy our special evening.  I recommend PGA resort for a wedding venue as well as a relaxing vacation spot.  Some prices for food/drinks were pricey but every resort you go to is.  I also recommend the spa!

title: Forced to stay
review: Every year we have a conference here. The staff is pleasant, rooms are clean. Can't say too much more as we really only get to see the meeting rooms.

title: Summer getaway
review: We had a great time the courses were great the staff were fantastic the spa was off the chart...PGA were doing renovations but overall it was good...would go again.

title: Would have rated lower if I was paying
review: Was here in May 2012 for a conference. Room was on basement level (i.e below a slightly elevated reception). Room was ok. I hated the mandatory $25 resort fee. One of the ambitiously-priced ($6!!) bottles of water in my room had been opened and not replaced. Pool was fine although the constant pressure-washing of a nearby area was irritating.

title: Great Golf Trip destination
review: Golf trip heaven.  We plan a 4-man golf trip around the US Open being on the West coast this year so we could golf early in the day and be able to follow the US Open later in the day and into the evening.  The golf courses were in excellent condition and the Champ Course and Bear Trap may be some of the most challenging but fair golf we have played while on golf trips.  The staff at PGA National is top rate, most are friendly and willing to help, food is very good at the I-bar, drinks are cold coming out the Bear Trap/19th hole downstairs.  There happen to be a Beer Festival/Burger Bash during the weekend we were there and it just added to the overall excellence of the weekend.    The only negative of the entire weekend was the fact that none of the televisions had HD reception.…

title: Birthday celebration!
review: We celebrated my husband's birthday with a weekend stay at PGA National.  We were married on this property 10 months ago and continue to be drawn back!  We love the ammenities and staff at this resort.  There was an incredible beerfest/burger bash event that we attended and also dined at the Ironwood Grille.  We love stayin at the PGA National and would reccommend this property to anyone for a "back-yard" stay-cation in the the Palm Beach area!

title: Great hotel, excellent value
review: PGA National has been my sanctuary for about 15 years. I had my father's 80th birthday party there, and then started staying there myself when I visited him. The rooms are quite big and well appointed. The staff is excellent. The food is usually pretty good . . .the restaurants have changed concept from time to time. There's a new lobby bar that's a good use of space, but it can get really noisy when there's a DJ spinning.The pool area is beautiful amd theres a lap pool at the health club for real swimmers. My favorite part of PGA National is the Spa. Beautiful new locker rooms. I seldom partake of the massage services, but love the manicures. Ask for Angie, whose manicures are indestructible. Really two weeks. I love returning to this hotel which, I might add, offers excellent…

title: The PGA staff was phenomenal
review: We had a group of 13 golfers and 1 more who didn't play but stayed, for a total of 14 people.  All I can say is we all enjoyed our stay thoroughly.  Although the condition of the Estates course and The Champion course were not what we expected, the resort went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of, even with terrible weather delays.    We had one of the PGA suites as our "hang out" room and it exceeded expectations.  We had a great time there.  We were there 3 nights and we ended up in the Ironwood restaurant two of those nights and the staff there really took care of us.    This resort has definitely taken their level of service and accommodations to the next level.  Thank you PGA Resort and Spa with a special thanks to Shawn Sterling and Jamie Myers.

title: A Relaxing Long Weekend
review: SURPRISE!!!!, my room was a house near to the PGA Resort and Spa. The house was super clean with internet wireless 24 hours. The house has 2 rooms and 2 baths, kitchen, laundry, family room, dining room and a lagoon at the end. Parking in front of the house by 2 cars. All the rooms have a plasma tv with Comcast cable and the family room have the same + DVD  The comunity has with security 24hours. Inside the comunity you can find a childrens park and other little pool. The Publix Supermarket are close so, you can buy all you want and do it at home (REMENBER the kitchen has everything, plates,vases, knifes, spoons)  The Resort was friendly with us. The service and food was excellent.

title: just had a wedding celabration here!!!
review: i can't say enough how much i love this hotel,great service,great room,great food,we just had a wonderful wedding celebration  with our family at Ironwood Restaurant:::::Oh!!!! great pool and drink!!!!

title: So wishing it was better!I
review: I'm a big golfer and supporter of the sport - but this property needs a face lift.  The location is excellent for anything you want to do in the area.  But the rooms are in need of a significant face lift.  There were wet water patches on my carpet for two days, stained bedding, flimsy sheets and no blankets.  It's Florida but still....  The lobby restaurant and bar are great after work - except the bartenders were wildly inattentive and aloof.  The food is excellent and the two free drinks with a reservation in the hotel was a nice touch.  The new restaurant downstairs is beyond bad.....bad lighting, terrible service, and worse food.  I was there for a business breakfast and should have stuck with the coffee bar on the lobby level.

title: Relaxing!
review: For my 50th birthday I wanted to relaxing getaway & this resort was awesome.  The staff at the ibar were so friendly & accomodating. Our dinner at Ironwood grill was the BEST, we just kept saying yum for the entire meal!  The pools at the spa were so relaxing, I highly recommend it!

title: PGA Resort & Spa
review: Had a great time during Memorial Day weekend.  The service was GREAT and rooms, especially the beds...were super comfortable! Kids activities were well planned and the poolside service was GREAT. The staff from the front desk, to the cleaning staff to the bar/wait staff were very welcoming, friendly and courteous.  The Bear  Trap was renovated since our last visit and we had a GREAT time eating with friends and family while being able to enjoy staying on the grounds for casual dining!  Can't wait to go back!

title: The most relaxing resort!! Everyone there was so kind and helpful!!
review: I recommend this resort!! Clean, good food...I can't wait to go again

title: Great Weekend Getaway!
review: Very friendly staff throughout the hotel. Great place to stay for an Anniversary, with the kids or just a getaway to relax!

title: We Go Back to PGA National Every Year!!!
review: PGA National is a welcoming family resort with exceptional golf facilities.  Our whole family can't wait to try and conquer the Bear Trap.  We go two or three times a year and every time we have a great experience.  The pool is always a great way to cool off after a round of golf or a game of tennis - the pool service is terrific.    We like PGA National because it has so many options for our family to enjoy.  We like to play golf, swim, play tennis, work out, relax in the warm sunshine, and they even have a racquetball court and basketball for the kids.  We can be as busy as we want or relax by the pool if we choose.  And, when it comes time for dinner, we know that we have lots of great options.  We can go as casual as we want or dress it up, what more could we ask for?  We…

title: Good Spot
review: My husband and I were at the PGA National in March for a golf vacation. We had a great time challenging the Bear Trap. the rooms were nice and spacious, customer service was excellent and food was good too. It was a nice and busy hotel with good service. Golf courses were well kept and we had fun playing with other guests. Pay the premium on the championship course, it's worth the money, just bring lots of golf balls. There are shops nearby and a great seafood restaurant which i will also write a review on. if you like seafood, please go to Spotto oyster bar, it's as good as any place you'll find anywhere.

title: Just Average
review: Three of us visited the PGA Resort for five days the week before the Honda Classic this year and while the golf was pretty nice, the resort is "tired" and showing its age.  Three of the four courses were in good shape but one was average at best.  The facilities at the resort are too small for the number of guests.  On one occasion when making the turn after 18 holes, there were no tables open for lunch at the restaurant near the golf shop.  We then walked over to the pool side restaurant and waited for a table to open.  We ordered some sandwiches and then waited and waited...almost 45 minutes.  When they did arrive, we had to eat very quickly just to barely make our afternoon tee time.  The food was average at best.  The entrance doors near the golf shop opened hard and should…

title: Great Family Resort
review: Exceptional staff made for a wonderful stay. I would definitely stay again. The facility and rooms have been updated.

title: A good independent hotel to host your meetings and events
review: I am a meeting planner, and I have used the PGA National Resort and Spa for at least 5 meetings of 100 or more people. My guests and I have been very pleased with the service, the facilities, the banquet food, and the recreation that the PGA National has to offer. Even though the hotel is not on a beach, it has a lovely pool deck as well as the restricted-access pool in the spa. The spa provides a wide range of treatments and is well-appointed. If you have guests that are interested in golf, then they will truly enjoy their experience at the PGA. At the time of this writing, the guest rooms are my least favorite part of the PGA. While they are clean, they look very dated and could definitely use a refresh. However, we have been able to negotiate very good rates with the sales…

title: Poor Service, Ok facilities, Needs Updating
review: Wife and I stayed I took advantage of a deal where if you buy a spa gift card you get a free night.  Front desk check in was indifferent...I needed extra towels and asked cleaning lady for three and was told that was too many.  Room was ok nothing special relatively clean but not great.  My wife went to spa had good treatments but the spa bar attendant was overwhelmed with request for diet coke.  Pool area is ok...restaurant was crowded tables at a premium we took one without umbrella asked for umbrella to be brought out but were refused.  At every turn where staff had chance to perform a basic service they failed miserably.  It is a shame because the course is nice and spa is nice.  Really need a training class on how to treat customers...and a makeover.

title: Totally overrated
review: I have been to many luxury golf resort in the states, Europe and Asia.  When it comes to hotel accommodations (excluding spa and golf courses), this hotel is totally overrated.  We arrived at 1PM in the afternoon as it started to rain.  The valet lady who parked our car, left the driver side window open despite the rain!  Then we were stunned to see a vintage clothes flea market inside the Lobby... followed by a disco party blasting 80's music for many more hours!  The Lobby was so loud with music that hotel guests could barely hear what the staff at the checking counter were saying.  Our hotel room was outdated and showed sign of water damage on the bathroom ceiling.  This resort is NOT what we expected.  It is far from being a luxury resort despite its golf courses and its Spa…

title: Elegant And Simply Wonderful
review: Thank you for your valuable feedback. I am excited to report we are planning a major room renovation starting in May 2012 and have considered all of your comments here. Enhancements will include a thorough redesign of the Citrus Tree restaurant, all room interiors to bring them up to a 5 star level and all corridors to bring them up to the same contemporary modern look as our extraordinary signature restaurant, lobby bar, resort lobby and lush zero entry resort pool.    Your comments are valuable to us and we will most certainly follow up with Valet to remind them of the importance of exceeding guest expectations.  – From the Executive Office

title: Great facilities
review: Went to a meeting in one of their rooms.  The food and servers were very nice and professional. Food selection consisted of lots of finger food, sandwiches buffet and several deserts. The views of the golf course were spectacular. On the way out the bar and resturants were packed and they had entertainment. A classy place with I am sure a price to match. The valets were very nice and professional also.

title: PGA resort religious compound
review: I am a club cottage owner on vacation with my family during spring break. I was shocked and still am that PGA resort rents the whole resort for 15 days to a religious group!!  The entire hotel, pool, lobby, restaurants, and bar are off limits to guests and members.  Oh I am sorry the members are given a few lounge chair in the rear of the pool! None of usual friendly staff was working since the group brought in their own! What a sell out for one of the most exclusive clubs in the nation. I am embarrassed and still floored that the resort my family and I love is turned into a compound! This will tarnish your reputation in the long run and impact the value of our property.

title: Club Cottage misrepresentation
review: The on-line details and photographs  of the Club Cottage is a complete misrepresentation of the actual cottage condition. I was very disappointed by the 1970-1980’s furnishings, interior décor, and overall appearance. I was entertaining business associates while at the resort and their visit to cottage 112 resulted in endless tongue-in-cheek comments about the dated interior and Motel 6 comparisons. The $1000 two night stay was very disappointing and a personal/professional embarrassment.

title: Pga is awesome.
review: Went back to Pga and OMG it was just awesome my family just live it there its great.

title: Great golf , Great pace of play
review: The whole operation was first class.  Everything went smooth as silk.  Have gone to Doral for many years (28) , first time at PGA National.  Golf courses much more interesting and in better condition.  Pace of play excellent, 4:15 or less per round.  Wish they had more outside dining for a burger,fries and beer after golf.  The Bear Trap is somewhat wasted space for dining or relaxing. Can't speak to the other facilities(spa,tennis,fitness center) but if golf is what you want it would be hard to beat National.  Rooms are spacious, clean, neat and well appointed.  I understand they are going to refurbish the rooms, etc. for the fall 2012.

title: Beautiful, but not sure if worth the $$!
review: The resort was beautiful, but if I wasn't at a conference, I would not have been pleased with the price we paid.  My husband and I were in a room with two uncomfortable double beds (small!) and the view was a tree - so no view and no natural light in the room.  The hot water from the faucet took literally 10 minutes to get warm.  Large flatscreen TV on the wall and decent size room and closet including iron, ironing board & hairdryer.  They have signs up regarding a big renovation in the Fall 2012, so maybe we were just a bit early.  My overall review would be that if you are not a crazy, wealthy golfer that wants to pay $260 for one round of golf, stay somewhere else and get better value for the money.

title: This is a first class resort!
review: Thank you for your feedback. The good news is you are correct! The resort will be renovating all room interiors and corridors this summer with completion by Fall 2012. The renovations will not affect business as usual and finishing touches include:    •A floor-to-ceiling guest room makeover featuring stylish bedding, headboards, wall coverings and carpet; spacious, modern work desks with multiple plug-in options; atmospheric lighting; and elegant furnishings. Suite bathrooms will have walk-in showers. State-of-the-art, high-definition, 42-inch flat-panel televisions have already been installed.   •Guest room corridors will showcase eye-catching carpeting; tastefully subdued lighting; and chic artwork and wall treatments.   •Renovation of its 19th Hole bar and grill, to be renamed “Bar 91,” presenting the latest in clubhouse furnishings, high-definition televisions and expanded outdoor dining overlooking one of the great vistas in golf. The addition of a kitchen will allow for a completely new menu offering.  •Updating The Haig Course with new turf, irrigation systems, rebuilt bunkers, and expanded tee and green complexes.  •The Citrus Tree Café, with its renowned breakfast buffet, will re-open newly renovated, renamed the “Palm Terrace” and available as a poolside location for evening events.  •The 40,000 square-foot European Spa with 32 treatment areas and the exclusive "Waters of the World" outdoor mineral pools will be updated matching the motif of the resort’s fashionably cool, hip décor.

title: Average Hotel, Poor Front Desk Service
review: This is a first class resort from the ibar with live music to the spa to the swimming areas to the comfortable room. We loved that the air conditioning in the room was so quiet- plus the linens were so luxurious! Our balcony overlooked lush plantings and we felt like royalty at a grand resort. Room service was great and we loved the noon check-out time. Love, love, love this place!!

title: Buisness Meeting
review: My husband and I booked our first 2 nights through Orbitz. The room rate was the same as what was being advertised on the the hotel's website. $255 per night with a $50 credit if we stayed 2 nites. We booked an additional two nites through the hotel's toll free number which included my husband on the golf gold pkg. When we arrived early on Thursday around 11AM, hoping to check in early we were greeted by Chris, the front desk manager. Yes, he was a manager!!!  He was not a very nice or very accomodating person. (I am being PC here.) He treated us like absolute garbage because we had booked through Orbitz and according to him we secured a "better" deal through Orbitz and that better deal meant we were going to stay in a crap room or we were going to have to pay. I told him we…

title: Terrible Customer Service
review: The hotel grounds and public areas are very nice.  The rooms are very outdated.  The pool looked very nice, but I was never able to use it.  The staff was very helpful.

title: Watch your wallet
review: Three guys had their wallets stolen out of their golf bags when they went to hit balls at the driving range.  When they were late, the starter at the first tee had NO sympathy (must be in on the scam).  Bellmen were tipped in advance to do a job and did nothing.  I hope you get a good deal if you stay here, watch your wallets, and don't tip until the service is complete.  Would NEVER stay here again.

title: PGA is a great place for a golf vacation.
review: The golf courses are in excellent shape. The convenience of four courses to play is the reason to go to PGA.  There are many good restaurants in the area and on site.

title: bad maintenance and a surprise bill
review: We stayed for two nights only at this hotel. Thanks God it was only two nights. Our bedroom smelled, there was hair on the bath tube, it was dirty and rusty.  The water that comes out of the shower and toilette for some reason was yellowish, disgusting! Decoration was so dated. No fridge in room, no mini bar. Very expensive food from restaurant. When we received our credit card bill, we realized they charged us for an extra night.

title: Very nice resort
review: Rooms are nice and clean. The pool is very relaxing. Clay tennis courts very nice.  Ironwood restaurant is excellent.  Close to shopping and lots of golf.  Very nice resort.

title: Clean, friendly hotel.
review: Beautiful views of the golf course. Friendly staff. Great food! The spa is fantastic!

title: Excellent golfing location
review: We stayed at the hotel as we were taking lessons at the David Leadbetter school. Did consider other hotels initially due to some less than favourable reports of the hotel on Tripadvisor, however for sake of convenience we decided to go ahead and book the hotel. We were so glad we did as the hotel exceeded our expectations with a very spacious and well appointed room, exceptionally courteous and helpful staff and as an added bonus the Honda Classic golf tournament was on during our stay and a leading golf pro was in the room opposite us! Even although the hotel was exceptionallly busy with the tournament on the standard of service did not slip. The only downside was that we were unable to play golf whilst at the hotel as the courses not being used for the tournanment were too…

title: It was nice, but they need to have more modern cottage rooms!
review: The property was nice and I was there right before the Honda classic.  Lots of pro's there.

title: Nice but dated
review: I stayed at the PGA resort Feb 12-14.  The pool looked amazing, but unfortunately I was here on business and we did not get any free time.  We were able to eat at all of the restaurants and the food was very good.   The staff is very accommodating.  The rooms are a bit dated.  Since I was here on business I really noticed the lack of electrical outlets.  There were none by the bed and the one for the desk was inconvenient as well.  The bathroom was clean but again dated.  If you are here for leisure these things may not bother you, so it would be a good choice.  My room did not have a mini bar but it did have a fridge.  Beware and include and extra $20/day resort fee when comparing other resorts in the area.

title: Wonderful getaway spot
review: I would like to share some exciting news with you in regards to your review. We have some exciting renovations that will definitely correspond with the comments you voiced about the resort. Starting this April and being finalized by November 2012 we will be continuing with renovations and enhancements to the resort which include:   •Floor-to-ceiling guest room makeovers will feature stylish bedding, headboards, wall coverings and carpet; spacious, modern work desks with multiple plug-in options; atmospheric lighting; and elegant furnishings. Suite bathrooms will have walk-in showers. We will also be having updates to electrical for all the most modern gadgets and electronics.  •Guest room corridors will showcase eye-catching carpeting; tastefully subdued lighting; and chic artwork and wall treatments.   •Our restaurant by the golf course, 19th Hole bar and grill, will be renamed “Bar 91,” presenting the latest in clubhouse furnishings, high-definition televisions and expanded outdoor dining overlooking one of the great vistas in golf. The addition of a kitchen will allow for a completely new menu offering.  •The Haig Golf Course will be renovated with new turf, irrigation systems, rebuilt bunkers, and expanded tee and green complexes.  •The Citrus Tree Café, with its renowned breakfast buffet, will re-open newly renovated, renamed the “Palm Terrace” and available as a poolside location for evening events.  •The Spa with 32 treatment areas and the exclusive "Waters of the World" outdoor mineral pools will also be updated matching the motif of the resort’s fashionably cool, hip décor.   We here at PGA National Resort are proud that our ownership is committed to the long-term plan of becoming the premier meeting and golf destination in the country.  Sincerely, The Executive Team at PGA National Resort and Spa

title: Great Resort, Great Staff
review: Chose this hotel for a one night Valentine's Day stay. The staff was friendly and professional. The facitilites were clean and well appointed. We spent most of the day at the pool had a great time. We would definitely stay here again!

title: If you're going for golf, don't do it.
review: Stayed 4 nights with three friends on the gold golf package for our first visit to PGA national.  I have visited several golf destinations over the years and this was by far the most disappointing from a golf perspective.  We stayed in a cottage, for which we were actually pleasantly surprised, given some of the previous reviews.  I assume that the one we stayed in had been recently remodeled, as the appliances, furnishings, tv, beds, etc. looked relatively new.  Housekeeping was great as cottage was always cleaned when we returned from golf including the dirty dishes (left a nice tip upon our departure).    The golf, however, was disappointing, mostly from the perspective of not getting value for your money.   We played the champions course  (good but not great)  twice because…

title: Not a luxury hotel,  but clean and great facilities!
review: We went down with a few ladies to play tennis...It is really a golf hotel,  but the courts were great!  The fitness  facilities and the spa were great!  They have a private pool area at the spa and you can have a healthy lunch and take a dip in special mineral baths!  The Bar in the hotel is very lively at night,  with entertainment most nights.  The restaurant in the hotel,  is one of the better ones in that area.

title: Overall a comfortable stay, but it's a question of how you want to spend your money.
review: My partner and I decided to stay for a much earned rest after exhibiting at the PGA Golf Show in Orlando. In total we stayed 8 nights. We are from the UK and went by Trip Advisor reviews in deciding on staying at the PGA National.Knowing nothing about the area, we booked on line from the comfort of our home and went through hotels.com. We are both keen golfers and wanted to play both courses in the area as awell as the PGA courses. On arriving late evening we were pleasantly happy with our room which was spacious and comfortable. The Ironwood bar was super for a late supper and drink. The staff were very helpful. After a good night sleep, we went to the coffee shop for breakfast and sat in the warmth on the terrace- lovely. Tip no 1, you don't need to pay extra for breakfast.…

title: Great for Golfers
review: The accomodations are roomy and clean. The hotel lobby bar is lively and has a good bar and lunch menu. You really go here for the golf. Great selection of courses. the only down side was the hotel breakfast area. The space needs some updating.

title: Great Stay in a Classy Resort
review: I recently stayed at the PGA National Resort and Spa while participating in a multi-day golf tournament. This was my third stay at the resort in the past 5 years and I found the new remodeling and improvements to be very well done. The iBar area in the lobby was always active and served excellent upscale food. Very refreshing after a day of golf. I also found the restaurants to be serving very high quality, unique dishes that were well presented.  The golf was excellent, as always. The Champions course was in perfect condition, with the greens rolling very fast. The Squire and Haig courses were also in very good condition, although the greens were not as fast nor pristine as the Champions course (which is to be expected).  Of course the front desk staff, pro shop staff and valet…

title: Do not plan your event at PGA National
review: I am in the middle of planning my wedding at PGA National in West Palm Beach. I booked the venue nearly two years ahead of time.  About ten months prior, when my family and I were beginning to secure blocks of rooms for the destination wedding Anna Erickson, PGA National's catering professional, promised, they told my family another corporate event had been allotted all of the rooms the week before my wedding. Now, my guests have no place to stay and we might be forced to change our wedding plans. Horrible service and disappointing.

title: Average Hotel
review: Although the bar area and lounge were nice to hang out in, the rooms were just about average.  The front desk was very accomodating for an early check-in at 11:00 a.m. The lamps and the telephone between the beds did not work at all.  The room seemed a little dark too, without any view.  Just a view of more rooms.  Bring your own conditioner, as they don't provide any.  For someone that has long hair, it can be an issue.  Also, funny how I was charged over $20 on my bill the next day after I checked out for using their mini bar?  They removed the charges when I told them I never even touched their mini bar.  It does bother me; however, when an establishment can charge you something that their missing when it wasn't me who took anything!  Makes me question their ethics in…

title: Disappointing
review: The bar, lounge, and to some extent the pools, really were lovely here, and we had an absolutely incredible meal in the Ironwood Steakhouse. Because of these factors I'm keeping my review at average. But the service, rooms and overall experience were hugely disappointing. We did not leave happy - not that anyone ever asked. As a disclaimer - because we spent upwards of $350 in the spa, our room was "free" (except for the assorted taxes - expected - and resort fee, plus other fees). That is the only reason we didn't make a  fuss, and part of why I'm giving it an average rating.   I visited the PGA National Resort & Spa this past weekend with two girlfriends. We each booked spa appointments and planned to spend the rest of the stay enjoying the pools, bar, lounge and restaurants.…

title: Personal Service As It Should Be
review: We recently spent 4 days at the resort combining business and pleasure. Aside from the setting, which was beautiful, I've seldom experienced a more friendly and helpful staff. I was pleased by the staff asking me  about my general well being, whether I was enjoying my stay, or in need of service. It didn't matter whether I was walking across the lobby, passing a staff member on my way to a meeting, or uusing one of the resort's many facilities.

title: PGA
review: PGA's new lobby and bar is a great improvement, and is a fun place to have some drinks. The rooms can described as middle of the road, and comfortable; but the lighting is really dim. The number one problem is the noise in the hallways. The doors have a locking system that creates a huge noise when they are closed. I stayed 3 nights, and was woken up each night multiple times as the doors slammed. There is a gap under the doors, and that makes the issue worse. In spite of putting two robes at the gap, I was woken up at 3:30 and 5:30 with huge door slams. Pool is nice, and the golf was nice , but the pace was super slow (5 1/2 hours) and pricey. Not rushing to get back......

title: Great for Golf Oriented Groups
review: PGA National is one of the best resorts I've seen for efficiently handling large groups of golfers like ours. The hotel has a great lobby bar meet-up place, and the food service was excellent even at the banquets.

title: Rude
review: Where to begin? From the rude front desk who refused to talk to us and instead walked away. To the housekeeping call that I did in order to procure toothpaste and a toothbrush ( something any normal hotel would have on hand)...snorted back....oh you can go buy that in the store...we dont just give that away..would not have been so bad if he was not so dam rude. To the over 5 mosquitoes my wife and I killed in our room the first night ( the back door was never opened). To the crib that we requested for our son - but was for an infant and was told there were no other cribs. 2nd day there we received a very different crib that works fine and moved to another room. maybe it was because we booked the room through priceline.

title: Your Grandpa's favorite hotel
review: We stayed at the PGA National for 4 days during a business / personal trip this past week of January 2012.   We have mixed emotions about the place. The common areas are very modern, and nice, the rooms are clean, but wow straight out of 1970, you almost feel like you’re stepping back in time, it’s very dated. For example: One of the bathroom sinks is in the bedroom area, almost no hotel does that anymore, but it was huge in motels of the 70’s. The furniture is also very 60’s, and kind of bold flowery prints. The artwork in the rooms was interesting though, all Southern Florida flora and fauna.   Each room has an angled balcony which is nice to come out in the morning and have coffee on, there was a small refrigerator in the room, and coffee maker, given the EXTREAMLY high…

title: Great for Meetings
review: I have stayed at the PGA National for three years in a row to attend meetings with clients.  They do an excellent job in hosting large events and their food service is second to none.  The bar in the main lobby is the center of activity each evening and is a fun place to hang out.  Service was friendly and efficient throughout.

title: Lots to do for the active person
review: Golf, tennis, fitness, yoga classes, power walking fill your day if you take advantage of the facilities.  The renovation to the lobby and pool area creates a beautiful setting.  The room we had needed an update, although it was quite spacious.  The staff were pleasant and efficient.  We had one dinner and one breakfast at the resort over a five day stay.  They were nothing to write home about.  There are ample restaurants outside the property.  There is plenty of parking, so valet service is unnecessary.

title: Impressive Resort
review: The PGA National Resort and Spa is an outstanding facility with some of the best Golf Courses in the world.  The staff is abundant, cheery, and helpful.  Aside from the golf they have a great spa, a nice workout facility, great clay tennis courts, and fine food at very reasonable prices. Whether you golf or not put this on your lists of destinations.

title: Lovely Experience
review: My daughters, myself and my husband just enjoyed two nights at this resort.  Overall just wonderful stay.. pool drinks and food a little pricey but overall enjoyed the whole resort.  the spa is beautiful but out of our budget.  love the band by the ibar.

title: Palm Beach Paradise
review: Over the years, my husband and I have enjoyed coming to the warm South for the Christmas holidays  to escape our frigid Canadian temperatures. This year, we decided to spend a couple of days at the PGA National Resort and Spa.  We made a good choice.  As we were driving down Avenue of the Champions, we were absolutely amazed at the expanse of the whole complex. This was only the beginning.   We were given a warm welcome at the Check-in desk and, as we waited for our room, we savoured a good cup of coffee and pastry at the Cafe Pronto. We found it a neat idea to have a coffee shop in the lobby, especially, when arriving early at the hotel, as we did.  We were soon shown to our suite through a wide hallway with cosy nooks, ideal for browsing through a magazine while waiting for…

title: Beautiful resort neading a bit of renovation and kid frendly?
review: We stayed at this resort on new year's eve and January 1st with our 2 boys. The grounds are so lovely. I think the rooms will be renovated shortly. Needs a bit of refreshing, especially the lobby carpets and the downstairs bar (bear trap). Speeking of the bear trap, they advertised a large pizza with drinks there for 2 days on the daily activity paper received in our room. We went there and asked for it... no waiter seemed to know what this special was!?  Also, I do think this resort does not want to attract families. Full green fee price for kids? Why is that?  The staff at the bar is very friendly and I thank you for the little 2012 chocolates at our room. A nice attention.  I recommend this resort but the green fees are to pricy for families.

title: Exceptional!
review: Thank you for your comments. We wanted to let you know that we are planning a major renovation starting in May 2012. Enhancements will include a thorough redesign of the Citrus Tree restaurant in addition to all room interiors and corridors which will be redecorated to making them more modern, and contemporary. We are actually in the process of creating a new and improved Kids Club with a newly renovated location in our resort. During the Summer months whent he kids are on break our kids pricing is more attractive and we offer some wonderful programming to keep the kids busy. We appreciate your taking the time to offer your comments. They are valuable to us and we take into consideration all the feedback you provide.  -From the Executive Office Team

title: 3 Day weekend
review: Golfers paradise, nice food selection, perfectly prepared, and served with a smile from friendly wait staff, close to shopping, free parking, easy acccess from turnpike.  Beautiful swimming pool, and plenty of tennis courts.

title: PGA National - Super place for everyone
review: PGA National is a one of kind destination. Golf is the central theme but there is something for everyone. The pool scene is as good as anywhere in the country, great food, music and drinks. The hospitality is second to none. This is both a resort and a community with friendly people who live and work in the area. You are close to the beach, and great food both formal and informal dining. The vibe at the hotel is also great with new and changing restaurants and a great and eclectic bar. I will come back many times.

title: No suprises here
review: There is never a surprise when we vist the PGA resort.  The service is always excellent.  The courses are in great shape, and the pool is very comfortable.  We look forward to going again.

title: Looks can be deceiving
review: Just completed a 5 night stay.  Overall, we had a relaxing time.  But for the reputation this resort has, it left a lot to be desired.  The front desk not all that friendly, very clearly overwhelmed/busy, and did not pay much mind to us.  The lobby, pool, restaurant, and really most public areas look very nice, classy, 4 star.   BUT, the rooms are another story.  They need a desperate renovation - and "marble" and "granite" placed over dated fixtures doesn't count.  Our king execute suite, while very spacious with a great view of the spa pool, just appeared a little dingy, old, and 3 star worthy.  Golf is very expensive and I'd think they would want hotel rooms that reflected a better image.   I would NOT recommend the breakfast package.  You can get breakfast at the Cafe in the…

title: eab
