review: Thank you for your valuable feedback. We are planning a major room renovation starting in May 2012 and are considering all of your comments here. Enhancements will include a thorough redesign of the Citrus Tree, all room interiors to bring them up to a 5 star level.  Your comments are valuable to us and we will most certainly follow up with Team Members and remind them of the importance of exceeding guest expectations.   – From the Executive Office Team

title: Excellent experience
review: My wife and I stayed here for Christmas eve and day - overall we enjoyed it a lot   Good points - pool and hot tub and wave bar are great in sunshine, iris who organises children's activites and her daughter are amazing fun, golf is great but v expensive if you don't have a package, food is great in all restaurants / bars, great tennis facilities and health club etc and running routes if you want to do that.   Bad points - we had to wait 45 mind to be served dinner on Xmas day but frederica did make it up to us with drinks and champagne and excellent service and food, pool can get busy  Overall would recommend this resort

title: Wonderful resort with something for everyone
review: We just returned from the resort that was a surprise Christmas gift for my husband. The executive suite, room # 2066, has a magnificent view of the lake & the practice range. I am a new golfer and the team in the pro shop, especially Chris, were top notch. We played 4 courses and I had a blast. Our caddie, Nathan Klatt, was very patient. The food in the IronWood was well prepared and presented. A little pricy but for a special dinner - perfect. We ate a meal in the bar area - food was ok but the service was not. Very, very slow but this is the only negative during the entire stay. The pool is warm and an ample supply of lounge chairs. They have activities for everyone - kids camp including a petting zoo & water slide to cooking classes and make up application tips in the spa. I…

title: Great weekend with the fellas
review: Just spent a long weekend playing golf, relaxing at the "cool pool", dining, drinking, socializing, and just lounging around.  Why leave the complex.  The golf, with all levels of play available, was terrific, the courses were maintained to the highest levels to please the fussiest of us golfers.  Had drinks at the pool on those nice lounge chairs, had dinner at Ironwood and finished off the night hanging around the iBAR meeting new friends.  Very easy access to the airport.  Staff was very friendly and accomodating.  Couldn't ask for anything more except a chip in or two.  Will probably bring wives next time because there is plenty for them to do as well.

title: October Golf Outing at PGA National
review: Our group travels to different resorts annually, this was our first visit to PGA National. We were thoroughly impressed by the facility as well as the over the top service.  The golf courses were is top condition, arrangements for tee times were hassel free.  The food in the restaurants were 5 star.  We shall return!

title: They Should Teach How to Host a Guys Golf Weekend
review: For years, friends and neighbors have travelled to PGA National for a spring weekend of golf, friends, food, and drink.  Each year they asked me to join them as they told about their most recent trip....even better than the last!  This year, I went.  They didn't exagerate, the minimized how good it was.  Terrific golf courses, fine accomodations, and superb service.    If you have a chance to spend a weekend or more with family and or friends and want to include golf at a terrific resort....PGA National is for you!

title: Great Family Vacation....Something for everyone!
review: One more day left and bumming out about having to leave.  My 18-20 year old kids having a blast playing tennis, golf and enjoying the pool.   Work out facilities are as good as they get.  Played 2 of the courses, both were in great shape and challenging. Golf service and attendands are great. The tennis facility is outstanding and included in the hotel package. Food so far has been excellent. Will definetly will be back!  Sign up early for tennis clinics..they fill up quick.  Mike  Boston

title: Golf and Stay
review: I stayed at the resort for 3 days and played 72 holes of golf.  Great Golf and great service.  I thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

title: Great hotel
review: I stayed at the PGA National Golf Resort and Spa and I had a wonderful time.  Great room, food and amenities.

title: Perfect for the entire family
review: We've been to the resort a handful of times now and we are huge fans.  Everyone looks forward to going.  Daddy loves the golf, mommy loves the spa, and the kids love the pool area.  It's a special treat to be able to bring our dog too.  The resort staff is as courteous and friendly as you'll find anywhere.  The rooms are impressively furnished with big flat screen TVs and comfy beds.  The free wifi works great throughout the resort.  The golf is top notch.  All four courses have always been in excellent shape and there's plenty of bathrooms and ice water located around the courses.  Both driving ranges are huge and there's plenty of room to practice all parts of your game.  I love not having to worry about my clubs at all.  The golf carts are new and fast.  My wife loves getting…

title: PGA National Experience
review: PGA National was the best hotel complex that I have ever been at, including the Breakers in Palm Beach! The spa was awesome, the golf was tremendous ( 5 courses to choose from) and the ironwood grille and the I Bar were perfect for relaxing and socializing The food and overall service was great and i would give it my absolute top ranking, definitely should be on your list of go to places in South Florida

title: Great Golf Resort
review: As a Golfer you have 5 Challenging golf course, the finishing holes on the Champion Course is a difficult as it get, especially if you get any wind. Superb practice facilities, extremely talented instructors for lessons. I love the Lobby Bar and a great pool for my family to enjoy!!! My hotel room was good, much better than i get at some other golf resorts that i have played!

title: Golf and resort paradise
review: This is a golf and resort paradise that caters to each and every one of your needs, whether it be great and challenging golf, wonderful food, excellent service, wines, drinks, bar life, and live music.  We were there for a guys annual trip and it did not disappoint.  Our golf carts were always ready, our dinners were planned perfectly, and the two room suites were upscale and inline with our expectations.  The 'Bear Trap' on the premier course brought us to our knees, this three hole stretch really shows how good the PGA pro's are at their game.

title: Golfers Paradise
review: If you are a golfer, then this is the experience you would dream of. My clubs were waiting for me each morning on a golf cart ready to go, after playing just drive up and leave em. Several great courses right on your doorstep (some more pricey than others), but definately a worthwhile experience.

title: Nice facility but poor housekeeping
review: I was at this facility in a two room suite while speaking at a conference.  The rooms are nicely furnished, check in staff is professional and food while expensive is good.  The problem with this property is the housekeeping in the rooms.  My  suite had two bathrooms.  The first had a used washcloth on the shower curtain.  The second had dried feces on the floor. In other circumstances, I would have checked out and gone elsewhere, but since the room was being paid for by the conference, and since I had another full bath,  I closed up the second bath, used the first one and hoped for the best.  While the dried feces were removed the second day, the level of cleaning of the restrooms were still subpar.  There is obviously no quality control in the housekeeping.  I would not book…

title: Went for a wedding, not for the golfing
review: Even though the front desk didn't really comprehend the kind of room we wanted when we checked in, they quickly took care of the problem and even upgraded us to make up for the problem. The King Deluxe room was spacious, though the furnishings were pretty spartan, and the bathroom was in need of an update.  The best part, however, was the good-sized balcony with the view of the pool, pond and golf course. Staff here is very friendly all around.

title: Convenient
review: Stayed at this resort to participate in a weekend long golf tournament.  Would definately recommend this hotel, it is golfer's heaven!

title: Overnight stay
review: We stayed there on Nov 13 for Nov 14's cruise from Miami. We got it by chance from priceline at 41USD/night, plus 25USD resort fee , tax, etc. Total will be 80USD/night.   PGA looks like a 3.5-4 star hotel within golf community. All are 2 story buidlings. The room is clean but it is a little bit tired and needs renovation. We did not have chance to try any ameneties within PGA.  It looks like a golfer's dream place.

title: Treat members much better than hotel guests
review: I have stayed and played at many golf properties before, but  PGA national treats members far better than the guests.  Had the second tee time of the morning on the Plamer course which was in very good shape. Was mvoing around course at a nice speed as would expect waking up early for a tee time until we make the turn. They had a shotgun back nine start of elderly ladies palying at about a 5 1/2 to 6 hour pace. The group in front of us even came back to us to tell us how slow it was about to become. After trying to get through a few miserably slow holes called the clubhouse to try to switch to a different course.  After three phone calls we did finially manage to swtich, but was given a terrible attitude about it was my fault for playing too fast. We were a threesome all…

title: Better if you are a golfer
review: I was here for two nights in early December and the grounds are very attractive but my King room was rather dated and while clean, it was a little depressing.  The water pressure was low and the faucets/showerhead had a strange spray to them.  The bed was comfortable, however, and my room had a nice view of the greens; the breakfast was standard and the ambience very average.  On the other hand, if you are a golfer looking for good value and great weather, I can understand why you would be drawn to this property.  If you are visiting here, take advantage of the facilities.  Bring your clubs or tennis racquet.  Otherwise, it's hard to recommend this property as being special--ok, the surrounding grounds are very attractive.

title: Strange Greeting
review: A client gave my wife and me a gift certificate for a king room and golf for several days.  The fellow at the front desk asked if I wanted to upgrade.  I asked what the upgrade would include.  He said, " a better view."  Most resorts I have been to give you a good view, if it is available, without charge.  The resort was fine, especially because I was there on a gift certificate.  The price of the golf at the rack rate is about $350pp. on the Championship course.  The course was nice, but I've played many nice courses for much less.  The Palmer course was also nice and much less.

title: A Beautiful Experience
review: This was a fabulous resort with extremely friendly and helpful staff. The Christmas decorations, which were awesome, certainly created a peaceful and relaxing getaway for us. We were very impressed with the facility. My husband, being a golf fanatic, raved about the Champion Course which he played. He likened it to being at Augusta, Georgia, home of The Masters.

title: Great Local Getaway
review: A little overnight escape. Family fun by poolside a wonderful experience   Great lobby bar and restaurant. There is a lot to do pool, golf, tennis, spa, fitness center. 1 night isn't enough time to experience the total PGA National Flair  I hope to come back again soon.  The only draw back is the pool is a it crowded with outside members of the club.

title: Great Resort
review: I visited for a friend's wedding. It was a great experience, much attention to detail on the part of the resort staff. We enjoyed the iBar in the evening and the Citrus Tree for brunch.

title: Nice place
review: I am from Florida and I have always wanted to stay here so on a recent visit I did just that. I had a standard king room with a great view of the pool area from my balcony. It is well kept and everyone was nice enough. I did feel a little weird since I was the only non-white person at the hotel other than the staff but I was never uncomfortable. I had a few drinks at the Wave (poolside bar) and a quesadilla but the restaurants and bar looked like they could be ok. It is a bit out of they way but I liked being away from traffic and such.There is tons of shopping close by and you are not too far from the inter-coastal. I would definitely recommend this place to a friend- especially a golfing friend.

title: A great find!
review: I travel to the greater Palm Beach area often and I found this resort by chance. I do not golf, but it looked like a lovely hotel for a reasonable rate. I can honestly say it exceeded my expectations. The Palm Beach Gardens area has a fantastic choice of shops, restaurants and bars. But, if you don't want to leave the hotel, there's certainly plenty to enjoy there! The service was excellent and the hotel was beautiful. A great find!

title: a very nice place
review: we stayed as  a  family.. felt the room with additional bed asked for was not provided for my child.. but room size was average...the night male hotel receptionist was less than helpful..in helping to get a bed for my child.. the resort it self was very good, well placed close to all amenities... pool is reasonable size , breakfast room is on the basememnt floor .. we stayed  off season and hence it was quiet.. i beleive some parts of the resort rooms are being re decorated again ..day time staff were helpful and pleasent ...may stay again.

title: What a great place to stay and play golf!!!
review: We stayed here for a  conference. If It had not been scheduled for this location we probably would have never gone there. That is not the case now. We will be back. Great rooms, great food, lots of leisure activities and of course GOLF!!!

title: PGA National - Golf Trip
review: Went to PGA National for golf reunion trip. Excellent service from wait staff to pro shop and valet service. We did this without a rental car and never missed a tee time or a car for that matter. Our group was pretty much solely focused on golf but we had dinner two nights at the resort and it was excellent as well as lunch by the pool. The courses were in great shape and while the Champ course is challenging and in nice shape so were the other courses (Palmer, Squires etc). We stayed in the 2-bedroom villas and they did the trick, nothing fancy but no complaints except no ESPN on their cable plan which during the college football season was an issue. 10-15 minutes from Palm Beach if you need to escape. Overall, a worthy destination if golf is your thing.

title: Great place to stay in Palm Beach
review: My son and his family live in the area and this is our favorite place to stay.  Friendly and helpful staff, nice rooms, fair price.  The resort overall is comfortable and inviting.  I am surprised at the review criticizing staff as that has never been our experience. They have always been most helpful and courteous.  I would rate it excellent if the beds were updated (not bad, but could be better) and there were more vegetarian items on the menu.  But I will definitely return as overall, I think it is the best place to stay in the area.

title: Relaxing in the rain.
review: During our stay at this resort it was raining as it only can in Florida.  Thankfully we were at this resort which offered excellent amenities since we didn't have much to do.  There was plenty of shopping nearby as well.

title: Average at Best
review: I went here with two girlfirends for a golf/spa/shopping vacation.  Golf was good but hard to get a variety of courses.  We finally put their feet to the fire and had them agree to put us on the Champions Course and NOT pay the $75 upcharge (totally not worth it) otherwise we would have been playing the same course all week.  Not acceptable given the number of courses they are supposed to have available.  The resort itself is not bad. I would not recommend the cottages as they are privately owned and not up to 4/5 star standards.  We ended up moving cottages as the first one we were put in was not satisfactory.  Second one was better but not even close to good value for the $750 we were paying per night.  There is an issue with the TV service.  The cable is not updated and the…

title: A wonderful stay......
review: I f your looking to treat yourself to a relaxing SPA stay this is the place. The staff was out of this world, the facility was perfect and the price was right.... Do it      TREAT YOURSELF!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Not impressed
review: Went here for a 3 day weekend and we were not impressed.  It's an okay resort, but not on par with others I have been to.  When we first pulled up, as soon as the bellmen realized we were not going to valet park, they totally ignored us and did not offer to help get the luggage/golf clubs out of the car.  The front desk staff was not much better, however there was a new person (I wish I had gotten her name) who was friendly.  We had reserved our tee times weeks in advance and had confirmations from our travel agent, however, the pro shop had no record of the times.  The pro shop staff made no apologies, but they did work us in on another course.  The courses we played were in good condition.  We did not use the spa so I can't comment on it.  We only ate breakfast there once…

title: Great golfing buddies venue
review: Five rounds of golf on four of the five courses with eleven friends. The golf tracks were great (but I spent too much time in the bunkers)! We stayed in the golf cottages. Lots of space for group time. Free wireless internet in the cottages. The hotel lobby is the place to hang out! The bar, music and dinning are all integrated into the lobby. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Food was outstanding. Cigar bar onsite.

title: PGA National Resort and Spa
review: Extremely nice and rennovated designation.  The Staff goes above and beyond to ensure any and all needs are met.  Most important is the relaxing atmosphere.

title: The best experiance
review: Everything was absolutely a wonderful experience. Every staff member we encountered there always had a smile and very outgoing. My room was wonderful. it was very clean and I felt very comfortable. The overall experience was the best I have ever had in all the years and places I have traveled to.

title: Stay that exceeds expectations...
review: As a 5 day a week business traveler, I chose to stay at PGA to indulge in The Spa. From valet greeting, to check-in, the staff was professional and efficient. The guest room was immaculate with superior quality bathing products. The high quality bedding made for a very restful night. I was delighted by the Spa services and being pampered. The resort is truly and gem that you want to return to again and again. Truly a place that will continually exceed expectations and something for everyone of all ages. Superior quality for the price.

title: Wonderful resort is true to name
review: I am not a golfer.  I just wanted somewhere upscale to stay.  Rooms are superb and spacious. All very quiet. Such a beautiful property with manicured grounds and designer pools and amazingly comfortable pool lounges.   Staff were excellent; very courteous, even the valet parkers whom I did not use..  Rooms were  beautiful with crown molding and wallpaper, and all had balconies with chairs and table, and large LCD TV with  a superb variety of channels.  Pillows were terrible; absolutely awful. Bathroom toilets were small and basic; good for women. Closet and safe were extra spacious.  Additional outside vanity and sink, mirror.  Beers for $2 at happy hour include some delightful craft brews. Resort fee is a pain, but here there is actually some possible value in facilities…

title: Wonderful experience
review: My husband and I spent the weekend to celebrate our anniversary. We enjoyed the spa and the pools, we also had drinks at i Bar and lunch at Waves we were very happy with the service and the food. I was pampered at the spa and plan on coming back very soon. It was very clean and maintained beautifully, staff is friendly and knowledgeable. There are some hidden fees we weren't expecting like $20 a day for valet and $25 for the use of the amenities. All in all it was a wonderful time and I will recommend this as a truly pampering experience.

title: Great trip
review: This was a golf trip for my wife and I.  We had a great time and courses were a great value, at least in September. The bell and golf staff were way above average. When we did have a problem the head head of housekeeping came by and made everything right. We also enjoyed the food, drinks and service at the iBar and iGrille, but be aware an 18% gratuity is already included in your bill.

title: September golf trip
review: This trip 9-18 / 21- 2011 was our second one to PGA National.  We returned to this resort this year for these reasons.  PGA National offers a GREAT stay and play rate.  We did not leave the resort once after we arrived.  Everything you need is there.  The golf as you would expect,  top notch.  4 courses keep you challenged.  The hotel and ammenities are in  line with a 4 to 4 1/2 star hotel.  The pool area is very nice.  There is a spa and tennis and lots of other things to do, but we never tried any of these because we were on the golf course all the time.  The staff at PGA National knows that you are their business and treat you as if you are the only person at the resort.  I have traveled an incredible amount of times, especially for golf, and this resort is one of my…

title: Just average if you aren't a golfer
review: The room was spacious and had a balcony.  The grounds were flawlessly beautiful, of course, this being a golf resort.  The self-parking is relatively convenient.  The food was average and very expensive.  Automatic 18% gratuity is applied to everything, including just a glass of wine.  The nearby Publix grocery store and Walgreens came in very handy for last minute, forgotten items.

title: Lackluster venue
review: We were at this location for a car show. The entrance was very nice and the gentlemen who valeted our car were very professional and friendly.  When we walked up to the desk and gave them our reservation we confirmed with them three rooms non-smoking, king size beds.  They said we were not guaranteed a king bed to which I immediately voiced my disagreement. She was a little snooty and told me that if I would wait a couple of hours they would see what they could do to accommodate us. We got one out of three kings. The service at the ibar was poor at best. The poolside bar the Wave, waitress and the food was very good. The next morning we had breakfast in The Citrus restaurant.  The waiter was great, very friendly, helpful and the buffet was excellent. The room was average at…

title: Great golf trip Destination
review: We loved the golf and the experience..However, I do feel that the property does need some refurbishing..If a guest does not have transportation, then the resort needs more restaurants with different menus - open for more hours...The best  restaurant "Ironwood Grill" has one menu that does not change for the entire week..not even their specials..The Bear Trap is not very inviting - really needs an overhaul and in a different location..19th hole is only open until 3pm - so no casual bar and conversation area after golf. Our golf game did not end until 2:45 and we were disappointed that we could not get any food....The pool was fabulous as was the Wave...The Spa was great and we loved it.. The bathrooms need to updated to 2011...All in all it was a great experience. Yes, we would…

title: Love this Resort
review: This is a lovely resort to spend a weekend at.........even if you live nearby! Fla residents and summer bring great rates also! Beautiful spa, lovely large pool area with misters everywhere and well appointed room!  The bar in the lobby has happy hours and specials. Their main dining room is a steakhouse which runs special and half price bottles of wine in the summer and it is deelish!  Great Thai restaurant down the street on PGA Blvd called TALAY THAI!  Dont miss it! This is our little weekend getaway spot only an hour away!

title: Good Price-quality in off season.
review: Most if the golf courses are in repair for October

title: Horrible  customer service
review: Asked to change rooms the 2nd night of three day stay due to other guests " partying" in the hallway Manager took 8 hours to find us another room with a dirty A/C Give us a $50 gift card to use in the pro shop.   When we tired to buy a shirt,  the pro shop manager said - the card has a ZERO balance After a 30 minutes wait, got the shirt Hope they don't send us a bill Very overrated hotel

title: We will be back for sure!
review: This resort was great and had everything for our family. The golfing was great, the pool was amazing and the spa was perfect. The accommodations were great as well. Everyone was so friendly. The prices for food at the bar, the buffets and restaurant were a bit pricey but overall it was great!

title: Great Golf Trip Destination
review: Planned a buddies golf trip for 12 guys with handicaps ranging from 5 - 18.  Stayed in three of the cottages, two to a room.  All the cottages were located in the same complex.  Cottages were a good set up and easily held the nightly meetings. Played all four courses.  The Haig was the only one that was below expectations because the greens had been aerated two weeks prior and hadn't come back. Because of that we moved our last round from the Haig to the Champion without the usual up-charge.  The golf staff was very accommodating about the move and everyday had our carts loaded and ready to go and even freshened the cart between rounds (new towels, emptied trash, etc).  My only complaint was the cost of food & beverages on the course.  $4.00 sodas, $14 for a hot dog & coke,…

title: One of the best vacations ever!
review: Only bad thing, not enough time to enjoy all the things this resort had to offer! Great resort with so much to do. Golf, tennis, pool, spa, food, bar, ect......

title: FABULOUS place!
review: Stayed for five days and everything was lovely.  Pool was just the right tempature, spa was relaxing, and service was top notch!  Everyone had a great weekend.  The room was spacious, clean, lovely view of lake, and beds where very comfortable.  We will be back next year

title: Love this place!!!
review: We came here last year and vowed to return due to the excellent golf and great location, so we returned this summer for 5 nights. The golf is excellent, and if you go for the golf package this can be really good value for money (you do pay $30 pp for a cart though).  Normally there is a $50 pp surcharge for playing the Champion course, but this was waived as they had recently done aeration of the greens.  The course was still in great condition (putting aside!!)... Palm Beach is an excellent location where there aren't too many tourists which is nice.  Lots of choices of restaurants, but the Ironwood grille at the hotel does the most incredible food. Staff are so friendly and helpful, fingers crossed we will be back again next year!!

title: Beautiful resort!
review: Driving up to the resort entrance is an event in itself....a truly impressive entrance. Beautiful room, great furniture and big flatscreen. Bathroom area a little tired despite all the marble. Well lit sink area outside the toilet/shower area. Shower /bathroom a little dingy. Need to upgrade the hairdryers. Got great complimentary body creme the first day.....cheaper substitute the following three days. Great bed and bedding. Pool area is outstanding although the piped in disco music gets a little tired. Found the Wave Pool Bar prices a little steep. Had to check bill closely to note that an 18% gratuity already included in bill. There was a written request for an optional "extra gratuity"......the nerve.

title: Great value
review: We stayed here for a couple nights when we needed a last minute place.  Hotels.com helped us find a deal, so for the price, we were very happy.  The rooms are large, clean, and comfortable.  The restaurant has a good selection of wines and the food is above average (not exceptional).  They charge for parking but at these prices, who cares.

title: Nice but not fantastic.
review: We have been going to PGA for the last couple of years using the summer escape package deals.  This year is probably our last.  The restaurant and ibar are very mediocre.  You may think you're getting a deal but do the math - and keep in mind, they charge a $25/day resort fee on top of whatever the package price is.  "Self-park" is available but inconvenient. If you chose valet, it's a $20 daily fee (+ tip everytime you use your car).    The air conditioners in the rooms are pretty noisy and very few rooms overlook the golf course.  Most overlook the pool (a/k/a noisy).  The spa experience was below par and not worth the $150 I spent.  My advice - if you're looking to golf this is probably worth it - otherwise, go for a spa resort on the beach.

title: Like a Country Club
review: A pleasant stay for a short get away. You can spend some money here  with the additional fees. The golf is expensive for Florida in the summer. The resort fee and valet parking fee along with a fee to use the steam and sauna (some spa pools not working)can put a dent in your wallet . I liked it here even though I was not overly impressed. A lot of group golf outings going on .If you came to spend the companies money this is for you. Like so many resorts in this economy , I could feel the squeeze going on...too bad. The employees were great and the stay was adequate but .........carpets could be cleaner , upholstery cleaner,cigarette butts emptied ..it doesn't feel high end to me

title: very nice    relaxing   loved it
review: very relaxing and fun place to spend time with family and friends.    The day at the  Spa was especially enjoyable.  I highly recommend a vacation here

title: Hidden Value - Great Property, Reasonably Priced
review: I had a one day meeting at the PGA Resort - heaven for golfers, but great for non-golfers too (me) - I even stayed an extra day (which I never do).  First, the property has relationship with GoTransportation from the West Palm Beach airport -- really easy, Go picks you up ($74 for towncar and $30 for van including gratuity -if booked directly with Go) and it is directly billed to your room.  The rooms are remodeled, new beds, big bathroom and of course flat screen tv.  I always want a clean room - so called in advance and asked for the air filter to be changed.  Not only was that done, but an Orick Professional Air Purifier was also brought to the room and operating when I arrived.  Also, the grounds are beautiful for walking, 3 pools and 5 golf courses.  All the staff is very…

title: Great golfing and wonderful family vacation!
review: This was our first trip to PGA National Resort and Spa. We were here for a golf tournament. The staff was very friendly and helpful during our stay. Our guest room was very clean and comfortable. We enjoyed our stay so much we will be returning in the near future.

title: we enjoyed our stay and we'll most definitely be back..
review: service was excellent  love the room location is great love the tranquility of the resort..

title: Love, love, love this place!!
review: We have been to PGA National twice now and planning our third trip for the fall of 2011.  We love everything about the resort.  Our first stay was during a renovation stage, so we didn't get to enjoy all of the hotel, but the follow-up visit was FABULOUS!!  The pool is first class, the golf wonderful (my first time with a caddie and I had the best!) and there were plenty of selections for food.  If you can hold out for a great package deal, do it.  The nicer restaurants can be a bit pricy, but the food and service is very good.  The rooms are sooo pretty and clean.  The spa is fabulous, though I've only been to the outside mineral pools.  My next visit will include an official visit to the spa.   I can hardly wait for our next visit.

title: Expected more given all the hype
review: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in May for a quick golf getaway.  I'll start with the pros - the common areas (lobby, bar, restaurants, pool, etc) are all lovely, clean and well maintained.  The service for the most part is top notch - we especially enjoyed Mindy at the poolside restaurant, and we got to know a few others at the lobby bar.  My husband played two of the golf courses and enjoyed them very much.  I spent that time at the pool, which is very nice - clean, plenty of chairs.  Now on the not so great side - the rooms are just.... tired.  And in dire need of some updating. The furniture and soft goods are outdated and the bathrooms just need to be gutted - dingy tile, dirty corners, yuck.  Also, the front desk person who checked us in clearly had better things…

title: Don't book direct!
review: Don't book direct with this hotel, we booked via a "special offer" email we received and ended up paying double what other guests had paid plus $200 for a round of golf on the Championship course which had greens which had just been "holotyned" so we had to putt to 3 foot and take gimmee's. The IronWood grill food and service was excellent but on the high $$$ side ($229 inc 2 glasses of wine) Our room was overlooking the practice ground(with binoculars) but was clean and spacious, room 2169.All the staff were very attentive especially all bar staff where they were very friendly and ready to mix a variety of Margaritas or Mojitos. Overall a good time was had although we wished we had booked through Expedia or Hotels.com as their deals were far better than direct, one guy even got…

title: We loved it and we'll be back!
review: We came for an international junior golf tournament. The rooms were above our expectations, both spacious and very clean. The property was gorgeous and all our requests were met with ease. Best hotel shower I've had in Florida ever! The food was prepared banquet style for our tournament and was excellent considering how many people had to be fed each morning and evening. The bed was very comfortable.The staff was always helpful and courteous. We cannot wait to come back!

title: Great location!
review: Didn't know about the parking fee up front, but really enjoyed not having to get my car in the lot when it rained! Comfortable rooms, nice staff.  I did most of my meals off property.  Really enjoyed the pool and hot tub!

title: Amazing hotel, great service
review: My husband and I both loved this hotel. The service was great, the rooms were spacious and the hotel clean. Everyone was very helpful and when I took a cute turtle stuffed animal as a souvenir (and expected to pay for it) they didn't bill us!

title: Great overall resort, something for everyone
review: Very nice golf resort with many other amenities! Something for every one but the fisherman. Incredible pool and incredible golf.

title: Overall great experience.
review: Friendly staff in all areas of the resort.  Outstanding golf experience.  A beautiful facility.  Great menu choices in all the restaurants.  Will return again and recommend it to our friends.

title: Great Room - Great Course
review: We had a 2 bedroom Executive Suite.  Great room, great View.  Room was very quiet.  My 7 year old loved the pool.  We entertained guests in the room and had a fabulous meal at the Ironwood Grille.  It was nice to get a call from reservations 24 hours before checking in to see if there were any changes.  Golf staff was accommodating to changes in foursome.  Champion golf course greens had been aerated but were still very playable.  Good GPS in cart.

title: Perfect Getaway
review: My family and I chose the PGA for a long weekend getaway from Miami, and loved it! We were looking for a peaceful and quiet location yet something with plenty of options for activities, shopping and relaxation. The tranquil setting of a first class golf resort, even though we don’t play golf was just what we needed! We had a terrific suite on the 2nd floor, right behind the lobby, convenient for access to the magnificent pool and the main restaurant, the Ironwood Grill. Duane the pool manager gave us a great tour of all amenities and services the day we arrived. He introduced us to Toni the bartender at the Wave Bar & Grill; both of them took great care of us during the entire stay. As I said, we do not play golf but we sure spend a lot of time in the fitness center and the spa.…

title: Great golf and friendly staff
review: Excellent golf facilities, went on the off season and took a chance on the weather and lucked out. The resort staff did a great job making sure everything was to our satisfaction.

title: Great facilities for families - just needed more time to use them all!
review: Great sporting facilities and good creche / childcare facilities too to allow parents to confidently enjoy some child free time knowing the kids are in good hands. Be sure to take your golf, tennis, pool and gym gear to make the most of all that's on offer.

title: Great Golf Weekend
review: I just came for the July 4th Weekend.  I live in New York and had thought about coming here to play some golf and take some lessons.  I came with my girlfriend.  She's not a golfer but likes tennis.   She tooks some tennis lessons (I saw one and thought it was a great lesson) and she accompanied me on the cart when I played golf.  As a golf weekend, it was great.  You have four great courses (though some are going or just went through some maintenance, but I didn't care about that -- they seemed great to me) right on the grounds.  You don't have to go anywhere to play them, which is great.  It was not very crowded this weekend, so you could play without waiting for groups in front of you and without pressure from groups waiting behind you.  The guys in the pro shop couldn't have…

title: great vacation
review: from the moment you drive up and someone opens your car door you have hit the perfect place.  the staff, amenities, rooms, food, and facilities, makes the pga one of our favorite couples retreats.  it truly has an activity for everyone.  even if golf, tennis, or a day at the spa is not your thing there is great shopping at the palm beach garden mall. we live in the heart of miami beach and hotel row, and this is the only hotel we return to repeatedly during the year. the value for your dollar cannot be beat..........5 stars in our book

title: We had a great time, but service needs improvement
review: Ok - here is my hotel review -   FYI - call the hotel for prices - the prices over the phone were half what the web rates were.    - the hotel itself was great.  It was clean and comfy.  We got an upgrade without paying for it, so that was nice.  Very kid friendly.    - the pool area was especially kid friendly.  My 2 yr old and 1 yr old loved the slow inclined entrance to the pool and we played in the shallow end for quite some time.  We met other guests with little ones as well  - the food pricing didn't always make sense.  For example, they had an all you can eat buffet by the pool with hotdogs, hamburgers, chicken etc....for $15 a person, but their breakfast was $22.50 a person and was pretty much a standard eggs, potatos, cereal and fruit buffet.    - definitely double…

title: Excellent Family Vacation
review: This was a great trip for our family.  There is a ton to do for the kids and us parents as well from the Kid's camp, golf, tennis, pool area, multiple bars and restaurants, spa, etc.  The staff is awesome throughout.  I would recommend it as a family vacation.  I would also recommend it for a golf trip with the 5 courses, 2 driving ranges, cigar bar, and multiple choices for eating and drinking.

title: I've visited around the world & there's nothing like PGA National
review: Wether you are a world class traveler, an avid golfer or just in search of a relaxing weekend getaway retreat; PGA national is a place to see and be seen. I've stayed, played and visited there many time for years now for business & pleasure and PGA has superseded my expectations everytime. Their golf is superior, PGA Spa/Salon is second to none, and their entire staff throughout the property is phenominal. When visiting Palm Beacheither in need of a moderatly priced hotel, or are looking for a 5 star resort experience; PGA National is the place for couples, business trips or your family not to miss.

title: What a pleasant surprise!"
review: I am not a golfer and was attending a baseball tournament in the area.  I moved from the team hotel to get more of a vacation feel since I was spending a week in the Palm Beach area.  I was pleasantly surprised to find the package deal on-line for this amazing resort.  I feel I got a great deal for the beautiful surroundings, comfortable rooms, and amazing breakfast.  I read reviews on line that the staff was not too friendly so I expected a stuffy resort feel but I got the exact opposite.  Everyone was so friendly and welcoming, I felt like I belonged in the resort despite the fact I was a baseball mom with my two boys. The staff smiled and said hello, everyone worked hard to make me happy and I did not feel like they were looking for a tip every second, I felt they were…

title: Beautiful resort!
review: I was here for business and it was a beautiful resort.  Banquets, room service, staff all very professional and nice.  Room was very comfortable.  Enjoyed it!

title: Resort with something for everyone
review: We have gone here two years in a row with a group of 40-55 "golfers". You are treated very well in general. Sometimes service at the ibar is a little slow foodwise but not too bad. We only ate at the restaurant once and it was not memorable other than the house wine was awful. The have a mini starbucks on site where you can buy sandwiches snacks and coffee for a reasonable price. Ice and water machines are plentiful on the courses so no need to buy a bottle of aquafina from the hotl for $6!  I didn't go to the spa but the ladies I was with really enjoyed it with no complaints.

title: Great facility with excellent service, would definitely stay there again.
review: Our room at PGA National was very nice and extremely quiet.  All rooms have either a balcony or patio.  The spa & spa pool were fabulous and fitness center was very large with a large number of exercise classes that were all included in room price...no extra charge for fitness center.

title: Difficulty checking in & out
review: I booked a 4-star hotel through Hotwire - and received confirmation that PGA National Resort & Spa was my hotel. I arrived there after midnight after a cross-country flight - very tired. The front desk didn't have my reservation. After about 20-30 minutes of the desk manager scratching his head what to do, he made another reservation for me & said we could straighten things out in the morning. I will mention that the room was nice and comfortable - the little time I was actually in it (about 8 hours total). When I checked out in the morning, they still hadn't  received my Hotwire reservation, and I had to wait another ten minutes or so for them to figure out what to do next. They finally figured out enough to close out my room - and they added a $25 "amenities" fee to my bill. I…

title: Awesome place to stay and golf - fantastic for a golf vacation
review: Stayed here for a long weekend get-away from cold Michigan and can't say enough good things about it!  The resort is very close to the West Palm Beach airport so it's easy to get to and very well marked from the highway.  Nice hotel and lobby bar area - we didn't use the pool, but it looked welcoming...  Can't beat the convenience to the golf as four of the courses are right there and you can walk from your room to the Pro Shop to check in and get your cart and go!  Nice range areas and great golf courses.  Used the spa once and it is beautiful and serene -- just a little difficult to locate -- the resort needs better signage for directions to the spa area.  Be sure to give yourself plenty of time to enjoy the experience and great pools with different 'healing' waters from…

title: One of our all-time favorite places.
review: We live about 60 miles away in Ft Lauderdale, and we probably average 10 visits per year.  We are avid golfers(read hackers here), and the variety of courses fit our games perfectly.  The staff is great, going above and beyond to make your stay a great one.  The  restaurants are excellent here-we don't bother going off-property for anything to eat.  The spa is also excellent, with a wide variety of services.  If you like, the beaches are just a few miles away(I recommend Jupiter/Juno Beaches) to the east.  We have been coming here for about 12 years, and many of the staff have been there at least that long.  A great resort, either for a group of serious golfers, a family, or just a couple for a getaway.   We are going again in July for wife's birthday, August for one of our 5…

title: It was very nice - just not my kind of place.
review: The hotel was nice, the staff was courteous (though not overly friendly), the grounds were well maintained, and the staff of the spa was wonderful. All in all not a bad place to stay. We got a very good rate because it was the off season. My husband loves to play golf so this seemed like a good plan for a short vacation. The course he wanted to play was closed for some sort of work and he said the one he played was OK but not as great as he expected. The room was wonderful, comfortable and clean and we had a very nice view.   My daughter and I spent one day at the spa and one day touring the Palm Beach area.  I doubt we would stay there again. Since the main reason we went was for golf and my husband was not overly impressed we will try somewhere else next time we plan a "golf…

title: COULD NOT ASK FOR MORE
review: Wonderful experience for a new golfer.  The pro was patient and motivated me to not be discouraged.

title: Classic example of "bait and switch" at the pro shop.
review: My wife booked this 3 nite special 2 weeks ago. We arrived from Naples about 7pm on Thurs. First impression fantastic, friendly staff, very clean room, nice and relaxing. I was on a 3 day golf binge while my wife did the spa and shopping. So we get up late and have to go to the front desk and check out and then check back in right away cause the "special" doesn't  start till Friday. No big deal but silly, so I played along not to be grumpy. Now that we were officially on the package golf special I headed to the course. The Pro shop is where you really have to be on your best game. The Champions course is the only one available (not) , it's not in top shape as the greens are being conditioned and the sand traps were hard pan. If the greens we not so bumpy like railroad tracks it…

title: For a golfing weekend, this place is great!
review: Liked the room, liked the staff, LOVED the golf courses. Three days of playing the ball down and never landed in a divot!  The grass on the fairways is like a carpet, and the roll at the end of my drives added 25-30 yards on each shot.  The restaurant was kind of pricy, but it IS a resort, so not unexpected.  Overall, we had a great time. I suggest if you're just a couple, you should find another couple to go with you so don't have to play as a twosome.  We played as a foursome and finished in 4 hours with no waiting to hit shots. If you can't find another couple, ask the pro shop to pair you up.

title: A First Class Resort Experience, Thanks to its Recent Renovation
review: Now that the multi-million dollar renovations are well established, PGA National has emerged as a superb golf/tennis/spa resort in the northern Palm Beach area. It's physically attractive, the golf courses are in terrific condition, and the dining/entertainment options are many. My room was generously sized and first-rate in every regard. It couldn't have been more comfortable. The service staff tries hard to make your stay enjoyable, often greeting you when you're not even expecting it. Example: Midday Sunday, I asked the concierge for that day's paper. There weren't any at the front desk, so the gentleman took me to the elevator and together we checked each floor's lobby area to see if there were any spare copies. He went above and beyond the call of duty. My only gripe: on…

title: DISGUSTING SCENE AT THE POOL
review: On Memorial Day Weekend 2011, my husband and I went to this Resort with our 2 daughter; 19yr old and 12yr old. We decided to go to the pool and enjoy out stay but unfortunally that was not the case. At the pool was this group of people bringing shots of alcohol in trays; about 15. The guys were pouring the shots on 3 female’s breast and liking their entire chest in front of many children and none of the staff at the Resort did anything about it. This people were very loud and drunk. It was very disgusting to see an adults doing this stuff and not having any consideration or respect for other families that like us, plan this family vacation and paying maybe even more that any others and not be able to enjoy the Resort or Pool because of this. We ended up living the pool and…

title: Beautiful Resort!
review: Attended a Sales Conference at this resort and everything was impeccable!  Staff was very friendly and greeted everyone they came across.  Rooms are modern and well appointed.  Although wish they had a business docking stations near the desk.  Not many outlets were found.  The grounds are fantastic, pool area was amazing for lounging and relaxing.  Spa services were very tranquil and I highly recommend a visit if you need a little pampering.  The plunging Mineral and Sea Salt pools are a must.  Banquet facilities are top notch along with the staff.

title: Cottages should be avoided...
review: This resort is great for golf (although expensive) but the accommodation we booked was terrible.  The 2 bedroom cottages should be demolished and rebuilt because remodelling would not fix the problems.  Very tired 70's style decor, dirty, the sofa bed my kids were to sleep on was ancient and bumpy.  When I asked for 2 rollaways they wanted to charge me for them.  The kitchen equipment was minimal and old.  No sets of anything so you couldn't really work with it.  Dresser drawers were broken, no knobs, bathrooms were old.  I can't say enough bad stuff about this accommodation - take my advice, do not under any circumstances book these cottages.  We all thought the area was pretty much deserted and only later realised that we were the only saps that booked these awful places.  The…

title: Nice, but.................
review: Five ladies went for the SPA special.  Lots of extra charges.  Make sure you check your bill for anything, including food.  GRATUITIES are added already to the total on any bill. Biggest complaint were the spa pools.  Both of the larger pools in the spa area had algae and who wants to go into a pool in that condition???  This was very upsetting to us in a fancy posh resort.  NOT ACCEPTABLE!!!  Spa and massage were very nice! Room was nicely furnished, but hairdryer was missing.  Our friends in another room did have a hairdryer.  Perhaps someone took it, but housekeeping should see that all necessities are in the room............part of their job I would think.   Lots of little extra charges.

title: Too Pricey for the stay
review: Although a very clean and nice hotel, it seemed as though their were many hidden costs. resort fee is $25 a day even if you dont use the aminities. bottle of water is $6, and they bait children with a $20 stuffed animal laying on your bed. not to mention $25 a night for valet parking. not relaxing, had to move rooms cause the halls were so loud and walls were so thin, and pool was crowded with kids. wouldnt stay again.

title: Worst Breakfast Buffet I Have Ever Had
review: Rooms are adequate.  Lighting is the poorest I have ever had in a hotel room.  Very dim bulbs in all of the lighting fixtures.  Breakfast buffet in the Citrus Tree Restaurant was the worst hotel breakfast I have ever had ($26.00 per person).  Food was tasteless and cold.  Biscuits were cold and hard (like hockey pucks).   Service in the restaurant was awful.  Never received a refill of juice despite requesting such.  Front desk employees were poorly trained and not at all welcoming.  Check out was a nightmare.  Our room had been paid for by the conference we were attending but the front desk staff insisted otherwise.  Internet was slow.  It is difficult to believe this is a four-star resort.

title: Beautiful resort, great staff & service. I'll be back!
review: This property is truly amazing from the pool to the golf courses. It's well maintained and absolutely beautiful. Must make this a destitation trip for family vacation or reunion with golfing buddies.

title: Average quality, high end prices
review: The room was dated, but comfortable and clean. With a special conference rate of $150 it was OK. The hotel does win first prize in the 'Worst Breakfast Buffet Value ....... EVER!'. Shockingly poor quality meat and eggs, at $26 pet person ! I wouldn't return on my dime !

title: Friends wedding My Treat
review: Me and my husband stayed at the pga resort, after one of our friends was married there.  It turned into our litte retreat. we loved it!

title: Beware of the "cottages"
review: This place is a very mixed bag.  Lobby, pool area and restaurants are fine.  We unfortunately stayed in what they misleadingly call their "two bedroom cottages."  These were in fact circa-1970 cheaply constructed condos.  Everything about them was circa 1970s, including the decor.  Very tired, very average, very depressing.  On top of the poor quality, the "cottages" are not even on the property.  They are in a residential housing development that is a 10 minute walk or 5 minute drive from the resort.    We felt totally mislead and left after two days.  We would have left sooner if we could have.  Don't make the same mistake.

title: Overstated quality
review: It is a beautiful property and the pool area is excellent. However everything is very over priced.  They do not take the in room coffee cups and glasses to the kitchen to be cleaned...I marked the bottom of my cup and it was only cleaned in the room sink..ugh. Older accommodations need to be refreshed and the internet connection is basically nonexistent outside of the lobby.  Why they do not fix this is beyond me in 2011 when virtually everyone needs to be connected for dinner reservations, business, and family concerns.  Overall it is overvalued and the glasses and coffee cup issue is being reported to the health department as soon as possible.

title: Nice facility Great staff great location
review: Nice facility, great staff, great location. I would recomend this property to anyone visiting the Palm Beach area.

title: Tired, Overpriced and Watch Out For Lack Of Internet
review: I am very familiar with PGA National having been here numerous times and rented a Golf Villa for a month. The golf is good but way overpriced. The Honda Classic Course costs over $200 if you are on the golf package the other courses are $150. Only 2 of those are really any good, The Haig and The Squire. The golf staff in the pro shop is excellent.  The resort is tired and needs renovation. It's clean but worn without the basic in-room amenities like a microwave or refrigerator. The internet access is ATROCIOUS! The have 10Mbps for the entire hotel. At times I had download speeds of 0.13. Welcome to dial-up. The Operations Manager told me that he hadn't had any complaints and just then another guest walked up and complained about it also.  All in all the value isn't there. I…

title: Pool is as beautiful as the photos!
review: We just came back from a wonderful four-day stay at the PGA Resort. The photo of the pool was what attracted me and it's just as beautiful in person. This is a low-key resort, with a mixture of families, golf and tennis enthusiasts, and couples. We used the pool and tennis courts, and drove to Miami and Port St. Lucie for day trips. There are many restaurants within a short drive. Every room has a balcony. I will definitely recommend this to others and would stay here again.

title: A luxury trip that lived up to expectations
review: Invited to attend a conferance at the PGA National and was excited to visit one of golfs best courses.  The entire trip exceeded expections.  The hotel was beautiful and the staff did an out standing job of making you feel welcome.  Food at the resturants and meeting events was perfect.  Our meeting was help a week prior to the Honda Classic PGA stop and the entire venue was being prepaired for that event.  Even during the hustle and bussle of that process the staff still took great care of the guest on the property right then.  It realy was a remarkable feat.  The Champions Course (the one they will use for the Honda Classic) was open during all of this and words can not describe the thrill to play this course.  I was excited to play this course and it truely did not disappoint.

title: It's like staying at a Holiday Inn for the price of the Ritz.
review: Initially I was disappointed by the outdated decor of the rooms. Then our suite was not equipped as we were advised it would be (pull-out sofa and kicthenette). The restaraunts were grossly overpriced for quality of food, especially the $22 breakfast buffet. To add injury to insult, we were overcharged and I was told I had to take the matter up with "accounting". The accounting department were clueless as to how to resolve the issue until I had to spell it out for them; or they were just lazy. On a good note, the rooms were clean and the housekeeping staff was kind and efficient. I guess the only reason people would want to stay here is for the golfing.

title: A very well designed & operated resort, with great golf & tennis.
review: Facilities are well maintained, service generally exceeded my expectations, cottages are nice, but they were short of essentials such as paper towels. Dining was more than adequate, golf courses are world class and tennis facilities are super!

title: Very  nice hotel
review: Thiis resort is very nice.  I highly recommend the spa to anyone--it's a splurge, but worth it.  The pools are divine, so pack a swimsuit.    The Crab Maison sandwich is divine.  So divine that I had two while I was there!  Try it with the sweet potato fries.    Staff is friendly, public areas are beautiful.  The rooms are also very nice, extremely nice but I think they might need a bit of an upgrade in the bathrooms (nothing wrong, just not as fabulous as the rest of the hotel)  and having only one accessible electrical outlet in the room was frustrating.  In-room wireless was a bit slow at times, too.  Despite those very minor issues, this hotel is beautiful, staff are friendly and helpful and West Palm Beach is gorgeous -- doubly so in the dead of a gloomy winter!

title: Stay somewhere else.......
review: I stayed at PGA Resort for 3 nights on business.  Let's start with the lobby bar.....on Superbowl Sunday they had game specials with $6 house wine.  It took 25 minutes for the waitress to take our order.  She never came back to check on us and when I finally got the bill they charged regular price and apprently hotel policy is adding 18% gratuity to all tabs, so I guess they don't feel the need to provide good customer service.  They even add 18% gratuity at the coffee counter!    The guestroom was fairly large, but outdated and worn.  During my stay I had to call housekeeping for a bath mat and TOILET PAPER!!!!!  When I called housekeeping I was told I needed to call the front desk and they had to call housekeeping???? This is suppose to be a 4 star resort, but there product…

title: Expensive but wonderful
review: Excellent staff, awesome grounds and buildings.  I tagged along on my husband's business trip and had time to enjoy my stay. I spent a morning at the spa, where they do wonderful work. Word to the wise, however. I knew ahead of time what each service cost, and when I checked in for my spa services, I was told tip was included - which made the services seem more affordable. Actually, tip was added on by the spa at the checkout when I was done, and I am apparently a very good tipper. My $125 service actually cost $145.  The food was very good, the beds were very comfortable. The only refrigerator in the room was in the locked cabinet where the drinks were, so we did not use the fridge, so I kept my bottles of water cold with ice in the sink.  The service was very good, and for…

title: Great service, friendly staff, wonderful golf
review: Just got back from PGA national, was very impressed with stay.  Staff courteous and very helpful.  Had to change tee times for a late flight and they were very accomidating.  Some slow rounds but that had more to do with the players ahead of us, and hey, I was on vacation so I was not in a rush either. Room was clean and comfortable.  Breakfast was included and was fantastic.  As with any resort there are nickel and dime charges, but with such a friendly staff It was hard to complain.

title: Disappointed in quality level, worn carpets and older fixtures.
review: The hotel was a little disappointing, definitely needs an renovation upgrade. Entry is outstanding and sets high expectations.  Restaurants and food as outstanding.  Golf is great, however, women's locker room was shameful for any club house, let alone a high end course with high end prices.  Resort rooms were older, carpets worn, bathrooms had peeling wall paper and a little dirty in shower/tub.  Shower was very old, I've had much better at 25% of price.  Upgraded to suite with bar, but no bar fridge, very annoying.  Overall hotel was ok, just not as luxiurious as I expected for a 4 star resort and for the price.  Balcony had great space and view, but furniture was cheap and uncomfortable.  I wouln't stay again and I wouldn't recommend it for the price.

title: The last straw
review: I recently returned from a stay at the Resort, which to summarize was completely un satisfactory.  I have been part of a group of 8 men who have been coming to PGA National for 25 years and from time to time have encountered poor service...or worse.  A few years back we were given a very tepid heads up that the lobby was undergoing "some renovation", but that our stay would not be impacted.  We arrived to an active construction site and had to navigate through workman with jackhammers, and assorted noisy power tools through a hallway surounded by plastic to contain dust.  There were ladders and extention cords everywhere!  Not only was it very unpleasant...it was unsafe.  This year we were treated to arrive during a motorcycle convention.  All 8 of us were unceremoniously…

title: A Great Escape with great golf on 5 courses
review: We were on the fall escape package, which included daily golf/cart on four of the courses [Champion is $100/each extra], breakfast [either buffet or menu], free parking. Be aware there is a daily resort fee in addition to the room charge, and 18-20% gratuity is added onto every service, including spa services. Room was a good size, with a balcony that had 2 chairs/table. Very comfortable bed, quiet atmosphere allowed a good night's sleep. Toiletries fine for a man, women bring hair conditioner. Fantastic golf experience- my husband and I golfed seven days straight in perfect weather. The golf staff were friendly, efficient and professional. Resort was very accommodating when we needed to stay an extra night due to flight cancellation. Use the web site to check out availability,…

title: Luxurious Stay
review: This resort is so lovely. It offers everything you could possibly want. The golf courses are in excellent condition. I didn't get to visit the spa, but I will next year. We are already talking about our return visit.

title: Beautiful Hotel Grounds, Decent Rooms, Nice Area, Very Classy
review: To begin with, it is important to note two things:  1. I do not golf and did not golf on this trip.  I can say that the courses looked fabulous and a golfer would likely be in heaven here.  2. I booked this hotel via Hotwire, so I did not not know where I was staying (only that it was 4 stars) and I paid only about $100 a night, much less than a regular stay here.  That being the case, I was very impressed as soon as I walked into the resort: It is very, very classy with beautifully maintained grounds, a very swanky bar complete with white piano overlooking the pool, and a very professional staff.  This certainly has the feel of a four star resort, and the other guests fit that description with their $200k sports cars waiting at the valet outside.  You certainly feel like your…

title: CANT GET BETTER THAN THIS
review: THIS IS A COPY OF THE LETTER SENT TO THE MANAGER AT PGA NATIONAL. Dear Joel,  Although I just answered your survey I want to take this opportunity to tell you (without filling in the little dots on the survey), what a great resort you have and how well it is run.  From the minute I drove up till the moment I left all of your staff seemed to go over and above board to make my stay more than memorable. Always a smile from your staff was very much appreciated and more than that, I was amazed that whether it was at the ibar or at the Citrus tree your staff always spoke to me by name. So tell me how did you ever get them to remember the names of all your guests or was it just me?  I did not use the spa, pool or fitness room in as much as I was there for golf, good food and a good…

title: relaxation and great golf courses on site, no driving
review: Our townhouse was a little out dated but very clean. PGA National is a very well run resort. Overall we had a great time and would go back if we had the chance.

title: Splendid
review: My weekend stay with girlfriends for drinks, dinner and a facial at the spa was wonderful. The room was surprisingly nice. This was my very first facial and I think I'm addicted.

title: Nice full service resort at a reasonable price
review: The grounds were beautiful and impeccable.  The children in our group were well-entertained, while the adults enjoyed walking, the pool, and the health club.  The weather was chillier than we would have liked, but we enjoyed the tropical setting anyway.  The rooms were quiet and the beds comfortable.

title: Outstanding Value
review: The PGA is a beautiful facility and all the services are top of the line. The restaurants, golf, spa, etc. are staffed by very pleasant and knowledgeable people that obviously want to please the guests.  This was our second visit and will not be our last.

title: Hotel Nickel & Dime
review: I would never normally stay at a 4-star hotel....it's just out of my budget. But while attending a wedding in Palm Beach Gardens, we stayed here because we got a package deal and it ended up being very inexpensive with our flight. Apparently, the price we paid online was not enough for this hotel; as soon as you arrive they slap you with a $25 per person "resort fee" for use of the health/fitness center. This fee is NOT optional so you have no choice but to pay it (with tax!) or find another hotel the day you arrive.  I could have gotten over this, were it not for the next thing:  upon going to a wedding party, we asked the concierge for a cab, at which time they said to us, "a cab? you don't need a cab! you should use our car service!" So then they proceeded to fill out…

title: Golf paradise, and so much more
review: Even without all the golf courses and the terrific access to them all, PGA national would rank among my favorite destinations. Add the fact you can walk downstairs and right onto the first tee and it's a no brainer.   Rooms are well appointed and nicely updated. Mine had a couch and balcony to make it feel all the roomier.   Dining options are nice, from the casual coffee shop in the lobby to the grill by the clubhouse to the upscale prime dining spot. And the bar is the perfect locale for hanging with pals and doing some nice people watching. TVs cement this as a sweet spot for a buddy trip, but there are plenty of options if you're on a romantic getaway.   The golf is a huge attraction and the diversity of courses allays any fears about having all your golf in one resort. The…

title: Great courses, fabulous facility
review: The golfing is, not surprisingly, superb. Although the championship course, known for the Bear Trap and host of the Honda Classic, is the one most people seek to play, don't miss playing The Squire, which is fabulous. Scenic and challenging, water comes into play on every hole --- and seemingly every shot.   The resort is superb; modern, spacious rooms. nice bar, wonderful restaurant. And if you just want to work on your game, the Leadbetter Academy and Dave Pelz short game school are on site. I'd highly recommend this spot for a golfing vacation.

title: best golf resort in florida
review: With 5 championship golf courses, a double dose of Daves teaching (Leadbetter & Pelz) right there, plus awesome Spa, Dining and other amenities, this is the perfect place if your an avid golfer and want to play the infamous Bear Trap and enjoy lovely accommodations and outstanding service. Ironwood Grill is one of the best restaurants in Palm Beach.  I have stayed here numerous times with groups, family and on my own and always been treated fabulously. Even if you don't golf, there is tennis, croquet or just a whole bunch of leisure to enjoy with easy access from the Florida Turnpike, I-95 or the Palm Beach Airport. Do yourself a favor and check it out- you won't be disappointed.

title: Great facility, great service at a fair price.
review: I have been there before and will continue to go there. Great place, wonderful golf courses.

title: Excelent,
review: We enjoyed very much our stay in this magnificent hotel!  Excelent level of service, nice rooms, very nice gardens ,outside pool and Spa. Would like to come again!

title: Golf Shrine Beckons the Devotees
review: An enigmatic and slightly weird hotel choice, unless you love golf.  For those who do love the game, this is their shrine and all is as it should be. Overpriced food and beverage services; noisy lobby bar dominates the main entrance.  Rooms are pleasant, but avoid the 'interior' rooms with small balconies that face only palm tree tops.  Reservations staff will claim "all rooms have a view".  This is not true. Old-style bar fridge in the room is only there to run up your bill.  Decline the key, and request a portable fridge be brought in instead ($25).  Stock it with your favorite snacks and beverages, available just outside the PGA gates (Walgreens, Publix, etc.). Low grade TV service; no digital.  Poor WiFi. Comfortable bed, but you have to insist on fresh linens each day. …

title: The quality and service are unsurpassed
review: Be prepared to have all of your needs taken care of on this beautiful slice of paradise!The staff are warm, friendly and knowledgable of the area.

title: I want to come back -- SOON
review: Luigi, Al and the sommelier in Ironwood were warm, informative and made my visit a learning experience...wines suggested were always perfectly described and enjoyable.  Dinner specials and suggestions were supreme. Somehow these 3 gentlemen found ways to make it comfortable when lost in the wine list.  Hector at the front desk was jovial, efficient and very professional with a smile.  Opal in I Bar was such a joy!  An unnamed "hero" for me was Ana; she is one of the housekeepers.  I had an allergic reaction to something and was ill during my visit.  She was in the ladies room when this happened; she was kind and worried about my well being.  She cleaned up my "mess" and offered me a maternal type of attention during this event --- it was a brief encounter, albeit a negative one…

title: We will surely return!!
review: Our recent stay at PGA was fantastic. The grounds and hotel are beautiful and perfectly maintained. The staff was enormously friendly and helpful!  The lobby bar was always lively and fun. During our stay they hosted a Wine night with live opera singers in the lobby one night and a "ladies night out" with boutique shopping in the lobby another night!  Both added a pleasant "spark" to our stay. The pool and outdoor seating areas are really spectacular! The spa was exceptional. This will be a repeat vacation spot for us!!

title: Mostly Exceptional
review: The resort is fabulous.  People make the difference and here is all about the people enthusiastically making sure your stay will be a great one.  The only drawback was to me were the golf courses.  I may have been expecting too much in the terms of architecture or the "WOW" factor.  The courses were in very nice condition, with the usual very friendly staff.  I am kind of a golf course snob so... maybe it is me.

title: Hopefully not a "once in a ifetime" experience because I want to do it again!
review: The trip was a nationwide golf tournament hosted by Century Golf. There is nothing in our 4 day experience that we would have changed. Every aspect was thoughtfully anticipated and carried out; from the limo that picked us up on our arrival at the airport to the limo that returned us and everything in between. I only hope that I qualify again next year becasue I want to do this again and again. Thank you PGA!.

title: They like your money !
review: Nice hotel, nice swimming pool, nice restaurant BUT very expensive. Too expensive surely; The first room they gave was a view on a wall... We booked an executive suite and we get something like a jail cel ! After a short discussion, we were given a very nice and large room with a nice view ! Much better... We had great time on golf courses (The champion, 300 $ and The squire, a little less than 250 $). Staff is very efficient and friendly. I would recommand to play there but to stay in a fantastic resort where we stayed several time : The Boca Raton Resort & Club.

title: Comfortable and Safe Recovery
review: I stayed at PGA due to having eye surgery at nearby Bascom Palmer.  I was traveling alone and the staff took excellent care of me.  The room service attendant was especially accomodating and the food was really good too!  Now I am looking forward to returning when I can really enjoy all of the amenitites!

title: Exceeded our Expectations
review: Overall an outstanding experience from the time we arrived at the resort until we checked out.  The professionalism and friendliness of the staff was outstanding and very focused on customer service. You will find the resort to be exceptionally clean and impecably maintained down to the last detail.  The location is perfect, golf courses are in excellent condition, the Pool a very relaxing atmosphere  with nice background music even and the Spa also one of the best. Definitely upscale but great value for the money if you want a top notch resort.  Can't wait to go back!

title: Consistently fabulous!
review: This is our 4th time at the PGA and the resort has become our favorite South Florida destination, even though we now live in Florida. The pool is beyond gorgeous - the decoration is just so breathtaking! Lots of fun things to do around. Friendly staff and beautiful rooms and grounds, and of course, magnificent lobby. Drinks and food are overpriced, but lots of more fair restaurants around. Love it!

title: Favorite Stay-Vacation Resort
review: We live 45 min away and love this as a weekend getaway. We stay here a couple time a year with friends and extended family for relaxation and spa treatments. The hotel is fabulous, staff friendly and helpful, great lounge area with lots going on in center of hotel, restaurants on site great. The main hotel pool is large and beatiful. We have never used the highly aclaimed golf course beacause we really come for the spa. Although their pedicures/manicures are just average they have an extensive array of body treatments and they are all are fabulous. Fruit, Water and tea are always available. The spa has a separate pool area/cabana bar where you can relax after treatments with your group and have lunch and cocktails poolside including mineral pools.

title: Amazing
review: Amazing trip!  Felt like another world!  Very clean and friendly atmosphere.  Beautiful resort pool.

title: It has just about everything
review: Professional staff,  rooms are nice, ask for view overlooking pool or spa. Great location near lots of shopping and many, many restaurants including the Resort's Ironwood Grill and iBar.  Inviting lobby with evening music.

title: Excellent facility, very friendly staff...
review: Excellent facility, very friendly staff and beautiful courses. Stayed with the escape package which is probably the best value for an unlimited golf stay anywhere in Florida.

title: A highly enjoyable experience that we can't give enough praise
review: From the minute we drove up to the sad departure, our stay was fantastic.. The staff was the best we've experienced. The food was very good from the breakfast buffet to the ironwood grill. The golf was the best. We played all 4 courses on property and enjoyed all of the them. (The champion being my favorite and the Palmer a close second). We were at the resort from Sept. 13-18, 2010 on our honeymoon. After a relaxing week in Jamaica, we spent the last week enjoying all the amenities of PGA National. We can't say enough about our overall experience. Highly recommend it. Can't wait to return.

title: Golfer's Nirvana
review: I recently stayed at the PGA National Resort as part of a golf outing.  This was by far one of the best golf resorts I've stayed at.  The facilities were fantastic ranging from several ranges/short game practice areas to the way the cart staff handled us before and after our rounds.  There are five courses to choose from (four on site and one off) and they go out of your way to make your play fun and productive, complete with a ranger roaming to tell you conditions of pace of play in front of you.  Also, I liked that the ranger didn't get all nasty if your group was less than 5 minutes out of position; something that can easily happen on the Champions or Palmer courses if you find the water or someone in your group loses a ball. Instead, they would stick around for a bit to see…

title: Highly recommended; looking forward to a return visit.
review: Whether you're a golfer or not this resort is a must.  Myself and my husband spent 4 fantastic days at PGA National and look forward to getting a group together and return in the next couple of years.  The resort has everything you need and the staff are fabulous.  I actually wished to have stayed for an extra couple of days but time just did not allow it.    The golf was excellent; food was excellent; pool was excellent and the spa was my favorite.  Gotta indulge in the spa.

title: Good Golf, Nice Spa, Room was disappointing
review: I went to the PGA National Resort and Spa for a long weekend with my husband and in-laws.
