The summer rate we got would have been a great deal, but I hurt my back and had to sit out on all rounds of golf.  Everyone else said the golf was great, just hot and humid, which is usual for this time of the year.  On the plus side of my injury, I got to go to the spa.  I got a facial and a pedicure.  Both were pleasant.  The Spa staff was friendly and the facilities were clean.    However, I found the room amenities to be disappointing.  Now granted, no one really goes on vacation to stay in the room, but as a woman, I found the bathroom completely lacking in toiletries.  There was only one bar of soap for the shower, a bottle of shampoo and body lotion.  There was no soap for the sink,…

title: FANTASTIC
review: The resort was beautiful. The travel to others places was right there at the intersate!!  Loved the staff..especially at pool side!!  George and Scott at the pool made sure we were taken care of...Great Place!! Valet took time to help us with bags and opened doors...special treatment there!!

title: Top notch friendliness
review: We recently stayed here and were very impressed with the friendliness of the entire staff. The lobby/lounge area was big, beautiful and comfortable. Enjoying a coffee in the lobby/lounge area  from their very own Starbucks coffee shop was a pleasant treat. Unfortunately, we didn't have time to enjoy alot of their amenities but I would come back for sure. It was friendly, clean, conveniently located and classy.

title: Great Resort with non-friendly front desk staff
review: Do Nice resort to go if you want to take a golf vacation. Very good deals.  Don't Un-friendly front desk staff (manager). Very rude and non accomodating. Not welcoming or greeting on arrival or departure.

title: It was a great getaway.
review: The room was great and we had a fabulous time with spa treatments and a wonderful dinner at the Ironwood Grille.

title: great for golf... little bit old rooms
review: ok... if you want a great golf stay this is the kingdom for golfers...  the rooms are a little old the swimming pool really nice, the SPA as well fitness room huge but a little dated 20 min from downtown palm beach

title: Great Value and Very Nice Facilities
review: Went on a whim after booking with Travelocity,s "Top Secret" hotels. I took my wife and two children and we had a wonderful time just relaxing. The rooms are new, clean and spacious. The lobby was clean, new and attractive. Check-in was painless., The pool area is really great. It definitely compares with the big 5-star resorts like the Ritz and Four Seasons that we travel to often. The kids pool is great for kids and adults as it makes a nice place to lay and tan while staying cool in the water.. Its nice because its not over crowded, so its more relaxing and enjoyable. Drink service is also a bonus while lounging in the pool area. Also lots of great restaurants in the area to go to. I would definitely return and recommend to anyone.

title: Most relaxing get-away ever - best experience in a hotel ever!!
review: From the moment I checked in the hotel, this was probably the best experience I have had at a hotel - it was like everyone was there to make me feel good!!  The pool is like a tropical paradise, with music and poolside service.   The room was beautifully decorated, clean, and the view was breathtaking!  The IBar was a nice place to relax before dinner, and the staff there was very warm and welcoming as a single woman sitting alone at the bar!  I will definitely let the secret out of this beautiful spot right in my own backyard!!

title: Excellent trip
review: We did the stay and play package and had an wonderful trip.  I would recommend for golfers and non golfers alike.

title: There are better hotels in the area
review: Upon checking in to the hotel there was one bar of soap for two sinks and a tub and one tube of shampoo/conditioner - that was it for the "Signature Spa Amenities". The front desk seemed disinterested when I told them that was all was in our room and asked if perhaps I could get some lotion.  The coffee shop attendant seemed bored.  On their website I cancelled my request for an upgrade 5 days before arriving and I was still charged for the upgrade.  At the front desk Tim, was again disinterested and less then helpful and let me know he did not have the authority to help and that he would have the manager get back with me.  I gave them my phone number and email and  have never heard from them.  For breakfast a bowl of oatmeal was $11 in the restaurant  although the waitress…

title: Great golf getaway
review: The room I stayed in was a bit older but, other than that, everything else was good.  I went strickly for a golf vacation and, even with 2 of the 5 golf courses closed for maintenance, I was very pleased with the quality and variety of courses.  Super-friendly staff made things even better.

title: I not only live here, it's so nice I chose to vacation here, too.
review: We live in PGA National and when given the opportunity to stay at the Resort Hotel on the premises we jumped at it.  We feel we are so lucky to be able to use all these facilities as if they were our own.  What made it even better is that there was no traveling involved and yet we felt we were at a far away exotic resort right here in our own backyard.  How lucky are we?

title: A super time and we will definitely return to PGA National.
review: We took advantage of the PGA National packaged "2010 Summer Escape and Play".  What a deal.  Our Superior Guest Room was spacious and had a very nice private balcony.  The bed was so comfortable and the room was very quiet.  The plan included a round of golf per day for 2 people, spa access, breakfast for 2 at the Citrus Tree Restaurant and two-for-one cocktails in the bars.   Breakfast was great - the buffet had everything from hot items to oatmeal to bagels, yougurt, fruit, etc.  You could also get eggs done or an omelette.  The staff was very friendly and helpful, even offering you coffee to go if you were interested.   Golf was great and the pro shop and staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  The courses (we played the Squire and the Championship) were in excellent…

title: Get ready to PAR-TAY!
review: This was my second trip to PGA National. It's a great golf resort with first-rate courses and a very nice hotel and spa -- but before you go -- ASK WHO ELSE WILL BE THERE!!!!  We went twice for a huge junior golf tournament, The Optimist International. And this year, they had another group there: The Dave Mathews Band Fan Club and Groupies.   Now, I'm not against a good time. But please, as a hotel, decide who you want to be. Are you a premium golf resort that hosts a PGA event? Or are you MTV Spring Break?  We had loud, crazy, out-of-control people in the hotel, at the pool and in the hallways and public areas until 5:00 in the morning. We called security because my son had an early tee time, but they didn't do a thing. How could they? They booked over 100 rooms to the Dave…

title: Unbelievably nice and great golf
review: We stayed in the cottages off club drive, we had microwave, full kitchen, washer, dryer, 2 bedroom, 2 bath. It was nice and quiet, the only incovenience was when you came home after dark, there is a guard shack and they check your room key and id to make sure nobody gets in. Sometimes there was 10-15 cars in line and took 10-15 minutes to get in. In their defense, there was over 650 junior golfers there and kinda crazy at the hotel. Golf course we played was the champion, and it gave us nightmares because it was so narrow and trouble everywhere but it was a great experience.

title: PGA National is a beautiful resort and friendly staff.
review: Stayed at the resort for a conference. Was disappointed with the quality of the food for a resort of this caliber. The landscaping and overall property was beautiful and felt very luxurious. The hotel was booked full but it felt very uncrowded. Most of the staff were friendly and eager to please guest requests. I would love to stay here again.

title: Beautiful resort, great value, everything you could want - and relaxing!
review: Golf here if you get a chance - 5 courses - awesome.  Very comfortable rooms and beds, and great staff throughout the entire resort.

title: Gets it right on every level!
review: Lovely facility, accommodated our group of 300 without missing a beat. Perfect for the weekend get-away or a large conference.  My suite was so immaculate and comfortable, I regretted leaving for home.

title: It's a quiet and relaxing place to stay.
review: The PGA National Resort and Spa was a very relaxing place to stay.  Our bed was super comfortable and the cleanliness of the room was pretty average.  The staff was friendly and nice.  A nice place to spend intimate time with someone.  Photographs on their main page are true to what you see when you get there.  Nice shopping centers in surrounding areas we found a cute little pet shop.

title: The best resort experience we have had in years!
review: We were so pleased with our stay at the PGA National resort. The reservation planning with Alan was wonderful he planned the perfect trip for and attended to our every need. . Alan was so professional and went to great lengths to assure that our stay would be a pleasant one.  The bell staff was courteous and informative the check in experience was good. The Ibar food and service was excellent our waitress was so pleasant and the setting of course beautiful. The room was perfect for our needs quiet and the housekeeping staff did an excellent job keeping our room in tip top shape. The large pool and snack bar were a pleasure. It was very crowded we wondered if all those people that walked through the hotel with suits on were guests. One man started diving in the pool and o get a…

title: The perfect Spa and Golf experience
review: While at PGA National I had the opportunity to spend a half day at the spa.  The spa services were wonderful.  The spa staff were extremely helpful, courteous, and friendly.  The spa is a great serene getaway.  My husband spent the day golfing and had a wonderful time  as well.  PGA National was the perfect spot for those wanting golf and spa experiences.  The resort is very nice but not posh and stuffy....  I would definitely go back.

title: Relaxing, a perfect place to vacation
review: Between the excellent service of the resort staff and the realxing resort spa, it was an amazing vacation each time we have visited this resort.

title: Great Resort with the best of everything
review: Upon arrival at PGA, I was greeted by a smile and a welcome by the Valet,he was very friendly and made every effort to assist with my bag. the front desk staff could not have been more friendly in making it easy for my business partners to be located on the same level.The pool area and Michelle at the pool bar was fantastic. The banquet dinner that evening was the best, this is a wonderful resort and I will return there again.

title: First class and relaxing stay
review: Room upgrade without even asking.  Bed was yummy.  Shower was perfect.  Breakfast was delicious.

title: WOW What a feeling!!
review: This resort is awesome, needed a get away after the death of my father, and my girlfriends, took me this resort for some R and R and boy did I get it.  The staff went above and beyond to help us with our needs.  I would also like to thank Bill Horn for his attention to detail.  Finally I would like to say thanks for the cool towels by the pool.  I am going through the change and those towels really helped.

title: Be spoiled at PGA
review: The PGA golf courses are magnificent and the resort itself is world class. Breakfast buffet at the Citrus Tree is bountiful and delicious. The Ironwood Grill can be compared to any 4 star restaurant in the country and the 19th hole has great sandwiches (get the homemade potato salad for your side). A special trip to celebrate an event and to be spoiled.

title: Don't waste you're time or money
review: My wife and 2 kids have stayed there twice.  The first time they were undergoing renovations. They did not tell us ahead of time nor did they mention the $20 resort fee PER NIGHT on top of the orignal rate. (Not sure for what...to walk through the plastic that was lining the hallway??) Our room was nice and clean. (That's about the highlight.)  Second stay we got the cottage 340 per night we figured they just renovated so it should be great. It was horrible looks like the rest of the hotel was renovated but not the cottages. The beds were hard as a rock, the cottage was musty, looks like 1980 with a genuine VHS player.  To top it off the cottages are not even close to the hotel you have to drive to what looks like a residential community.  Don't forget you need to pay the resort…

title: Great experience!!!
review: First time travelling abroad for playing golf. I booked a package online and everything worked out well. Service in all areas, room, golf, food (restaurant a bit expensive but excellent quality) I did not visit the spa so I can not give my opinion. I will come back!!!

title: Golfer Paradise And More
review: I travel constantly and I'm not much for writing reviews since I find most hotels are pretty much the same. This Hotel stands out. It is simply beautiful. Yet at the same time it has a comfortable feel accented by some of the best staff I've encountered. It's not trendy or glitzy but it is surrounded by several of the best kept golf courses you will ever see. I was also impressed by the fact that they don't try to nickle and dime you for internet access, exorbitant parking charges and the like. It's included. It is not an inexpensive hotel but if you are looking for something special this is the place.

title: At the special group rate, this beautiful resort was a steal.
review: I had an enjoyable stay at this resort Memorial weekend, rooms were large, clean, well appointed, beds were comfy.  I was with a large group and utilized the pool and the party rooms.  The event was fantastic.  Everything was executed well.  I would recommend this hotel for an event and for a quiet personal stay.

title: Wonderful Place!
review: My husband and I went there for our 1st Wedding Anniversary and it was great! Great people, good food and lovely spa, esp the pools of the world, so relaxing and my favorite part of the trip :) and My husbnad had a great time on the golf courses. I would def recommend this resort. We will for sure be back!

title: Fabulous Resort
review: Just a quick note, this hotel was great in every way and the room service meals that i had were the best meals i have ever eaten in Florida and i have had thousands.  To get in here cheap, do Hotwire for a Palm Beach Gardens Hotel and select the 4 Star. There are no other 4 Stars in PBG or North Palm Beach.

title: Great facility but dine off property
review: This resort provided the golf and tennis that we desired.  Quality of everything other than food and food service was very good.  Plenty of off property restaurants available. We will go back.

title: One of the Worst Resorts We Have Ever Stayed In
review: I can't emphasize how bad and erratic the service was. They must train their staff to be unfriendly. The room was dated, the golf course was being aerated so you could not play and the Spa was like an old men’s club...brutally bad. To end this wonderful visit they added an extra $50 per person per day for fees...so expect to pay another $100 per day for a room at the PGA National.  Deceptive advertising on rates…avoid this place like the plague.

title: Nothing but the best!
review: From the moment you drive up to the PGA you feel like royalty.  The staff was fabulous and attentive to our needs.  The rooms are spacious and the decor beautiful.  Had a chance to hit some balls and everyone at the pro shop was also nice and accommodating.  Your staff and property in my eyes is a 5 Diamond Resort !  Keep up the good work.

title: An Excellent Resort
review: The following are GREAT!! Golf, Spa, Pool, Service, Meals, Drinks, Atmosphere, Treatment. Ask your travel agent for details of packages BEFORE you make a reservation. Once there, you will really enjoy a first class resort including championship golf and world class spa. 'Nuff said!

title: Great Golf Experience
review: One of the nicest golf facilities I have ever been too.  Every aspect of the stay was incredible.  Staff was wonderful, courses were imaculate, food and drink was excellent, and the pool and other non golf activites were also terrific.  I highly recomend this Resort.  Proximity to other Palm Beach activites is second to none.

title: Memorable Experience!!!
review: Memorable Experience!!! As you can see, I enjoyed my stay at PGA... Good Food, Good Service and Great Golf made my trip memorable. Enjoyed the resort style pool along with the food and decor at Ironwood Grill and cocktails at the Lobby Bar. I really enjoyed the opportunity to play the Championship course only a month after the PGA Tour was there, it was in great condition.

title: Great Golf Experience with Fantastic Service
review: Just returned from a fantastic trip to PGA National.  First time going.  It truly is a golf experience with 5 different great courses to choose.  Also enjoyed the pool scene.  The staff was fantastic and no request went unfulfilled.  Highly recommended

title: PGA National is a definate MUST stay there
review: 1st Class all the way! Friendly, Clean, excellant facility, great food, outstanding golf.

title: The Premier family/golf resort
review: The Premier spot in west palm for vacation and golf.  Bring the family to the pool/golf course/tennis courts/spa. Great food and drinks.  Great service and friendly/helpful staff.

title: Place was the MONEY!!
review: Go see Donny January on the Course, ask Barry to make you Honda Classic, and see Cindy at the Bar.  Going to be a great time I promise.

title: Terrible. Mold around the bathtub. Dated decor in the suites
review: I upgraded to an Executive suite for 1 night at the PGA Resort. What a dissapointment. The decor is outdated. The room looked as though it had not been updated since the 70s. I asked to see an udated room and was shown exactly the same distateful decor. The room I was in had mold around the bathtub. I explained this to the manager on duty but it fell on deaf ears. Very unfriendly at the front desk although the rest of the staff was wonderful. I have visited to Spa at the PGA before and it is wonderful. I had hoped that the rooms would have been an equal quality. My last time ever. Absolutley do not recommend. Cost $455.00 for ONE night.

title: Beware of Villa's
review: Group of 8 in their 40's and 50'shad a long weekend golf trip. We rented a group of 2 BR Villa's. Be aware that the Villa's are privately owned and not a part of the PGA. The golfing was phenomenal. We had problems with the Villa's and the private security company at the front gate. They actually wanted to scan drivers licenses  despite being given room key and showing the drivers license. The ended up calling the police. I might go back and stay at the resort itself, but don't stay at the villa's. In addition the villa's were old and in poor shape

title: Phenomenal facility and staff
review: Excellent service in the restaurants, bar, and room service.  Great food, beautiful hotel.

title: Wonderful, beautiful, relaxing, fun
review: My husband and I went on an overnight trip without our kids.  We felt so relaxed during our whole stay, from the moment we drove up to the beautiful grounds.  Everything was clean, relaxing, the staff was very, very friendly and welcoming.  I loved being able to sit by the pool and go to an exercise class at the fitness center.  We enjoyed the music in the lobby, at the pool.  We do not play golf, but we really enjoyed a long and peaceful walk around the golf course.  I also liked that we did not feel that we were "nickle and dimed" and had to pay for every little thing once we got there, like sometimes happens in high-end beautiful resorts (eg, free water at the pool, you can self-park).

title: Golf get away
review: I have just returned from three days at the PGA Golf resort.  From the moment we arrived we found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful.  The rooms are nice, comfortable and clean.  We really liked that everything was right at our finger tips.  There are 4 or 5 golf courses, we played three of them and they were all very different with lots of variety.   We enjoyed beauty treatments in the spa, which is a must!  The staff and therapists were excellent.   We didn't make it to the tennis facility but it looks great. We ate at the bar two evenings  which was fun, there was a real buzz around the place, creating a great atmosphere.

title: Fantastic Hotel - Excellect Value
review: I am a repeat customer at the resort.  It is always spotlessly clean, the staff eager and friendly, the food sublime.  Don't let their reasonable prices fool you...this is a luxury resort hotel in every way, complete with world class spa, tennis and golf.   I consider their low prices to be the chocolate icing on some very decadent cake.

title: Blessed to be back in the Happy Place
review: This is a great sanctuary. I've been coming here for 10-15 years. Elegant rooms. The best spa (ask for Angie for nail services). always a commitment to gues services. recent renovations are a great improvement. The hotel often has irresistible promotions. Keep an eye out.

title: Very relaxing!!
review: The hotel is great.  The restaurants are a little expensive, but the food is very good.  Lots of shopping, dining and theater choices surround the resort.  The resort is beautiful, very tropical landscaping and modern interiors.  This was a getaway for my husband and I with out the kids and we took advantage of the down time.  I would also take my children to this resort as it seems to be very family friendly.

title: A wonderful, relaxing experience!
review: I was a guest at The Resort for my birthday and it was amazing!  The staff sang to me when I checked in and it was great!  I would stay there again and again!!!

title: The staff is awesome!!!
review: We've been going to the PGA resort for years but this is the first time I felt compelled to write a review. A few of the key people there really went out of their way to make my family"s stay a real treat. Everything is tight these days and their willingness to be reasonable over greedy was something that has been sorely missed. I felt the need to tell the omelet chef just how much he had brightened my day by exchanging sincere pleasantries with the guests.I thanked him for brightening my day. I go there once a year and they actually remember me not just pretend they know my name.

title: Very disappointed in the service and resort.
review: The beds are comfortable. Housekeeping was mediocre. The bathrooms are small. We had many problems that began when we checked in.  No soap in the room, hair dryer didn't work. Other amenities missing. Didn't have the king bed we requested. Didn't leave wash cloths nor hand towels after cleaning the room. Took a very long time to get theses item.  Valet was good.Several of us sed the spa and found the services to be ok, for what they charge they should be excellent. You pay before your service as well as tip. They do not bother to ask afterwards whether or not you enjoyed the services. A package arrived for my husband for a business meeting. NO one bothered to inform us. Not their policy to do so. Concierge services do not really exist. When we asked for it we were told they…

title: If you have already been everywhere else
review: I was surprised that this golf resort and courses never rate in most US reviews. We played the first day at the Champions course and never have seen such a poorly organized starting area in any golf course. We advised when we arrived that we were teeing off in 90 minutes and after 70 minutes and searching for our clubs they were still in the reception drop off. Simply, you can not have three golf courses all starting from same cart area. The champion course was nice but nothing special apart from the par 3s. The fore caddy was average. We then played two days at the Palmer course as well which was quite open and unimpressive as well, apart from brutal 18th hole. Still we still had a great time and went to delray beach one night for dinner.  We went out for dinner one night and…

title: WOW, we do not want to go home!
review: The resort is a wonderful place to stay.      The pool is awesome  The rooms are beautiful The beauty shop is wonderful The restaurant foods are delicious The golf courses are great The employees are kind and gracious and gave us much TLC  We are ready to go back for some more "R&R".

title: Mediocre resort/great golf school
review: My wife and I went down to PGA to attend a two day mini-school at the Ledbetter facility at PGA National.  The school was excellent and exceeded our expectations.    However, the resort was a big disappointment.  Not only did they lose my golf clubs (which were returned only 2 weeks later), but the hotel management never apologized or made any concessions to improve our stay.  Kevin Danus, the Assistant Manager for the golf facility, was very helpful and stayed in touch with us throughout.  He will be praised in our letter to the resort.  The rooms are fine, like an upscale motel, but the food throughout the property is only fair.  We played the Haig golf course, which was very badly tended and had ticky-tacky houses jammed on every side.  We would not return to this resort.

title: Meet me on the veranda
review: The royal carpet treatment at this resort was just what we needed. Family gathered for great drinks and spot on burgers as we laughed with each tall tale .

title: A Great Place to Party
review: I just got home from a business conference at the PGA Resort. The place is fabulous! Great service, friendly staff, beautiful grounds, fabulous night life! The iBar was wonderful - waitstaff was professional and helpful! The music the hotel books every night was great!   The breakfast buffet was tasty! Tons of choices from pancakes to blintzes to yogurt with every topping you could desire! Truly fantastic!  The resort did fall short of an "Excellent" review due to one issue. They over-booked several rooms. Myself and other colleagues were put up for one night in the nearby Marriott. Transportation to and from the resort was provided by PGA National. We also each received a $100 gift card to be used at the resort as an apology. I thought this was a great gesture from PGA National.

title: First Class!
review: My Daughter and I recently traveled to the PGA Resort and Spa for the Honda Classic.  What a fantastic venue to hold a golf tournament and the fireworks show on Saturday night was better than most 4th of July shows.  Our room was clean and well maintained and the Resort overall was in incredible shape.  The staff obviously knows how to put on an event from the speedy valet service and great front desk to the outstanding service in the restaurants, the Management and ownership has much to be proud of with their staff and resort.  I look forward to bringing back the whole family later this year!

title: Great golf experience
review: Fabulous place for a golf outing.  Despite operating dozens of groups simultaneously, the ever-friendly staff runs the place like clockwork.  Your bags are ready on your carts each morning and off you go. The facilties are beautiful and extremely well maintained.  It is a bit expensive, but you absolutely get what you pay for.  The Champ is one of the most gorgeous courses you will ever play; fork over the money and play it--best of all with a caddie--you won't regret it.  The Haig was also excellent.  One negative, the Palmer course was in very poor shape, I suggest skipping it.

title: A resort you return to time and time again whether business or pleasure
review: I enjoy the PGA National and have returned year after year..always to find the service impeccable and the furnishings fresh.  Staff in both the ibar and on property are extremely attentive, helpful, and thorough (and yet unobtrusive).  I needed to catch a March Madness game for my alma mater and the staff secured the station and a table for me!  Also, the hotel room and views were amazing with the resort only 10 minutes away from the Cardinal and Marlin's spring training facility and about 15 from the airport.   My only regret in staying at the PGA was were were unable to take FULL advantage of the property's amenities this year due to too many meetings however, the pool and fitness were wonderful.  I promise to test one day schedule enough time to test the spa and return to the…

title: A great experience with great service!
review: Great resort, great golf, great spa, great food, great service.... great experience.

title: Great stay at the PGA National Resort
review: My wife and I recently stayed at the PGA National Resort for three nights and had a great time.  The hotel staff was excellent, the grounds were beautiful and the atmosphere was great.  Although the stay was a little on the expensive side, once you look around you'll understand.  We arrived at the resort on the final day of the Honda Classic - their largest PGA event of the year.  Despite the commotion and the large number of people, we were treated very well.  The hotel itself is close to shopping, great restaurants and a short drive to the beach.   I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the Palm Beach area.

title: Wonderful Winter Break
review: Great location...Wonderful accommodations......Fantastic weather  Above average service..... Just a wonderful place to enjoy a mid-winter  break from Chicago area weather......All we had planned for and then some!!!!!

title: Enjoyable stay - Know the System
review: Stayed at this resort for 3 nights recently.  I booked using airline points.  Found that a la carte golf fees were $378 per person  for Champions, $150-170 for other courses on site.  Would have been better to pay and book golf package.  Played Squires and Palmer courses.  Courses were typical resort style courses in fair shape .  The Champion Course (from taking a ride out to look at and taking to locals) is by far the best course. So look on-line for packages/deals.. We upgraded to a suite.  Very nice accomodation and location.   The Citrus tree is $26 for a buffet breakfast.  Don't waste your time on this as there is a Starbucks typed place upstars where you can get good fruit bagels coffee, yogurt, etc for reasonable price.  Also i bar has half price appetizers for happy…

title: Far exceeded our expectations as a conference venue.
review: I knew the golf would be terrific but didn't expect the staff - the whole staff - to be so well trained, so univerally friendly and so consistently helpful.  Great food at both the Ironwood Restaurant and at our conference banquets; so much so we didn't bother going offsite as planned... as well as an excellent wine list.  Wonderful bar staff and atmosphere.  Spacious rooms, no waiting for elevators and fast room service.  A front desk with enough staff to have the time to help.  (Thanks Ari.)  A very large, child-friendly pool, also with good food and beverage service.  And a very knowledgeable, helpful concierge.  All in all a great destination and terrific value.

title: beautiful resort and spa
review: we had a very relaxing stay, spa was great, bed and room were so comfortable, i would highy recommend staying at this resort, staff were friendly and helpful!

title: Service by staff was outstanding
review: Very nice resort and we had an excellent package deal.  Food was good, although a tad expensive.  Fitness and tennis facilities were very good.  Golf practice areas were great, but the courses themselves weren't anything exceptional.  What was exceptional was the staff.  If we dealt with 25 people in our 3 day stay, I'd stay 20+ were 'above and beyond' in their level of service and desire to make our stay enjoyable.

title: Great place for a golf weekend with your buddies
review: The staff make this place.  Can't say enough about the friendliness of the people, their attention to dtail an ddesire to make our stay as enjoyable as possible.

title: Paradise in Florida
review: Our trip to PGA National Resort and Spa in Palm Beach Gardens was amazing.  The rooms, the pool and the staff made our trip as close to being in paradise as any trip we have ever taken.  My kids thoroughly enjoyed the pool and my wife commented on how this was the best vacation we had ever had.  PGA National exceeded all of our expectations.  We can't wait to go back.

title: Best experience ever!
review: Mu husband and I stayed at this resort for Valentine's Day weekend and it was a memorable experience that we would like to repeat. The resort is impecably clean and its elegance when you drive in and when you enter the lobby is unforgettable. The lobby bar is inviting tp seat and relax while looking out, through gigantic windows, to the pool area and the numerous lakes. It is the perfect place for a wedding or any type of celebration. The rooms are very spacious with a living room, dining room and balcony. The beds are comfortable and the decor is elegant and rich. Location is also plus as it is near the Palm Beach Gardens Mall, Jupiter, etc, etc. We cannot wait to ggo back and take our sons for a weekend of golf, tennis and memories.

title: Fabulous Valentine Week-end
review: Outstanding food,comfy beds with lots of pillows,  perfect room temp,very clean.  Thanks to  Mr Bill Horn and the  front  desk staff there were no delays,easy check-in everyone was kind and considerate. Spa is first class.Lots to do in the local area.Beach within 5 miles. Beautiful  golf courses.

title: Resort staff exceeds all expectations
review: This is a beautiful resort with a great spa.  What puts this resort above the rest is the friendliness and experience of their staff.  Everyone we came in contact at the resort exceeded any expectations I had of a Resort staff member.

title: Won't pay for it
review: I stayed at the PGA National as part of a sponsored business trip. If I had been paying for the room, I would have been really upset.  The good? The setting, pools, grounds, and fitness center are wonderful.  I also found that most of the employees were very courteous and helpful.  The business center was horrible for the year 2010-two, very slow computers, in a very small, smelly room-plus, when you print, you have to go back out to the main desk and wait in line to get your documents. (Boarding passes) The really bad?-our rooms were downstairs, mine, 1007, the other 1012. These are NOT their premier rooms, but expensive none-the-less. The phone is my room was filthy-it looked like coffee and other sticky items had been spilled. The rooms are nothing spectacular to look at, and…

title: Great time with friends
review: This is our third trip to PGA National - a great golf experience, location, staff.  We're looking forward to booking again next year.

title: Nice place - even for non-golfers
review: I stayed here over Superbowl weekend. We did not golf, so my view of the property is limited to the resort itself. The property is solidly 4-star. Its not on a level of the Ritz or Four Seasons, but it does deliver very nice public spaces, well maintained grounds and attractive pool area, and the service was excellent. We stayed in a standard room, which had a very comfortable bed, HD TV, and a little balcony. The bathrooms are just okay. The resort offers several nice features that you'd expect from a 4 star place, including free business center, large spa/workout center, and ample comfortable seating through out the pool area and common areas. (There is a $25 resort fee - which is annoying. If everyone has to pay it, just add it to the room cost.) A few minor negative notes -…

title: Golfing Adventures
review: I stayed 4 days while playing in a tournament held at this magnificent resort. My package was in a superbly appointed club villa with 4 bedrooms, flat screen TV, a full kitchen (pots, silverware, plates, everything) and lots of championship golf. I do not know how to express the elegance of the premises. Oh yes; "LAVISH" immediately comes to mind. LOL If you would like to eat great quesadillas, please go to the I-Bar and ask Fred the bartender for a heaping plate. follow it up with a Kettel One and Cranberry and heaven is called the PGA NATIONAL RESORT AND SPA...  I had an amazing time.

title: PGA National is the best!!!!
review: Four groups from Washington, Dom Rep, NY and Miami just spent the most wonderful weekend golfing and sharing great memories at the PGA in Palm Beach. Ther accomodations were excellent the golf staff was the best I have ever seen. Thank you to the Manager Hector, the bellboy Bobby, bartender Tara, front desk staff Iris and Ari. You guys were great. We look forward to next year!!!

title: The staff of the PGA made you feel like a treasured guest and made us very comfortable.
review: Great hotel!  Would recommend to anyone!  The beauty of the grounds amazed me.  The staff was outstanding and handled everything with a smile!

title: Great hotel, amazing staff and memorable experience!!!!!
review: My fiancee and family stay at this resort at least 5-6 times a year.  Every time we go we always have an amazing time.  Food is always great, service is amazing and the amenities are the best.

title: Magnificent
review: It was excelent. First I would like to give  KUDOS to  Iris and Hector in the from desk, very profesional at what they do. rooms are vey confortable. and people at the pro shop well oriented.

title: Top Notch Facility.
review: The Hotel accomadation are very comfortable and clean. The staff is very attentive. The Champion Golf Course is a good experience and very well maintained. The Palmer and Haig are fun golf courses to play but the conditions are not up to the Champions standards, If you want to play 36 make the replay times before your first round and attempt to book them in advance prior. Playing time on all courses for our group were between 4 hours 15 minutes and 4 1/2 hours. The breakfast buffet is complete and lunch in the grill or the I Bar is very good. The I Bar for drinks after golf and before dinner is a convenient option with very good staff.

title: Excellent
review: Excellent golf outing.  Staff were incredible good.  Will recommend to all friends and family.

title: Wonderful place to stay and enjoy the ambiance and great service!
review: Everything about the hotel was geared to making you feel welcome and in the lap of luxury.   The entire staff was exemplary and whoever trains them should get a raise!  If there was any negative it would be that my room was on the first floor and had very little natural light.  If and when i stay there again (which I hope to do) I will request a room without this drawback.

title: This is the real deal - Over the top customer service
review: We return here, year after year, because this hotel consistently outpeforms everywhere else we go - and we travel quite a bit.  The golf, of course, is the reason we go, but the in house food, service and the spa are awesome.

title: We would return in a New York Minute
review: The Hotel offered the best Golf and Spa facilities you could want.

title: Nice Hotel
review: I stayed for new years Eve at this hotel and I thought it was very nice; the rooms are a little old but they are very spacious and they have been very well up kept. It has good size flat screen LCD TV's in the bedrooms and the satff was very friendly. The bar in the lobby and the overall decor was very elegant.

title: Great golf with a pretty good experience
review: My husband & I spent 5 days at PGA National follwoing Christmas and into the New Year.  Overall, we had a pleasant stay.  We found most of the staff to be very friendly and helpful (especially in the pro shop), unfortunately, the front desk staff on the day we checked in were the most unfriendly and unwelcoming people we encountered.  The rest of the time though (when they were helping with dinner recommendations, suggesting things to do, etc) they were really good to work with.   As to be expected, the golf was fantastic!  We played 7 rounds in the 5 days we were there.  It was great to not have to leave the resort for anything if you didn't want to.  Did I already mention that the staff in the pro shop was great!?  They moved tee times, made adjustments and seemed to do…

title: Golf course is nice but caddy is terrible
review: Not worth paying several hundred dollars for champion course. It was the worst caddy (Name starting from A, same as one of famous governor in US) I have ever seen, and I argue if he really knows rules and manner. Golf course was not so bad, but was easier than UK course.

title: The ultimate way to enjoy a weekend with friends
review: Every imaginable amenity and service is offered at this Resort.  There is a very friendly atmosphere everywhere you go. The Restaurants are exceptional.  Enjoy a very relaxing day around the comfortable pool area.

title: Great golf venue.
review: We came for a tournament and we could not have been more pleased with every service we used during our stay.

title: Nice but not Excellent
review: Being the PGA national resort my expectations were high for the resort. I was thinking it would be comparable to Pinehurst or even Grand Cypress in Orlando but while the hotel was nice the golf courses and service were average, maybe it was the time of the year. Not many eating choices other than a high steakhouse at the hotel.  The pool was beautiful and your stay includes tennis and the gym not much to see as far as exploring the grounds. The location is close to Juno beach and some of the other beach towns which I recommend visiting if you have the time. Some nice restaurants located off the main strip. Would do once with a great deal on a package but only once

title: very friendly service. ask for it and they will find a way to accomodate
review: Hotel very reasonably priced for accommodations and service. Fitness center large and variety of exercise options. Tennis courts in great condition and available courts anytime we wanted them even though we didn't have a court reservation. Golf is expensive, but morning tee times move well through the course, excellent service. If you prefer to have a caddy ask for Ted or Collin. Both great knowledge of the courses, fun to hang with for the entire round. Will give you swing tips if you want them. Spa was average to good, clean, friendly, variety of services.

title: Wedding was perfect; food and service excellent!!
review: Staff was great.  Overall experience was wonderful!

title: Beautiful place!!
review: The PGA Resort is absolutely gorgeous!!  They treat you like a prince/princess from the moment you arrive.  And the price is a steal for all of the services you receive.  The pool is beautiful, as are the views if your room overlooks the back part of the resort.  In addition, it is so great being a business traveler and being treated to more than just a treadmill and a bike in terms of workout equipment.  I took both a spin and a yoga class and they were first rate.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.  My only complaint is that the rooms could use a bit of updating in terms of decor, as it doesn't really match the modern feel of the lobby and resort, but that is a minor aspect to deal with.  Oh yeah...be sure to find out the price of a glass of wine before you…

title: excellent in all aspects - would love to return
review: my husband and i are golfers - spent a wonderful week golfing and relaxing by the pools (spa pools were wonderful) - staff were all excellent, obliging and friendly, going out of their way to ensure our satisfaction - convenience of having everything onsite,  was a win - rooms are spacious and extremely comfortable, very well furnished and we were fortunate to face the pool and the lake - location is perfect, and most convenient  for all kinds of shopping and restaurants - would love to return

title: What a deal!
review: I stayed at the PGA National for 3 days and just loved it! The rate was very reasonable, the pool is amazing and the food at the Wave was yummy!   I read in other reviews that the staff was rude..... I found them very nice but there was one woman that the reception desk that had "edge". Not in a bad way but I could see where some might take her style the wrong way.    Also, the little express coffee shop in the lobby is EXTREMELY expensive.  I paid $4 for a water and $3 for a yogurt.  There is also no fridge in the room.  The fitness center is also great! We took a spin and yoga class while there. Great facility!  Overall though I had a wonderful experience!

title: Fabulous!
review: Had a great time! Rooms were very nice, in fact, the whole facility was very nice, as was the staff. We were there for the golf, and found the 4 courses on the property to be the best. The Estates course was ok, but a little dull. All in all, a great choice.

title: ....A dream to come true
review: Point form....  - Unbelievable VALUE for their offseason rates - Treated like a pro or royalty for 5 days - 7 rounds in 4 days....heaven on earth and the  proshop was extremely accamodating! - Courses were in great shape aside from the Champ course since their fairways were in transition, but this is expected at this time of the year  Would go back in SECOND! If you are golfer, you would be crazy to go anywhere else

title: A vacation we are happy to share our comments about!!
review: My husband and I just completed a 5 day escape and play package to PGA National for an anniversary. Although the weather was unusually hot for this time of year, we played 4 of the 5 courses and 36 holes on our last full day. Needless to say, we enjoyed the resort thoroughly. The staff at every area of the resort couldn't do enough to make our stay relaxing and enjoyable. We have been to many golf resorts, including the Greenbriar and had actually planned to return to the Greenbriar for our 10th wedding anniversary in 2010. After this great trip, we have already decided to return to PGA National.   It is a much more cost effective trip than many others that we have taken and at the same time, it was the most relaxing resort for the after golf hours., not to mention had golf…

title: Great golf, relaxing spa, perfect weather - what more could you want?
review: We got a great package deal on this trip, and our focus was on R & R for an extended weekend stay.  The rooms were very clean and good-sized.  The bed was outstandingly comfortable, and the flat-screen TV was nice, too.  We primarily played golf (5 courses total, and we played 3 of them in 3 days) and layed by the pools.  The main pool was nice, but we found the mineral pools at the spa to be even better (quiet with relaxing music).  The golf courses were superb, and the golf staff was very friendly.  We didn't utilize the restaurants much at the resort, because we thought they were a bit pricey (but probably pretty normal for a resort) and the hours were odd (i.e. only one restaurant open in the evening, and one overlooking the golf course closed at 3pm).  This wasn't much of…

title: Class act
review: It was nothing more then a class act,  service was excellent.  If your a golfer this is a must do. courses were well groomed.

title: Outstanding amenities, great service, and Top Notch Golf
review: As if the golf on PGA tour tested courses is not enough, it is as though you are golfing on an outdoor tropical zoo.  The exotic birds are everywhere you look, even walking right up to you as you tee off.  Alligators poke thier leathery heads from the ponds from time to time, as a warning not to be too concerned about the ball that you just sliced in the drink.  Turtles arrive on the shoreline of the pond from time to time, almost as guides to the pin.  Geckos scurry about the cart paths as we made our way from each tee to green - and not one spoke to me about car insurance.  The courses we played (The Haig and The Champion) were tough, but not so daunting that average duffers like us couldn't par the odd hole and enjoy the rest without too much frustration.  They are thinking…

title: The perfect place for everyone - never have to leave premises!
review: Everything is at your fingertips.  Restaurants (several), gorgeous spa, tennis, and of  course amazing golf courses.  Off season is the time to go if you want a bargain.  Many deals with everything included (full buffet breakfast).  Golf was included for the price of renting a cart ($40).  No charge for tennis.  Several pools including an adult pool.  Everyone is ready to go back next year!

title: Perfect Spa and golf getaway
review: Staff at check in and at Spa and Golf  courses attentive, very friendly and welcoming. Rooms were great clean and nicely furnished--though could use a few more floor lamps. Food at Ironwood grille and other restaurants was exceptional. Didn't leave the resort for four days that's how good everything was.  Would return in a New York minute!

title: Golf Heaven
review: The staff couldn't have been more hospitable.  The service was great everywhere we went.  It was a good balance of relaxed atmosphere and attention to detail.  The courses were a great challenge and in beautiful condition.  My wife and I were able to play and enjoy the round when there were other groups around that we let play through and when we were alone.  She got a great golf experience even as a beginner.  Of course she credits her teacher, (me).  The Leadbetter pro helped too.

title: Escape & Play package - what a deal
review: Use this package to get a great deal.  We had unlimited golf, breakfast and great rooms for a bargain price.  The staff was great and the rooms were spotless.  I would book again for sure at this resort.  The courses were great to play on and the pro shop and staff were on top of everything - all the time !!!  The outdoor pool was very unique, clean and spacious.

title: Absolutely awesome!!!
review: Spent 4 days here for a 40th birthday trip. What an amazing place.   The resort is first class all the way. Huge outdoor saltwater pool with literally hundreds of lounge chairs and lots of areas to relax. The 5 golf courses are all fantastic and in perfect condition. Staff are always eager to help. Food was excellent and lots to choose from both on and off the resort. If you like Thai food, you must try Talay Thai, which is just down the road - Lobster Pad Thai to die for (check out the picture!)  We are definitely planning to go back.   One tip: Club rentals are expensive @ $90-$115 US per round, so if you are going to golf, bring your clubs.

title: Great getaway with family!
review: PGA resort is terrific!  Rooms are first-class, golf was great, and the pool was incredible.  We'll definitely go back.

title: The most disgusting thing !!!
review: I attended a dinner here and witnessed one of the servers/bus boys take butter from a box with his bare hands and place it at the plates at our table.  He had no gloves on and used no serving utensils.  How can this happen in this day of swine flu and all of the diseases going around.  This is unacceptable.  I have not heard back from the banquet people.  If it happens here, where else does it go on in the resort.

title: Wonderful!
review: Our second visit this year to PGA Resort and Spa, which was as wonderful as the first.  Everyone at the hotel is friendly and helpful and make us (and I am sure all) guests feel welcome.  The rooms are beautiful; the amenities overwhelming - so much that our only regret is that we were not able to stay longer to enjoy some of them.  The golf was excellent, as it was on our first visit.  We plan to go back again as soon as we can.

title: fantastic value at a fantastic resort
review: we did the "escape and play" package so for entire stay you played as much golf as you wanted for free except champions course was extra, got breakfast and room for one price. 5 different courses on or near premises, ironwood restaurant delicious but ny prices. we had 2 different services at spa both were very good, spa nice a big and plenty of services to choose from. room was very nice, king size bed that was truly king size, flat screen tv and plenty of additional movies to rent. Breakfast was good restaurant was a little drab looking compared to rest of hotel. pool side eating was good but a little pricey, "19th hole" was not impressive at all and choose to use car and go down road where there were tonz of places to get a bite for lunch and dinner  Can't wait to go back…

title: No worries.
review: Spa services were extrodinary.  Room was spacious and the bed was so comfortable. Resort grounds were nice and clean.  Pool and Deck / Bar area was beautiful.  Two days of Rest and Relaxation!!  No worries.  Definitley returning.

title: FABULOUS
review: We just returned from the PGA Resort.  The resort is fabulous.  The Escape and Play Package is a great deal.  The golf courses are amazing and the breakfast buffet was very good.  The pool was so beautiful and comfortable. Hope to return in the future.

title: We could not have celebrated our 25th anniversary at a better place or with better people.
review: The room was beautiful. It had a deck with a table and chairs to be able to enjoy the beautiful landscaping. Room service was there exactly on time with our breakfast still nice and warm,set up on a table with linens and flowers. Very easy to get to, right off the highway The list is too long to tell what was liked, everything was great. We found nothing that we disliked.  All I can say is relax and enjoy.

title: Excellent golf destination, very good service and great food!
review: Overall experience was very good.  Had some slight problems with adjusting the AC in the room but finally figured it out.  Very nice pool area.  Great Golf and room service met every need we had.

title: very relaxing and incredibly  up- scale
review: First of all, having your main pool open to swimming around the clock was wonderful.  We wanted to get a swim in at 7:30a.m. on Sunday and we did before we had to go to a brunch and catch our plane. Also,  I was able to attend the aerobics swimming class as a guest and I truely appreciated that.  Janel was a geat teacher and so friendly.  I'm a golfer so loved the decor in the halls and your lovely pro shop.  I couldn't golf on this trip, but appreciated the conversations in the pro shop.

title: Amazing golf
review: Great four courses in great shape, the hotels is great, rooms are very good. The restaurant can improve bit there are a lot of fine ones nearby.

title: Can't wait to go back again!
review: Our weekend getaway was fabulous.  We got an incredible Escape and Play package.  Unbelievable price that including unliminted golf and breakfast.  Plus some other nice perks.   This hotel was exceptional.  The room was beautiful.  By far, the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in a hotel!   If there was only one thing I would recommend, it would be better lighting in the room.  Aside from that minor detail, it was delightful! The staff was top notch.  Always eager to assist.  Sean at the front desk was particularly helpful as was the manager (unfortunately I do not recall her name).  I do recall Opal at the iBar was awesome, as was Angel and another waitress we had for breakfast. My spa experience was also fabulous, and I absolutely LOVED the Waters of the World!! Our dinner…

title: Great activities for the kids
review: We stayed at the resort with a group of friends and we all have children between the ages of 5-13.  They had daily activities at the pool for the children and the kids loved it.  It was appropriate for kids of all ages and the lady who ran the program was wonderful.  Full of energy and we appreciated her as we were able to enjoy ourselves poolside while still being able to keep our eyes on them!  What a great experience.

title: Fun For All
review: I would recommend this hotel to all. Check out the Ibar they make the best Dirty Martini. And, the pool rocks.....

title: Excellence Consistently Provided
review: From check in to departure their excellent staff consistently provided friendly and efficient servive, anticipated our needs and offered suggestions to enhance our stay.  The resort was very busy but managed to provide quiet retreat for rest. This resort was spotlessly clean and amenities were first rate.

title: Great Place to relax, play golf, eat and drink in one location
review: This was our first leisure vacation trip to exclusively go for golfing. The PGA resort met all of our expectations. The golf was challenging and excellent. The food, restaurants and IBAR kept us on site for the entire week. The overall facilities provide a wide range of activities and the staff were very accomodating to our needs. We will return to this resort again

title: Relaxed excellance stress free wth agood value
review: Excellant experiance where the staff catered to my needs and for me it was a totally relaxing atmospher

title: Fantastic Stay
review: PGA is a phenomenal resort!!! There are limitless ways to spend your day in the Florida sun, or at the spa. I recommend the resort, not just for the activates, but for the outstanding and considerate staff that are always available to make your stay the very best it can be.  From the moment the valet opens your day to the moment he closes it upon your departure, you are always greeted with a smiling and welcoming face. Our stay was wonderful and we will remember it and hopefully return for years to come.

title: Exceeeded our expectations...no need to leave the country.............
review: I have to say this is the first time our room looked exactly like the one portrayed on the website. We were thoroughly satisfied with every aspect of the resort. Particularly loved the open bar concept in the large lobby---it really seemed to attract people and was a good place to mix with other hotel guests. Service and friendliness of the staff was exceptional---something for everyone.  Food was exceptional and budget friendly, if needed. Plan to go back next year with additional people and support the US economy.

title: Beautiful resort!
review: The resort generously offered free rooms for military families during the Labor Day weekend. The resort was beautiful, and we especially enjoyed our time by the pool. I highly recommend the pina coladas poolside!  I have not patroned the spa, but have family members who rave about it! And the golf is among the best around

title: PGA National Resort and Spa is reccomended for its great golf, nice facilities and good service.
review: The resort offers a selection of great golf courses along with full tennis, fitness and spa facilities.  The pool is very large with plenty of patio seating, it includes a hot tub and poolside bar.  Outdoor movies are shown in the pool area at specified days and times, ask bout it. The is a good selection of restaurants, from trendy to the 19th hole.  All restaurants offer good food and friendly service.  Check out your room when you first arrive.  I had a minor plumbing issue but nothing that dampended the overall experience of the stay.  I highly reccomend the property for it's quality golf courses, close proximity to the West Palm beach area and for it's very comfortable amenities and quality service.

title: Overall good trip - not so great customer service
review: My husband and I stayed here for Labor Day weekend.  We booked a King room.  When we arrived the morning of our first day there, the front desk staff member told us they did not have a King room available.  We told her we would wait for one to be available and she rechecked and said that she would not have one available at all since they overbooked.  I asked if we could be upgraded to a King Suite if one was available, but she told us it would be a $50/night additional fee.  A moment later a couple checked in with the staff member next to us and they were told they could have the suite for an additional $25, so when I asked for the same rate, our front desk staff member had an attitude.  I felt like we should have been upgraded for no additional charge since they were the ones…

title: The Resort, the staff, everything was great!
review: We found the sale in the spring at this resort and could not resist the offer.  We are so THRILLED we did - a great spot to just relax and unwind and close to everything!

title: Excellent value. Rooms are spacious, service excellent and lots to do.
review: If you like golf or tennis, this is the place for you. Great location. Beautiful pool area. Shopping nearby. Rooms are very nice for the price. Great values.

title: Wonderfull Resort and Golfing experience!
review: Enjoyed a four day, three night stay at a well appointed Resort. Major purpose was to play three rounds of Golf, especially on the Champion Course which is used in March on the PGA Tour. All three Courses were in excellent condition, fast but true Greens, challenging layout, Traps, water hazzards, Trees, etc. My wife, who doesn't play Golf enjoyed the Resort facilities, spent a great deal of time Pool Side! We had a number of meals at their Ironwood Grill including a special Italian Dinner, not on the menu, prepared by the Executive Chef, Vinnie, what a treat! Off-season rates were excellent, I would and already have recommended the Resort to friends!

title: Great hotel, great golf courses
review: our 3rd visit to this resort.  the golf courses are challenging and beautifully kept.  we will definitely be back

title: Fantastic resort in WPB area
review: We travel to West Palm Beach each year to attend Dave Matthews Band concerts.  For the last two years the resort has hosted DMB fans and provided excellent group rates.  I cannnot say enough about this property especially with the discounted rates.  I dont' play golf and have never used the spa or tennis center at the PGA, however the pooside experience is fantastic and the entire property is beautifully landscaped. This has become the unofficial headquarters for the antsmarching.org and DMB fans everywhere.  One NOTE: to get the group rate this year you had to bypass the normal reservations system and call during the day into the group sales office.  Hopefully next year there will be a similar deal.  Thanks PGA Nationial for a great weekend!

title: I wish every hotel was like this.  Wow!
review: My family and I stayed here for a few days and it was great in every sense.  If every hotel was like this it would be bliss, but you get what you pay for.  This is the type of hotel you tip at people so be prepared.  Valet parking, top notch bar, golf courses everywhere, and 5 star dining within 15 minutes or so of the resort.  (We ate at Seasons 52 one night and it was very good and be sure to try the deserts).  I'm big on the beds, so let me just say this is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on, period.  I slept wonderfully the entire stay.  The pool area is awesome.  It has a cool toddler pool, about 1 1/2 feet deep with fountains and then a bigger pool for the adults and older kids.  The resort is huge and the hotel hallways are very long if you happen to get stuck…

title: Great resort - all the right amenities and atmosphere
review: My wife and I visited the resort with some friends and decided to stay on our own - best decision we made! The resort was fantastic from the staff, to the amenities to the rooms! We loved every bit of the resort and are already planning our next visit.

title: Wonderful Experience
review: What a wonderful experience staying at the PGA Hotel & Spa.  5 Star all the way.  No negatives during my stay. Keep up the Great work. Thanks. Bernard Rubinstein [--] ce;;

title: Golf Nirvana
review: If you want to play golf - this is the place. Fabulous courses; professional, attentive staff and outstanding practice facilities. Great food before and after and in between a great pool. For the golfer this really is heaven.

title: 5-Star Quality with a 3-Star Price
review: The overall value at this facility is remarkable. If you can get a package deal or out-of-season offer...get on their email list to get specials offers. It's a full-service resort that will satisfy all your families needs: Pool-Spa-Tennis-Golf-Fitness Center. I found out that they are offering a 2-day package for $139 a night that includes golf. THAT IS CRAZY REASONABLE. I live locally and was given a free room as my birthday present, so I know the other area resorts. I had already been to their fantastic PGA Spa a few times and decided to just play by the pool as they had good entertainment and $6 mojitos. Pool service lagged some, but other patrons were very friendly, not the stuffy type at all. And the cupped water you could get from a cooler was filtered and ice cold.  Our…

title: Noisy bunch of drunks and rich people with no manners.
review: I booked my stay online and was aware of the $20/day resort fee.  Didn't have a problem with that.  But I did have a problem when I checked in with my not knowing about the resort collecting another $100 a night in case there are any damages done to the room.  What does this tell you about the kinds of people who stay here?  So this shorted me my cash for spending.  We are not rich and came down here with only so much money to use for dining out and for entertainment.  The room was noisy and there were people all night long laughing, slamming doors and being inconsiderate of others who are trying to sleep. I also paid $25 extra for a panaramic view of a pool.  My room was supposed to be a Premier Executive Suite.  Suites are supposed to be two connecting rooms.  This room wasn't…

title: Very Happy
review: Our stay was great from the time we checked in. I the staff was very helpful. We enjoyed the pool and the wait staff at the Wave bar Thanks Katie. During our stay I was having a surprise party for my parent’s 40th anniversary at the I-Bar and the staff was great in helping with the party. I had 30 people and the staff  keep right up with there drink orders and my food orders as well. Fred was a great bartender and Kim the I-bar manager was a great help making sure our party went off with our any problems. After the party we went to check out the Bear Trap where we found another great bartender Marc with a great sense of humor and great drinks. The only few things I was not happy with during my stay were that the gift shop was out of AA batteries the breakfast buffet was the…

title: Wonderful Golf And Spa Experience At PGA National
review: Our stay at PGA National was excellent.  The staff and facilities were top notch.  You couldn't ask for better value at a professional level golf facility.  There are many different packages and it pays to remind the staff of the items that should be included in your stay.  If you don't ask, they don't always tell.

title: PGA National Resort and Spa weekend
review: My husband and I stayed at the PGA National Resort and Spa for a weekend on our way to the Florida Keys.  The resort had a Spirit Airlines special with a $99 per night rate and a $40 unlimited golf option when we stayed in mid-July 2009.  The rate also included buffet breakfast and a complimentary David Ledbetter 1/2 hour golf clinic.  There was also a $20 resort fee that all guests pay regardless of use of the resort and spa ammenities.  Our king bed room was large, on the first floor and overlooking the pool.  The decor was tasteful and we were impressed with a beautiful tile floor that makes so much sense in Florida.  The room and breakfast were nice, but we were there for the golf.  With four courses to choose from, none of which were very busy, we were able to play 36 holes…

title: Great holiday, great location!
review: We spent nearly 4 weeks there, and it was great for the kids. Great golf coaching, and beautiful golf courses. We will definitely go back.

title: Wonderful place to golf and relax in beautiful Florida
review: PGA National is the perftec place for the golfing family.  We just spent 5 days there at a Junior golf tournament and did not have to leave the Resort area.  Everything you need is at your finfertips or within walking diatance. It is a good value for the quality of service and experience that you get.  I highly recommend this Resort - even if you are not a golfer.  I

title: Absolutely Unbelievable! So depressed to leave.
review: It is rare that a resort's website portrays the resort in actuality. PGA National has done this. Everything you see on the website is exactly as it was. The resort was stunning- everything was new and well designed. The staff was phenomenal, always going above and beyond, always greeting you and making sure you are comfortable. Our room was incorrect when we checked in, so they ended up upgrading us to a suite-amazing!  The golf staff and courses were great. The staff always checking in with us and the courses meticulously manicured.  The spa was serenity and you were treated like you were worth millions. The mineral pools in the spa did wonders for our skin. The food at the hotel was pretty average, but by no means gross. The pool area was lovely and always had a great vibe…

title: Great hotel with golf and spa
review: Very clean hotel with friendly staff.  Excellent for golfers and those who enjoy a nice spa.  This hotel was booked for a convention and was a great place to relax and enjoy the atmosphere.  My only negative is that it wasn't on the ocean, but there is a lovely lake behind the hotel.

title: Wonderful
review: This resort is superb.  It's a great place to relax and unwind.  The resort is beautiful without being over the top.  The lobby is open and gorgeous with a very nice bar.  The pool is nice, and the grounds are also very well maintained.  Everything was clean, and neat, and the service was great. Food was good in the restaurants, and the pool bar has the nicest bartenders I have ever meet.  Truly a wonderful experience.  You need a car to get around but a 10 to 15 minute ride get's you everywhere you need to be.  Go!

title: Beauty is only skin deep at the PGA National
review: We drove up to the PGA resort with a bunch of "ooohs" and "ahhhs"...the entrance is gorgeous, and the lobby is breathtaking.  Simply gorgeous, modern and inviting.  Sadly, that is where the "oohs & ahhhs" ended.  The biggest problem - the beds are WAY too small.  We are a family of four (kids are 10 and 12 -- and small kids!) and the room with two "queen" beds was ridiculously small...well, the beds were too small, the room was adequate.  (Incidentally, My sister-in-law had a room with a "king" bed ... and that bed was too small too.)   The solutions was an roll away bed in the room.  The service was atrocious.   The front desk crew didn't care that our family was uncomfortable in the provided room and later they seemed too rushed to take a phone call inquiring about the…

title: Everything was marvelous.
review: I highly recommend this hotel to everyone. Everything you need is on the grounds. You don't have to leave for anything.

title: perfect
review: This was with out a doubt the best place i have ever stayed at. Room was very nice and the staff made you feel like family.

title: Golf courses and Resort exceeded our expectations.
review: We highly recommend PGA National Resort and Spa for a wonderful relaxing experience.  The friendly staff, magnificent golf courses, and professional service is impeccable.

title: This place keeps you coming back for more!
review: This is our second visit to PGA  National in less than one year.  The place is fabulous!  The staff is great and meets even above your highest expectation! They make you feel that you are the only guest at their resort.  The food at their many restaurants is not cheap, but it is good!  If you love to golf, exercise or just soak in the pool this is the place!  I can honestly say that I can not think of one negative remark about this resort.  Their pool is just absolutely lovely ----  the most posh one that I have ever seen!  Take some time out for yourself and visit this place.  Believe me, you won't be sorry that you did.

title: Great weekend getaway.
review: Great place for a weekend getaway.  The golf and tennis were great as well as the pool and food.  The spa services and adult pool areas were a nice touch.  Had grandchildren along and they had a great time also. Will go back again for some r &r.

title: Palm Beach Gardens best accommodations
review: The resort underwent major renovations to public areas and pool.  Spa is beautiful, fitness center extensive.  Activities have been upgraded to include music at lobby bar at night, live music poolside, and movies by the pool in the evening...complete with popcorn!  Great resort even if you're NOT a golfer!!

title: Best place I have ever stayed!!
review: I just got back from a long weekend with my girlfriends and we stayed here.  Bill the Director of Sales made us feel so at home!  He was so great!  The other staff was great as well!  Christina the bartender at IBar and the security guard Tim were a awesome!!!  Me and my friends will defiantly be back for another girls trip!!  Thank to all the staff for making our trip a blast!!

title: Will Be Back. Wonderful Stay
review: Stayed here for the weekend with friends. Had an amazing time.  All the staff was very friendly and helpful. Made our stay much more pleasant & fun from Christina, the bartender at IBAR (lobby bar) to Bill, the GM to Tim, in security. The resort is beautiful, very well maintained. The pool area was nice. There are servers so you never have to get up unless you want to take a dip in the pool.  The rooms were nice sized with comfy beds. When the drapes were pulled you could hardly tell that the sun was up. Great for the people who likes to sleep in. Bottom line, I would highly recommend this resort and will go back.

title: Wow, this resort has sure changed!!!
review: We needed a get away and had heard the PGA had recently undergone a renovation.  We had been there a few years ago and knew the golf and ambiance was good.  What an amazing surprise to see how much the place has changed!!  This hotel has always been a 4 star but now...I have to give it a 10.  The entrance and lobby and new Ironwood restaurant are amazing...so chic.  The staff is very accommodating and friendly.  From my first call to their reservation department to my last wave good-bye to the front desk and valets, everyone we encountered was welcoming, friendly and professional! The restaurants were terrific.  When we lounged at the brand new swimming pool, we had great service from the staff for all our drinks and snacks.  They even have a special kiddie pool with fountains…

title: Staying at PGA National was a great get away for us.
review: It's a beautiful resort! The atmosphere is elegant, but comfortable. We liked our room with a balcony and a nice view. This resort has great golf courses, pools, spa, restaurants, and more. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet every morning. (it was included with our package deal.) Both the food and service were excellent. All the resort staff were very friendly and helpful! The location is perfect, with plenty of restaurants, shopping, entertainment, and beaches close by. We liked Juno Beach. (changing facility,parking across from pier, lifeguard, clean beach). We really enjoyed our stay at PGA National, and look forward to another trip there in September.

title: Excellent for a group golf outing.
review: The resort staff coordinates with the group very well. They know how to accommodate the golfing groups and provide excellent service. This combined with five great courses (four on site), nice accommodations, and a convenient location makes it a perfect venue for a large golf outing. The 19th is perfect for after the golf rounds and the I-bar is great fun after hours. The staff was courteous and helpful. The weekend couldb't have been better. I highly recommend it!

title: BEST DESTINATION GOLF VALUE IN FLORIDA
review: The Champion Course is a MUST PLAY....home of The Honda Classic. Caddies are excellent. EXCEPTIONAL EXPERIENCE walking the course. "The Bear Trap" (holes #'s 15-16-17) will test your nerve. Good practice facilities. Recommend a HOT Stix Custom Golf fitting or a David Ledbetter or Dave Pelz golf lesson. I-BAR is hot and attracts the "locals". Ironwood Grille is basically a steak, seafood and chop house. Cool design, good wine values....food was very good. The service staff was friendly and courteous....very helpful and not stuffy. Signature pool is very dramatic....Wave Pool Bar, great spot for after golf drinks. Fitness center extensive and good private trainers, etc... Spa is very nice....excellent pool experience in "Waters of the World", therapeutic salt water pools.

title: Bear Trap Open - PGA National Resort and Spa
review: Please take some time during your next planning period of a trip, to visit and absorb the wonderfull amenities that are available to everyone that stays at the PGA National. We spent four wonderful days with friends from all over the states playing in a fun golf tournament at the PGA. The golf was next to perfect - my scores were next to NBA scores; but the overall hospitality of each and every staff member was something to behold. Acutally finished the last night after our awards ceremony going out and playing nine holes on the Champ with Glow Balls, probably should play all of my rounds in the dark. Great time give it a shot. Smokey Moresi

title: PGA is terrific
review: PGA National is a beautiful setting, great location just 15 minutes from W. Palm airport.  Outstanding service and amenities.  Position A for the avid golfer.

title: I went to a Resort Spa and a Golf Tournament broke out.
review: The trip was the Third Annual Bear Trap Open.  The name is derived from three holes which make up the toughest par 10 on the PGA Tour.  The 15th, 16th and 17th.  All unassuming.  Two par 3's and a par 4.  Not exceptionally long no blind shots.  Nothing to fear....well except for the fact that all three greens require an approach shot over water.  And that the prevailing winds are in your face.  And the greens, which were in spectacular shape, are positioned to make even the steadiest of players to grip the club a little harder (not a good thing).  The two day tournament was very competitive and a lot of fun.  The golf staff from the pro shop to the starter to the bag boys were all outstanding.  They kept things moving efficiently with 4 other golf courses on campus to keep track…

title: World Class Vacation
review: The level of service and sense of urgency that the staff at PGA provide far exceeds other resorts and hotels.  You will not be dissapointed.

title: We felt as if we had a weekend away in just one day.
review: The staff was so friendly and the resort was delightful.

title: If you are a golf fanatic, a tennis nut and want a destination resort, go to PGA National.
review: The Champion course with "the Bear Trap" will bring you pleasantly to your knees, and you'll beg for more. Five courses and a "to-die-for" pro Shop.  Easy to get there from West Palm Beach airport.  Unbelievable pool!

title: Nice, but not worth the money
review: PGA had beautiful grounds and the staff were amazing! Several reviews did not have good experience with staff, but I found them up to tropicl all-inclusive caliber.
