The rooms were average...not worth the cost. We had a conference rate of $220/nt, but I think they go for around $450/nt, which is WAY overpriced. The resort fee didn't bother me as the internet access was fast and reliable. But, the prices for everything else were a bit steep. A continental breakfast of oatmeal and fruit is $15.00 + 6% tax and 18% gratuity additional. A bottle of soda is $4+ and a bottle of water is $5. I'm really not sure how they can get away with the charges... Many people left the conference to stay at less expensive hotels down the road... definately something to consider.

title: PGA almost ruined my Valentines Day Weekend
review: The PGA was a HUGE disappointment.  The hotel staff were rude, and not accommodating at all.  We had to change rooms four times during our two day stay before we finally got a room with a decent view and a king bed.  The hotel is not architecturally designed well, so they have several rooms with a view of a wall or a dark alleyway.  It is NOT four or five star quality, and not worth the money.

title: Hidden Charges
review: By the way, there is a $20 per room per day "resort fee" and 11.5% additional tax,  that is not included in your nightly stay.  Make sure you know what you will be charged upfront, don't get ripped off like we did because nobody told us!

title: Nice room, great spa and close to everything.
review: We took a girl's spa weekend trip for a friend's birthday and stayed at the PGA National Resort and Spa in April 2009. First impression was that the grounds were beautiful with the greenest grass I have ever seen. Check in was fast and the staff was very friendly but once in our room we noticed that the beds (supposed to be two doubles) were very small. We ended up requesting two cots so we could all sleep in comfort. The room itself was large and there was a seperate sink outside the bathroom that made getting ready very easy.   We had spa appointments within an hour of arriving and loved that we could get to the spa without walking back through the lobby. There was a seperate door leading outside and to the spa. The spa was very nice with lots of comfy waiting areas and polite…

title: Great Stay
review: We took a trip to PGA National for a week with the family. To start, our reservations took a little while to set up, but we finally got it. Diane is reservations was very sweet.  We were warmly welcomed by a very friendly bellman. Checkin was very smooth and we got right to our rooms. Our room was ok, really nothing too special. I wouldn't say the room was super clean... in fact we had to pick up some previous stay trash. I was first very disappointed by the poor wireless/internet services offered by the resort. Throughout the stay, it really seemed like the resort wasn't up on the 21st century as far as technology was concerned, which was kind of disappointing.  I didn't set up any golf prior to my stay and called down to get some information. I called twice and got a voicemail…

title: Great Birthday Weekend!
review: After four trips to Palm Beach this season to visit my daughter's horse, we have stayed at several mid to high end hotels and b&b's.  PGA was clearly the most fun, the staff is more than accommodating; we checked in very late and it was a BIG birthday weekend for me.  A mistake with my reservation led to a great upgrade, making my birthday very special.  We are tall people and teenagers are messy.  Having my own bed for two nights was incredible.  The staff is so friendly, it's welcoming in tough times.  From Hector and the young lady at the reception with him, Sanchez and Hugo (in the restaurant) made warm efforts and joked with my teenage son. The price point is half that of Resort at Singer Island, The Ritz and Palm Beach properties, and, while some upgrades are in order, it…

title: Second time is the charm.
review: We stayed at the PGA last year and were disappointed in the handling of the finer details of the resort. (previous review also posted)  This year, we decided to try them again as we love the area and also wanted to play golf.  I was pleasantly surprised with the improvements they made which resulted in much better service and ambience.  A noticeable change in the demeanor of the staff this year.  Very friendly and helpful from the woman who checked us in (and remembered us later) to the outside pool restaurant and concierge staffs.  This time we were made to feel welcome and we were always greeted wherever we went.  We hated our room last year and now understand that there is a vast difference in the rooms available.  We asked for, and got, a room that overlooked the pool and…

title: Great Trip to PGA National over Spring Break
review: Great trip to Palm Beach Gardens over Spring Break.  Took in a Cardinal Spring training game and played golf while Kids enjoyed the pool.  Champions Golf course was awesome and in excellent condition.  Other courses are excellent as well and practice areas are huge and perfect condition.  Kids enjoyed the beautiful pool and our double/double room was much larger and cleaner than where we just stayed in the Orlando/Universal area at 5 star resort on the way down.  In fact we all agreed this was a nicer place to stay and are coming back next year as there are lots of things to do in the area.  This place is a hidden gem.

title: Rooms were okay; Rude front desk
review: My stay would've been okay if not for the poor front-desk reception.  Juliana was very rude and exhibited poor hospitality to arriving guests.  Based on this poor experience, I would not recommend staying here.

title: Posh, glorious sports resort -- with some defects
review: I *would* have ranked this a five-star for several features: beautiful grounds; gorgeous and spacious rooms; best hotel fitness center ever; tremendous golf; attentive and hospitable room service; and over-the-top good service from the golf pro staff. All this I got at a bargain promotional price of $119 per night (plus a $20-per-night resort fee) on Expedia.com.   But there were problems with my stay: 1.)  I found it difficult to call the property in advance to ask questions about the facilities.  My phone calls apparently bounced to a on off-site call center where attendants were inadequately familiar with the resort's facilities.  When I got them to transfer me to a human being’s phone line on the property, they didn't pick up and it went to voice mail.  This happened several…

title: Not worth its 4 star rating
review: I don't understand how the hotel got 4 stars. Sure the lobby/lounge is good and the swimming pool is nice but the rooms have no sun light and are noisy as you can hear nearby rooms. The buffet breakfast was one of the worse I had in a hotel and the staff is far from being 4 stars worthy. I would not recommend this place even discounted price.

title: Adequate Resort (Not top quality)
review: First of all we booked hotel on priceline and got what i feel was a great rate of $84.00 plus the website charges so total was $101.00.  I called ahead of time and asked for a check in upgrade which all hotels offer and was assisted by Josh who gave me the pricing of $30.00 for a better view or $50.00 for a suite.  I asked if he would grant it to me on the phone and he did so, basically we were given a suite for $151.00 which is about half the regular rate.  Check In was smooth and simple, we were prepaid already.  They charge $18.00 for valet but the guest "no charge" parking is very close so we chose not to do that.  The resort fee of $20.00 per night is non negotiable and I guess it covers the pool and gym.  The casual restaurant breakfast buffett was $21.00 per person plus…

title: Great Stay!!!
review: We spent a week here over the Christmas holiday. We stayed here due to the price and golf courses. We had a great stay and I would recommend this resort to anyone. You do not have to play golf to stay here. It is a great resort for families. The golf is one extra benefit and if you do plan on playing then I recommend getting on a golf package. The golf is really expensive if you are not on a package. You can stay a week and if you plan on playing only 1 day than ask them to put you on the golf package for that 1 day only. They will do it and you will save a lot of money.   The resort has been updated in the last year and is very nice. The rooms are not updated but are not too bad. We stayed in a cottage and we were very happy. Just remember when making the reservation, please…

title: Great Hotel and Outstanding Service
review: The PGA is a very comfortable resort and would be suitable for a golf trip destination among friends and family and also serve as a good launching pad for the rest of the Palm Beach area.  We stayed at the PGA on our trip to the Equestrian Festival in Wellington because there are not a lot of good options in the immediate area.  The drive North to the PGA only takes about 15 minutes and you develop a feeling of relaxation being away from the hustle of the Palm Beach, while still being close enough to all the action.  We didn't use the pool area, but we had a look and it looked top notch.  We stayed on the low basement floor (which I was apprehensive about at first), but it ended up being a good room.  It was actually huge compared to most hotels and had a walkout to a lower…

title: Consistent, friendly and a GREAT stay
review: I've read the reviews and the property must have too.  -- It was opposite of all the bad opinions as the staff may have heeded each negative complaint and worked on it.  My company booked their conference here and I enjoyed every second of it. I was a bit concerned at first after reading the posts, but pleasantly surprised with the property, staff and restaurant.   I'm always a stickler about rooms, and these were very nice. They must have just recently completed their renovation because my bathroom smelled faintly of fresh paint. Bed was comfy, flatscreen was a good size for the room and the overall size of the room was decent. Only bad comment would be the closet still had remenants of the old place as an aged wire closet shelf system was used.   A co-worker had a suite and…

title: Great Pool, Spacious Rooms,
review: Got a great rate on this hotel and couldn't pass it up. I don't golf, but if I did that is where they make their money. Green fees are high!  I was very pleased with my room, its not 5 star, but it was large, clean, and had a comfy bed. I did have to walk what seemed like a mile to get to it though. I sometimes could hear my neighbors though the wall, but I always bring a fan with me to drown out such noises. Room had a nice patio. The pools here are relaxing. Room serivce wasn't so good, it took an hour to get a pizza. Bartenders were somewhat snide and don't even try to ask for a corkscrew! But, the front desk staff were very pleasant. The landscaping around the hotel is fabulous. There are many good restaurants down PGA Blvd. If the price is right I'll definitly be back.

title: Great Stay,  however......
review: Got a great rate on expedia during thanksgiving 2008 and had a wonderful stay, the room was clean and nicely decorated even had a balcony. The satff on the other hand somehow managed to make me feel as if they were doing me a favor letting me stay there! If they were a bit nicer I would give them 5 stars. And OMG the fire alarm went off at 3 am and we all had to take the stairs down to the outside in the cold,  (was a  false alarm) couldn't go back to sleep and had an early flight.

title: Inconsistent, but good for the price
review: First of all, we booked the room for $70 on Priceline, but if you get this rate on Priceline with the mandatory resort fee of $20 plus the taxes it really comes out to a $100 a night. On our first night we tried to switch to a room with a better view, because at the priceline rate they had us in a parking lot view room, but the next night other rooms freed up in addition to the first room they sent us to being infested led us to stay in a pool view room the rest of the trip, which had a beautiful view of the updated and luxurious pool and lake. The room itself was outdated with the exception of the marble and granite in the bathroom, balcony furniture and flat screen televisions, which are a little small. In our first room the toilet seat would not stay up for a man to do his…

title: Gorgeous resort at an incredible price !
review: My wife and our best friends JC & Lourdes stayed over on the weekend to visit frinds in WPB and to get out of Miami for the weekend. While I would love to say that everything was perfect and that this is the most gorgeous resort in town, I cannot.. however for the price $99 this value cannot be turned down ! The resort itself is in pristine condition, the entire staff we encountered from the valet, the bellhop, housekeeper, front staff, etc.. are courteous, polite and very professional. Our first room had a very musty, mildew smell and we ended up moving to room 2063 which was fine and overlooked the golf course.. the front desk clerk moved us right away and we couldn't complain a lick.. the resort is definitely top notch, the pool area is huge and the restaurants are great…

title: Pretty Good...
review: Overall we were content with our 3-night stay at this resort, which was booked for $99 a night.  However, it's definitely not 5-star.  The facility is lovely and has numerous golf courses.  The resort is part of a larger PGA gated community with homes and condos.  The lobby and common areas are nice, and the new zero-entry pool and pool area are pretty.    There is a $20 daily resort fee that includes tennis, wi-fi, local phone calls, all fitness classes, and a newspaper.  We felt that this was a good deal all in all, given that other hotels would price gouge for these a la carte, and we played tennis daily.  There were activities planned daily, some which were free and some which cost money.  This was very nice for families with kids.  There was a little petting zoo one day, a…

title: Very Average Rooms
review: The resort itself is very beautiful and definitely 4 stars, but the rooms are definitely not more than 3 stars.  We were given a room on the first floor which is below the lobby level and it felt like we were in the basement with the hollow acoustics and musty smells.  This is a huge property so it's probably not that easy to keep all the rooms nice, but I would never stay here again.

title: Fabulous Spa, So-so Hotel
review: I have been going to the PGA Spa for a few years now, whenever I get down to Palm Beach. The thing to know about this place is that the Spa itself it just wonderful, top notch...but I would book a hotel stay elsewhere. I only stayed at the hotel once and thought it was not up to par for the price... the rooms and services were bland and outdated--i.e. what you would expect for old guys who play golf maybe? But again, as to the spa part, one of the best spa experiences I have found! (my "excellent" star review is for the spa only)

title: Great Stay at PGA
review: My stay at PGA was quite wonderful.  The renovations were very nice and my room was large and airy.  I recommend the snapper at the Ironwood restaurant and the staff was very polite and friendly.  Nice pool area.  I treated myself to a facial and was glad that I did.  Overall experience was extremely enjoyable!

title: First Class
review: My wife and I spent three luxurious days - great golf for me, pool/spa/shopping for her, excellent dining for both of us. We enjoyed three of the resort restaurants. Palm Beach Gardens also offered the best of everything - Carmine's La Tratoria is now my favorite Italian restaurant.

title: loved the resort
review: I recently returned from the resort having a girls getaway.  Upon entering the newly renovated lobby we found it to be beautiful. The service staff was very friendly and professional at the same time. They made us feel welcome from the start.  We indulged ourselves at the IBar, Ironwood Grill, and the beautiful new pool. All fantastic.  We had spa treatments that we loved. Our rooms were cleaned daily and I liked the fact that they are eco friendly. They also allow pets. My children are grown but I noticed that they have daily activities planned for children. Everything is close by the resort. Mall shopping, dinning, movies,etc. A short taxi ride to any activity. I had been to the resort with my husband before the renovation and thought it was nice but they have now blown me…

title: Fantastic
review: Fantastic hotel. Did not eat there but service was great, many employees. Resort fee was $18 dollars a night for local calls, a fantastic gym, high speed internet and a fantastic pool. Recently renovated I believe, the room was wonderful and overall very nice with tennis courts as well.  Plaza not far with a Walgreen's and Burger King but car needed to get around Palm Beach area. The rate of about 90 we paid plus the fees was well worth it; summer rates are lower in this part of Florida. Highly recommend for family or business.

title: Great for a golf trip
review: Stayed here with a golf outing during the first week of August and had a fantastic time.  The Pros: Easy Parking Great desk staff who helped with all issues Rooms were very attractve Pool area was beautiful Food in all restaurants was excellent (service great also) Golf was right out the back door with access to 5 courses Only 15 minutes from the airport and near many stores and restaurants  The Only Negative: Pro shop staff was not to friendly  In summary PGA National is a great hotel with lots of excellent employees

title: nice hotel and grounds
review: Stayed here with my wife and 2 teen children. We all loved it. Nice room, fantastic pool and quiet grounds. Got a great deal via hotwire and was a bit nervous about the hotwire selection. But immediately upon arrival was put at ease as this is a real quality hotel. The lobby was huge well done and huge windows looking out to the pool or the golf course. After the drive from Orlando and the general overcrowding of Orlando to escape to Palm Beach gardens and the PGA  resort was a real holiday pleasure. Olympic sized pool, the golf course although I did not play, gave a great atmosphere were so impressed we stayed an extra day as we all enjoyed the resort and the general area

title: Amazing Hotel. Amazing weekend.
review: Everyone's experience at a hotel is going to be different. And I admit, after reading some traveler's reviews on their stay, I was wary to book here. Not only did I have a flawless weekend, this hotel completely exceeded my expectations. The rooms were spacious and the beds were comfortable. Any need we had was met. And every staffer we came in contact with had a smile on their face and a kind comment to give. I came down to attend a 2-night concert so I can't comment on the golf course or Spa, but the people who were partaking in those activities looked like they were having fun. The hotel was kind enough to let us have an after party to the concerts in the lobby after each show. (Oh yeah....and they give you a few buy one get one drink tickets when you check in which came in…

title: Nice, but seen nicer
review: After all the conflicting reviews, my husband and I still opted to stay at this resort - afterall, how bad could it be if professional golf tournaments are held their? The hotel in itself, has had a beautiful make over; the lobby, the rooms and pool are all very nice. The food is very good...expensive, but good (Ibar lunch avg $60 / 2 people & Ironwood dinner $150) Food was a problem because to find any place (anywhere) to eat after 9:30-10pm was a mission in itself. We're not exactly 'early birds' and yet, found ourselves racing to get showered and dressed to make it to a restaurant before closing time! As for the golf, we had both hoped the courses would be nicer - the pics on the site definitely look better, but  in all fairness, it is nice...by no means a dump.  Now, on to…

title: Nice Hotel, BAD service
review: The facilities of the hotel are great.  In fact it is wanderful.  However the service is very unorganized, and most of the people that I delt with were quite rude.    My room was not ready when I arrived at 2 PM.  I had to wait till 6:30 PM for it.  During that wait, nobody knew the status of it, and it seemed like everyone just looked at each other dumbfounded  whenever I would ask about the room's status.    There was a mold problem in their ballroom, so that was closed, so the meeting that I was supposed to attend was held in a tent in the parking lot.  That would not have been such a problem, except it rained the entire time that I was there.    I had a small box shipped to the hotel.  At first they could not find it.  So I tracked it.  Then they told me that it was in the…

title: Glad we waited...
review: We originally were to visit the PGA National Resort last August (2007) for our anniversary but had to cancel unexpectedly.  The PGA National Resort cancelled our stay without any questions and/or fees and further wished us well.  Well, we finally rescheduled our anniversary trip and we are thankful we had to wait for this trip ... the resort has been renovated and it's very nice.  We found the resort to be LOVELY.  Our room was gorgeous - nicely appointed, extremely clean, bright and cheery.  The grounds are well manicured, the golf was great - of course, the pool was beautiful, and the staff exceptional.  Everything was great for us.  We didn't dine at the restaurants or go to the Spa, therefore we cannot comment.  The tennis facility looked really nice and use is included at…

title: Dark Room
review: I was only there for one night and having first made my own reservation directly, it was then taken over by a friend who lives on the Resort who obtained a better rate for me. Upon arrival they claimed to know nothing about any cancellation but had 2 rooms booked. It took 5 minutes for them to agree that I would only be charged for 1 room. This was no biggie and they handled the matter with smiles all round.  The room itself was on the lower level with a very poor outlook and little natural light.....open the curtains and you were overlooked by other rooms close by.  It was nicely fitted and as I was there only until the morning I never bothered to try and change it.  The bar area was very nice and they added an 18% tip and still left space for an extra gratuity.....why ?? …

title: Good - Not Great
review: When I learned that our annual sales conference would be held at PGA National Resort and Spa, I immediately pictured myself living, if only for three days, a lifestyle wrought with sophistication and luxury - and on the company's dime! So while the resort's prices reflected such a lifestyle, I was under whelmed by just about everything else.   The resort overlooks a small lake and is surrounded by golf courses. The resort's beautiful pool area and veranda are well-situated to take advantage of the magnificent setting. Aside from that, and the aforementioned high prices, the resort does little to remind you it's anything more than a Holiday Inn.   My room was dark and unremarkable (nothing like the pictures on the resort's website). The decor looked dated and worn, and the…

title: wouldnt go again
review: when I read these, i wonder who writes them. Now I know- ME. the staff was RUDE. the place was empty- alot of staff just standing around- they bill you 18% on top of everything so they dont need to provide service- I thought i was at one of those rude restaurants.  Room service was fast (the hotel was filled 7% capacity)- the tiki bar closed at 7pm- the sun was still out, its FLORIDA and there was NO where to get a drink except the lobbey bar or the dungeon bar which was showing American Idol re-runs. We booked a sitter one night and ended back in the room after 2 hrs for lack of things to do! We had our children with us, the place CLEARLY doesnt cater to families- the menu at the outside restaurant has ice cream on it- but all the bartenders denied knowing what ice cream was -…

title: a whole new hotel
review: Our family went on vacation to PGA National several years ago and had a good time. Although the property was a little tired, it was still a fun trip. We just came back and WOW what a difference. They just renovated the pool, restaurant, bar, lobby and I even think that they did something to the front entrance, It feels totally different. The new restaurant, Ironwood Grill was spectacular on all counts ambience, service and of course the food.   The difference even shows in the staff, there was an excitement that you don’t find at most other places. Although the guestrooms are spacious, clean and feel new, they don’t have the look of the rest of the hotel yet. I guess that’s  coming

title: What an exciting stay
review: Me and my wife checked into the pga resort on friday and stayed through the weekend. From the moment we walked through the beautiful entry way , where we were greated by a bellman who took our bags to the front desk to the amazing round of golf we had. An  A++++ experience that was summed up with an amazing dinner at the resorts new restaurant Ironwood Grille. The ambiance of this restaurant was breath taking. Me an d my wife cant wait to come back next year...

title: very nice
review: Very nice hotel, excellent for golfers and sporty types, very well equipped gym and lots of tennis courts plus golf and swimming pools. The pool area is lovely but a major problem is the issue they seem to have with large birds meaning that everything including chairs and tables is covered in bird poo, also very irritating when dining as they come down to steal food. During lunch one day at the pool bar the waitress was bringing over my burger when one of the birds came down and literally stole the food off the plate. The rooms in the hotel are lovely, very clean and tidy and spacious. We had 4 people in one room with no space problems at all. The only other downside to the hotel is the dining. The quality of the food and the range of food available was not up to the standards…

title: Don't valet your car at PGA National
review: While attending a golf member/guest at PGA National our car was damaged while in the valet lot. In addition to receiving no satisfaction for our claim, we were treated with complete disrespect, called liars, and our host member was harassed with questions regarding our character.  It was hard for us to believe that PGA, after spending millions of dollars recently to try to make their resort a first class place to stay, would allow its members and their guests to be treated in such a manner.   Not only was the valet representative rude and uncourteous but the PGA management showed no response to our claim. We requested that a PGA representative be available at the meeting with the valet person and they sent a room's manager who knew nothing about the valet service.  We would…

title: A four-star that wasn't
review: The PGA Resort and Spa tries to be a very high-end property but fails to do so.  The rooms are very small and ours had some peeling wallpaper...the beds and bedding were absolutely wonderful though.  The service at the bar and restrauants was slow and not very friendly and no wonder....an 18% gratuity is automatically added to your bill, so why should they try to serve the customer in a timely manner?  The breakfast buffett was a grand total of $52.00 for two people.  Last time I checked bacon and eggs were pretty inexpensive!! We attended a convention and stayed for 5 days.  When we checked in after a horrible trip that took 11 hours by plane with delays, etc.  that should have taken 4 hours, the airline lost our luggage, we missed our first dinner meeting (had nothing to wear…

title: New Experience; Never Again
review: We will never stay here again!!! They could have rolled out the red carpet and served us our meals on golden platters and it will not make up for the experience.  At 3:30 in the morning the fire alarm went off.  Obviously concerned my wife and I went down the stairs to the lobby to evacuate only to find out it was a false alarm.  The alarm then went off for the next 37 minutes.  Then fifteen minutes after it finally shut off it went off AGAIN.  This time it was only for 5 minutes or so.  It doesn't matter, because now we were up.  The biggest issue I have with this whole situation is that there were no efforts taken to tell us this was a false alarm. There were no phone calls.  No staff walking up and down the halls. We had to find this information ourselves. We actually called…

title: Nice spa!
review: We stayed at the resort for a weekend, to relax and rejuvenate at the spa.  The resort is under renovations in the main lobby and poolside areas, and the rooms are completed now.  The spa is wonderful compared to other resort spas, definitely in the upper 25%.  We enjoyed a leisurely lunch and dipping in the various mineral pools after our spa services.  The breakfast buffet is good, with fresh omelettes made to order. If you don't mind the dust of renovations, and some elevators that are not operating, this resort is a nice surprise.  Nice to note that it is quiet due to the lack of normal crowds, and plenty of early morning golfers.  Since we cannot stand to hear loud partying in the hall or next room, that was a big plus for us.

title: OK for an overnight stay
review: We stayed at the resort as an overnight on our way from the Keys to Orlando.  As other reviewers have mentioned, it's undergoing extensive renovations - and looks as though it does need this work to be done as the place was generally a bit tired and unappealing.    The room was a generous size and had a very comfortable bed.  The bathroom arrangement is a bit peculiar - the bathroom door only just opened without hitting the toilet, and getting into and out of the shower was hindered by the positioning of the toilet and the door.  The bathrooms felt a bit tired and old-fashioned given standards in other hotels nowadays.  The staff we met were extremely friendly - from the concierge who recommended her favourite restaurant to us, and it was a great place to go to - to the…

title: Good for a last minute stay.
review: PGA Resort is ok.  They are doing a ton of renovations that are probably overdue. Made the place visually unappealing.  Although that comes with the territory.  The rooms were older and the lighting was not that great.  The bed was nice, and it was a good tv.  I didn't like the bathroom.  It was tight and old looking.  There was no way that I would consider taking a bath in that tub.  The pool, once it's finished will probably be amazing.  In the meantime the small pools are available, but not as appealing.  The restaurant was overpriced but convenient considering there's nothing in walking distance.  I was disappointed that NOTHING was open at 6am.  We were leaving to catch our flight and I just wanted some tea or water, but there was nothing open.  That was a bummer.  Overall,…

title: golf trip with the boys
review: went for a 4 day golf trip with 12 guys..rooms were large, although resort said new carpeting, etc, it seemed dated...ceiling tiles by the a/c in the ceiling dirty and moldy, construction on site made for alot of confusion and limited facilities...golf courses were enjoyable except for the upcharged championship course which, i feel, was in fair to poor condition..muddy  fairways, and overpriced.  The haig course was also in need of some attention.  The general and squire and estate were all in good condition and fun to play...main complaints were construction tunnels , limited food choices..Some service staff werre abrupt at breakfast...golf staff rebecca was  wonderful , as were most of the golf rangers and golf staff we came in contact with..overall i would wait to book pga…

title: We will be back...
review: Well despite the renovations, the staff, spa, and golf are great! I can't wait to come back and see what the remodel looks like. Looking at some of the other reviews I am shocked to see some of the comments. I knew that they were under renovation so I expected the worst especially for the great price. I admit the pool area is a mess but the spa pools are just as nice. This place will be the best in this area after the renovations.

title: Glad I didn't have to pay.........
review: I have stayed at the PGA twice for business trips. I was very unimpressed. Like others have said, the catered food is horrible. The dinners were always a hodge-podge of whatever the kitchen had leftover. First visit, my room was horrible. Red wine stained floral comforter, sheets felt like sandpaper, just seemed dirty. I ended up getting sick. Second visit, room was somewhat redone. Much better, felt & looked cleaner.  Spa is ok...overpriced in my opinion. I don't play golf, so I cannot comment on that. I would never pay to stay here with my own money.

title: Golf Getaway was a success
review: Went with some clients for a golf-getaway.  Booked a reasonably priced package which included a round of golf per day on one of their five courses.  Was disclosed of their $16 per day resort fee which included wireless internet access and access to the fitness center. Renovations are taking place as disclosed on the hotel's website.  Most of the common area is pretty torn up.  It should look nice, but not so terrific now if you are going to the hotel to stay at the pool.  However, the rooms have been renovated and all of our rooms were nice with comfortable bedding and flat screen tv.  The fitness center was well-equipped.  Because the main pool was being rebuilt, we could have used the fitness center pool (which was a lap pool), but chose to use the pool area adjacent to the…

title: Not Worth It!!
review: I came out to this site to read some of the reviews from past visitors to this place.  And going down there I suspected that there would still be some renovations taking place.  However, I was not prepared for the HEAVY renovations taking place.  It's my opinion that they tear the whole place down and start over.  Like previous reveiwer comments the place was very dingy.  I felt like I was at a Motel 6 and not a spa.  The pool closed at 7:00 pm.  It did not feel like I was at a resort at all.  I must say the only good part about my stay was the fitness center.  The fitness center was nice and clean.  And they offered aerobics class to those staying in the hotel.   Back to the actual hotel the carpet needs to be replaced, the rooms need to be cleaned from top to bottom, the walls…

title: Giant Dump AND they rip you off - EVEN Priceline customers!
review: Booked through Priceline for $71, the hotel website was $99 so not much savings.  This place is a tired, dingy dump undergoing a renovation to the common areas.  What they need to do is clean the rooms, hallways, and make sure all the appliances work.  Our HVAC system blew a moldy stench I haven't experienced before and hope never to again.  Then the icing on the cake:  upon checking out I noticed a $15 charge on the bill.  Remember - I booked on PRICELINE, i.e. one charge, all included and paid to Priceline.  Well, PGA National Resort and Spa feels the need to charge every customer - whether direct, Priceline, Orbitz, whatever - with a $15 "resort usage" charge to cover telephone, workout room, internet, etc.  I checked in at 11pm and checked out at 6am.  I used nothing in the…

title: Be warned!
review: The enitre place is under construction.  The main pool is closed and you have to use the spa pool, which is fine, but not incredible.  Maybe it was because we were there in summer, but everything was closed.  At 5pm, there was no where to sit and have a drink, either by the pool or even in a bar.  (well, actually, the cafe by the golf shop was open for drinks, but it felt like a cafeteria)  Couldn't even get a coffee - even though there was a big sign in the lobby advertising "Fresh Starbucks Coffiee This Way".  It was closed.... They'll charge you $25 if the valet parks your car, even though the lot is 2 minutes away (park it yourself) but they won't mention that there's a charge until after you're already checking in and your car is long gone.... The spa was lovely, and the…

title: Great stay - very nice resort!
review: Fantastic stay!  Planned just one night but when the Doubletree had a fire we gladly came back to PGA.  They took us in with open arms and gave us a very large king room that easily fit 2 rollaway beds at $129 using AAA.  We had room 4084.  It was right next to ice room but we never heard a peep.  There is major renovation going on but we actually benefited from it.  Since they are redoing the pools they are letting guests use the spa pool which is normally reserved for spa customers.  Check out there web site to find info on the "Waters of the World" pools.    Beds were soft & comfy, high quality linens and towels, quiet rooms, great WIFI.  Staff was always helpful and friendly.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

title: Very Helpful Staff, Hotel under heavy renovations
review: We stayed at this resort from Sunday through Tuesday, during the last week of July 2007 for a conference.  The room was very nice, clean and has a very comfortable bed.  The hotel was under going a major renovation, that had not been mentioned when the conference reserved the rooms.  However, it was not that intrusive and the workers were very polite.  Only one restaurant was available, breakfast was average, but very expensive.  We did not utilize the one functioning cocktail lounge, but we did peak inside.  It seemed clean and large.  The large pool area was dug up, so the only pools available were the three connected to the Spa.  We did not use the spa services, but we did use one of the pools and one of the whirlpools.  A very nice pool and patio area.  The resort did offer…

title: Excellent value, but that's because they're remodeling
review: When I went to the website and booked a room using my AAA discount, I was pleasantly surprised that a standard room was $80 and premium room $90.  Once I got there, I found out why.  The 2 main restaurants (Shula's and the Italian restaurant) are both closed for remodeling.  The pool was also closing for renovation the day after we left.  The front entrance was also closed and we had to use a side entrance.  Nevertheless, these issues did not impact signficantly on my hotel experience.  I usually don't eat at hotel restaurants anyway, so didn't miss the restaurants.  However, I would have been disappointed if the pool had been closed, so you should definitely check with the property first.  The gym is large with a full schedule of fitness classes with very good teachers.  The…

title: Beware when they remodel pool in July 2007
review: My husband had a business conference at the resort, and we brought the kids to enjoy a few relaxing days by the pool. The 2nd day there was a sign posted that the pool would be closing for a private party for the rest of the day. They advertise that they have nine pools at the resort, so I began asking where I'd be able to go with the kids, as there is nothing else on the property for kids to do unless they golf. I found out that 7 of the pools are located in the spa, and are only for spa customers and no children under 16. The only other pool is at their fitness center, and it is a hike from the main building and not very large.  They will begin remodeling the pool area on July 1st, so I'm assuming that everyone will have to use the pool at the fitness facility. I'm not sure if…

title: Fabulous Spa Experience!
review: My best friend and I just got back from a Sheer Indulgence Spa weekend at the PGA Resort.  The experience we had with regard to the Spa, staff, food, (both restaurants on the property, Shula's Steakhouse and Arezzo had superb food. The Citrus Tree and Windows on the World for Breakfast and Lunch also had ample, good food.) property, room, etc. was all top of the line.  The Spa treatments were heavenly--I felt like I was floating after my Reflexology treatment.  The Waters of the World pools were warm and relaxing and just really enjoyable.  The spa was everything we hoped it would be.   From the beginning of the trip where we arrived late and having trouble with my credit card at check-in, the staff went above and beyond to insure that we were happy, and would get the fabulous…

title: Superior service level of the entire staff at the PGA National
review: I would like to take this opportunity to thank the PGA National Resort & Spa for the exceptional professionalism and the superior service level of the staff.  Their efforts made a significant contribution to the success of ABN AMRO's Winter Sales Meeting (February 22nd- February 25th, 2007).  Their enthusiasm, preparation and attention to detail are a reflection of management's commitment to deliver an unequaled resort experience in South East Florida.       I was also impressed by the responsiveness of your team to my client's needs during a very busy month for your resort.  We were made to feel like your number one priority, even as your resort made preparations for the PGA event it was hosting the following week.  All these factors contributed to the confirmation that I made…

title: HONDA CLASSIC!!!
review: I recently stayed at PGA National Resort and Spa in Palm Beach Gardens, FL for the PGA Tour's Honda Classic.  It was the greatest experience I have ever had at a PGA tour event, and I have been to MANY!  First of all, this is the best venue for a tour event that I have ever come across.  The course owned the players, and they were very happy about that.  I expect the word of mouth to travel very quickly, thus attracting even bigger names for the coming years.  The accomadations were also extremely plush, and the staff was attentive to my every wish.  I had a fantastic weekend at PGA National, and strongly encourage ALL to check this place out for a golf vacation!    Post Script:  They also host golf groups!

title: It's all about golf
review: Rooms were large and newly refurbished-- Flat screen TVs and good beds.  Some of the public areas looked a little worn.  Staff was most accommodating. Breakfast buffet and room service were great.  Italian restaraunt was so-so.  Golf was fun.  Would come again for the right price

title: Classic Golf Resort
review: I am a seasoned business traveler with high expectations; especially when properties have reputations such as the PGA.  Enjoy your stay at the PGA - don't expect super amazing guest rooms as they are a wee bit worn. The staff is amazing and makes sure each guest starts and ends the day with a smile.  Lovely lobby, grounds and public spaces. The pools looked so inviting I was kicking myself for not bringing my swimsuit! My friend was able to squeeze in time for a massage and an hour or so by the pool and loved it.   I had a suite (Rm 3049) and it was very comfortable. King bed with luxury linens (bed a little hard for my taste) and six large (foam) pillows. Bedside tables were actualy large enough for more than just a lamp and phone/alarm clock - a nice feature often overlooked.…

title: Will go back
review: Had a great time.  Great resort.  Rooms were very nice and roomy.  Played golf twice and enjoyed the courses.  Did not have time to use SPA ,but stopped in to check it out and look really nice, will try to use next  time.  Enjoyed the pool area and workout room.  Some of the staff was rude, but overall had a really nice time.  Will go back!

title: Property is beautiful but beware of cottages, restaurants....
review: Was looking for a place to stay that would appeal to the whole family and would be comfortable. Noticed that they offered "club cottages" and thought it would be perfect...Although the cottages are on the enormous property you feel like an outsider. First of all, the cottages are privately owned and rented out. When we stepped into our cottage we thought we were in a time warp. Felt like the 1970's. Very outdated. On the surface it looked clean but there were hair's from previous guests in the bathroom countertops and bathtubs. Even found hair's in the coffeemaker. Housekeeping knocked on our door at 8:30 am the following morning to clean our unit and kept coming back until we told them to leave us alone. We ate at Arezzo's and the food was good but service was very, very slow…

title: Really glad we went!
review: I almost cancelled our reservation at the PGA National after reading several reviews.  However, I ran short of time (3 day advance cancellation) and didn't want to lose my one night deposit.  And...I'm really glad I didn't cancel.  The place was wonderful and we had a superb time. The staff were really helpful and the lobby was beautiful with a "lodge" feeling.  Big, airy and numerous spread out seating areas with animal print fabrics on the furniture.  Our room was huge and clean.  We chose to dine in Don Shula's Steak House just off the lobby and had an absolutely brilliant meal. After a brilliant night sleep (the beds are huge, luscious and extremely comfortable) we went for breakfast and a round of golf. Aside from it being extremely hot, the course was in immaculate…

title: Never Again - Strike Two!
review: This resort is unbelievably awful.  The spa is great!   The golf is average at best.    We (and two other couples) stayed here in 2004 to celebrate 40 years in business and had a horrible experience (someone in our room, new room not cleaned, used soap in the shower, double billed credit card, safes that don't work, and argumentative staff).  We complained and they offered to have us back for a complimentary stay, which my wife and a girlfriend embarked upon last month. Unfortunately, their experience was even worse.  Their room was not ready until after 7:00 pm (check-in is at 4:00).  The very average and outdated room smelled of smoke, and no other rooms were offered (the staff argued that the room did not smell of smoke).  Both women are allergic to smoke, and are very…

title: Leaves Much to Be Desired
review: My husband and I recently stayed at PGA while he was in town on business.  We have stayed at several upscale hotels (Plaza - NY & Boston, Acapulco Princess, Babados Princess), and this "resort" doesn't come close - except for the prices they charge.  The spa was very nice, but here are a few of the reasons why I would not recommend this place unless you get a great deal (under $145/night).   - Room smelled unless we had a/c set to 68 or lower. - Could hear EVERYTHING our neighbors on either side did; open drawers, open glass sliding door to balcony, etc.  We were woken up each morning when the papers were delivered down the hall.   - Way overpriced for everything (except maybe spa amenities).   - Poor front desk service (our toilet overflowed & we had to call three times before…

title: Utterly Mediocre Golf Resort
review: I was probably even more miserable at this place having come straight from the Biltmore in Coral Gables, which is gorgeous, but I think the PGA is pretty dreadful in its own right.  They managed to design the place so none of the rooms - at least none that I saw - has a good view unless you go out on the patio and crane your neck. Dark room, pretty awful decor. They promised wireless internet but it didn't work for two of the three days we were there and all we were told was "it's not our fault". This is not very helpful when you have business to do. There was no other connection, except for the business center.  There was no concierge present at the dinner hour, which I could not believe. They never heard of the restaurant I was going to (right up the road), and recommended…

title: loved the golf
review: go for the golf, not for the room or the food - poor quality housekeeping service - food is mediocre, staff is very nice, the golf is worth it all - 5 courses and also good tennis and health club facilities -

title: PGA Resort is a small notch below excellent
review: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights as a 10 year anniversary get away from the kids over the Christmas holiday week.  Overall, the resort was very nice, and probably a dream come true if you are a golfer.  We aren't, but enjoyed the spa instead to relax.  Prices were steep ($150 for dinner at Shulas, and $40 for a simple brakfast buffet for the two of us) but not out of the ordinary for a high end resort.  Service was very good with a minor problem in our final bill dealing with the Spa package we signed up for.  I got a bit frustrated dealing with the front desk to resolve it.  The spa is very nice and should be the only pool you go to if you don't have kids with you.  As mentioned before, the resort is being renovated in some areas but you wouldn't ever know if with the…

title: Definitely coming back - next time with friends
review: Just got back from four wonderful days at PGA National.  My wife and I were needlessly concerned about the effects of hurricane Wilma before leaving.  The hotel and the golf courses were completely cleaned up and if you hadn’t seen all the TV coverage you wouldn’t have known the severity of the storm.  We were pleasantly surprised at how big our room was (2018).  It included a king size bed, a love seat with coffee table, armoire with TV and mini-bar and two large closets.  Our spacious balcony overlooked the spa and got the morning sun so it was nice to have coffee and read the paper there.  A large alcove had a round table which I used as a desk with their free hi-speed internet access.  It was a good place to work.  We played The Champ and it’s in great shape – bring extra…

title: Unacceptable food
review: Stayed at this medocre resort for two nights. Very dissappointed with service, accomodations, attitude, and most of all the food.  Breakfast was equal...or worse than hospital food.   Stale breads, tepid eggs, freezer-burnt croissants, and dried out muffins.  Total disaster.   Lunch was worse.  Dinner at Shula's was extremely expensive, and not worth the price.  Started with drinks at Hall of Fame bar.  Big, loud, obnoxious bartender with attitude.  Typical no-brainer ambiance.  Football theme of course.  Worked our way out of there into the restaurant.  There was nobody in the room for hours.  Should have realized there were no locals dining.   Do they know something wary travelers don't?  Extremely overpriced steaks and sides.  Below average quality.       Catered food was…

title: Friendly stafff and excellent golf
review: My wife and I stayed at this resort over Labor Day.  I really enjoyed this hotel.  When we arrive we were greeted politely and given a room right away eventhough we were way early to check in.    All of the staff were very friendly and accomadaiting.  There was on option for vallet or self park. I recomend self since it is so near to the enterance.  I do recommend you have a car if you are traveling as a couple or alone.  There are some great restaurantes just a few blocks away.  I recommend Carmines Ocean Grill and there is an Oyster Bar joint that you should reserve in advance because it seams to be a local favorite.  We actually never ate at the hotel since we like going out to eat.  There is also a Publix right across from the hotel.  We got snackes and drinks there.  Bud…

title: Management is horrible
review: I have never stayed in a Four Star hotel before. I've had a better experience in a Days Inn than I did September 1, 2005 at the PGA Resort.  I was there for a convention. PGA is currently under construction. Its ok that they re under construction, progress happens...BUT they need to control and inform their STAFF, be sure not to be greedy about booking rooms that are AFFECTED by the construction etc...especially if they are a FOUR STAR RATED HOTEL.  The room numbers each have two room numbers which led to confusion. I would think a FOUR STAR hotel would have automatic service of a bell hop ESPECIALLY when the rooms are all DOUBLE NUMBERED and different...we wondered until we saw a staff member in the hall way. Then in our room which was not the room we booked (was suppose to be…

title: You've ruined my Croquet
review: I spent a delightful winter there in 2005 playing croquet for reasonable fees. Under your new fee structure it is now prohibitively expensive to consider staying and playing at PGA in 2006 and I shall therefore be staying elsewhere.

title: Great facility
review: Myself, my wife and two children stayed at the PGA Resort and had a wonderful experience. We found that the employees were helpful, the grounds were beautiful and the surrounding area was also nice. We would stay there again and recommend it.

title: Really needs some work
review: I spent one evening at this Hotel for a meeting.    The entrance to the Resort is very nice and it's a great first impression as you pull up.  Unfortunately, it went down hill from there.  There were no bellman in site.  The lobby looks like it has been recently renovated and is quite nice.  The food quality in the banquets was poor at best, the service just ok.  We had dinner in Shulas one evening,  The quality and service were both excellent, though pricey.  We each had a Caesar salad, one glass of wine, and shared a salmon filet.  The bill was $110.00.  But again, great quality and the server was terrific.  The rooms really need a renovation.  The furniture is outdated, the sheets feel rough and cheap, and the bathrooms have only a very small shower and bath combo.  It looks…

title: PGA National Resort - upgrades are no upgrades
review: Just stayed for 1 night at the PGA resort.  I had reserved a room with 2 doubles, but, upon check in, was informed that no rooms with doubles were available.  Because we didn't want 1 king (was traveling with a friend), they offered to "upgrade" us to a club cottage with 2BR and 2Bath.  They also threw in 2 free breakfast vouchers.  The club cottages are privately owned/decorated and supplied as rental units to the Resort.  When we arrived, we discovered four things:  1) the A/C was not working right -- while the thermostat said 70, the temp was reading over 78.  2) the sliding doors were jammed open. 3) there were dead bugs randomly around the villa. 4) 1 BR had 2 twins, the other had 2 dbls.  Called the front desk, was told maintenance would come over.  After about 30 minutes,…

title: Not quite as advertised
review: We stayed in the 2BR/2BA villas, but had to call the front desk and ask to be moved to one of the "nicer" ones.  They moved us right away and honestly the two young men we dealt with in the hotel were very nice and competent, but I didn't see any hotel employees over 25 years old.  After we got the room hashed out we went to the pro shop to book a tee time.  We were told that the PGA courses were for hotel guests and members only.  This came as quite a shock since we asked about this and even called the starter before booking the trip.  I argued with Bud in the pro shop until he all but called me a liar about calling the starter, then he agreed to arrange my husband a time on a course off the property.  This was not why we came to the PGA , so I found myself back in the face of…

title: Disgrace to the PGA
review: This hotel is a disgrace to the reputation of the PGA. I expected luxury accomodations and excellent service and got neither. The rooms are in need of repair & updating. I had a foot of water in the shower with me. I had to carry my bags to the car & put them in. The breakfast buffet was $15 each + 18% gratuity. It had no eggs & we had to pour our own drinks. When I complained to the front desk they offered no resolution. Maybe the course is great, but guys don't bring your wife here if she expects more than motel 6.

title: No complaints at all
review: Having been through hurricane Charley we were unable to continue on our itinery at Sanibel and through the Everglades so we escaped to the SE where there was electricity and water! We did get i imagine a very good walk in rate, especially as it was low season. I have done a fair bit of travelling over the years and this hotel is a real treat. Luxurious, clean and the rooms are impressive. With two children we were not typical guests and felt more comfortable eating outside the hotel. The pool and surrounding gardens were fantastic and we really enjoyed our stay before we could pick up our itinery in the keys.
